All of the ingredients in the burrito are fresh and incredibly good, the shrimp is cooked to perfection with just the right amound of spices. Usually I can't finish the burrito because they're huge, but it always tastes excellent the next day or later that night!
author: Natalie M.

description:
When you visit San Francisco and the people you are visiting are all, "Do you want to have a Mission burrito?"

FOR THE LOVE OF ALL THAT IS HOLY, SAY YES!

Then get your ass to the Mission and visit Taqueria Cancun. Do yourself a favor and order one of their kitchen sink burritos - you Californians will understand what I am saying. Everything-but-the-kitchen-sink burritos are the cornerstone of the Mexican food in California.

While you are at Taqueria Cancun, be sure to throw a couple of quarters in the jukebox and enjoy the bad ass selection of music.
author: Tara H.

description: This is my favourite Mexican spot in SF. Great burritos, great atmosphere, quick service, great price!
author: Shane O.

description:
Cancun is located in an awesome area of the SF Mission on Mission @ 19th Street.  There are a ton of great bars, clubs, and art/music venues, and it is open after they close at 2am to feed the masses.  There are also a ton of great taquerias in the vicinity, so a place has to be top notch to garner a minimum 4 star rating from me!  When I want a carne asada super burrito, I go to El Castillito.  If I am craving a carne asada torta, I got to El Farolito.  If I am craving a vegetarian burrito I will go to Cancun.  I have had awesome carne asada burritos from Cancun, but they are inconsistent, so I go with what I know will be bomb.  This is going to sound sac-religious, but I go for a burrito with just rice, cheese, avocado slices, and hot sauce.

Their spanish rice is amazing, I love that they use whole avocado slices instead of guacomole, the queso is perfect, and the way they heat it all up and the homemade tortilla crisps up on the outside is perfection.  If you are ever in the mood for something along the lines of a quesadilla, I highly recommend this.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I stumbled upon this place and it was a very lucky stumble. I got the quesadilla with lengua. Very authentic and delicious.

Lots of people on a Tuesday night. Anddd free chips!
author: Sam D.

description:
Caution: They only have 1 kind of salsa which is about medium spicy in chipotle standard. 

I always come here for burrito if I'm near 19th street area. If I am near 24th st, I will go to Farilito. The tortilla is flaky and the burrito is huge. They also give you chips and salsa, but I found their chips have this lard smell/taste to it which i am not a fan of.

Their al pastor is pretty flavorful, less fatty than El Farilito's. Other things like rice, guac and beans are all pretty standard.

4 stars instead of 5 is because they never distribute the content of the burrito evenly as I always started/end with the meat on one end.
author: Ruxin H.

description:
This place is bomb! 

I moved to SF a couple months ago, and I've been on the hunt for a good/cheap Mexican spot, and this is it. Long line, but it went by really quickly, and my super chicken burrito was delicious. Salsa was really good and spicy.

The tacos and quesadillas looked amazing too. I will definitely be going back.
author: Kalina M.

description:
My daughter and I both got super burritos, she carne asada and I carnitas. Very very good, she is not normally a fan of big burritos but she loved this. The rice and beans were very tasty and were in a good ratio to the meat. 

We cut our burritos in half, intending to save the other halves for later but that didn't happen, they were too good!

The two salsas they give you with chips were medium hot and I enjoyed them, especially the green one, but they were too hot for Valerie. The chips were different, thicker and I wasn't sure if they made them themselves. The atmosphere was perfect, bright and busy without being too crowded to find a table. We'll definitely return.
author: Julie T.

description:
Quite honestly the best burrito I've ever had. The chicken in my burrito was perfectly cooked and seasoned perfectly. It had just enough of a kick that it didn't kill my somewhat sensitive-to-spice palette but still packed powerful flavor. There was a decently large line for it being 3PM, which I saw as a good sign, but they managed it extremely well and from the time we walked in to the time we got our food was no more than 15-20 minutes, and there were about 10 people in front of us in line. I didn't know about toasting the tortilla, but I've heard that it'll take on the flavor of the meat on the grill, so I'm most definitely going to try that out next time. 
Quality, authentic and delicious Mexican comfort food. I know the Mission has plenty of Mexican food places to choose from, but no matter where you are in the Mission or in SF in general, I promise you won't regret a trip to Taqueria Cancun no matter how far it is.
author: Dan K.

description:
My dad never says anything is good, and when he does, you know it is. He loves Mexican food and I brought him here for a few tacos and he left one happy guy. The place is truly authentic, cash only and the food is really flavorful without being too salty. 

There was a line when I went and usually pass it and see a line as well. We had chicken and veggie tacos and they were delicious!
author: Louise Z.

description: The place is somewhat dirty, which I wouldn't care if the food was great. I was expecting more. The Burrito Mojado is enourmous. I had a carne assada one and the meat wasn't very good, it had some nerves and wasn't very flavorful. I wasn't asked how spicy I wanted my burrito, and I ended up getting it hotter than I wished. The rice was well cooked, but the beans lacked flavor. I liked that they give you tortillas with a couple of sauces for you to wait the order.
author: Lucas C.

description:
Taqueria Cancun vs El Farolito. Carna Asada burrito. I came to SF with expectations to be blown away by two of the most popular burrito spots in the bay area. I've been told they're the best in the state, better than LA or SD. Having lived in SD for  7 years, i'm going to strongly disagree after this initial tasting. The tortilla at both places are lacking (not toasty enough) and sauces/salsas are underwhelming (not enough onion or spice). Having stated that, lets continue on to the comparing Taqueria Cancun  to El Farolito.

El Farolito has better beans (creamier and more flavor), better tortilla (more crispy) and better sauce (more spice). Sounds like everything in a burrito right? El Farolito has the win in the bag right?! Problem is that I'm carnivore and Cancun had the better carna asada. Far by. Better seasoned and cooked to a slight crisp that adds texture. And the protein is very important. Like the important  enough to even out three other definitive advantages to El Farolito.

Based solely on this one  visit to both places, i'd be most likely to return to Taqueria Cancun because the quality of the protein is the most important thing to me. I shall be returning to both to taste of the other protein options
author: Billy T.

description:
You know how New Yorkers like to say if it's not New York, it's crap? Well, I've learned after Taqueria Cancun that there are some things we just don't do as well as the rest of the country.*

The burrito here is the primary reason to go, and it's delicious and gigantic and everything that Chipotle** will never be. The tortilla is toasted just perfectly so that the first bite is crispy and crunchy, and by the time you're done the tortilla is the perfect amount of soggy from the juices from the meat. I'd suggest you cut it in half, or just cram the whole thing into your face like I did.

Your burrito also comes with chips and a small amount of salsa, unless you're like me and didn't know that and ordered an extra chips and salsa. With a soda, I still got out for under $10 which is fantastic.

For out of towners, when you go into the store, walk past the first station and find the cash register -- they'll take your order there. It's cash only, but not too expensive so you should be fine there.

Also, seating is at communal tables, so if it looks crowded send everyone to go sit at a table and let one person order for everyone.

* - The others are barbeque and free refills on soda.

** - Don't worry, I still love you, Chipotle.
author: Danny P.

description:
Fantastic chicken tacos. 

In the land of burritos it's rare to find a chicken taco that satisfies. Look no more my less carb loving friends, Cancun will take care of you. 

The flavorful, tender chicken with fresh salsa is superb. Yes, you may have to wipe off your table with a napkin, BUT IT'S WORTH IT. 

And, you can drink the water.
author: J. M.

description: I went around all of the Mission in hopes to find the best authentic taqueria and this may be the one! I cannot stop raving about this place to my friends. Carne Asada tacos are where it's at, but I hear the burritos are bomb diggity as well. Almost all the taquerias in the mission are awesome, but this one was especially good! Highly recommended!
author: Debbie R.

description:
Good ol taqueria cancun in the heart of the mission. This place can get packed during peak hours but I've never felt like I had to wait that long. Finding a place to sit could be an issue though.

There's an ATM in this place so that's great.

If you come here, get the super tacos.

Happy eating
author: Tony P.

description: I had their lengua tacos and they were delicious, simple and authentic. Others had the al pastor and also raved about them.
author: Farida C.

description:
It's a late night, I've been out drinking, anything would taste good right now, I'm so hungry and can't think of anywhere else to eat kind of place.

I like spicy food A LOT, but their one measly salsa they give to you with your order - and no salsa bar here! is so damn hot. Sometimes. They're not consistent with it. It's annoying.

They use store bought tortilla chips. A big no-no in book. I eat it anyway and I hate it every time. They're so salty and have a cardboard box taste.

I will continue to eat here for some reason.
author: Camille R.

description: I always get a vegetarian super burrito, which comes out to about $8 and I always split it with a friend because it's so big! Their salsa verde is to die for.
author: Julia A.

description: Roommates brought me here for some "LA style like" tacos. I enjoyed it, especially since I rarely go to LA because of school. I recommend it!
author: Bryan B.

description:
Pros: cheap food, large portions
Cons: cash only, food orders come out slow

I came for dinner with friends. There were a lot of other diners already inside but we still managed to get a table inside. Ordering is very simple and the entire menu is very affordable. I ended up getting a Burrito Mojado. I really didn't expect the burrito to be the size that I got. For less than $10, I got a large burrito (that could clearly feed at least two people), and also they throw in a tray of tortilla chips for you. The plate was covered in enchilada sauce and the insides of the burrito were nice and moist. I got grilled chicken in my burrito and the chicken was not dry. The only thing that is keeping me from giving Taqueria Cancun a five star rating is that the service was slower than I thought. Especially since it seemed like the guys behind the counter looked very speedy. It took a while for my burrito mojado to come out but once I heard my number and went to pick up my order, the sheer size alone and the plethora of sauces was enough to forget that and eat the entire thing myself.
author: Alex T.

description:
best mexican food (other than Guadalajara) that i've found in norcal. I found myself even admiring the tortilla. Their verde is something to rave about. It has chunks of avocado in it.. In love with this place. You might as well get a burrito, because they pack so much stuff on the tacos that its hard to even pick up! 
If you're in the area and have been drinking all night at one of the many bars in the mission, and need to refuel your belly so you don't regret everything you did the night before when you wake up, go to Taqueria Cancun.
author: Bat V.

description: Not anything to write home about. Got the chicken tacos, they were dry, overly spicy and lacked flavor. My boyfriend got the el pastor burrito mojado, the meat had no flavor and the enchilada sauce that topped it tasted like it was out of a can. I may be spoiled as I'm used to the tacos in LA, but if this is rated the best Mexican in San Fran that's pretty sad. The food isn't bad, it's just not anything special. The portions are good for the price.
author: Desirée G.

description:
Had carnita's in a regular burrito. 
-Pork was flavorful.
-Beans were cooked well.
-Cilantro was a bit strong, but I enjoy that.
-Filling was evenly distributed.
-Decent spanish beer selection.

*Cash Only*
author: Carlos T.

description:
MY FAVORITE BURRITO PLACE. 

Al pastor... omgggg.... seriously. That's all you need to know. Super Burrito with al pastor and your life will be changed forever. (Oh but take out the beans... I don't like the texture.)

And since I know everyone likes to compare the two, my personal opinion is that Taqueria Cancun is better than El Farolito. 

There's really not much more I can say that everyone else hasn't said already except you need to try it NOW.
author: Sally T.

description:
So full.  Super burrito so big.  This place is legit.  I got the Al Pastor Super Burrito and it was delish.  At $6.50 it's also a deal considering how much food in the city can go for.  It's pretty much packed with flavor and meat.  They toast the outside of the burrito so it's kinda flaky and crispy.

Their tostada cerviche ($2.50) item is also a great appetizer for yourself (or to share).  Consider adding avocado to it (Extra $1.00)

The seating inside is self seating and while it's not huge, there seems to be plenty of seating.

CASH Only.  They have an ATM machine inside, but it's easier if you're prepared.
author: David K.

description: This burrito was so wonderful. I would encourage everybody to eat one. Best part is the delicious, flaky tortilla -- unlike anything I have ever had.
author: Robin W.

description: Been eating here for years.  Always satisfied.  Great tasting food, reasonable prices.  Location is good...alway from the more congested part of the Mission.
author: Acura Nsx T.

description:
BEST BURRITO I'VE EVER HAD. I always get the prawn, and it never fails. Perfect ingredient ratio and the prawns are cooked perfectly- crispy on the outside and tender (but not undercooked) on the inside. 

The complimentary chips and green sauce are the cherry on top.

Better than El Farolito.
author: Maeve H.

description:
Came to Taqueria Cancun late on a Saturday night for some drunken munchies.  There was a long line of 20 people and plenty of commotion. But they have an efficient system that keeps thing moving quickly. Only waited 10 minutes to pay and pick up the food:

Regular Carne Asada burrito - delicious, big, juicy, flavorful steak - 4 stars

Sesos (brains) taco - deeee...sgusting. my first time trying brain and I could only take on bite. It tasted really funky and creamy, with a mushy texture. 

Overall Taqueria Cancun is another example of great Mexican food in the mission. Just stay off the sesos
author: Mike K.

description:
This place. This place is my jam. Well, I think so at least. I've only been here once. It was late night on valentine's day. My friend and I came here after a night of single ladies partying. I got the carne asada super burrito (because who am I to go against the crowd?). Our plan was to take the burritos to my apartment and eat them while watching Broad City. While waiting in line my friend was getting eyed by a handsome bearded stranger. On our way out we left her number with him on an order ticket. He ended up texting her and she got a date out of the whole experience. Snaps for Taqueria Cancun-- valid place for picking up strangers! 

Anyway, we successfully transported the burritos to my house. We added more hot sauce and sour cream to the burritos (from my own personal stash) and the experience was... orgasmic. I will have to go back and try again. But for now I think my SF burrito allegiance lies with Taqueria Cancun. Keep doing what you're doing guys.
author: Carson S.

description:
Best spot I've been to for burritos in SF. Ordered the super burrito with al pastor.

Tortilla - 8/10. Grilled tortilla with just the right amount of crispiness.

Filling - 9/10. Great meat, great salsa, great rice, great big chunks of avocado in the guac. What a burrito should be -- flavorful, a bit spicy, juicy.

Other - 8/10. Awesome chips come with your order.
author: Lucas V.

description:
Carne Asada Super Quesadilla (~$6): This was a reasonable price. I was stuffed after eating this! It was crispy on the outside and full of yummy goodness on the inside. It is a little on the messy side to eat and the quesadilla isn't like you think it is. Also, it was very watery so make sure you eat over your plate! 
http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GD59stprlmEKJLOgwkY5fQ/l.jpg

Burrito Mojado (~$6): If you can eat a lot but you are on a budget.... I would get this dish! My bf got it and he ended up finishing it! Well worth the price cause this burrito was humongous!! I am not sure how he fit all that in his stomach! The red tomato sauce on top is a bit tangy, so if you don't like the tangy taste, ask them to put that sauce on the side. Overall, they didn't skimp on anything in this dish.....  
http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-42Pz6KgFTdAnDv_dOxZtg/l.jpg
author: Erica T.

description:
I've lived all over the country and Cancun is by far my favorite burrito/taco/pretty much anything they are willing to make. Burrito's are grilled after they are wrapped, meat is consistent and flavorful. 

Just a couple doors down from the knockout bar/venue, so it makes this spot the perfect late night meal.

If someone is visiting town fr the first time, this is THE spot i take them too before all else. CAn't praise them enough, friendly affordable and absolutely scrumptious.

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE TAQUERIA CANCUN!
author: Hunter S.

description: The food here is amazing! Can u please put one of these in LA? It is to far for me to drive and I am jonesN' for a quesadilla suiza :0(
author: Ann D.

description: Does this place really need another 5 star review? The burritos here are amazing. Everything is super fresh and comically large. The line can be a bit insane at times, but it definitely moves pretty fast.
author: Alex K.

description: The super burrito here changed my life. I live in Miami but I had to come to San Fransisco to taste the real mexican heaven. Go for it.
author: Larion G.

description:
I feel like a fraud coming to a restaurant like this and wimping out on the hot stuff. Alas, even their mildest of mild was too hot for me and as my friend sat eating the most robust burrito I've seen, I meagerly ate on my plain-ass burrito.  Points to the guys for understanding. 

But my review is 4-stars for the atmosphere and the Horchata. I still crave it's cinnamon-sweet-nutty goodness. The size of the cup earns it a title of almost being a meal in itself.
author: Lani P.

description:
Got a cheese quesidilla with avocado. Overall pretty solid. 
They're open late which is great. 
The green salsa is awesome.
author: Ariana L.

description:
I've been here multiple times during me early twenties.  Each time was post bar-hopping around the Mission.  Each time was a blur.  Each time, I was sloppy.  Each time, I ordered the super nachos.  

I tried to re-live my early twenties a few Thursday's ago.  My friend was visiting from New York and as a request, wanted our close circle of friends to party like we did when we were "young".  It was my first time in ages, bar hopping around the Mission on a Thursday night.  I'm normally in bed by 11PM if I have work the next day.  A "crazy school night" for me is having a few glasses of wine (or saki, depending on the place) with my dinner at a restaurant with my friends.  

I thought that I would last that Thursday night out.  I even cheated and power-napped after work so that I wasn't going to burn out as fast and be a debbie downer.  Unfortunately, I still managed to be "over it" by 12:30.  Two of my close friends and I decided to sneak away from the rest of the group at Beauty Bar and eat at Cancun for old times sakes.  Although I wasn't as sloppy and rowdy like I used to be when I was younger,  I was able to finish my entire plate of nacho.  Atleast my disgustingly huge appetite hasn't failed me.  Yikes.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: One of my go-to burrito/taco shops in the Mission. Actually, probably it's just my go-to.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
I have lots of fond sober and drunk memories here. 

I love their lengua tacos and burritos! It's quick and easy food and its reasonably priced. They are always open if I am stumbling through the mission in need of good food to sober me up!

Will be coming back here whenever I crave lengua tacos or burritos!
author: Christine W.

description: One of my favorite places for a burrito in SF. I usually have the carnitas super burrito and always have some leftover--the burritos are huge. They pan fry their tortillas so they're warm and flakey.
author: Rachel W.

description: Whenever I'm in the city and I get the munchies, I can go here to get something to fill me up. The only complaint is that lines can get very long and they only accept cash. The food is delicious and they're pretty quick in getting food to customers and they're open late!!
author: Rebecca C.

description: I had my first Mission Burrito at Taqueria Cancun in 1996! It's been nearly 20 years and returning for lunch today I appreciated the experience as much as being touched for the very first time. I ordered a carne asada burrito today but have eaten here over a dozen times. In my heart it is still the best burrito in San Francisco and therefore the United States.
author: Bryan W.

description:
San Diego has their carne asada fries.. but what should one do when drunk off their a$$ at 2am? Taqueria Cancun to the rescue!

Their tacos and burritos are solid.. but what REALLY got me loving this place was their al pastor torta. Very flavorful pork between two fluffy warm buns, with lots of good toppings in between. You can't beat this torta!

Lately, I've been having to use some serious will power every time I go to the Mission now to steer myself away from this place. *stomach grumbles*
author: Kazu O.

description:
In the second installment of The Mission Burrito Experiment, I visited Taqueria Cancún.  As mentioned previously, I was new to the Mission burrito scene and needed to decide if I like Mission burritos or not by visiting a few of the burrito joints in the Mission.

So, I got my standard burrito; carne asada, pinto beans, sour cream, guacamole, cheese, no rice.  This was definitely a step up from El Faralito.  It had the same flavors, but everything tasted better together.  So I've identified the flavor profile of a Mission burrito (did I really just say "flavor profile" in a review? gag).  While it's not what I'm used to, nor is it the best burrito I've ever had, I'm still going to go ahead with my mission (ha!). Stay tuned for the next installment of The Mission Burrito Experiment!
author: Nadeem A.

description: Quite possibly the best burrito I've ever had is the Super Carne Asada burrito from Taqueria Cancún. Super unassuming from the outside, this hole in the wall serves up quick, delicious, authentic Mexican food. We also ordered the nachos to split - don't waste your time with those. The burritos are where it's at - which also comes with a side of chips and salsa. I will definitely be back!
author: Lauren C.

description:
This taqueria is my favorite in the mission! The ingredients are fresh and you can taste it. Every time I go inside, you can see someone chopping onions, tomatoes, cilantro etc. 

It is known to have the 'best veggie burrito' and as a vegetarian, I can fully agree. I order the veggie burrito with black beans and extra avocado. Burritos come with complimentary chips and the most delicious green and red salsa (get extra green salsas, it is that good and you will run out).

AND as a cherry on top, its inexpensive! My giant burrito + chips  only comes out to be six bucks and is waaay too much food. I'm always impressed with the fact that I can feel so nourished and full for so little money! If you don't mind hole in the wall dining, I recommend this as your go to for delicious Mexican food in the mission. Also, they juice oranges and carrots if you're into fresh juices. American/Mexican beer and horchata are available, too.
author: Nicolette S.

description:
The Wet Burrito is soooooo freaking tasty I feel like huggin the cook.

It comes out looking sort of nasty like a rainbow defecated its skittles on my burrito, but the taste is superb. Oh and lets talk price, it is real cheap! I mean the burrito is a legit two meals or one large I want to die young of heart disease meal.

The Carne Asada inside the burrito is where it is at. I mean yea you can get other meats, but trust me it is real good.

They also carry real South American coke which means it is super sugary and will give you diabetes, but once in a while it is okay.
author: Luis D.

description: This is my absolute favorite taqueria. Get a super taco with carne al pastor. Cheap, delicious, filling, delicious, fast, delicious, and delicious.
author: Dave S.

description: Not much in the veggie selections, so I felt misled at the "best veggie burrito in town" sign. All that was in it was rice, beans and cheese...not exactly filling of what I would consider the "best". Also, not very clean, tables were a mess and it was overall not inviting. Two stars as the people who work here are really friendly and it is fast.
author: Kristy S.

description:
Very good Burrito.  I ate some of the carne asada and had my own cabeza (head) burrito.  Flavors were awesome and I'll need to try the tacos next time to reconfirm the goodness.

Decor: 3
Food:4
Service: 4  

Would I go back? You bet your pastrami I would!
author: Kelson H.

description: LOVE LOVE this place!!!  I'm from San Diego area and hispanic and I have been on a search for some REAL MEXICAN FOOD!  I was out this area and Yelp "good Mexican food" and this place popped out.  My husband is the type of person who separates  all his food and is very picky lol and he loved his food!  The food was great!  The price was great and the staff were very friendly!  I'll be back!!!  Only complaint is the seating is very limited and cash only, BUT they have an ATM machine inside the restaurant. :)
author: Gloria J.

description:
The burritos here are super cheap. Cheaper than a lot of taquerias in the area. They also stay open pretty late so if you have a craving for some tasty Mexican food, you'll want to stop here.

I ordered a grilled chicken burrito. It had a bit of a kick to it. Service was fast even on a busy Monday night.

The regular size is just about right for me.
author: Amy J.

description:
Super Tacos. Must get. Reminds me of the famous Lilly's Taqueria in Santa Barbara. 

Authentic Steamed Mexican Tacos. And I'm not talking about carnitas.
Sounds weird but you'll get it when you get it. Don't regret it. 

These were the jam:

- Sesos (steamed cow brain)
- Cabeza(steamed cow head)
- Lengua (steamed cow tongue)
- Ojo (steamed cow eye)

I wish they would carry:

- Cachete (steamed cow cheek)
- Labio (steamed cow lip)
- Tripas (steamed cow intestines)
- Buche (pork stomach cooked in lard)

Best Taqueria in SF hands down. Check out El Norteno Taco Truck for more exotic meat options.
author: Grayson K.

description: Best torta I've ever had in San Francisco...Chicago has some pretty good Tortas. Great prices. Clean bathroom, relatively. Fast service. Free chips. Lots of bebidas!  Can't miss this place for taquerias in the mission!
author: Craig Z.

description: This is my wife's favorite spot.  It's here or El Farolito for me!  Very good burritos and all; carne asada, carnitas, etc.  The better half loves their veggie burrito, aka ex-meat.  My only very, very small gripe is that I wish their salsa was serve-yourself like other spots in The Mission.  I am the annoying dude who stands to your left while your trying to pay pleading with the cashier for more salsa.  That said, they always oblige.
author: Joseph M.

description: Super Taco with carnitas is the way to go.
author: Jessie M.

description:
probably my favourite burrito in san francisco so far!

having lived in san diego for four years, my expectations for "american mexican" food are a little higher.  to be fair, i've only tried papolote, san jose taquiera, some place in ocean beach, and green chile kitchen in san francisco, but this is def my favourite so far.  my friends were hammered, but i was DD + sober here at 1:30 am.  the line was long, but it went by quickly, and i got my burrito less than 5 minutes after ordering it.

the burrito was hooooottt and stayed that way even a hour later when i got home.  the chicken was perfect in that it wasn't super dry or too wet that it soaked through the tortilla.  although i'm a HUGE fan of salsa, they taste good without it, too!  burritos also come with chips and salsa!  if you factor that into the price, it's a good fucking deal.

i don't want to dock any points for something so trivial, but taquiera cancun would probably be my favourite mexican place in the city if it had good salsa.  since i now get heartburn, i'm supposed to avoid salsa so i guess it's not a big deal anyway...
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Pros
- HUGE burritos
- Great fillings
- Tortilla was nice and crispy
- A lot of carne asada

Cons 
- Cash only 
- Wasn't a fan of the communal seating

Great burritos a couple blocks away from 16th+Mission Bart. They're cash only and the line wasn't that long around 6pm on Friday. Friend and I went here after checking out the Nate Silver Burrito Bracket, when Taqueria Cancun ousted El Farolito. 


But, imo, the carne asada burrito is not as good as El Farolito's. It comes down to the meat and this meat was less flavorful than El Farolito's.
author: Andrew S.

description: This was a pretty good steak burrito I had here though the place was super crowded! Plus side, I made new friends and there was even a guy playing a tiny guitar while we ate. That was fun.
author: Emily V.

description:
Pretty standard sf style gigantic burritos, which I do love, but I don't really understand what the fuss is all about for this place. People are really crazy about it. They must all be coming here drunk at 2am?

I've had better shrimp and more interesting burritos from other places nearby, and they don't have my favorite nopales vegetarian ones. Not very spicy, not a lot of sauce options. I prefer the El Norteno taco truck (best shrimp), El Faro on haight (best vegetarian), or whatever taqueria is closest - I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

At least there was a guy playing live guitar, that was pretty cool.
author: Simon B.

description: I'm not a big fan of Mexican, but I do know that this was one of the better ones that I've had.  I love their spicy guacamole salsa, but sometimes they can get stingy with it.  I always order their tacos which are filled with meat.  Their wet burritos are also pretty delicious and filled with meat.  I would recommend this place if you are looking for a quick cheap bite.
author: Lynn L.

description:
This place is great. I try to be healthy and that's pretty hard with Mexican food. Get the super burrito with pollo asado, black beans, light rice. No cheese or sour cream. Add extra chicken if you're looking for more protein. Eat half and the other half later. You won't be too full and avoid any food comas and get in with your day.  

Salsa/hot sauce needs some work. Otherwise I'd give 5 stars. A little pricey but worth it.
author: Jason W.

description: What can I say? Everything you'd expect from a well executed California taquería. Get the burrito mojado!
author: Michael M.

description:
Best Tacos de lengua I've ever had. The guys here are super friendly, and the food comes out super quick and piping hot. 

Don't forget that it's cash only!
author: Amelia H.

description:
Came here last night with some friends after the Dia De Los Muertos celebration in the mission. We walked our ass' to this place since my friend said it was the best place plus all the other places were packed!

Its very cozy inside especially when its busy and you're waiting in line to order. We took our food to go. It was a good burrito. I love how they gives you chips with every order not every mexican restaurant does that.

*open till 1am on a wednesday!
author: Evangelina B.

description:
Why is it so *bleeping* hard to find a *bleeping* good taqueria with all the *bleeping* taquerias in the fucking mission?! (oopps, did one escape?!) 

Another late nite nachos run... This time the chewy tortilla chips topped with greasy low-grade cheese & a mountain of chicken that tasted like it had been nuked in the microwave. $5.99 + $2 for meat. 

The good nacho joints are: pancho villa & la corneta. El gran taco loco is a distant third. That's it. Three. Of ALL the taquerias I've tried. Such a disappointment. I'm open to nacho suggestions, kids. Do share.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Best taco I had in a long time. The chips and salsa were very good as well. I did not appreciate the cashier for staring at me and trying to touch my hand when I requested another chips and salsa.
author: Rosa F.

description:
AMAZING TORTILLAS. 

There are a lot of things to love about Taqueria Cancun. The free chips and salsa, the really, really fresh tasting ingredients, the large burritos that are actually a bang for your buck, the spicy sauce, and the fun interior design. They can also do a really good vegetarian burrito - which is impressive because the meat is seasoned really well with 

But, the tortillas are so good - they reminded me almost of crepes because they were so soft and amazing. 

Definitely recommend!
author: Kate T.

description:
Taqueria Cancun offers a good meal at a reasonable price.
I had the Burrito Mojado and it was extremely filling. The description on the menu says "the big one", and it's very accurate. You might even be able to feed 2 people with it.

If stopping by, you will leave neither disappointed or hungry.
author: Andrew H.

description:
This place i s alright.  It's nice that they're open late since I usually come after the climbing gym closes (~11pm), but the food here is pretty mediocre.  I do come from so-cal, so the expectations may be higher.  The portions are huge and it's a great deal for the cost, but it's just not flavored that great.  

I would recommend the burrito if you come here (I personally like carne asada) with a Pacifico.  

Also, one thing that I found annoying about this place was that it's cash only.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Add another 5-star rating to the pile for Taqueria Cancun. We moved to the Mission recently and have been on a mission to find the best Taqueria (yeah, it's kind of pointless). We went back to TC within a week of our first visit.

Super Taco. I can't get enough of these, but peeps say you got to go for the burritos. Regardless, if you haven't been here you're missing out. 

And yeah, bring a few singles for the annoying ass singers with their tiny guitars.
author: Marcus C.

description: Sometimes I will come here and get the best carne asada burrito of my life; other times it's not as consistent. It seems that there are two burrito-makers, and one is a slacker. Regardless, it's still worth taking the chance, because when this place is good, it's REAL good. Plus their green salsa always has enough chunky Avocado to right any wrongs.
author: Louise L.

description:
Great spot for a casual bite in the Mission. I've been here on several occasions, and Taqueria Cancun never disappoints.

The interior is decorated with artwork, flags, and bright in-your-face colors, lending an ambiance that is colorful and fun. I usually order the lengua burrito, but you can't go wrong with any of their options. The food is fairly authentic, consistently delicious, and served in portions so large that you might think the chef ran out of rice and put a brick in the tortilla out of desperation.

The burrito "mojado" is similar to their normal burrito, only it's served "wet" which means it comes with red salsa, green avocado-salsa verde sauce, sour cream, and cheese. Only order this if you're a gluttonous grizzly bear who can also use a fork and knife -- meanwhile, I'll stick with the regular burritos on future visits. I also wish the meat was cut into bigger chunks, as I like to really sink my teeth into it.

Despite these minor cons, Taqueria Cancun remains a solid hole-in-the-wall that will satisfy the hole in your stomach.
author: Alex L.

description: We came here because it was #6 on Americans Top 20 Burritos List.  We ordered a Cheese Quesadilla and a Al Pastor Wet Burrito with a free side of chips and two salsas.  The quesadilla was your typical quesadilla with jack cheese but the burrito was anything but typical.   This thing was as big as the plate and more than enough for 2 people!! The tortilla is fresh and homemade, red sauce had a little kick and Pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole covered the top.  I don't think Al Pastor is my favorite, but they said that was their speciality so I had to try it.  Something tells me if I had ordered Carne Asada this would have been a 5 star review because everything else about the burrito was amazing.  Staff was extremely friendly and entertaining.  We will definitely be coming back and trying out other menu options soon!
author: James B.

description: This place was great! I highly recommend getting the tacos. The avocado makes it extra tasty. We also got the at burrito, but it wasnt anything special.
author: Vivian W.

description:
After a long drive, failed attempts at finding parking for a festival and then giving up and going to the beach this burrito hit the spot. 

I love The Mission. I love the stores, the people, the food and Taqueria Cancun doesn't disappoint.

This place is cheap, has great options for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike and is just oh so scrumptious. The service is quick and the salsa is great too. I highly recommend coming here for a cheap quick bite.
author: Lacey C.

description:
One thing I love about Taqueria Cancun is the fact that they don't skimp on their portions! I love their Carne Asada Super Tacos which was jam-packed with meat. I did, however, find the salsa to be overwhelmingly spicy. 

Tip(s):
- Cash only
- It gets packed, if you see a free table be aggressive!
author: Juliette R.

description:
I hold the controversial opinion that Taqueria Cancun is delicious. Deal with it.

The salsa verde is the best I've ever had. Now do you feel like it was worth reading my review? Hope so, because I'm done.
author: Alan Y.

description:
This is our Scrabble group's go-to Mexican place after club meetups.  Yes.  We go here because Cancun is open late and they have great quick Mexican food that's hearty and affordable.

I tend to order the carne asada or lengua burrito - comes with free chips and salsa - and it's always hot, packed with nicely flavored charred "meat and friends."  Whatever you order, you will scarf down your food, and you will be full afterwards.  Delicious!

There's aways something to see, too - the crowd is a mix of hipsters, Latinos, techies and whoever else is hankerin' for a real fatty burrito on any given night.  I love the guys who work here too - they move fast.  They have to, because the line can be long if it's Saturday night.

But the line never keeps you away because the atmosphere is so damned awesome.  Occasional live guitar music, smashed partyers, walls painted all colors and adorned with various .  Also, delicious salsas - of course.

And let's not forget that last time I was here, there happened the Great Burrito Incident of 2013.  This is how it went down:

I and friends were sitting at a table - seven of us - and we had all just gotten our orders, lickety-split, one after another.

Anyway, in the corner, there was a couple tables of maybe 12 friends eating.  A homeless woman had been wandering around asking for money or food and throwing a general tantrum, screaming and making a scene, even for this place.

Well, no one was helping her out, and she was getting loud, so finally she decided to GRAB one of their burritos, CHUCK it out the door, then BOLT OUT THE DOOR and run away with the burrito that she just hurled outside.

Needless to say, the table was stunned.  I was stunned too.  I actually burst out laughing and commiserating with the guy whose burrito got plucked.  The cashier dude came over and the situation got sorted out: they remade his burrito, and the woman got interrogated by cops later.  Evidently, this criminal mastermind simply slunk down in a doorway nearby.

So that was a first.  Always a good time here.  Fun place, good food - probably seats 80 if really packed.  Open late!  See you there!  Hands off my burrito!
author: D B.

description: Solid quesadilla suiza.  Prices were fair.  Food was good.  Staff was friendly.  Pretty typical Mission taco joint.
author: Brian B.

description:
Late nite eatery or if you wanted to sober up after drinking, this is the spot!
Long line but there is a reason because the food is really good.

I had the Super Steak Quesadilla - Cheese, Steak, Pico De Gallo, Alvarado, and sour cream.  The thing was huge as it was two pieces somewhat roll up like a burrito.

It was so delicious but most of all sober me up.

Definitely be back if i am nearby and have been drinking.
author: DVS A.

description:
This is my favorite place to get burritos in the mission! Not only is it the best tasting, it may also be the cheapest. I usually get the shrimp (nice and springy) or the chicken (tender and juicy dark meat). 

The chips and salsa are nothing special, but it's free so...
author: Soysizzle t.

description: Food is pretty good. I use to get the steak burrito, but once I ordered the Veggie burrito, I am hooked. I love how big the Veggie burrito is and that they have  avacado sliced up inside. Flavor is delicious when it comes to there burritos. I only had one bad experience here and it was that whoever made my burrito that one time, didn't do a great job on rolling it up so it fell apart after a couple of bites. Dowside is can get super packed to where there is a line wrapping around the back end of the restaurant and parking can be hard to find since it is on mission street.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Super Burritos stuffed with your choice of meat,
 I had the shredded pork (Pastor) that was marinated in mojo while my wife enjoyed the shredded beef (Carne Asada) which had the perfect amount of seasoning.
I had mine loaded with rice and beans, which in my opinion, is the only way to enjoy this meal.

Side of complimentary chips with salsa and guac...

Can't beat the price, worth a trip to the Mission
author: Leonard L.

description:
In general their food is really good.

Tonight in particular it wasn't so good:
The burrito was good except that I asked them for a small amount of mild salsa and instead it's insanely hot. Like making me sweat. Which is the opposite of what I wanted. In retrospect, I feel like the guy who was taking my order didn't understand what I said but I wish he would've asked.
author: Dan T.

description: Nothing fancy. Good ol fashion burrito. They're huge! Bring cash since its cash only.
author: Daniel T.

description:
My favourite is the Super Quesadilla....

They have the typical staples but this is defenitely not my favourite Burrito shop/Mexican spot by any means. Its convenient when absolutely starving, for convenience (there are quite a number of them I think in the city), and on a budget. 

The seating when busy is uncomfortable. Their green salsa is quite good but they dont have a condiment bar like many other Taquerias. Water is not plentiful and their aguas frescas dont look all that special really. Ive tried a few things on the menu and they all pretty much taste the same.. And this sums up Taqueria Cancun..
author: Julian I.

description:
I usually hesitate to give out 5 stars to a restaurant, because 5 star means its perfect. This place definitely isn't perfect but based on how delicious the food alone was, you get 5 buddy... allllllllllll 5 stars.

I had some flavor enhancers (alcohol) right before coming here so my review may be a bit skewed.

I had the Carne asada super burrito and it was phenomenal. The carne asada was extremely tasty and tender. There was a ton of guac in it which is always a plus.... AND IT WAS 6.50$!!! I don't think i've ever paid 6.50 for something edible in the city. Living in SOMA makes you appreciate a deal. Both of the red and green salsa were really really tasty; they had a kick to them as well, which I will always appreciate.

Definitely the best tacqueria I've had in the city. Will definitely come back as soon as I get a chance.

MUST HAVES:
Carne Asada anything
The green avocado salsa
Cash
author: William L.

description:
Great place just ate there for the first time a few days ago pretty late at night. Huge burrito for 6-7 dollars is great and everything about it was awesome. Flaky tortilla, lots of beans and meat, cheese, etc. The portions were awesome too. 

Messed up my order, but it didn't even matter it was too good. Long lines are expects at night, but at any other time its great!
author: Jarrett R.

description:
I deliberately visited the mission with the aim of getting a big fat dirty burrito in my mouth. I'm glad I settled on this place, because it really ticked all the boxes.

I got the carne asada and was in awe of how massive it was. The fact that it came with a massive bowl of chips and salsa too really didn't help. There was no way I was going to get through both, though I gave it a red hot crack, using the super sweet Horchata to help wash it all down.

It's busy here, but service is quick and you won't wait that long before your own feast is ready for you to get stuck in to.
author: Tresna L.

description:
LOVE their shrimp burrito! This is the only place in the city that I can find a delicious super shrimp burrito! . Shrimp is cooked perfect..

Their carne asada is also good. Pretty close to Farolito's version. ! 

P.S. why can't i find a delicious fish burrito anywhere in SF?? it should be simple...right???
author: Dee N.

description:
Mojado burrito!!! Amazing! Not only because it's massive a meal for only $8.16 but it tastes amazing! No joke I had the burrito before my flight to Mexico last month, it's just phenomenal. 
If you like to put a lot of salsa in your burrito order Mojado, they put so much sauce that you will never feel your burrito is bland or dry!
author: Anna J.

description:
Uhm, yum?! I am so glad I stumbled upon this restaurant while walking through the mission. Originally I was going to get a pupusa from the Salvadorian place down the street but the service was horrible. Oh wells, lucky me cause I found this place!

I got 3 carne asada tacos which I thought were going to be a rip off but they were huge. Also, the chips and salsa was amazing. I loved how crunchy and grainy the chips were and the salsa was fresh and spicy.

Great experience and great customer service. Will def be back.
author: Victoria Y.

description:
Third visit to Taqueria Cancun this weekend. This is no frills, nothing fancy, just delicious and authentic Mexican food.

I usually get 2 super tacos and they automatically give you chips and salsa (the salsa is spicy, even the green one - consider yourself warned). It can sometimes be hard to find seating, and they don't come by and clean the tables very often so you might have to shove trash from the people before you out of the way. 

They are cash only which is a pain sometimes and parking is usually a disaster, but the food here is just so good I keep coming back.
author: Rachel E.

description: Some of the best tacos I've had so far. Get the normal tacos.
author: Thomas C.

description:
I love you, Taqueria Cancun. Love. You. Your vegetarian burrito is about as good as it gets (and I'm not even a vegetarian). One of the students I tutor asked me what I wanted for my birthday. My answer? A burrito from Cancun. Fact.

Cheap. Friendly staff. Fast even when there's a line all the way to the door. Salsa that's spicy, but not so spicy you can't actually enjoy it. 

Again - I love you, TC. The only thing I'd change about you is your cash-only policy.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Oh my. That's a good burrito.

Whenever my family is in the Mission district, this is our go to spot. We don't ever bother trying to find a bette place. The atmosphere seems so authentic, with Spanish speaking people behind the counter, lots of noise from sizzling meat, and bright yellow walls. My usual order is the super burrito, and what more is there to say? It's super!
author: Silje S.

description:
I don't think I've ever had a better taco in the Mission. 

Went here on a casual Sunday afternoon for a quick bite before some fun at Dolores Park. Lucky for me at 2:30pm there was no line, so I went right up the front and ordered the Super Tacos with Grilled Beef Steak Al Pastor. 

A friend had recommended the Al Pastor, so I thought I'd give it a try. I can honestly say I would be happy to never have a taco with another meat again. 

I'm making it my default post-drinking spot whenever I'm in the Mission at nights, I'm sure it would taste even better after a good night of bar hopping.
author: Brad M.

description: THERE IS NO SALSA BAR. What?? Yes that's right, no salsa bar! But you order quickly and the food is great.
author: Jeanna G.

description: The ceviche tostadas were unbelievably good. They had a nice kick to them and the salsas that came with the chips were fire as well. this little hole in the wall did me really good last night around midnight. fast, reasonably priced, and friendly. what more can you ask for.
author: Joshua P.

description:
Where do I begin...

I just had an amazing lunch today at Taqueria Cancun. Everything was perfect...I mean everything. The sun was out in the city today. The "urban" streets of the Mission made me feel like I was south of the border. The food was delicious. The ambiance was great. Just a nice day today.

Taqueria Cancun is one of the heavy hitters on Yelp when it comes to Mission Mexican food. So it was just a matter of time before I got my hands on one of these burritos. I LOVE burritos in case you didnt know. 

Burrito of choice, carne asada super burrito. The pieces of carne asada were juicy, tender, and full of flavor. The rice was super soft and fluffy. The flavor of the rice was really subtle but complimented the meat juice well. The burrito was HUGE, although it had a little bit too much rice but hey, I'm asian, I'm not one to complain about rice. There was still a hefty amount of meat in there.

I wish there was a salsa bar so I can load up on that stuff. They keep it behind the counters so you have to ask them for a little container of salsa. The pico de gallo was good but the gaucamole stole the show. It's has a little spice to it and has a super creamy texture. Ask for lots of little containers of gauc, trust me.

As I mentioned before, I thought the ambiance was great. Tacky decorations were plastered on the ceilings and walls. Festive music was blasting. The smell of the grill was drifting through the air. I loved it. 

*CASH ONLY*
author: Harry T.

description: Amazing! I prefer the chicken to the beef, but simply delicious. I especially love the salsa they give you with your chips - so fresh and yummy.
author: Karen L.

description: I would say this place is just standard fare. Nothing special here to talk about. They say the burrito is the one to order but I am not sure. Prices are fair and quality seems decent. It's the taste that's missing.
author: Zee R.

description:
Hands down the best taqueria in the mission, which is saying something because the mission has a ton of tacquerias.

I eat a lot so first time I came I got the "Burrito Mojado (a Big One)" because it seemed like it'd be the biggest burrito. I was correct it is the biggest burrito. I was only barely correct in my ability to handle it (definitely incorrect in my desire towards the end). Volume-wise it's probably two Chipotle burritos: so there you've been warned. Also mojado means wet in Spanish (which I neglected to notice the first time).

Now I just get their super burrito which is still filling and delicious. Cancun is generous with the amount of meat and avocado they use and no other taqueria gets the mixing of the ingredients quite right.

The place gets pretty busy and it's sometimes hard to get a table so if you go with a group, have one person be on the lookout for people leaving and claim it, unless you want to take it to go.
author: Jason C.

description:
-- Lunch only ---
Though I think they're known for the Wetback and the Camarones (Shrimp) Burrito, I decided to tackle lighter fare:  regular carnitas burrito and quesadilla suiza.  
Re: serving size, the burrito left me comfortably full but if you're looking for the mother of all burritos that will give you lunch and dinner portions - the best spot is Castillo Mason.  The carnitas itself wasn't that memorable but at least it wasn't dried out.  The quesadilla suiza wasn't prepared to my liking - I prefer the carne asada cut up and the quesadilla using a larger flour tortilla.  Not sure what is more authentic, but they prepared the rather small tortillas and non-marinated meat slices.  All this said, the taqueria is still worlds apart from the Chipotle at the mall.  It's worth a stop for all the local techies much too lazy to walk to 1058 Hoagies or Deli Board.
author: Tom B.

description:
HOLY HELL. 

Who knew that at the suggestion of grabbing some Mexican food after a night of barhopping in the Mission would lead me to the best taco I had ever ate in my life?! Enter: Taqueria Cancun. It was like all the surrounding bars had invisible arrows pointing their patrons to Taqueria Cancun after a night out...this place was crow-ded with hungry buzzed foodies! 

The dude taking the orders was a comic in his own right, he definitely livened the place up, asking us "Are you sure you don't want any Tequila with your order!?" My boyfriend got 2 Lengua Tacos, my friend got a Quesadilla & Taco and I ordered a Carne Asada Super Taco & Carnitas Taco.

The Carnitas was full of flavor and I loved the huge ladle of salsa on top. But the winner of the show was definitely the Carne Asada Super Taco. I seriously could not believe how freakin' delicious this was! Sour cream, avocados, fresh salsa, onions & cilantro all on top of perfectly charred Carne Asada wrapped up in 2 warm tortillas. I was in heaaaaven. I can't even describe it any further, it was just...perfect.

Forget that the free chips tasted store bought, the bathroom was super groddy & that it was cash only...I'm willing to forgo those cons just because the Super Taco was JUST. THAT. GOOD.

So yes, 7x7 and poortastemag.com do not lie. Taqueria Cancun is worth the hype!
author: Faye G.

description:
Mmmm this place is muy bueno!! Delicious, authentic, and CHEAP. What more can you ask?

The burritos are solid and delicious. The tamales and dishes are huge and more affordable than other joints (no more than $7 for a combo dish? What!)

They also give you free chips with salsa and spicy guac (extra chips costs $1.50).

Good solid joint...just be prepared for a hole in the wall type of place though, nothing fancy here!

Just be aware: CASH ONLY!
author: Veronica S.

description: Yikes! This place is good. We were looking for something famous and we found something fantastic. Line inside took ten minutes but it's worth at least 45 minute wait. Tortillas are amazing and the super burrito is more than enough to leave you satiated.
author: Angela D.

description: Tried it out on the mission district food tour . Ahhh so yumm .... Very basic hole in a wall kind of place but very colorful. Loved their tacos and salsas and tried the soft tacos with pork filling . Delicious . Must go for a satisfying Mexican fare
author: kungfupanda l.

description:
Really good plates. Authentic socal carne asada, refried beans, and rice. 

And they have beer. 

There is no salsa bar, which is why I docked 1 star.
author: Charlie O.

description: Awesome food! I ordered the Super Burrito and it was amazing! It's HUUUGEE! The Horchata here is also really good!
author: Francisco G.

description:
Great place that is so Mission. The tacos were top-notch and they had a good selection of different meats. I tried the al pastor, lengua, and the carne asada - all were delicious. The ceviche was a sleeper pick, but was well enjoyed by all.

The salsa could be better, but the Tapito saved the day. Didn't appreciate the cash-only, but I was over it right after I took the first bite...
author: Billy D.

description:
This place does not need another review, I mean lots of people are already saying good things! That plus the youtube vid, I think you get the gist that this place is worth trying. 

However, I will say that you should forget the burritos and come for the quesadillas. OMG I am drooling just thinking about them. My friend moved out to SF and showed us this place a few months ago when we visited her. She felt a bit apologetic of taking me out to dinner in the city to a taqueria (as we are both Mexican and from LA) but she swore it was delicious, in her neighborhood, and prob the only thing left open at that hour.

Guess all that traffic we caught was worth it because it lead us here! The atmosphere is A+ The guys working the line were clowning on everyone. "El guey de la cacucha roja" to give someone their order. I felt like I was at one of my family functions! Haha. So on top of the great food the atmosphere is super lively.

My bf always orders the burritos because that's his default. He thought I was exaggerating about the quesadillas last time so we traded bites when we went this past weekend. The burrito was good, but nothing too spectacular. And well, his "bite" became chomping down on my quesadilla :( but that's okay because the thing is huge (insert bad joke here lol). I was so full even after he ate a good amount of it. 

So yes, get the asada quesadilla!!!
author: Silvy A.

description:
I was so excited and so hungry, but man am I disappointed.

Got the super shrimp burrito, which is my standby. 

- They rolled it wrong, so the first half of the burrito was almost entirely beans, then a mess of avocado and cheese, then a pile of shrimp, and ending in rice soaked in sauce. The ingredients would have gone well together. But alas, they were not together, and I didn't know until too late.  Google "Dear Guy Who Just Made My Burrito" and you'll have a summary of my experience.

- The shrimp were 100% flavorless. Come on, guys.

- I had to pull shrimp shell out of my mouth.

On the plus side, great tortillas. On the downside, even though I was starving, it just wasn't very good overall, not even for $10.

Oh also, beware on the guacamole -- HUGE chunks of raw peppers, mostly jalapeños but I think also poblanos. Tasted more pepper than avo. Someone's bag I'm sure, but not mine.
author: Sarah F.

description: Legit, quality burritos for a great price. Open late, always crowded but get your food fast anyway.
author: Ryan G.

description: Can't go wrong here...if you're thinking of eating at Buen Sabor...STOP...then take a short walk and get a better in every possible way...burrito/portion/price at Cancun.
author: Chris w.

description:
Boss and I went here after our session with Julie from BuTong (she recommended this spot since boss and I were starving...)

It was a block away from BuTong... so that might become a habit! We got there and it was pass 1 pm so there wasn't as much people... 

First reaction: oh I've been here before during my hay days with my girls. BUT back to the review...

I ordered the regular carne asada burrito ... it was a decent size and my service was prompt... but my boss... not so much. Her's took a while (even if we got the same exact thing...) and also the place got busy.

The carne asada was flavorful... Like fellow Limzer... it's good but definitely not the best. 

Anyway... decent spot... so-so service... and decent pricing! It filled this tummy until dinner time!

PS: CASH ONLY!
author: Cath M.

description:
A solid 4 stars. I think we like El Farolito a little better.

We tried the carnitas burrito (delicious!) and the super nachos were tasty but got soggy fast with all the fixings on top.
author: K. D.

description: Got the basic chicken burrito here. Pretty average/bland. I'd get something else next time.
author: Ann C.

description: Ok so what is a guy who is not crazy about Mexican food doing here?  Part of the Mission walking food tour. Had the El Pastor and a side of chips and salsa. It was fine but won't be  destination for me.
author: Joe M.

description: SOOO GOOD. super cheap for how much food you get. the burritos are huge and delicious.
author: Marissa G.

description:
Cheap, fast, and tasty! I had a super steak burrito that was loaded with more than enough to fill my manly chipotle-comparing appetite. I also got to try the steak quesadilla and combination nachos, which were also delicious. 

What makes this place worth while for me, as compared to the dozens of taquerias in the mission, is their f!$@'ing white queso sauce that they put on their nachos and quesadillas. Trust me, SO GOOD! 

I sometimes ask other taquerias if they have white queso and they just stare at me like the fat hoppa American that I am. This place knows the deal! 

I'll be back for more, fur sure.
author: Mike G.

description:
Best burrito I've eaten so far.  Carne Asada Super Burrito.  Hold the sour cream.  

The steak is juicy and flavorful and perfectly cooked.  This place is extremely generous with the avocado - they throw in large, fresh slices.  Plus, they heat up the tortilla on the griddle with the cheese melting on top of it.  Excellent.

Order your baby to go, then eat it in the park.
author: Wolfgang C.

description: Yummy!!! Great Mexican food in an easy location, CASH ONLY.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I love the carne asada burrito - in fact, this is my favorite carne asada burrito in the city! I also like the nachos but I'm not a great fan of the tacos, though that might be a personal preference. Kind of dirty, but I think that adds to the flavor. It's what you expect from a hole-in-the-wall.
author: Bianca E.

description:
Damn you, Taqueria Cancun! Their super veggie burrito has ruined all other burritos for me to the point where I can't even walk into a Chipotle now.

I didn't even *like* burritos before coming to this place because they always just tasted like rice and beans on bread to me. But the beans and rice here are really flavorful and they other items they add all folded together makes it a gooey mess o' goodness. Their melon agua fresca is damn tasty, too.
author: Tomaito E.

description:
One of my favorite taquerias in the Mission.
Food is delicious, fair prices, the music is great, the decorations are beautiful and the workers there are hilarious!! Definitely recommend this place!
author: Marlo M.

description: The best carne asada super burrito I've ever had. And really fantastic green salsa. Only issue is the carne asada is pretty salty, I'm going to try getting half carne asada, half chicken or carnita next time.
author: Rob G.

description:
Okay, let me first start off by saying the tacos here are good. If you're drunk off your ass and you wanna get tacos, I would recommend this place. The only thing I didn't like about this taco spot is that the taco's are a little over priced. If you want really good tacos for a cheaper price, drive another 5 mins to 24th and Harrison. Taqueria Vallarta tacos are cheaper and taste a whole lot better than this place. 

This place does not have a salsa bar, which is a bit disappointing because I like having a lot of salsa with my tacos. Instead they give you really small portions of salsa. 

Oh, and bring cash, they don't take card.
author: Jason D.

description: The location in the outer mission is the best. There is something about their tortillas, I love them. This place is also a San Francisco staple. I do not recommend the 16th and Mission location.
author: B A.

description: Simply the best, but not if you cannot eat gluten. I definitely got sick the last time I ate here. I suspect the complimentary tortilla chips have gluten in them. I have been suspicious of the tortillas there, as well. So long, super tacos. I will miss you.
author: Patricia D.

description:
Bomb.Com

I'm not sure what it is, but I suspect! what makes this place so good is the quality of the ingredients, especially their meats (get carne asada!). Their tacos are amazing, and their salsa has just the right amount of spice. Also, I can't forget to mention the prices, which are comparable to other areas in the Mission, but still good for SF!
author: Kevi L.

description:
I'm a little late to this party, but still want to give credit where it's due! I'm an El Farolito fan, but after my first meal here also realized that there is plenty 'o room in this belly for Taqueria Cancun. 
I ordered the al pastor and carne asada tacos and the combination of the intensely flavorful meat + the creamy delicious avocados? Out. Of. This. World. 
I also sampled their nachos and regular burrito and would highly recommend both. I can't wait for my next visit when I get my hands on their other offerings like lengua and cabeza. Te amo Tanqueria Cancun!
author: Irene B.

description: Pretty good tacos 6th street or mission
author: Fresh B.

description:
First off, let me say that one of the times I went I found a roach running across my table (hence -1 star = 3 rather than 4). It was gross and made me abandon my meal immediately, but it doesn't keep me from going back.

I'm realistic. I know most eateries have pests running about, it's kind of impossible to keep things impeccably clean. My only concern was that this place tends to keep slabs of raw meat out because they are constantly chopping and cooking. They also keep large cardboard boxes of cilantro and lettuce on the floor... which I'm guessing with roaches publicly wandering about isn't the most sanitary thing.

But hey, is anything in the Mission sanitary? I mean it's sidewalks reek of urine anyway.

So now that all that's out there and out of the way let me say that their nachos are amazingly delicious. Their burritos are good, and their taco salads are good. Their chicken is good too, which is surprising because I really don't like bland chicken. Even though all that stuff is tasty I insist that you HAVE to get their super tacos.

They are large soft corn tortillas with cheese melted directly on them, beans, meat (I always get carnitas), salsa, and sour cream.

One fills me up to almost past full capacity. I really think that the cheese melted on the tortilla is what makes it so great. Or maybe it's just what the roaches leave behind? Eh, I really don't want to think about it...
author: Vanessa F.

description: Food tour.... so yeah continuation with the food tour, hehehhee!!! it was so funny that the tour brought my wife and i over here.  This brought us back to college days when my we would party all night long and would be so hungry we had to find a great place to eat.  This was and still is the go to spot to get a freshly made Mexican meal.  Their horchata is the way to go after a long time of partying, if u know what i mean!!!  Either a fat burrito or just their home made chips and salsa!!!! holy guacamole!!!! always will be our go to spot in the Mission distirict.
author: Richard G.

description:
Went here when I was in town last week from Vancouver - and I was not disappointed.  We don't get the best Mexican food here - and this was spot-on.  The food was quick, tasty, huge and all around awesome!   It was a Saturday night - so they were busy, but it didn't take much to get a seat or our food.  I had a carnitas burrito and it was too big to finish (for me!).   For 7 bucks - not much better.


Atmosphere was organized chaos - and I liked it.  There was even a random Mexican dude singing and playing guitar.  Go here.
author: Graeme F.

description:
Carne asada super burrito did not appeal to me.
Carnitas super burrito is usually good but be sure to help yourself to extra salsa or you may find your burrito lacking in flavor. 
Carnitas super suiza is pretty good though that boiled pork flavor can be a tad bit unappealing unless you like that sort of thing.
Sometimes my burritos seem to be missing ingredients even though I was request all the fillins but w/e ..still dank af
author: Beth N.

description: When you're from east LA and trying Mexican food in the famed Mission district....here are my thoughts: For three bucks a taco, this place is pretty bomb. Got al pastor, lengua, and carne asada.  The tongue is very tender but didn't have enough salt. Al pastor not as good as the ones I had before. Needs more pineapple in it or something. Carne asada is the WINNER!! I'd def come back to get more asada tacos. Salsas got a kick to it but I like spicyyyy
author: Karina H.

description:
Many people leave their hearts in San Francisco. To be specific, I left mine at Taqueria Cancun.

I would like to dedicate my 200th review to YOU, Taqueria Cancun!

I was told everyone in SF has their FAVORITE burrito place. Taqueria Cancun was the favorite of my tour bus driver and we stumbled by a few hours later and had to venture in. 

(Side note - I did try 2 other taquerias during my visit, but neither surpassed this place)

Taqueria Cancun had fun festive Mexican decor and the tables were nice, wooden & clean. I loved the cheesy mariachi style music too.

I had a carne asada burrito. $5.99. WOW. The burritos are the size of a BRICK. Really. I could have smashed someone's windshield with that badboy. 

I quickly stuffed my face with half of the burrito plus most of the FREE chips & salsa that came with. I wrapped the other half up for a midnight snack.

Unfortunately, I was so completely drunk off my face later that I have no recollection of eating the other half. I did find the wrapper in my hotel room trash bin though, so I'm assuming it went down well.

A+
author: Lauren M.

description: HOLY COW! my burrito was the size of a small dog covered in tasty sauce! it was epic. I shared mine with the hubby and filled up on half -- but our buddy (a local) had an entire one to himself and reigned triumphant! impressive! fabulous accompaniment to our wild SF bender.
author: Angie V.

description: Burrito the size of my head, check. Cheap eat, check. Quick service, check. You can't go wrong with the selection. I got the grilled chicken super burrito and a water for $8 or so and I came with chips and salsa.
author: Clark L.

description: Awesome tacos. I recommend the chicken super taco. It was so delicious. Not a bad price either.
author: Jesse D.

description:
Breakfast Burrito review only!!!  Everyone should know about the non-breakfast burrito options at Cancun, but last night I was there and had an urge for a breakfast burrito and was pleased to find that they offer them at night as well - score!  

Well the breakfast burrito here is definitely massive, but I ordered it straight up to see what it came with and I wasn't a huge fan of the pinto beans, hence I knocked off a star for that.  It didn't have potatoes either, which I can go either way with, but the eggs weren't as light and fluffy as I typically like in my breakfast burritos.  It wasn't overly cheesy either (which I like, although a 'normal' amount of cheese is fine too).  It's a good burrito but not as good as what I was expecting from them.  Still it's a great value as I wasn't able to finish my massive burrito!
author: Gene X.

description:
Love the burritos! 

Cheap!

Open late!

Enough said!

Try it and If you don't like it, I will delete my yelp!!!
author: Robert R.

description: The burrito mojado cannot be beat.   You won't find a better one, anywhere in Northern California.
author: earl w.

description: I like how they're really fast & accurate with my orders every time I go there. They always treat me very good & I feel comfortable in this place.
author: Cesar G.

description:
I was seduced by the name as I've eaten at the Taqueria Cancun in the Mission multiple times. This one seemingly has no connection aside from the prices. 
I ordered a Carne Asada burrito with half black beans and half refried beans, and got pure gristle - no exaggeration, not a single piece of meat, and pinto beans.
If I had paid more than six dollars for this, I would have been more angry.
The complete lack of meat in a meat burrito, especially when meat and beans were the only two ingredients IN my burrito, seems suspect, but what can you do? 
Leave a bad yelp review, I guess.
author: D C.

description: Best super burritos ever!!!  This place is always busy but the food is quite worth it. I am willing to drive and extra half hour just to get their burrito.
author: Michelle P.

description:
Taqueria Cancun in the Mission is where I go for my meat tacos, particularly the al pastor (marinated pork). The meats are always moist and flavorful, but not dripping in fatty grease like at El Farrolito (or maybe just a little). No filler beans in the taco like La Taqueria's. With the meat so flavorful, you can't beat Cancun's $2.50 taco price tag. 

You do get chips and two sad tiny tubs of salsas with your order. I guess they have to keep the price down somehow. The salsas are spicy and fresh, but lacks flavor so I don't even touch them.

Eating here is rarely pleasant, especially when you're by yourself. The place is rather dingy and the homeless would wander in from time to time. It goes without saying it gets sketchier at night, but those damn good al pastor tacos sure keeps me coming back.
author: Rina W.

description: cheap and super delicious. One of the best burritos in the mission because they give a little golden crisp to the outside of the burrito. yummy!
author: Jason H.

description:
Besides having gaudy decorations and a terrible color scheme, this place is dank-licious. So good in fact that I frequented them twice in one night. Granted, the second time was at 2 am on my way home and I only ate half the burrito before throwing it back in the bag and onto the floor of my room. 

That said, this place has a great carne asada burrito that i would definitely eat again. It is a good go-to spot in the mission.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Not bad. Ordered the carne asada super burrito, which is pretty big. Partner had the carne asada plate, also good size. And the super nachos. Which may have been too much since each order gets its own chips and salsa. Cheap prices. Oh, I did like the cantaloupe juice yum.

We're from Texas. Specifically San Antonio, and we're constantly in search of good Mexican food in SF. We really thought this place would be it. We love taquerias! But I dunno there was just something missing from the flavor of the asada. Just not salty or fatty enough LOL. And the refried beans are too runny, not thick and fatty like in SA. And the nachos.. forget about it! They are supposed to be put in the oven hello!?
 
Aaggh I miss REAL Mexican food!! What is up with this type of "Mexican" food found here in SF?!?! Ugh and it really irks me everything's about burritos here. I don't think I ever ate burritos in Texas! There's so much much much much more to Mexican food!!!! I need to visit Texas stat! 

:D But I love SF don't get me wrong LOL
author: Vol T.

description: The food is ok... A bit dry I got the regular burrito and what can I say it was a plain burrito one easily made at home I go out to tastes a different flavor then the one in my kitchen. The service was the worst ever I've never had someone bark orders at me especially when I'm the paying customer! Horrible!
author: yvette g.

description:
Open late. Great mexican food.  Free chips and salsa with your order?!

There's not much you can ask for in a taqueria.  I ordered the standard burrito with carne asada and it filled all of my needs.  Its a popular place on the weekends (especially at night) but the service is quick and it will definitely hit the spot.

Eat to your hearts desire!
author: Robert T.

description: Vegetarian burrito and breakfast burrito here are the best around. I'll definitely recommend this joint to all my veggie brothers and sisters.
author: Isaac R.

description:
Originally from Southern California and having lived on the east coast for the past 6 years, there has been a huge void of mexican in my life. While on a quick trip to SF, I was determined to get my mexican fill.

A friend mentioned this was the top rated placed by veggies for veggie burritos, and he was definitely right. 

The veggie burrito is HUGE, filled with deliciously fresh avocado, rice, and other amazingness I cant recall. Since its unlikely they would ship a weekly order of veggies burritos to the east coast, I will surely be back next time I am in SF.
author: Ashlyn M.

description: I am vegan at home and accept that I may have to do vegetarian when I am out.  now that I know this place uses meat sauces in their vegetarian burritos I won't be back.
author: Mike F.

description: I love the tacos here -- particularly the pork ones. It's nothing special to look at, and there's no table service, but the food is seriously yummy.
author: Tini T.

description: I got a carne asada burrito and it was alright, but nothing spectacular. Their salsas are good. Be aware they are cash only
author: Olivia K.

description: Best spot in the Mission for a GIANT burrito. Get the majado "big one" burrito with enchilada sauce and guac! yum!
author: Leah B.

description: i loved the carne asada burrito and it was HUGE. was a bit disapointed at my suiza quesadilla due to the size. it was a perfect size for me but im not that big of a guy so usually when i eat at a mexican place i expect food for 2 days. The flavor was just what my inner glutton desired.
author: Brian R.

description: Yea -- 4 starts for a rad taco place -- cheese quesadilla was tasty, as was the salsa and chips. Weekday day/before the night rush hits seems to be the best option for this place.
author: Mel G.

description:
I got a wet Carne Asada burrito.
It was pretty standard.
Would have been better if it had cheese.
It was also really spicy.
author: Javier R.

description: Hands down best vegetarian burrito I've had for 6.99. The tortillas are flaky and cheesy and the burrito came with avocado! I was in burrito heaven from this vegetarian burrito and I can't wait to go back!
author: Shruti S.

description:
I suddenly realized I hadn't written a review for this place yet.  Of course, I'm not the only one to do so . . .  It's been a while since I've been here, but after reading the other reviews, it look like it's still the same after all these years.

There are lots of Mexican joints in The City.  There are two things that set this one apart:
