description: Wonderful experience here. My first meal during a trip to San Francisco. I found it to be as good as some of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Texas. I recommend the carne asada super burrito. You also get some good chips and salsa while you wait.
author: Michael N.

description: Excellent carne asada, which i had in the taco, but everything else was a disaster.  The chicken quesadilla was mediocre at best but worst of all the sanitary conditions are extremely lacking.  I've worked as a cook for 8+ years and we've always worked with plastic gloves on.  I joked to my friend that we would probably get some sort of food poisoning form this place and two hours later I was proved right.
author: Jeff R.

description:
One of the best hole in the walls I've ever been to. My girlfriend heard/found this place, and we were lucky enough to stuble upon it for lunch one day.

For what it is, it is pretty clean though. Nothing didn't feel dirty at all like some other places. Table tops here clean. Not sticky. Smooth and clean. The floors weren't sticky as well for the amount of foot traffic this place must see on a given day or week even. Everytime I've gone the line was a little long, but went by fast. Plenty of places to sit. There are a lot of long/big tables, for like whole families, but there is a lack of personal sized tables for maybe 2-4, so you might have to find yourself sharing the end of a big table with strangers, but that's no so bad since everyone is there to eat and run anyways. There's the occassional table with two or more older dudes drinking corona's but they aren't any harm. 

Everything I've tried so far has been WINNER! Super burrito, taco sald, burrito mojado, all good! The al pastor was my favorite, followed by their carne asada anything. Just so flavorful. All was made well, the mojado burritos look and taste so friggin good. I love it. I might just get mojado anything burrito from now on, hahaha.

The prices are super reasonable. Better than El Faro I think, but I don't even like El Faro, gross -blech-. Anyways, $6 for super/mojado burritos, really not bad. Especially considering the food to money ratio. You really get what you paid for and more! 

The area can be a bit sketch, but I haven't felt super threatened at all, used to it especially since as of late up to the last time we went, we were in that area walking around, bar hopping, eating, all that stuff on different days. 

Come back? HELL YEAH!

Tip: Bring Cash. They do not take card.
author: Jay V.

description:
I wish there was a 3.5 stars.  I like Cancun.  It's open late.  I can walk there.  And I often do.

I pretty much only order the vegetarian burrito, and the melon agua fresca.  The burrito is big, and for under $7 with a tasty beverage and free chips and salsa, what's not to like?

I've eaten there, and taken it to go.  It's not super clean, although not super dirty either.  I find it hard to believe that they earned a score of 100 from the health department, but I don't really care either way.  I try not to think about it really.  Anyhow, the burritos are good, and the tacos seem to please the other people I know.  I might note that if you're a super-strict vegetarian/vegan, this place is probably not the best for you due to shared grill space.

The one thing I don't recommend is the giant wet veggie burrito - they microwave it to heat the sauce up and melt the cheese and the resulting hot avocado is beyond disgusting.  Otherwise, it's a reliable place for standard Mission fare.
author: Kim S.

description: I absolutely love their burritos, but I'd love it even more if they gave me more green sauce.  They keep their sauces behind the counter so that no one can take too much.  If you try to ask for too many, they will ask you for more money.  Why can't they be like the other mexican places I've been to that give you as much salsa as you want and make it self serve?  The workers behind the counter are super quick so the wait never gets to become unbearable.
author: Steven S.

description:
How anyone with tastebuds can give this place anything less than 5 stars is a mystery of the universe. What did you do? Eat from their trash can?

Oh, I'll grant you that the restaurant itself is tiny and cramped and you couldn't pay me to use the restroom (if they even have public restrooms) there, but that's part of the charm!

I would say "the price is right" or something equally trite and sound-bytey but that would imply that the quality of the food is lacking in any way. Believe me, it's not. The burritos are thicker than my arm. Toasted tortillas filled to capacity with savory Mexican rice, beans of your choice, juicy grilled meats or even prawns, heaping handfuls of cheese, spoonfuls of fresh avocado... and I just had a food orgasm. Excuse me.

Ahem. Better now. I can't speak of the rest of the menu. The burritos have been so good to me I've never had a reason to look at other items. Love the horchatas, though. Ever so cinamonny.

I cannot use enough superlatives about this place. I remember one visit when I was in high school. 1 am with my high school boyfriend, eating their chicken burritos. Suddenly he asked me "what's wrong?" I realized I had been staring at my burrito with a dazed in love look. I assured him, "It's nothing. I was just having a moment with my burrito." 

Years later, I still feel the same way. Try this place.
author: Diane Y.

description: Probably my favorite burrito place in San Francisco. Open late. Delicious food. Of questionable cleanliness.
author: Karl K.

description:
This is easily my favorite taqueria in San Francisco...or... anywhere, it is SO good!  (and I grew up in Southern California so I know that when people say "So. Cal. has the best tacos" that it isn't true). 

The chips and salsa that you get with your order are really good-- ask for an extra green salsa (it is superior to the red salsa). 

I used to order the super taco... but I have moved on to the super quesadilla. Let me tell you, it has everything... meat, avocado, sour cream with lots and lots of cheese. It is probably enough food for two people, but I eat one all in a single sitting. It is that good. 

My friends and I go regularly, "hey- you wanna go get tacos?" translates into "LET'S GO TO CANCUN.. NOW!"... and specifically this location.
author: Russell Allen E.

description:
Another great burrito spot in the city.

So far I've only had their super burrito, but it was well worth it. Their carne asada is awesome and one of the best grilled steak burritos I've had. Compared to El Farolito (my other favorite burrito spot in the mission) Cancun's burrito has more beans than sour cream. However, it remains very moist and flavorful.

If you love burritos like I do, order one here!
author: Andrew C.

description: Great food for Very little Money. One of the best Burritos in town. This place is always crowded. For a good reason!
author: Adrian W.

description: First time here and the food was great. We are Texas relocations and this was on par with most tex mex burritos. Would go again!
author: Luke A.

description:
I was very disappointed with my burrito from Cancun Taqueria. I had been looking forward to coming here for a long time after my buddies had raved about how good this place is. When I saw it on the 2010 7 x 7 Big Eat list, I was finally convinced to drag myself out to Cancun to see what all the hype was about. And that's exactly what it was, hype. 

To begin, the chips and salsa were outrageously boring. The chips were clearly store bought and the salsa was anything but mild and inspiring. I asked the guy at the register if they had any really spicy salsa, like habenero salsa, and he said the green one he had provided was very spicy. That was so bogus. Get that weak "hot" sauce out of my face! It was about as spicy as a sweet watermelon agua fresca. Also, at an authentic Mexican restaurant in the mission, is it too much to expect fresh chips made in house? Even the gringo white person Mexican places in the Marina make their own chips, WTF! 

Then came my burrito, a super chicken burrito. Overstuffed grilled tortilla packed with flavorless chicken, cheese, avocado, sour cream, salsa, rice, and beans. Tasted bland as fiber one cereal. I mean, do they even marinate the chicken? Come on! Also, you must be the only taqueria in the Mission to serve up whole beans; where's the refried beans when you need them?!? These are supposed to be dirty, greasy, gut blasting mission burritos! I didn't know they sold Baja Fresh burritos in the mission! 

Anyway, I won't be coming here again. Just off the top of my head, I'd recommend El Burrito Express, Nicks Crispy Tacos, La Taqueria, La Tapatilla, El Faro, La Corneta Taqueria, Tacolicious, Papalote, even Chipotle before I suggest Cancun Taqueria to anyone!
author: Timothy C.

description:
Burrito = great.
Food poisoning = not.
author: Nicholle B.

description: If you want authentic Mexican food, this is your place.  Right in the middle of the Mission. Perfect place for lunch while touring the Mission District.  Very simple looking storefront, that cranks out great food. Had the carnitas platter and it was amazing. Huge portions of tender pork. The beans were also great.  You can see them cook it up while you wait.  Highly recommended.
author: Marc C.

description:
Cheap. Fast. Filling. Authentic. and LOUD! 

The experience you get when you dine here is really authentic. The Mexican dude who sings with his guitar seems to come here often. There's something about dining amidst their bright yellow walls and festive ceiling decor that makes me feel so happy. It's like a fiesta every time! Just like Mexico. Oh and about the dude, sorry to say... but he really can't sing. He's a sweet fella, though!

Tostada de Ceviche with Avocado- Sure beats El Farolito's. They were spot on with the marinade! Not too sour. Not too watery. Good balance of cilantro and onions. Good portion of fish too! I think it was tilapia.

Alambres- Bacon fat makes everything taste better. Especially when slathered about onions and mild green peppers. That's all I've got to say. Oh yeah, bring some Tums.

Carne Asada Burrito- Aromatic, but standard. Nothing hopped out at me in terms of flavor.
author: Colleen W.

description: I love this joint. Al Pastor Super Burrito for the win. Nice flakey tortilla, little bits of jalepeno in the guac (which is good avacado chunky guac) , and damn fine pork seasoning/roasting.
author: jacob m.

description: I just moved  to the city and am a big fan of mexican food.  Hopped onto my yelp and came across Taqueria Cancun and saw that it had 1400+ reviews so i thought i must definitely give it a try.  I think a big part (for me atleast) of mexican food is the chips n salsa.  I am huge fan of chips n salsa and from my experience, if the chips n salsa arent good, neither is the food.  The chips n salsa were nothing special at all.  I ordered the super carne asada burrito and it was OK.  Id eat here again if i was in the area, but wont go out of my way to eat here.  Also, Cashier was friendly, but the cooks in the back who call your number when your order is ready were not friendly at all.
author: David S.

description:
Freaking taco heaven!  I need to make it to the mission more just to get some mexican food like this.  Its cheap, delicious and the salsa packs a punch.  And be warned the guac is almost as spicy as the salsa, there's no relieve except an ice cold corona.

The asada tacos and carnitas were on point!
author: Ryan J.

description: Im eating right a lady with her mother, grandma or something  coughed hella loud. Not covering her mouth just cough. That lasty I will never eat there again.
author: Glen W.

description: Perfect if you're in a bind, but you got better options in the Mission. The place is narrow as hell and the chips aren't very fresh. 3 stars sober. 10 stars when I'm not.
author: John B.

description: Al Pastor Super Burrito was Bomb!!! So tasty. It was my first time there and there will be a second
author: Jesse B.

description: Totally over salted beans,REALLY crappy chips, no salsa selection, no tortilla steamer, and a permanently open door making the place perpetually freezing. What you east coast transplant dipshits that post on here have failed to recognize in your short tenure out west, is that a tortilla steamer MAKES a burrito. LA Cumbre is number 1...
author: Tim E.

description: I seriously love this place. Sometimes I go here late at night after work, still a line out the door, but always just as good of a burrito as any other time. The guys who work here are super friendly, and very tolerant of all the drunkards shouting orders at them. Hats off to these guys.
author: Samuel J.

description: Great burrito for the price. Love their guacamole sauce.
author: Sam L.

description: The regular burrito is very big and is stuffed with any choice of meat (chicken, beef, I forgot the rest), beans, rice, cilantro, and onions. There was not much onions (I guess that's a good thing because who would want onion breath) but I like onions because of the crunch. I really liked the nachos and salsa and green tomato sauce. There was live entertainment too. Next time I come here, I will try something else other than a burrito because apparently, I couldn't really handle it. I do like Taqueria Cancun so the next time I come here, I'll just order something different!
author: Vicky P.

description: i like the warmed, grilled tortillas here for their burritos.  i do wish they gave more salsa away, b/c they come in tiny containers.
author: Helen T.

description: This place made me realize my pet peeve with Mexican food. No salsa bar, and extremely stingy with the tiny cup of salsa. One red and one green, barely enough for three bites of chips.  I hate that ish. Figure out your portion size and charge more, I don't care. Just give me more salsa. The torta and burritos need it.
author: Derrick V.

description:
The Good:
+ To the SF folks who always whine and argue about how California Mexican is superior to NY Mexican: thank you. I finally know. The burrito with carne asada that I ate was such an impressive monster. It was the most delicious Mexican food I ever put in my mouth (this may seem like a backsided compliment, but it's not; I eat a lot). 5 star grub!
+ Beer availability in the fridge was a plus.
+ The menu items were affordable.

The Bad:
- Cash only.
- Seating in the communal picnic benches is scarce on a busy day.

The Ugly:
-- If I never stepped foot into the restroom, I may have given this place 5 stars. To say "it was disgusting" is an understatement. The restroom was unfinished as the walls were just sheet rock. For some reason there were two toilets. One was a replica of the toilet scene in "Trainspotting". I swear I almost lost it.
-- I would go back again, just avoid the restroom.

IFHTP 1
author: Peter K.

description: Good taqueria. Very cheap. Service minimum. A bit of a line.
author: R G.

description:
Here for a capoeira event. Only thing that was near and open. I admit the service is fast. The register guy is quick and accurate and the staff is ultra quick. The restaurant is also very clean.

The only reason they're getting 2 stars? Most importantly, the food. Their chips are completely fake and not homemade like most taquierias! I ordered their nachos with carnitas. While the meat was moist, it was also oily and too salty. The balance of cheese and vegis weren't good either. I ended up eating mostly the meat and a few chips.

Totally dissatified.
author: Jaelynn D.

description:
Nom Nom Nom.

Places like Taqueria Cancun make me want to forgo eating healthy and become morbidly obese.  The food is just so delicious. I would deal with the social stigma of weighing 400 lbs just to eat here every day. 

I love this place for many reasons: 

1. Avocado on everything.  I freaking love avocado. If I could marry avocado and have it's yummy, yummy children I would. 

2.HUGE portions.  I always have two meals worth of food. Plus, they are never stingy with the salsa or jalapenos. They will happily give you extra.

3. They make an awesome burrito. Also, everything else on the menu is in burrito form, so you know it's good. Order a taco.  It's really just an open-faced mini burrito.  Order a quesadilla.  It's a cut in half burrito without rice or beans. Nachos. They are just the innards of a burrito on tortilla chips.
author: Lara O.

description: CASH ONLY. But great food and service. It was good quality for a hole in the wall kind of place on the mission.
author: Jaimie M.

description:
Cancun is reliable, open late, very low-cost, and has excellent vegetarian burritos. The location is also great. The seating is ideal for large parties, and the staff manages to be polite, efficient, and friendly even in the busiest times.

While I feel there are better burrito places on the Mission, this one is still amazing and beats the heck out of anywhere not on the Mission. Nothing I've ever had here has been bad. For sheer reliability, rowdy/cheerful atmosphere, and service, this place deserves 5 stars.
author: Ned D.

description: I find my way here every time I'm in the Mission. Great carne asada, reasonable prices, this place would fit in if it were in SoCal. Which of course means it's legit.
author: Kevin C.

description: I daydream of these burritos on a regular basis.  Enough said.
author: Courtney C.

description:
Our friend who lived in San Fran for a few years just raved about this place so we went there last Saturday night and the food was REALLY good!!  The burritos were huge and tasted just like street food in mexico.  Salsa and chips weren't amazing but free with our food.

It's a hole in the wall place so we weren't expecting fine dining but the bathroom was disgusting.  Urine everywhere.   

But I would definitely go back for the food.
author: Jen D.

description:
Get the vegetarian burrito, you'll be glad you did.

Most of the meat burritos would feed two people.
author: Eric H.

description: It only feels right that my first yelp review would be for Taqueria Cancun. I will love Taqueria Cancun more than my firstborn. I don't care that I have to circle the block 8-10 times to find a parking spot. I don't care that I have to feed the meter. I don't care that it's cash only and I have to pay a transaction fee. Mutha'ucka charge a two buck transaction fee! My douchey ex-boyfriend used to take me here all the time until our Ike and Tina Turner-esque relationship ended, so I avoid this location like the plague. I'm not trying to run into him with his fugly amazon girlfriend (don't worry, I'm not mad)  Now I frequent the Bernal Heights/Mission location for my vegetarian burritos. Less hipsters, more Frida!
author: Crystal P.

description: Horrible service - messed up my order after making me wait one hour.  Don't go here. Dirty and gross!
author: Ray K.

description: I had 2 super tacos and they were delicious!  The only problem is that now I will want some every time I am nearby...
author: Andrew L.

description: Taco salad was good.  Place seemed clean enough and the service is fast and friendly.   Salsa was hot.   Pretty standard.  Cool loud décor and stuff.
author: Abigail J. M. M.

description: The Veggie Burrito is huge. Took a little while to make, but complimentary chips and salsa kept me satisfied while I waited. It's served on a warm, flaky tortilla and is hearty but dry; I'd order the Burrito Mojado next time.
author: Dan R.

description:
You can always count on a fresh vegetarian burrito here.

The avocado is creamy and green.

The cheese is melted just right.

The rice isn't too salty.

And the salsa always tastes fresh.

Palaote is my one true love, but when it comes to burritos, Taqueria Cancun has some sweet burrito rice filled curves.

(review edited due to some rather graphic burrito porn :) )
author: Jessica T.

description: We had the vegetarian tacos with avocado and marinated pork tacos. Tacos were ok, nothing to rave about. I have been to better taquerias than this, but so many yelpers cannot go wrong. Maybe I'll try their famous burrito next time around. This place was overflowing with people  in any case.
author: Mia C.

description: Just ate a big ol' burrito here from a STRONG recommendation. Bestburritoinsf. The salsa's are both great, one is real spicy which I love, and the other is a milder verde. I stuck to the Super Burrito and it is enormous. Chicken was a bit dry, but when you're paying 6.50 for tasty food wrapped in a warm blanket amounting to the size of a small lamb, no complaints!
author: Patrick A.

description:
Damn, 900 something reviews huh?  

Well, I'm struggling between giving this place a 4 or a 5, because seriously, I can't find anything wrong about the Super Carne Asada Burrito I had.  Good tortilla properly heated, good guac, good salsa, charred asada.  Hell, this burrito is probably one of the best I've ever had.  So why not the 5?

Maybe it's because this Taqueria Cancun is found in the Mission District of SF, which is grimy as fuck, and that's coming from a person who spends a lot of time in Venice.  Maybe its the super crammed space and long lines that bother me?  Naw, that's not it.. I see passed all that shit.  I really don't know.  But if I were you, a random person not from SF looking for some good burrito action in Mission, I'd come here.  

Oh one more thing,  Mission sucks.  Viva Taq. Cancun!
author: Jason R.

description: Delicious Delicious Delicious!  Some of the best Mexican food I have ever had, and it's perfect for late nights.  I love Al Pastor, and their Al Pastor knocked my socks off.  The only thing I would complain about is the size of the place, but the food more than makes up for that.  I truly wished I lived closer because I would probably eat here daily.
author: Eric L.

description: I went here after bar hopping with some friends..I kind of didn't want to stick around mission because it gets pretty scary at night but I'm glad we did!!  SOOOO NOM NOM!!! I ordered the super carne asada and they pile on CHUNKS of avacado...this is the best burrito I've had so far in the bay area...I'm supeer picky with burritos. This was by far the best part of my night :D and FYI I was sober so my taste buds were intact hehe
author: Michelle P.

description:
After yesterday's Gordo bland burrito, I had a hankering for a real burrito to remedy the blah and restore my belief in burritos as comfort food. I just so happened to find myself in the Mission District. How fortunate. 

Taqueria Cancun was packed and I had a feeling that I was going to leave happy. Stood in line, ordered the regular burrito with carnitas, then sat down at a table to feast on the complimentary chips, guacamole and salsa. I love spicy food and the guacamole and salsa packed quite an unexpected punch. Wow! My burrito was ready in about three minutes. As I picked up the burrito and unwrapped the top part of the foil, I knew I was in for a treat. Sure enough. The burrito was packed with tender, juicy carnitas, along with the perfect proportion of rice and pinto beans. I finished about half and was delighted that I'd have enough for lunch tomorrow. 

$4.99 for a delicious burrito, chips, guacamole, and salsa: one of the best deals in the city!
author: Melissa K.

description:
Fast service +1 star
Big Burrito +1 star
Yellow tables and cool music +1 star

I didn't really think that it was that amazing, but then again I got a veggie burrito... Burrito comes with chips and extremely spicy dip. No more dip for me, thanks.
author: Colleen M.

description:
My husband and I moved to the Mission about 6 months ago and we have been on the hunt for a taquiera that we both agree on.  Every place seems to have a few things that each of us like, but we've still been searching.

Taquiera Cancún definitely got us a few steps closer to finding "our place."  This might even be it - we'll know for sure next time we want Mexican food - if we immediately think of this place or continue our hunt.

I got the super nachos with carne asada and he got a carne asada taco and a carnitas burrito.  The carne asada is delicious and tender.  The carnitas were good too - but the carne asada was so good that we kept wanting more of that. The horchata was great too - I love when it has authentic texture.  

I definitely recommend this place. They are always open late and the staff was fast considering how busy they were in there. 

Yum.  Maybe we'll go for lunch today. :)
author: Autumn B.

description: Featuring very festive decorations, it is a great obvious late night spot, where they intermittently play a Mexican song or two. The portions were quite large and cheap, but the most important part is that it was surprisingly good. I got the large chicken burrito. No doubt, I would go back again given the chance (just not too often).
author: Silis J.

description: I am a El Farolito Addict! I would choose their burrito over any other, BUT Taqueria Cancun was closer to me so I've been going there and it has grown on me. All I have to say is get a Steak and Shrimp Super burrito, Trust! My friend made it up and it is GOOD!
author: Karen T.

description: One of the best options for authentic Mexican food in the City. Perfectly priced and competitive with other establishments so it really forces the customer to decide loyalty. Well, when I'm craving a taste of home, the choice is easy - I'm bringing myself and good company to Taq Cancún!
author: Spencer R.

description: Good food, great prices, large portions.
author: Mike E.

description:
My husband and his friends always say that the best taquerias can be ferreted out because they have one of the two following characteristics:  1.)  Christmas lights year round, or 2.)  Questionable hygiene practices in the kitchen.  

While Taqueria Cancun doesn't actually meet either of those requirements exactly, they do have immensely colorful decorations hanging down from their ceiling year round, and the bathroom is definitely scary...but that's okay, because you came here for one thing:  The BEST Burrito in all of San Francisco!!  

Their carne asada is moist and flavorful, already very different from the rawhide-style chunks of shriveled beef found at most taquerias.  And instead of filling your burrito with watery guacamole, they give you the real deal:  humongous hunks of fresh avocado!

I also highly recommend their quesadilla suisa - succulent, flavorfully meaty and cheesy and incredibly filling!!

A word to the wise:  don't order the refried beans if you can't handle heat.  Cancun's refried beans are super-picante, something that often surprises new patrons who are used to the uber-bland kind found at other taquerias, Tex-Mex restaurants, and from a can.  Not a fan of black beans, either?  Try the pinto beans - they won't scorch your mouth like the refried ones, but feel substantially lighter in your stomach than black beans!

The only downer about Taqueria Cancun is the corn tortilla chips, which aren't the thin, crispy, salty addictive kind found at most other taquerias...but you don't generally go to a taqueria for the chips, right?

Best of all, Taqueria Cancun is open really late at night...so if your burrito craving hits after several hours of hitting the local bars in that neighborhood, you might still have time to stop over at Cancun for something substantial to soak up all the alcohol in your stomach before heading off to bed.

Sure, there are folks for whom this taqueria isn't the earth-moving experience it is for me and mine...but I figure these folks just haven't tried the carne asada!
author: Amy L.

description: Easily one of the best burritos I've ever had. The line wasn't as long as the other popular burrito places in SF, but the burrito was crazy delicious all the same.
author: Rajesh S.

description:
Ive now been here twice. The first time I was borderline blackout drunk so that review i'm going to leave out... But I came here today for lunch for some hangover Sunday brunch with my friends

I got the Super Burrito with cabeza and it was preeeetty good. The flavor was all there. I loved the flakey tortilla and the melted cheese lining the inside of the wrap. 

The reason i docked two stars were that they went a little heavy on the pinto beans+rice, didnt include as meat or guac as i hoped, and i found all the sour cream at the very bottom so I didnt even finish it. 

For 5.99 it did its job: get me full, so for that it gets 3 stars. Buuuut I think I had a better experience when I was piss drunk, but doesn't that apply to everything anyway?
author: Calvin L.

description: One of the better burritos in the city- a close rival to El Farolito.  I usually go for a Prawn super burrito. Cash only.
author: Bass T.

description:
Best Burrito in the city.  
This place will change your life.

This is what living is all about

Great food, good prices, fun atomsphere, just all around goodness
author: Doug S.

description: This place used to be the bomb. Now, they are only so-so. If you just want a full belly with nothing too special, you'll be alright eating here.
author: Laura P.

description: My favorite freaking carnitas in San Francisco. I can't really rate any of their other food because when I come here I get the carnitas. If you are not comfortable in the mission you won't be here. If your OK with The Mission don't miss out on the best carnitas in SF.
author: Brian D.

description: The best burritos in the city.  Yeah, I mean it.  The carne asada burrito is my favorite, but I like the tacos and quesadillas too.  There is no yuppification- bastardization of this Mexican food.  Just good old fashion Mexican Food, served in generous portions.
author: David F.

description:
I have to be fully honest: when I went here, it was very late and I had indulged in a few drinks, so my standards weren't their highest.

Despite this, I was extremely satisfied with my two tacos: one carne asada and one grilled chicken (had to try both). I have a weakness for great fresh tacos; the way the meat mixes with the cilantro and onions all on two delicious corn tacos just really does it for me. One thing that always gets me about carne asada at a lot of places is when it's too fatty and not cooked well so it's that tough, hard to eat fat that gets in the way of me enjoying my taco. Not a problem here.

Great food, I look forward to coming back one day totally right of mind and doing a comparison. Look for the update.
author: Rachid G.

description: I was pleasantly surprised eating here last night! My friend and I shared a shrimp burrito and picked off of my other friends chicken nacho plate. Overall everything was really good! It was a little messy on the inside, but what can you really expect from a 2am burrito?
author: Erin L.

description:
Al pastor taco, you may have dripped all over my new trench coat, but I could never hold it against you. All those red stains are just a testament to how goddamn juicy, spicy, flavorful and delicious you are.

Carnitas taco, you were yummy too, but lacking that crisp I was looking for. I gave you a shot, but I've decided to commit to your brother al pastor til death do us part. Can we still be friends?
author: Lisa W.

description:
This place is where it's at! My friend and fellow comic introduced me to this place one day after getting wasted for his birthday and were looking for a spot to chow down. Maybe the reason I liked it so much was because I witnessed the best fight ever between a bunch of hipsters that lasted for more than an hour and I'm not exaggerating. I think after writing this I should rate the SFPD one star for never showing up because people were beating the living shit out of each other and it just never seemed to end. Back to the food.

This place gets' PACKED and fast. So make sure you save a bench while your friends are ordering. I order the tacos every time when I come here. I always order my favorite and what I believe to be the staple of the restaurant, the Al Pastor (In the words of Drake "The best I eva haaad") and then try out something different. Tacos are big and filling and down right delicious. This is the favorite spot for comics to come after doing the Sunday Punchline showcase, so if you're hungry and looking for a good laugh go to Taqueria Cancun on Sundays. Show is free admission with a two taco minimum.

Or you can check us out on January 25th for the Fresh Kids of Comedy show at the SF Punchline! http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=118785931524456
author: Josh V.

description:
Bomb burritos!! Every time I visit the mission, I make sure I come and get a burrito.  I like the carnitas the most, but the chicken and steak are good too.  

This taqueria is really cheap and it hits the spot every time. Thank you taqueria cancun for so many late night drunken cravings. 

This place is so good that I will hop on Bart from West Oakland, to come and get my grub on!
author: Skyler W.

description:
I used to eat here frequently. It's the place that I used to look forward to for late-night food after dancing or rock climbing. But I just can't support a place that treats its patrons with the contempt that this joint does.

A while back, myself and seven other climber friends came here after Mission Cliffs closed to order some tacos. As we were ordering, a woman at the back demanded from one of my friends that he give them his tacos. After he refused, she and her friends assaulted my friend, cutting his face, punching him a few times, and calling him racial epithets.

We stopped the fight and amidst the yelling, asked Cancun to call the police. They refused.

Then the group assaulted another Cancun customer after they stood up for us.

Cancun still wouldn't eject the patrons, call law enforcement, or intervene in any way. It was a quiet night with no line, but during the whole thing they calmly took whatever orders came in while their customers were being attacked.

The group of people, having physically attacked two customers, sat down and continued to verbally attack and threaten other customers until they decided to leave a few minutes later. We had called the cops, and luckily were able to identify them and get them arrested.

I was incredibly shocked by Cancun's appalling attitude and have nothing but contempt for their business.
author: Kyle B.

description:
I've only eaten here once, and I've only had one thing, but the Burrito is AMAZING.

It wins 5 stars ipsofacto.
author: Gerardo C.

description:
A brilliant coworker of mine suggested we head to the Mission for an evening out. I can think of no better place to start the fun than is burrito place, which has burritos so good they will Don King your hair  with each bite.

There's not much more to say about the food other than it's incredible, perfectly cooked innards that don't suffer from the typical burrito problem that each ingredient is ghettoized within the tortilla. Things were spread evenly and awesomely and it was the same consistent goodness from bite one. The green sauce they give you is pretty spicy, so don't overdo it and ruin your burrito until you've sampled it. Tortilla chips also smacked of yum.

But before i move on, i must pay homage to the tortillas themselves. Now i have traveled the earth, had my fair share of foodstuffs designed as a vehicle to get other foodstuffs into my belly. Of the greats (butter cookies for nutella, terducken, chick fil a biscuits) nothing comes close to these. These must be some Atlantean recipe, something passed from the alien visitors to the Mayan and Aztec high priests. They are the rising and setting sun and all life in-between. Their mix of taste, thickness and barely charred flakiness means that they pierce your chest cavity and grab hold of your very soul li ke the first love of your life.  Were that i only lived in San Francisco.....

So what stops this place from being the perfect establishment? It is understandably crowded... While the clientele seemed pretty damn cool, friendly and in a good mood (who wouldn't if they were eating there) it was pretty close quarters and if your party is larger than 4, chances are you will either have to split up at different picnic table style seats or wait a while for a seat. Chances are the former once you get your food because you will lack the patience to wait.

Also, if Mission life isn't your thing, then this will probably be too sketchy for you...but really, this is worth any trial or tribulation to get to it.

Overall, its in the same service style as  (line ordering going towards a cashier), but looping them in the same group as Cancun is like saying Cortes was close enough to Quetzalcoatl... Go there, be merry, bring cash, be ready to order and you will be rewarded with a happy ummy that prepares you for whatever late night adventures you are getting yourself into.
author: Ned C.

description: Huge burrito that hits the spot if you're hungry. Free chips too and salsa was good. Price was ok so I'd go back if it were closer to me.
author: Dang T.

description:
This place carries my favorite burrito in the world.  The Super Veggie with pinto beans.

When I left the country for a year to go to Ireland, I met my friend at SFO to say goodbye and she BROUGHT ME A SUPER VEGGIE BURRITO because she knew I wouldn't see Mexican food for waaaay too long.  That's love.

You can't go wrong when there are actual slices of avocado in your burrito.  Plus, they grill the tortilla.  It's the best.  Add a Negro Modelo to your order, eat the free chips and salsa they give you with your burrito and you won't have to eat again for a day.

If you're downtown, try the one on Market, too.  It's consistently faster than the one on Mission & 19th.
author: mary r.

description:
This no-nonsense place on Mission Street makes fabulous al pastor tacos!   I tried the carnitas also, and they're a bit drier of course but add the green salsa and you're all set.  

Late night there's always a line, but they are seriously fast (be ready with your order when it's your turn!), and you get your food really quickly. 

It's almost as good as El Farolto for that intoxicated, post-bar sustenance. You'll be glad you added several of these tacos to your night's consumption - you'll feel better in the morning.
author: Mike A.

description:
Approaching 6 months with living across the street from Cancun. Time for an update! I've tried to try every meat option available, but I still cave in and get the same things. Augh. I really need some self control. 

Here's my current personal ranking, but I'm just not a beef guy apparently:

Al Pastor
Carnitas
Chicken
Carne Asada (sorry maybe I just don't like them here?)

I should get tacos and just round up the tongue, beef head, and brains.
author: Charles L.

description:
Such enormous burritos, such small prices.  Haven't found a burrito I like better, and I live in the Mission...just getting that out of the way. 

  Anyway, the restaurant itself is festive, and the dudes working there are always kind and super fast in the cooking department.  The place has an open kitchen where you can watch the magic while you wait a bit in line. If you're really lucky you may see where exactly they store all that shredded cheese...
author: Pernicious J.

description:
Open late and in the heard of the Mission.  Thats already a good start.  

The food itself is pretty good, they claim to have the best veggie burrito in the City but I don't really agree with that.  It is tasty, and deff one of the top 10 mexican joints in the City.
author: Raman S.

description:
When I lived in Miami, I bitched about the lack of authentic Mexican food. You'd think there'd be better options in such a Latino melting pot, but no, there was a dearth in Mexican cuisine. Better luck in Philly, I was promised. 

So in Philly, there were better options. Nothing blow-your-skirt-up fabulous, but decent Cali style burritos. "Just wait until you get to SF!" my friends promised. 

Now that I'm finally here I'm being told this isn't it. It's LA where I want to be. WHATEVER. I am completely satisfied with Taqueria Cancun. It's where I devoured my first post-bar burrito and it's where my heart's buried.

I know El Farolito has all the street cred, but Taqueria Cancun is what I'm reppin'. Palabra.
author: Monica S.

description:
my GOD do I miss Taqueria Cancun...

When I met a guy on eHarmony who had also lived in SF, now lives in DC, hates the drabness of DC as much as I do, misses SF almost as much as I do, and - here's the clincher- said Taqueria Cancun was also HIS favorite taqueria in SF, i was CERTAIN we truly were a match made in Dr. Neil Clark Warren's heaven.

Turns out, mr. eHarmony and I are perfect BANTERING partners, but that's about the end of the partnering compatibilites... 

However, we both, still, languish over the lack of ANYTHING comperable to Taqueria Cancun in DC... I did find one place in the Bronx a couple of months ago that may actually surpass Cancun's veggie burrito, and i told mr. eHarmony about it, and he flat out refuses to accept this possibility... I understand. I, too, fear the wrath of the God of Taq Cancun at the mention of a rival, but I had to let the truth be known.

However, the likelihood of me getting to SF again far outweighs the possibility of me getting back to the Bronx, so Cancun can still count on my $4 every chance possible.

Now- for the fine print:
the location on Market St/6th -- if it's still there: didn't have such a good/tastey experience there the one time i ate there.

the location further out on Mission street:
it's just dandy. but somehow it just does NOT taste as good as the one on Mission & 19th (??? -- pardon my lack of specificity... i've been gone 8 years and i STILL miss this place!)

if you're veggie- *I* really believe Taqueria Cancun has THE best veggie burritos, ever! (save the little place in the Bronx that I can't recall).  GO THERE! Eat one for me, please!

6/10/07 UPDATE:
I just got back from a week-long vacation in San Francisco. And yes, I hit Cancun as much as possible. And yes, it's STILL just as awesome as ever. SO damn tastey. Can NOT figure out what makes the difference.... SO SO SO tastey. Go there and order the Veggie Super Burrito for $4.50.  You'll be happy.
author: Angela G.

description:
Not sure how the reviews are so great on this place.

The service was good for what you get ordering at the counter.  But the food?  so so.  The burrito that they are known for was lacking in what should have been burrito heavan according to others.  The carne asada was good but not shouting out.  

Better mexican is had in the area and in fact much better in Detroit which I was not expecting.  Taqueria Almeda or Senor Lopez in Detroit would make this place shut down if they were next door.
author: tony a.

description:
This place can get super packed and busy. The portions are a good size. Not over the top huge but not small either. The menu is equipped with the basics and they do it well. The prices are on par with everything else in the Mission. 

I prefer eating here late at night then some of the other taquerias in the mission.
author: Kate D.

description:
Delicious! 

Tacos were amazing (though, I'll confess: I had to use a fork). 

The beers hit the spot, and the ambiance was just what I needed (lively, casual, communal, completely unpretentious).

One of these days I'll get around to ordering a burrito ... I'm still intimidated by its size. But they looked great!
author: Minnie P.

description:
Amazing Taqueria! Overall Carne Asada Burrito and a Sol Beer for $9.49 with a side of chips.

The burrito was well put together - had the right mixture of rice, beans, and meat. It was pretty filling without being overwhelming like other burritos. One of the better burrito's I have had in San Francisco in awhile.

Cash only was the only drawback.
author: Brian D.

description: One good damn burrito! Tried the steak super burrito and its huge!   Also had thr chicken reg burrito.   Both very good.   Chips were great as well
author: Wai H.

description:
Like some other reviewers here, I am a little surprised to find that some people actually don't like this place?  hard to belive - it is really really good!!

If you like VEGGIE BURRITOS - I found this is the place for the best veggie burrito anywhere!

 I always swoon over the grilled tortilla.  Their green salsa is the greatest ever!  This place is very colorful...So glad to hear it is still a favorite with the locals!  Also another location somewhere in SF - just as good.
author: scott a.

description:
So if you know me, you'd know it was only a matter of time before I saw what all the fuss was about at Taqueria Cancun. 

Trust me, I'm as hurt as you are that I have to give Taqueria Cancun 3 stars. I just don't get what all the hype is about. I have to give it to them, for a hole in the wall Mexican place in the Mission that gets as much foot traffic as this place does, it is very clean. The wait to get your food can be a little lengthy, but that's to be expected from such a busy place. 

That being said, I have to explain why I gave the place 3 stars. I was a little disappointed with...the food. Say whaaaaaat? Yeah, sorry guys, but I just didn't think this place was as amazing as the yelp reviews had made it seem. Ended up ordering a chicken super burrito and a carne asada super burrito. I have to say, the meats were amaaazing. The carne asada was marinated really well, was super juicy, and just had awesome flavor. The thing I really enjoyed about the chicken was that little bit of crunch which gave the burrito a really nice bite. 

The gripe I had with the super burritos is the amount of filler ingredients that's in there. The rice and beans don't add much to the burrito flavor-wise, so the huge amount of each that they put in there really does a disservice to the great tasting meat. The best part of my burrito was the last couple of bites because all of the meat gathered at the bottom, with just a bit of rice and beans. Those last couple of bites were amaaaazing. Unfortunately, that means that the other 3/4 of the burrito was all rice and beans. 

 If the whole burrito was made like the last 1/4 of mine, Taqueria Cancun would've definitely gotten 5 stars in my book.
author: Angelo D.

description: Oh, I do love my hole in the wall taquerias and this one is no exception. I ordered two lengua tacos and my friend the super burrito. I thought my tacos were good, although this place charges a bit more than the average taqueria. I would have liked it more if they didn't chop the lengua into such small pieces though. My friend's burrito, which I had a bite of, was very good. They toast the tortillas on the grill with butter, making it extra yummy. If I come back, I'll order the burrito instead.
author: Alice W.

description:
A friend took me here because he said this place was recommended.

Before entering Taqueria Cancun, you will see that the front door has the "yelp loves us sticker".  This should be a good sign, right?  With high hopes and an unsteady stomach, due to motion sickness, I entered the restaurant.  Immediately I noticed the papel picado adorning the ceiling.  The colorfulness of the art brightened my spirits.  After a few more moments of looking at the art, I decided to turn my attention to the menu above the cashier.  

As I had never been here before, I needed some time to decide what I wanted.  While I was contemplating the menu, the man at the cashier stood there looking exasperated and kept tapping his notepad, which made me feel like I should hurry.  Mind you, there was no one else in line. 

Finally, I decided on a regular grilled chicken burrito and the boyfriend decided to get the regular al pastor burrito.  The man at the cashier gave us some chips, salsa, and guacamole.  We picked a table and waited for our friends to arrive.  While we waited, we snacked on the chips with the salsa and guacamole.  The salsa and guacamole had a nice amount of spiciness.  Our burritos arrived a few minutes later.  

The burritos were quite big but not quite as firmly wrapped as I would have liked.  Though I kept the aluminum foil wrapped around the burrito, the burrito started to fall apart, making it hard to eat as I neared the end of the burrito.  I liked that the chickens were grilled and cut into chunks but I felt that they skimped on the chicken and put in a lot of rice and beans as filler.  I couldn't even taste the chicken until I was 1/3 of the way through the burrito.  I tried a few bites of my boyfriend's al pastor burrito and I thought it was okay.  The place was nice enough to give extra sauce when we asked.

Overall, I thought it was okay.  Next time I go to San Francisco, I might consider coming back if I'm at a complete loss at what to eat but I doubt it.  If you are nearby, I do suggest coming here for a try.  3/5 stars.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
I came here for a quick post-race -i'm dying-must-eat-now!!! dinner before heading back to the east bay.   Not exactly by choice, since I've always been true to El Farolito up the street and I'm not really into the hipster : homeless scene at Cancun.  But the boyfriend really wanted a torta and after running 13.1 miles that morning, limping 6 blocks up Mission was too much effort for my aching calves.  So Cancun it was.

Quesadilla suiza with carnitas + cantaloupe agua fresca + freebie chips and salsa.   All of it wasn't bad, it might have been good actually, but somehow I just wasn't as satisfied by this exact meal like I normally am.  The quesadilla's flavors seemed all mushed together, and I couldn't tell if there was even sour cream or avocado in there or not.  

Maybe I'm being too harsh, but next time I'm sucking it up and hiking those six extra blocks for my little dose of happiness.  Ohhh, it's worth it.
author: Joanne G.

description: Thank you for being right across the street of Beauty Bar! You have saved meeh and my friends from many hunger attacks after a night of dancing!  I love your nachos n burritos. This place is pretty packed whenever I go whether it is during the middle of the day or late at night.  The guys who work the counter are cool and friendly.  They have a juke box that plays espanol music which I have yet to take advantage of. Also their prices are not all that bad.
author: Zara-Maria S.

description:
It's a bright yellow place, you can't miss it! Had my dinner here with a couple of friends, and this place is awesome. You know this place is awesome because of the upbeat music playing and customers chatting it up as they enjoy their meals.

We all got the Carne Asada Super Burritos with chips and Mexican Cokes. (I don't know why they call them that, but I LOVE getting those Cokes, makes any meal great) This was a cheap meal, and the size of the burrito was significantly bigger than what I've had in the past. 

I actually was unable to finish my meal and disgraced myself.. I'm such a phony.. The flavor was excellent, but it I can only give it three stars due to having one burrito that cannot surpass it in flavor.
author: Richard C.

description:
If there was one thing I could eat for the rest of my life, it would have to be the Taqueria Cancun's beef super quesadilla! It beats every quesadilla, taco or burrito I have had in my life; ever, anywhere! 

Every order comes with free chips and salsa. Great and colorful interior.

Cash only! (Did I mention that it's crazy cheap?!??!)
author: Tizia B.

description:
In the Mission district, El Farolito is the prime spot for Mexican food. It's open late, the food is bomb (especially when you're not sober), there's usually a line, free water and salsa, and its cheaper than most other places. 

To me, Taqueria Cancun is your next best option if you can't make the trek all the way down to 24th and Mission. I find their carne asada and shrimp burritos to have a good amount of flavor, and the burritos are just as big as El Farolito's. The price isn't as bad either, but they take cash only. Like El Farolito, this place has the vibe of a hole-in-the-wall taqueria. Those types of places off the best food. You know it. I know it. We all know it. It's a nice plus that its almost open just as late as El Farolito, so if you're clubbing downtown, you can take your time a little bit if you're gonna make your way over to Cancun. 

I know Iv'e mentioned El Farolito a lot here, but I'm letting you know that there's nothing wrong with this place. It's a very good choice if you're looking to try something different. Good prices, good food, and quick service. Free water if that helps haha.
author: Loren John B.

description:
I've been coming since i was shown this place by friends who live in the area. of all the competition of great mexican food in the area you know this place is the hotspot when its always packed and the place is a little dirty. Not filthy but just dirty enough where u know the foot traffic is so crazy that the employees can't keep it polished. 

i always get 2-3 super tacos pollo asado (grilled chicken) and a mexican soda pineapple. never disappoints and i always leave uncomfortably full. The salsa and chips included with each meal is to die for as well.

Tip: CASH ONLYYYYYYY
author: Ray L.

description:
I like my super nachos with NO BEANS. It's how I always order my tacos, nachos, burittos.. 
I'm a lil ole Chinese girl, I don't do beans and beans do not do lil ole Chinese gals. I do however, do salsa verde. It's quite tasty and spicy at Taqueria Cancun.
But back to the matter at hand - What the fuck are beans??? Espeically refried ones!
Chinese people don't have beans (well we've got tasty red ones but that's beside the point) and dam well we don't fry them and then refry!

=(***
author: Susy C.

description:
We went here after the Bollywood Elite event (were still hungry because the bites never made it past the kitchen/bar area).  :(

I got the tacos al pastor.  These are the things I order whenever I try to judge how good a taqueria is.  They are super tasty!!!  And they have that kick (yes, spicy)!  Still not the same as Pepe's in PV, but they are up there for tacos not gotten from Mexico.

They get 4 stars (instead of 5) because my friend ordered some other tacos and were not as good.  

Will go again?  if I am in the Mission area... :D
author: Cindy C.

description: Ordered the tortilla soup which came four orders behind. Had to ask where my order was and when it came it was tasteless and the tortilla chips were soggy. My friend had the shrimp burrito which was also tasteless, won't be back.
author: Zoe B.

description: Ahhhhh...Burritos...Perfect for anytime. Excellent when drunk. My go to order: Carne Asada Super Burrito + Prawns, no beans, extra sour cream. Dare I say it? YES! Taqueria Cancun is my favorite burrito in the city. Yes, El Farolito is frickin awesome, but the steak and prawn combo at Cancun murders the competition. I love you Cancun, maybe a little too much.
author: John N.

description: Taqueria Cancun is the most authentic and delicious place in the Mission, hands down. They're always kind and the food is out of this world. It's ridiculous to rate this place low because they don't make SoCal style burritos. We're in the Bay area; it's different!
author: Kat A.

description: I've only been here at night but really, what more can you ask for than a huge burrito or quesadilla, when you're winding down? The wait can be a little long and you may have to sit at a table that a previous occupier neglected to bus, but the food is so worth it. Also the parrots painted on the walls are a nice touch.
author: Zooey I.

description:
Dear T.C.,

I didn't actually break up with you.  I just moved away.  Looking back I see that I didn't appreciate you as much as you deserved.  Now I see that you gave and gave, and I took and took.  I didn't know that I had it so good.

I didn't know that one day I'd live in a place where avocados are considered exotic.  And salsa comes in a jar.

Even the things that used to make me cringe, like the stoned people who wandered in begging for money, don't seem like such big turn-offs anymore.  All I know is that you know how to make one of the world's best veggie tacos.  And you sell Tamarind soda.   And that's enough for me. 

Love,
Tara
author: Tara M.

description:
I love me some Taqueria Cancún. When I was going to school on the East Coast, I would pine for their delicious carnitas burritos, damn-near-perfect rice, refried beans and salty tortilla chips. Now that Cancún is back in my life, my waistline is getting worried. They don't skimp on portion sizes and I've yet to be able to finish a whole burrito. The enchiladas are good too, but I've only had them with chicken which I found to be lacking a bit in awesomeness. Stick with carnitas and you'll be good to go.

Overall: points for delicious food, good location, and letting me order in my terrible Spanish.
author: Meredith D.

description:
AMAZING guacamole that they give with the chips. I wish they'd give a little bit more... I feel intimidated to ask for more (not even sure if the seconds are free.) The super carne asada burrito is honestly just average, but what made it better was the price. It's a little cheaper than other taquerias that charge $7-9 per burrito.  The meat is JUICY. The first bite was full of flavor, but as I kept eating, the last 1/4 of the burrito only had beans.

Expected the bathroom toilets to be DISGUSTING, but it was bearable!

Overall, I think I'll just stick to the El Farolito near my house.  This place did not have the WOW factor that would keep me coming back.
author: Karen L.

description:
This place brings a lot to the table, namely a lot of good food and a lot of regret and pain the next day. I ordered an Al Pastor Burrito Mojado (covered in enchilada sauce and cheese) which for six dollars provided me with enough food to feed a family of four in a third world country. The Pastor had a lot of flavor and a lot of spice. They also give out free chips and salsa. How cool is that?!

Not the best burrito I've ever had, but damn tasty and an outstanding deal. Also, as a bonus, the music they play is pretty freakin' bumpin (think old school hip-hop crossed with mariachi).
author: Casey U.

description:
After testing out all the best taquerias in the mission, for the price, quantity and quality I must say Taqueria Cancun has my vote for the best all around full meal deal. Their carnitas and carne asada in a taco or burrito super styled is da bomb!!! And that amazing guacamole green sauce - fo get about it... absolutely good.

Two tacos or a super burrito will fill you up quite nicely, but if you are really up for a challenge go burrito mojado. That thing is huge!!!
author: Minh V.

description: I always find myself at this place because it's super fast and they don't leave their meat sitting out all day on display like other burrito places , also it's great that they are open late it's not gourmet but let's face it that's not why I eat here
author: Joonier Y.

description: I havent had a burrito in months for fear of the terrible bloating that comes after devouring the arm-length bundle of carnitas joy that is the Mission burrito.  I finally took the plunge and my experience was all delicious and no bloating.  Cheers!
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I'm not hard to please so you know when I don't like something, its pretty bad. I grew up in San Francisco and I remember first hearing accolades about this place from a certain burning man loving vegan physics teacher, which should have clued me in to the fact that it sucked. Vegans have no taste in food, burners have no taste period...but I digress. How much does it suck? Let me count the ways:
1. dry ass tortillas
2.chicken that tastes like the bits in a can of chicken soup
3. pastores that is extra ketchup-ey
4. Chalky horchata
5. The chips are always stale. I know they are free but still
In sum, the food is as shittily bland as the crowds it attracts: pasty faced transplants who see the bright decor and don't know any better. If you are drunk and need some gringo mexican food, it is seriously worth it to walk a few blocks to one of the farolitos. The green sauce is much better at farolitos.
author: Julia M.

description: Delicious carne asada super burrito.  Well worth the near half hour wait in line at 2 a.m. that started out the door and snaked through the taqueria.
author: Erich D.

description:
BEST. SUPER. QUESADILLAS. EVER. 

If you are looking for Mexican food- the Mission is where it's at. Although Taqueria Cancun might not be as popular as the other taquerias in the Mission- it is definitely my favorite. You will see tons of people fulfilling their drunk munchies after hours.. everything from carne asada burritos to carnitas tacos to whatever you heart desire. 

Absolutely need to try quesadillas though, one order will serve 2 people and i think it's about $7. It is huge, cheesy, meaty, tasty, absolutely delicious and a taste of heaven. 

Definitely need to plan a night in the mission just so i can come eat here afterwards:)
author: Tenny W.

description: Love this place I love the supper burrito de carne Assada  cocktail quesadillas  alambre carne Assada the prices are affordable  and it's near my house
author: Victoria A.

description:
Your burrito may just may get jacked!  read on...

The burritos are big, nasty and delicious.  Okay, so it's not in the straight hood, but you should be warned.  I know this is a weird outlier situation, but the last time I was there I had my burrito stolen by some homeless man.  I didn't really mind since I set it down to go grab some chips and I felt bad for the dude.  BUT I did have issues the SECOND time it happened!  The second time months later, I was sitting at the bench and I set the burrito down literally in front of me and then turned my head to talk to my friend.  A few minutes later, my friend pointed over and laughed as another homeless dude started eating my burrito in-front of me.  I didn't make that big of deal (mainly because I respect the Darwinian 'Winning' attitude that the guy had).  

So that's my warning.  If you're not done with the burrito, don't EVER put it down even if it's literally half a foot from your chest.  I now travel there with duct-tape and tape my burrito to my hands.  It's funny looking and it sucks when you forget about them and put your arms around a lady, but it's worth the risk!
author: Danny C.

description:
I think it's one of those overhyped solid places that doesn't need to try too hard b/c it has a such a strong following. It's good food, but there are better.
Edit: I just had a late-night super quesadilla and that this was the bomb-diggity. Turns out I have been ordering the wrong thing. Seriously that super quesadilla knocked my socks off! I now get the hype.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Burritos are what you want here.  For about $5 you get a massive burrito and chips with really spicy salsa.  What makes the burritos so nice in my opinion is that they "toast" the tortilla so it's a little brown and crisp on the outside instead of just soft.  The salsa is also excellent and spicy.

The actual filling for the burrito is good but not any better than other places.

Bike Parking: no designated bike racks, find a sign post on Mission St.
author: Jean K.

description: Made a stop here after some bar hopping in the Mission! Carne asada tacos and carne asada nachos was perfect sobering up food to make the drive home!
author: David D.

description: Good food, good portions, and good price. I am very picky  with my mexican food and so is my husband so when he told me about this place i had to try it. It was so good i have been coming back every week. Its always busy so if your going to take out i would suggest to order by phone and pick it up(no line or wait with phone orders). They guys make your dood quick and if you have a problem with your food they are friendly about replacing it. I give it 4 stars because they forget my specific order...specific...so you cant really blame them. Overall great place.
author: Nelly L.

description:
Cheese enchiladas FTW! 

I frequent this delicious eatery 2-3 times a month with my son, that's all we eat. I've been trying to get the staff to give me their enchilada sauce recipe for years. Alas, no dice. 

Not worth losing a start but, I wouldn't mind if they offered another style tortilla chip. Maybe, exactly like, Casa Sanchez, "thick & crispy" tortilla chips. Let's call it a nice to have not a need to have. 

Quick, tasty and you'll live longer then eating all that value meal crap.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I seriously came here 3 days out of a full work week, every week, for almost two years until I moved.

In the rotation:
Burrito Mojado, Carne Asada, Black beans
Shrimp Burrito (Extra guac on the side)
4 chicken tacos

Their fresh cantaloupe juice is also on hit! Fresh chunks at the bottom of the cup. Get the large cup - well worth the money.

This is also a great spot for the late night munchies as its in the heart of the mission!
author: Johnny W.

description:
Disclaimer - this review is biased because I've been separated from my beloved California Taquerias for over more than a year now that I no longer live in there and the fact that alcohol might have been involved.

The Mission is full of delicious Taquerias but this one is nice and bright and conveniently located near Bruno's and Medjool.  While waiting for your food, you get delicious chips and salsa and guacamole.  Both the salsa and guacamole were spicy but so fresh and delicious!  I ordered 3 tacos - if my memory serves me correctly it was beef tongue, carne asada and sausage.  They were all done perfectly, so yummy, so quick, so good!  

The service is quick and the thing I like about this place is all the random people there at the end of the night too!  We befriended a guy name Carlos who seems to be a regular since he had friends come in and out and a case of 24 Coronas beside him that he was willing to share!  So come for the Tacos and maybe if you see Carlos, you'll get free Coronas too! :)
author: Thu N.

description:
This. place. is. awesome. 

One a fairly hungry afternoon a few days ago, I went in and ordered a Veggie Super Taco and a Mexican Coca-Cola. The shear amount of food I got for under $5 was amazing... and it tasted great to boot.

Totally going back here, and I'm told it's open at all hours, which is dangerous.
author: Allison S.

description: I got a chicken plate and my wife got a Carne Asada Burrito.  The chicken was dry and nothing special, while the meat in my wife's burrito was ground rather than strips I've had in plenty of other Carne Asada dishes I've had.  The chips that came with our meal were good, but the salsas were also nothing special.  The green salsa had a little heat, but was other wise bland and the pico de gallo was just watery and bland.  They don't take credit cards, so make sure you have cash.  They seemed fairly busy when I was there, so they must have a decent following and maybe it was an off day when I was there.  I wish they had outdoor seating, so I could eat with my dog, but with there being so many other good Mexican choices, I'm not sure I'll go back.
author: Scott L.

description: I'd disagree with reviews that say this place is nothing special! Sure, it is one of THOUSANDS of other taquerias in the neighborhood. The menu, almost identical to any of their neighbors, but the flavor here is spot on. Everything from the tongue tacos to the pulled pork tostada salad were seasoned perfectly, left tender, and piled amply with meat! The salsa is nice and spicy, and tables turn over fast so there's always a place to sit. Grab a Carona from the fridge and drift off to Cancun!!
author: Cameron B.

description: This place is my favorite mexican place! I love this place , The food is fresh and delicious! I love the chips and salsa they have here , its so good! I usually come here for the tacos and quesadilla ! The meat is full of flavor and the portions are big enough to fill you up! You won't regret it! The best part about this place is , its open very late! around 2-3 AM , but sometimes its crowded! 5/5 stars!
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Love their burritos. Got a lengua. Next time I'll try the steer head or brains.
author: Johnson H.

description: Loud and chaotic but the food is crazy good!! Hubby had the super taco with carnival and I had the quesadilla suiza, with Carne asada. Delicious!
author: Christie M.

description:
I'm pretty sure I've already given them 5 stars, so it's time to balance it out with a late night review.

The people who cook here late night are not making burrito win.  I've never had a good one from here late, and last night I was definitely not tipsy enough so I'm absolutely sure I did not order an "onion burrito with extra onions, please go easy on the everything else I really gotta have those onions!".  I've always lost my appetite on their burritos late night, last night I ate 3 bites.  When it's late t's always worth it to go down 5 blocks to El Farolito.
author: Greg J.

description: So far, these are my favorite tacos in SF. Loved the Carnitas and Al Pastor tacos, and I will definitely be back!
author: Angela P.

description:
Cancun is pretty bad. I am convinced that the main reason people go to this place is that it is located in the middle of the part of the Mission where everyone goes out at night and they stumble in drunk. Their vegetarian burritos are not good at all. Super bland. I would rather eat at Taco Bell. BUT, on a whim I tried a vegetarian quesadilla which was actually pretty good. That's why it got the second star, but I'm more of a burrito-man myself. If you want a good burrito late at night go to El Farralito (it's open until 2 AM).

The best mexican in the Mission is at El Buen Sabor!
author: Seth H.

description:
This review is specifically for the Al Pastor Burrito..

Just like other yelpers, I came here for a late night snack on my way home from a party in the Mish. After reading the rave reviews, I got myself a burrito. The verdict is just A-Ok. Yes, the burrito is massive and cheap as hell, but the proportion is just wack. My whole burrito is 80% rice, 15% al pastor, and 5% onion and cilantro. The worst part is that I found 2 huge chunks of pure port fat in it. 

Next time I will just stick to El Farolito or pray and wish that Pancho Villa will stay open until later.
author: Winnie A.

description:
The best Vegetarian Burrito in the city, hands down. I have been spending a lot of time in the Mission and can't always afford the pricey, hipster restaurants in the area so I often find myself scraping five bucks together for the Cancun Veggie Burrito. Delicious! I think they use about 1/2 an avocado in the entire burrito and its very tasty, moist and filling. The complimentary chips and salsa verde is also delicious. I took my teenage brother here last weekend (he's from hawaii and we don't have much mexican food there) and he was very impressed. It felt great to be able to have him visit and feed him without breaking the bank. 

Once I find something I like, I hardly ever order anything else so needless to say, I always get the veggie burrito... but my friends have also really enjoyed the camarones and the quesadilla.
author: Shannon A.

description:
Hands down one of the best burrito spots in the mission - at least for my personal favorite, the pollo asada super burrito.  Their pollo quesadilla suiza is also excellent. Their tacos, while good, are a little pricier than others in the city and not my favorite.  I'm not saying to avoid them, they just don't stand out to me the same way the burritos do. 

As much as I like this place, there is some inconsistency in their preparation.  Cancun can get pretty busy and when there is a crowd, I think they may rush the preparation just a bit.  When unburdened by hordes of hungry mission folk, they make a burrito that is truly magical.  The tortillas get a bit more toasted, the rice gets a bit crispy, and somehow the flavor just explodes. That said, even at their busiest I'd still say they make a 4 star burrito that is better than most places and I've never had one that was "bad."
author: jacob l.

description: I would grade this place different on the time of day that you go here. In the afternoon and the evening its a fantastic place to get a burrito. The flavors of the Carne Asada and and Al Pastor have achieved the status of an authentic burrito. There is a reason this place has won so many awards. I will say though, I have tasted better salsa and it is the only reason why I wouldnt give it 5 stars. Also, when the bars close and this place is the only place to get a burrito, it gets hectic. I have also seen people rumble in this joint after drunk affairs.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Incredible.  I love the breakfast burritos.  I would eat one every day.  

Salsa verde is terrific, too.

Just about to get my first non-breakfast burrito; i'm told they're also terrifs.
author: Harry L.

description:
This place is actually pretty great whether you are drunk or not -- and that is key =P.  I've tried multiple things on their menu and have yet to find something that disappoints me.  Their carne asada and carnitas taste great, especially in their nachos, tacos, or burritos.

Something to take note of however, is that their salsa has a bit more lime than the usual and when you eat to much it really brings out the spicy-ness of the jalapenos.

Also the place is more of a "community seating" place.  They have long benches all lined up against the walls for everyone to kinda just share with each other.

Lastly, cash only folks!  There is an ATM inside, but just come prepared and skip all those ATM fees.
author: Pia V.

description: Favorite burrito place in SF! Great super burrito here. They have good tortillas here too. I feel like the tortilla is an overlooked ingredient in burritos but dude, it's that thing that'll put a good burrito into great territory. Tasty carnitas too.
author: Andrius U.

description: This is my favorite mexican place in SF. It used to be a bi-monthly to bi-weekly stop for me and a few friends. It mellow and open late. Great for a college student's budget and voted by the bay area guardian for at least 13 years in a row best burrito, and I have to aggree. I love all the cilantro and hot sauce in these things. There is another location close to the 210 (also on MIssion St) that we frequented much more than this one, but they are both awsome.
author: Lisa C.

description: Best burrito in the Mission, hands down. Love this place. San Francisco is like burrito heaven goddamn, I can't get enough of the mexican food in this city. I'm from Texas, and California beats Texas in terms of mexican food. Sorry, Texas. This is where its at.
author: Siraj R.

description: Great food and come in good portion. Ordered Taco salad and is fully satisfied. Great flavor and can't wait to try the rest of the menu. Cash only, so make sure to visit ATM before going.
author: J Y.

description: My boyfriend, best friend, and her boyfriend were starving on a Friday night before mini golfing at Urban Putt and our original plan was to go to Tacolicious, but the long wait deterred us from coming back for our reservation (woops!) My boyfriend suggested that we look for a taqueria nearby, so he Yelped and discovered Taqueria Cancun, which was walking distance from BART. Reviewed by Eddie Huang of Fresh off the Boat, my boyfriend knew he had to go and try their burrito and this was the perfect opportunity to do that! Immediately upon entering, there was huge line that basically went to the smelly bathroom, which is why Taqueria Cancun only gets 4 stars. My boyfriend got an al pastor burrito, while the rest of us got super tacos and regular tacos with carne asada and carnitas. I'm not sure what the total was, but it was definitely under $20 for the both of us! I honestly could've settled for the regular taco because the super taco was packed with a ton of ingredients, make it kind of difficult to eat. On the plus side, they didn't skimp on the meat! Will be back
author: Joyce E.

description:
My name is Margaret P, and I am a hot sauce addict.

Good thing there are places like Taqueria Cancun that understand I need to get my fix. Their tacos and burritos are good enough on their own, but when you add the sweet heat of TC's hottest hot sauce, then your really off to flavortown!

it burns so good!
author: Caddy M.

description: I'm always shocked to discover an amazing burrito shop outside of San Diego. SD has a monopoly on delicious Mexican grub based on science: it's closer to the border than the rest of California. These facts cannot be disputed, yet Taqueria Cancun seems to have warped all we know about time and space and physics and distance and somehow managed to produce an incredibly tasty burrito several hundred miles north of the border. It's like a total Einstein brainf**k. Anyway, I was too busy enjoying my veggie burrito to do the math, but I'm pretty sure they've broken some rules of science or something.
author: Terrence M.

description:
Even when I'm so drunk that I accidentally take someone else's food I still love everything I eat here. The Pechuga is my favorite. Long live Cancuns.
Also saw Aesop Rock here. He got 2 tacos to go. Totally chill.
author: Matthew W.

description:
I've been in SF for almost 4 years and this is the BEST veggie burrito in the city!  Fresh avocado and cilantro with a toasted tortilla is the way to go.  Also, the Horchata and Melon juice are fresh, authentic, and refreshing. Best way to go is get a friend and split a burrito and nachos.  The salsa verde is spicy and addicting!

Gotta go to Cancun on 19th and Mission, it's definitely better than the other locations.
author: Maggie M.

description: Amazing food for super cheap prices. Get the burrito or the enchiladas to start off. I try something new everytime I go. Chicken is better for the burrito
author: Marc M.

description: Just get the Quesadilla Al Pastor with avocado and love life! Seriously.
author: Mike T.

description:
This place is great! I'm from San Diego so I know a good carne asada burrito when I see one. Canún's carne asada burrito is huge, well grilled, and the salsa is great, although it could be spicier. Tortilla was whatever - didn't add anything special to the burrito but didn't affect overall taste. Looking forward to trying all the other dishes. 

It's quite crowded during dinnertime but service was super quick. The place also doesn't look as clean as it could be. Location is awesome and this place is cheap.
author: Vicki M.

description:
My fave taqueria place in the world... also a plus that it's really close to my house. Everything is good here, good carne asada, carnitas, and spicy boiled chicken, but the newest kinds of meat that I recently tried which are now my fave are the beef tongue and the beef head. Sounds so disgusting maybe to most but the meat is so soft, tender, juicy and delicious, it's become my regular order for a super burrito. The prices at this place are good, 6 something for a super burrito. Also another plus that this place closes late around 2-3am.

Super nachos are hooked up fat too.
author: Patrick L.

description: In the "heart" of the Mission. It's almost a cafeteria style taqueria, no frills all money spent on the MEAT! Best priced taqueria with less "fillers" in your taco. Piles of meat - I got caritas and carne asada tacos and they were tasty to my tummy. The salsa and spicy guacamole salsa were yummy and spicy. They sliced on fresh avocados.
author: Jennifer B.
