description: I go to this taqueria at least once a week. The cooks are extremely diligent and friendly. I have often seen them under much pressure to perform and every time I go, their food is delicious! I highly recommend their marinated pork super burrito, the best I've ever had! Their prices are extremely low and I recommend this business above all other taquerias in San Francisco.
author: Marvin F.

description:
I'm sure everything on their menu is good, but to be honest the Taco's are unreal.

I've tried the carne asada, chicken, and marinated pork in the last 2 visits to Cancun, and the carne asada takes the cake without a doubt.  

"So good it makes you wanna slap your momma!"
author: Jeff W.

description: I believe my meat-eater friends that love Cancun, but for vegetarians, the burrito was pretty uninspiring. I was surprised at how dry the burrito was. I guess they normally rely on juices from the meat to season it? The veggie burrito could use some sour cream or guacamole or SOMETHING. With all the taquerias around in the mission, I probably won't be coming back.
author: Claire G.

description:
Taqueria Cancun was unable to live up to its hype as a potential favorite burrito place.

Our lengua burrito mojado was huge, flavorful, and bang-for-the-buck, but it did not stand out from wet burritos I have had at other places.  The sauce covering the mojado did not have a distinct flavor, and the burrito fillings were not outstanding.  

The chips tasted stale, and the salsas available for us to dip them in seemed ordinary and an afterthought.

Maybe my expectations were just too high.
author: Andrew M.

description: I know a lot of people worship this place but the only reason I didn't love it was that the burrito felt noticeably more on the greasy and fried side than all the other taquerias I visited in the area. That said, it was still good and I loved the al pastor the best.
author: Lauren C.

description:
There are only 3 Mission taquerias I would recommend, Cancun being one of them.  It was here that was the first time I'd ever eaten a burrito that used avocado over guacamole by default.  Now I always request avocado over guacamole if I'm ordering a super burrito elsewhere. If they have that option at other taquerias.  

Overall a quality gut bomb.  Not really known for making the biggest burritos. If you want a huge burrito in the Mission (See Taqueria El Farolito).  My one complaint is they don't offer carnitas, which is my preference so I usually order my bomb with carne asada here pero no frijoles por favor.

I haven't had anything else here except the super burritos and the burrito mojado (wet burrito).  The great thing at Cancun is they don't charge you like a few extra dollars for the burrito mojado like most taquerias do.  

I've also been to the location on 6th/Market.  I feel both locations are quality.
author: David C.

description:
First off, no guacamole? What does that even mean for a Mexican place?

My craving for a burrito still not satisfied, my sister and I headed to the Mission to make it happen. So much hype over this Taqueria and my expectations were pretty high. Lets just say I was dissapointed.

I partly blame myself for ordering the wrong thing again. Dammit. I ordered Al Pastor instead of carnitas. The flavoring was as expected but the whole burrito just didn't impress. Too much, too little? I couldn't figured out why it sucked. Partly because I prefer guac to avocado in my burritos anyday. I ate half and took the rest home. My sister got carnitas and hers was better than mine but still nothing special. The chips were OK and the salsa was spicy. Pretty much the whole experience was just edible, nothing else.

When will I get a good burrito???? Please be today as I make another journey out to the mission to be satisfecha.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Came here at night and doesn't look like the safest place. From the outside, it had a small little entrance. It wasn't that big of a place, but the yellow would catch your eyes instantly. This place has great atmosphere. You walk in and you can see they are proud of culture. It seems as I can get anything on the menu and it would be great.

 I just ordered a simple carne asada super burrito with everything in it. It was really cheap and big compared to other taquerias. They give a guacamole sauce and some salsa with the nacho chips. Great place for the price. If you hungry and around this place, give it a go.
author: Hui L.

description:
The Vegetarian Burrito is alright. It is even better after a few drinks. It is awesome after a dozen drinks. It is a decent burrito, but nothing to write home about. 

I wish they had a salsa bar. That would add another star or 2.
author: Peter V.

description:
I've only ever come here after a long night of drunkenness and yeah, most food tastes good when you're drunk. When it comes to late night drunken Mexican I would put this place on par with El Farolito. I still prefer Taqueria Vallarta but Cancun is conveniently located within walking distance of much of of the nightlife of the Mission but it's usually always very busy especially on the weekends. Last night I got the torta con jamon because I wasn't hungry enough for one of their huge burritos. It was good. Wasn't the best torta i've ever had but it was only $5 so yeah...it's good for the price. 

So yes, I'll give it 4 stars for being open late night to appease my drunken hunger as well as the cheap prices.
author: David C.

description:
Everyone has "their mission burrito place" to which they claim loyalty and will defend fiercely. Taqueria Cancun was my friend's "place", and now its mine to. 

so now when people try and tell me that [insert random taqueria] is better I inevitably start shouting "NO WAY! CANCUN IS THE BEST EVER. [random taqueria] SUCKS! CANCUN FOREVER!" 

Dont get me wrong- Im not crazy. And I have occasionally had better burritos, but something about Cancun incites the rabid fan in me.
author: L K.

description:
Cancun is hands down my favorite Taco place in the Mission.  Now, this is not to say that there are not other good taco place around, but Cancun just trumps it all.  

Basically, they have two meats that stand out from the pack... Al Pastor and Chorizo.  The anatomy of the Cancun taco is as follows.  Double tortilla thingie, smothered with a GIANT dollop of the meat of your choice (but seriously, trust me, just get the Al Pastor and the Chorizo) as well as a ton of Salsa.  It's greasy, your hands and perhaps shirt will be stained, but as the juicy sloppy mess hits your mouth it generates a tacogasm that rocks you back and forth for basically the whole night.  The only downside is that, like a lot of the "hip" places in the mission, the tacos here are pricy, with each taco being $2.30.  If you want a better bang for your buck, get the Taco Salad, which is like $6, and giant.
author: Leon K.

description: My fav place on Mission for Taco's.  Carnitas, Lengua and El Pastor super tacos are all tops.  Not the best ambience, but its pretty quick, food is good everytime and there's always really good people watching.  Even took my parents from the Midwest here and they loved it.  Mom was trying to order 2nds in Cantonese - ya they figured it out. LOL
author: Scott R.

description:
I have had Mexican food at restaurants in almost every large city on the west coast and further have had the real deal in Mexico. This is the best Mexican food in the U.S. I have ever had and honestly the quality and quantity is beyond perfect for the price.

The green hot sauce is the best by the way!
author: Benjamin K.

description: Great cheap place to get a dank burrito for $5. This place also sells Mexican cola which is always a great refresher ( better than your regular coke). The only downside is that it's not too clean (but its worth it for the taste) and gets crowded too easily.
author: Dmitri S.

description:
I love you. No really, can we get married? Will you move back home with me and meet my family so we can spend the rest of our lives together? 

With fresh ingredients, rapid service and cheap prices and almost 1000 reviews, most of which emphasizing the positive, its easy to see how I, like so many others have fallen in love with Taqueria Cancun. If I was a local, I would be eating here at least twice a week. No question about it. Alas I am not, today I will venture back to the east coast, missing the awesome Mexican goodness from Taqueria Cancun. 

You hold a special place in my heart and trust me, you will be missed. 

Promise me you'll write?
author: Ben G.

description: Great food! Had the mojado burrito, gigantic. Also had the shrimp cocktail and the tacos. Don't recommend the shrimp cocktail, although the portion is very filling. Everything else is the bomb. The mojado is at least 2 meals.
author: Annie Y.

description:
No matter where I lived in the City, THIS Tacqueria Cancun (the one on Mission and 19th) . . . has ALWAYS been the best. I know, I know, there are a BOATLOAD of mexican restaurants, and tacquerias in SF, and I've tried most of them . . . but, honestly, this one is the best (in my opinion).

I always get the Burrito Mojado, al pastor, black beans, no rice. Get some grilled green onions on the side if you want. Seriously, the sauce they put on top of the burrito, is simply better than anywhere else; the spices in the meat . . . delicious. The only reason I've gone anywhere else, is 'location' (I've even tried the other Tacqueria Cancun's, and for some reason, they're not as good).

Call ahead, avoid the line.
author: Peter B.

description: One of my favorite taquerias in the mission. The super quesadilla with carne asada-- out of this world. Burritos here are good, honestly... anything here is good. Perfect place to grab a beer and a burrito and enjoy the evening.
author: Erica W.

description:
I am addicted to Cancun's green salsa (I think it is the tomatillo/ avocado salsa). I would like, upon my demise, to have the mortician replace my blood with this stuff, and I am quite sure that a handsome rather greenish mummified-me will be the result. I will then donate my corpse (bacteria inhibited by way of the pure green jalapeno now suspended in my veins) to Cancun for display, to be dressed as a baddass green slightly dead gaucho under whose sickly green warning, all may marvel and pale. And forevermore, they called him: Behold a great burrito!

Oh yeah and pretty much everything else here is good from the big ass tacos to the super stuffed prawn burrito. The sheer volume of food turnover here should let you know how good the place is. I am sorry to the gentelman poster, however, who got mugged in the joint. I would have assailed your offender with a homemade mace, a veritable eyesalve of tomatillo/jalapeno/avocado death, and we'd have strolled victoriously into the mission sunset, bad guys foiled with superior salsa!
author: Zizzle f.

description: Best carne asada on the fucking planet.
author: Rat A.

description:
So I am officially the 784th Yelper telling you what's up with Cancun Taqueria (I'm sure I mispronounced that.. I say 'tacoria' when I know I need to roll my R's a lil more)

I really don't think I have ever had a better taco in my life. No, serious..like ever ever ever.

Not much more to say except go here, eat the Al Pastor taco.. then come back, log in and thank me for the suggestion. 

Pick me up an extra taco if you want my undying love and affection. Yes, buying my love is just that easy. 
I'm moody though so, I'll be over you by the time I finish the taco.
author: T C.

description:
Having lived in the Mission for over a year now and eaten at this place countless times (and yes, even sober), it's time to update this review. I'm not sure what I was thinking before when I knocked off a star for chips, because who cares about chips when this is the best taqueria I have tried thus far?

Everyone is all about Cancun's burrito's, but I'm holding down the Quesadilla Clan. People, trust me. It's all about the Super Carnitas Quesadilla; it's better than any other I have tried in the area, and frankly, gives my life meaning. The carnitas are flavorful, and more importantly, not wet (unlike other places in the area) so the quesadilla doesn't get soggy. 

I could go on and on about the details, but c'mon, it's a quesadilla; I'm not about to pick it apart and comment on "technique." It's amazing, every time. What more is there to say?
author: Kelsey E.

description: This place is the place to go if you're craving legit Mexican food, and want to get in and out quickly. I can't speak for its early morning hour service, but I was here Sunday around 2pm and the service was quick. I heard it's super packed at night, but I hit this place the afternoon after to take care of the slight hangover and it hit the spot. I ordered the Chicken Burrito and it was delicioso!! And it comes with chips and salsa which is a win in my book. It was a mouthful, it was savory, it was tasty! My friend got their Vegetarian Burrito and swears by it, but I will have to try that one day for myself when I decide to go meatless for the day or something. I also got the horchata here and it was worth ordering!
author: Cindy T.

description: I can always go for a carnitas burrito from here lol. It is so delish! I have yet to find a place that serves better food than here but the reason there is only 4 stars is because it can get pretty crowded, the place is semi-small and they messed up my burrito- once. And as picky as I am, that is a good thing.. Ha.
author: Danielle A.

description:
It's the site of one of the best Burritos in town. I think it's actually against the law in San Francisco to not go to this Taqueria.

Pro Tip: Green salsa doesn't mean mild.
author: Roderic C.

description: Sizeable amounts of meat on the tacos, though the heat of the spicing kinda makes it all taste just...hot. A little more sour cream to cut the fire would have been nice. Really banging salsa though and the chips had more texturey crunch than usual. spacious and clean sitting area and the food came fast.
author: Kevin L.

description:
God I love the carne asada super burritos here with a coke in a bottle, the chips and that green sauce MMMMMmmmmmmmmm~!!!!!!!!!!!!
Sooo gooood one of my favorite burrito spots!!!  Been here in the past and forgot how good it was!  Freshest, tastiest avocado slices in my burry toe, rich perfectly grilled tend, and moist carne asada, sweet melted cheese, with no overload of beans or rice, just the right amount of everything, very generous with the carne asada,  hands down this place rocks!!!
author: Chris B.

description:
Dear Readers, 

THE FOOD HERE IS A PIECE OF MEXICAN HEAVEN IN EVERY SINGLE BITE. Since I've had the pleasure of knowing their existence, I've never been disappointed by anything on their menu. Granted, there is always a FATTY line that curves around the restaurant. But, the wait is well worth it! The food here is ridiculously mouth watering good - I ALWAYS get a side of their mexican rice since it's one of my favorite things on the menu. If you're not a vegetarian go for the super burrito/ the super taco/ (and/or) the quesadilla .. YOU WILL NOT REGRET THIS DECISION! It's sooooooooo good that I'm sure it will have you coming back for more. My friends and I would travel out of the way from a late night outing just to have a taste of their delicious food. Every order comes with a side of free tortilla chips and dips (which is always a plus). The price breaks down to something like this: 

super taco - $3 
super burrito - $5-6 
quesadilla - $5-6
a little piece of mexican heaven - PRICELESS 

The place itself is very festive and feels like a hole in the wall type of restaurant. HEADS UP - when there is a fatty line (usually after 1:45 am) at el cancun ...it does get hard to find a table to sit in (especially when you're with a group of friends). Be prepared to have one of your homies scout for tables while the others are ordering food.

Sincerely, 
Some girl that really loves mexican food!
author: Cindy H.

description:
There is always a hot debate over which place has the best Mission Burrito, and Taqueria Cancun is always one of the top contenders. 

I wanted to try my very first Mission Burrito (I know, how could I have lived in SF and never gotten around to it?!) and sure Taqueria Cancun has a couple of locations splattered around the city, but it shouldn't really count as a Mission Burrito if it's not bought in the Mission district.

However, choosing the weekend when the Carnaval parade was going on right on Mission Street was probably not the best idea. 

Probably took us half an hour just to find a parking space... 5+ blocks away. Then we found out it was on the other side of Mission Street, which also meant it was on the other side of the parade. 

After another 15 minutes attempting to duck and dodge across the street like a certain pixelated frog on a computer screen back in the day... we were in. Then found out we were short on cash having blasted it on pizza and booze the night before. 

But luckily the ATM machine was right there in the store. Then there was the waiting in line, giving the order, paying and taking a number, sharing a bench with completely random people snarfing on food so yummy my stomach is yelling protest... then #27! It was finally our turn.

A icy fresh melon aqua fresca, three soft chicken tacos with paper thin flour tortillas loaded with tender diced chicken, onions, cilantro, tomato... and his huge veggie burrito with flavorful rice, creamy sour cream, chunks of bright green avocado, and soft chewy pinto beans... sauce dripped all over my hands and toppings flew everywhere as I attempted to eat it... and as I was starting to reach that sweet food coma spot I kept wondering... was it worth it?

HELL YES.
author: ChiYan T.

description:
I live right by Dolores Park and this is my goto taqueria.  I alternate between the carnitas super burrito, with the oh so tasty and tender carnitas, and the chicken quesadilla, chock full of cheese and grilled chicken and grilled to perfection.

Their green cilantro salsa is bomb.
author: Courtney N.

description:
It pays to know locals! My friends directed me to this amazing taqueria and said that its vegetarian burrito has been voted the best in the city for the past 12 years. My out-of-town friends and I already had a big dinner but was thoroughly intrigued when we heard that. We split a burrito and all I can say is: WOW!!!! I'm not a vegetarian but I am in love with this burrito! The rice and pinto beans are cooked to perfection and there's guacamole and cheese in it too. Just beautiful! I judge Mexican restaurants on how good their salsa is, and by far, taqueria cancun has the best and spiciest I've ever eaten! My friends and I loved it so much, we went back there 2 days later (after dinner again) and had one burrito each! Now that's love!

The interior is really quaint and colorful. Long tables and benches with brightly colored flags hanging from the ceiling, and a huge statue of Maria looking lovingly down on the happy eaters.  There are other taquerias along Mission but they didn't have the charm of T.C.  It closes at 2 am, so you get the drunk clubbers coming in for post-drinking food. They're on the loud side, but hey, it's all part of the experience. Anything is worth it for a damn good burrito!!
author: Heather T.

description:
There's not much to say that hasn't already been said about Taqueria Cancun.  This is my go-to taqueria b/c it's so close to me.  They're open late and everything's made fresh (i.e. meat doesn't sit around in warming trays waiting to be spooned, it's grilled to order).  I love watching them scoop out huge chunks of avocado into the orders.

Inside is bright and colorful.  It can be a little crowded, noisy, and messy sometimes, but it's alive and I love that about the place!

The only thing I don't like abt TC is their chips.. they're more often than not pretty stale, very thick and probably not store-made.
author: Christie C.

description: I am not going to say as good as it gets, but lets just say it is pretty F*ing close so close I might change it.  I should have wrote this a bit ago.The food is delicious, and everything is, so go ahead and try something different. This great, quick (unless packed your not waiting long) and delicious food is HELLA CHEAP! Let me repeat that CHEAP! A nice super deluxe burrito, my friend got suiza and it was $12. The place can get crowded quick, family style or great for groups and always open late. Can I say that I love this place yes, the only reason its not a perfect ah shoot its family style why I don't love it is part of its charm ok changing this. JUST GO if you want good Mexican food.
author: Natasha M.

description:
if you want the best burrito in SF this is the place to go. I went in there for the first time in ages this last weekend and I was impressed. This was my first time going to this place sober also. You are not going to get a better and cheaper burrito anywhere else in the city. My advice though is not to try their nachos, tortas or quesadilla. You go to El Farolito for the Quesadilla, to Panchos for Nachos and Tortas Los Picudos for Tortas. 
The Menudo looks good and I think I will try that one day. I also like the creativity of their burritos (especially the one with that Enchilada sauce on top of their super burrito).
author: Nir B.

description:
From a mexican food addict, you can't go wrong with anything here.  And they're open late. Great employees, too.  Due to Mission location, can sometimes get some interesting characters wandering through, but hey that's what gives it character.  Overall, for a no frills Taqueria, I trade off between here and Pancho Villa as my favorite.  Great green salsa here. but PV has a salsa bar.

And, to add to the fun, it has colorful decorations.
author: Marcus R.

description:
I finally tried Taqueria Cancun for the first time the other day, after many a night showing up with no more cash for late night eats.  I'm pretty pleased to report that their basic burrito option is a pretty legitimate option.

This is the first taqueria I've been to that puts chopped white onion and cilantro in their basic burritos and boy does it make a huge difference.  The extra flavor added by these garnishes gives the basic burrito a big boost.

If you like some heat to your salsa, I recommend going for their green one.  Not sure what's in it besides avocado, but it burns SO good.  And it's right across the street from Beauty Bar!
author: Eric L.

description:
Update 10/06.

OK, it was around midnight and after spending the whole day in the data center, we were hungry.  So, we went into the mission, and landed at Cancun.  I had already regaled my coworkers with the tale of the roach at the Market St location and the hairs in my food at this TC, but we went anyway.  So as I'm sitting there eating, and commenting on how the pastor here is so much better than other places, what do I see?  A mouse, scurrying near the front of the restaurant.  Bloodied, battered, probably having escaped either a trap, a cat, or the cleaver at the grill, but there he was.  Unbelievable.  Mark my words - I will never ever again eat at this place or any of their locations, and I think they should be shut down for health violations.  On the way out, I joked that I'll never eat here again, but might consider takeout.  Nope, I'm done.  Caveat burrito-or.

--
TC was my very first SF burrito, when I visited my sister a few years ago.

Enough has been written here about this place, and it's all true.  The burritos rock, the price is near the bottom of what you'll pay anywhere in SF, and I highly recommend this place to natives and tourists alike.  Don't visit at night unless you're used to urban environments (or take a cab straight here).  Mission Street at night can get...interesting.

Bottom line - you'll find the best meal you can get for around $5 in San Francisco.

My review applies only to this location (see my other one for the Market St location).  Since my original review, I've downgraded it from 5 stars to 3, due to the hairs I found on my plate.  The owners of this chain really need to pay more attention to hygiene and general cleanliness.  I'm not sure I'll be back, there are too many other choices that are nearly as good.

My sister says there's a 3rd location way down Mission St. that is possibly the best of the three.  Let's hope it's cleaner.
author: dan s.

description: Didn't I review this place already?  LOL  I guess not.  A good place to get Mexican food after drinking at the Lexington.  Open Late.  Good prices, authentic Mexican food.  No flan.  Cool staff and fast service.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Everything is good at Cancun, from the staff to the food to the environment. They have the best green, avocado based salsa in town, and amazing ceviche. It's not over priced and fills me up every times - LOVE it!

I recommend the al pastor, pollo asado or carne asada - and that goes for tacos, burritos, quesadillas - and they have amazing refried beans if you are from So Cal - it's definitely the closet thing.

My only complaint is that every time I've eaten there bums usually come in and beg - but hey it's the Mission
author: Nate E.

description:
You should always be skeptical of a taqueria named after one of the most unauthentic commercial Mexican vacation destinations.

But I wasn't disappointed here. :)

Fresh ingredients, out of control fiesta decor and usually a homeless person or two in the restaurant at all times. Cancun is a total sensory overload. The tacos kick ass, are piping hot and generous with the portions of avocado and meat. It's a good late night spot when you've got the munchies.
author: Chelsea P.

description: I know yelp has been telling me that burritos are not a food group, but apparently me and my friend have been eating burritos like they are it's own food pyramid. I'm also surprised that it's taken me a few months to process this review. Geez, talk about procrastinating. The great thing about Cancun is that it's open late. It's great when you're slightly drink and hungry. They also really cool here, the dude running the cashier on the saturday late night shift is funny as hell. He laughed at my friends jokes after he said something about the color of salsa. (Doesn't make any sense now lol) Their burritos are ok, it's not my favorite, but they're still purty good. I wish they had super hot salsa!
author: Monina C.

description: The carne asada super taco is exquisite.  It's a mistake to come here and not order at least one.   Two is all that & a bag of chips! Also, the ceviche tostada is a superstar.  These two items put Cancún in a class by themselves. Cash only.
author: toad m.

description: I don't care how great your burritos are (and btw, mine wasn't - pretty much just black beans and rice, completely underwhelming). You have NO RIGHT to sweep trash and whatever other debris is on your floor onto my feet as I'm eating, in order to get me to leave b/c you're closing up for the night.  If you really want to close at a particular time, then stop taking orders. But having made me wait in line, taken my order, taken my MONEY, and given me a crappy burrito, you damn well better not bully me out of your restaurant 3 minutes later by deliberately sweeping all the trash so that it hits me in the back of the leg while I'm trying to eat.  Gross.  I'm never coming back.
author: Priya R.

description:
There's a reason this place has won as many best burrito awards as it has - it consistently makes the best SF-style super burrito in the City.  There's something about the way they construct their burritos here where they never seem to be as messy as most other taquerias offerings. The contents always seem to stay hot and juicy without turning the always flaky tortilla that holds their burritos together into a grease stain.

Last time I went, I made the mistake of riding my bike home holding my hefty carnitas with black beans burrito by the thin paper bag as I rode home.  A block later, the bag tore and my burrito hit Mission street, skidding to a stop in the right lane.  I picked it up, saw that the foil had not been broken (the chips weren't salvageable) and dusted it off.  When I got home five minutes later, I shamelessly unwrapped it, sunk my teeth in and smiled - best burrito in San Francisco.
author: Dirty D.

description:
Lets me start off by saying I come here almost every day. This little belly I've been growing is fed solely on Cancun burritos. I've tried to kick the fix but to no avail. It also doesn't help that it's literally one block away from where I work. 

If you're bar crawling in the Mission and are looking for somewhere to keep the alcohol down, Cancun is definitely the place to go.
author: Tim J.

description:
Stopped in last night for a quick bite. I had the carnitas super taco. SO GOOD. My BF had the chicken super tacos... and from what I witnessed he REALLY enjoyed them. I agree with previous reviewers that the salsa verde is pretty close to perfection. 

My only suggestion is larger water cups.
author: Kari B.

description:
Wow! I think I found my new favorite burrito spot. Taqueria Cancun knows how to pack it all in their burritos: ingredients, portions and flavor! 

We ordered the Super Burrito with Carne Asada. The burrito was at least two pounds, and served up super fast. The meat was really tender and full of flavor, and evenly distributed among the other ingredients including avocado, sour cream, rice, etc. The best part of the burrito, in my opinion, is the outside of the tortilla. Most places just warm the tortilla before they fill it up, but Taqueria Cancun throws it on the flat top with the cheese sprinkled on top. Not only does this ensure that the cheese actually melts in the burrito (there isn't anything more gross than semi-melted cheese), but it also gives the outside of the tortilla a little bit of crispiness. That, along with all of the tasty ingredients, made for the best burrito I've had yet.

My only criticism? Get some better chips, guys! Especially when you're serving up such bomb salsa and guac!
author: Amanda D.

description: What they say is true - they do have the really good vegetarian burritos. And watch out, they're huge. I'd recommend half a burrito first, paired with their freshly made carrot juice, and complimentary chips. Then when hunger strikes next (and your reminiscing how damn good that first half was) pull out the other.
author: Suzanne P.

description:
This is my go-to place for a burrito. When I get the fever for the flavor of a burrito large enough to choke your burro then come to this place. The big wins here is the food is good. The Al Pastor (in my mind the measure of any taco or burrito joint) is damn tasty. The Carnitas is awesome and their Al Ambres is simply put "the stuf."

A tasty and awesome side dish if you're a lover of scallion like myself is the cebollitas, grilled green onion cooked on the stove till lightly browned and doused with lime. How can you go wrong with that? Hm?

For you nighthawks this place is open late but with great long hours come great long lines of half inebriated bar hoppers. Seating is a communal and can be a pain but overall a great experience. Be prepared for the occasional pan handler making his way in for a nibble or a swig of your negro modelo.
author: Len S.

description: An ode to the best quesadilla; it costs three bucks or so. No fuss sometimes a little muss always worth it. Thank you for being there after I leave El Rio.
author: Shvonne A.

description:
Used to be a regular here... dining at least once a week.. sometimes two or three. But the bf and I decided to try some other places and take advantage of some Groupon deals... 

Let's just say, taqueria cancun... you've been missed. Went here again last night, after about couple months, and I cant believe I ever stopped dining here. The salsa is AMAZING. Nothing can compare to their salsa... sorry el farilito, taqueria guadalajara, taqueria vallarta. I'm always asking for more and more.

Everything on the menu is delish. I haven't come across anything I don't like, which is unusual since I can be quite the picky eater. 

Service is friendly and fast. They never mess up on my order, which can get complicated... burritto mojado, half carne asade, half pollo, extra cheese, black beans...

Great, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.
author: Raeann L.

description: Cheap price, medium-low quality.
author: Amaan M.

description:
Heard great things about this place from a local tech podcast, but unfortunately it did not live up to the hype.  The burrito here was pretty bland, not alot of flavor within the meat itself.

For a real experience I've learned about El Farolito which is a few blocks up from this place.  23rd and Mission.
author: Ivan D.

description:
One thing that I usually go by when looking for a spot to eat, drink or play is to follow the crowd. The more people there are, the better it is there. I saw quite a few people here enjoying their food so I decided on stopping in for a late dinner before a night of drinking. 

I went up to the cashier and asked him what he would order and he said the lengua super burrito. I went ahead and said "I'll get one of those". A friend and I grabbed a seat at one of the empty tables and a nice couple from Australia sat asked if the could join us on the table. We didn't mind at all. As a matter of fact they were great company! 

The burrito was good, but I wasn't overly impressed with it. It could have used a little more salt and could be a little less watery. I guess that you can say that I am spoiled with the great taco trucks and restaurants around Oakland, but II think this place isn't too bad.
author: Darryl P.

description:
Awesome Taqueria.
This is the one restaurant I went to a few times on my short trip to SF.
Get the super burrito version at all times. 

Burritos are incredibly filling and tasty.  The line may be intimidating, but it moves fast.  Before you know it, you are chowing down on some great eats.  

Food: 

Chips, Salsa, and Guacamole - The guacamole and salsa are awesome.  Just awesome.  They go incredibly well with the thick, crunchy, salty warm chips.  So good.  The guacamole is very spicy and definitely is the reason why the food is so much better than east coast Mexican food.

Carne Asada Burrito - I got the regular version, while my brother got the "super burrito" version of this.  The only difference between the two is that the super burrito comes with sour cream and guacamole.  The regular version is good, but when you get the super version, you are in for a treat.

I also had the chorizo burrito and taco.  The chorizo is very flavorful.  It looks a bit oily, but it doesn't weigh you down. This is what I will be ordering on my next trip out there.
author: Chetan P.

description: I don't get it. Burritos weren't bad but I don't think anything really stood out either. I got the pork burrito but maybe I should have been more adventurous and went for the tongue. The cantaloupe fresca was good though a little pricier than expected (almost 4 dollars).
author: Donna W.

description:
Not bad, not bad...  The carne asada is good but not the best!  There are several places in the mish for me to try...  Anyhoo, I got the carne asada burrito.  There's something about burritos in the bay area, why do they have to add beans and rice?!?!??!   It fills up the burrito with sides!

I WANT A BURRITO WITH MEAT, SALSA & GUACAMOLE...
...where I don't have to pay extra for it to have it this way!

That's the way I'm used to eating a Carne Asada Burrito just like in San Diego!

hehe.
author: Limzer L.

description: Just be aware that it is cash only.  But, damn!, they have some tasty burritos!!  And the salsa verde is perfect!
author: Angela R.

description:
After another spectacular showing of "Don Reeds East 14th" at the Marsh  http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-marsh-san-francisco#hrid:B0lX-7sI2kJY3MDUyvyvjA, I was craving for something to nosh on the 45 minute ride home.

As we were cruising down Mission, my head swiveling back and forth like I was at a tennis match, the bright yellow decore of the Taqueria Cancun drew me like a moth to a flame!  We pulled over and my son ran across the street and picked up some tacos and Horchata for us.

The taco's were very, very, very big for street tacos and the meat was just falling all over the place.  This was good because they were about twice as much as I'm used to paying, but they were very good.  The meat was moist, juicy and tender.  

The Horchata was good, but the portion was small for the price.  

They saved the day!
author: Bee D.

description: Yes eat here if you are carnivorous. I am all about burritos made well and can vouch for Cancun's burritos by appearance and friends reviews only. There are little to no veg options aside from white rice and beans.
author: Laura C.

description:
Of the many, many taquerias in this city... Taqueria Cancun is my taqueria of choice. Specifically, this location.

LOVE the food... LOVE the free chips... LOVE the prices. They're fast and efficient, though it can get busy late in the night. You really can't go wrong here -- just don't expect anything gourmet. Just go. So yummy.
author: Daniel P.

description: Off all the many taquerias I've been a patron at, nothing ever beats TC.  The lively ambiance, the delicious food with that awesome green sauce, the late-night service... It is all there for you.  Much love for TC.
author: Kurosh H.

description: Nothing special.  I have no idea why this and other nearby taquerias are so highly rated.  I lived in San Diego for seven years.  These places are a joke.
author: Greg W.

description:
I've been eating here on and off for years but only recently, in the last 9 months have I started to really obsess about this place.   The location really works for me because of its proximity to a good friends place and ODC dance studio a few blocks away.

I always come hungry and they never fail to satisfy.   Eating in, you'll get nice nachos.   The prices are very good, especially if you're a taco fan - their carne asada taco's are excellent, and you know beef is one of the main things that can be funky in an otherwise ok place;  but here,  I only occassionally get a piece of meat thats too charred or too much fat.   For the price, thats not even a complaint.

I havent had a burrito here in a while but I remember that was nice also.  

They're open late and there's always a bunch of folks who live in the mission trying to quench their munchy-jones and nurse their buzz.  It can be fun.

I definitely recommend this place.
author: Afshin M.

description:
oh boy.. what do i say about the burritos at this place... Simply Awesome

This is my favorite stop for Brunch,lunch,dinner and late night dinner. The place is pretty big for a burrito place and the price is pretty good for the quality & quantity of food you get. 

Iam looking to find an apartment that is above this place so i dont have to drive down to this place. LOL

Besides there is live spanish music all the time. I guess its time to brush up on my spanish skills
author: Kishor K.

description:
HANDS DOWN. BEST TAQUERIA IN TOWN.

I WILL MISS YOU DEARLY TAQUERIA CANCUN SINCE I MOVED TO EAST BAY.

Let me just say, their super beef quesadilla or any other type of quesadilla is absolutely delicious. From the quality of the tortilla itself, to the yummy carne asada, to the pieces of whole avocado versus putting gross and watery guacamole, to the way they wrap it with aluminum foil to keep it warm and soft. Absolutely delicious and quesadilla second to none.

Super nachos are also great! 

Their hours are also extremely accommodating!! ONLY TAQUERIA IN THE CITY OPEN TILL 2:45 AM DAILY! 

LOVE IT, ADORE IT, OBSESSED!

CONS: they do not accept credit cards. This is absolutely RIDICOULOUS because it is only a way to drive clientele who does not want to pay a $3 ATM fee and other $3 NON-BANK ATM fee away... It's really a shame cuz I was often forced to hit el Toro as I only had a crdit card on me and was lt willing to use their ATM :(
author: NC B.

description:
BEST BURRITOS!

walk away with a tasty food log!

A must if you're in the Mission!
author: Mel A.

description: Once upon a time, I was told a story about a place where they had burritos that was the size of your forearm and it was to be found in the MIssion. Well, 20 years plus some change later, I finally became a believer. Okay, so the burrito might not be as big as my forearm but it is big and you will be full. It comes with all the fixings without the extra charge which is always good on a student's wallet. The carnitas was tender and flavorful and not greasy. The bite of cilantro and onion was refreshing to the burrito. The only thing that would make it better was if there was more heat to the burrito. My cousin got the alambres and I think I prefer that one to the burrito. It is big enough to share or if you never learn that skill in kindergarten, you will have leftovers. So dig around your couch for some change plus the singles from you wallet and come hungry. It's worth it.
author: Eve C.

description:
There's no better way to end a night in the Mission than at Taqueria Cancun.  I usually get a super burrito or super quesadilla with carne asada, take it home, and happily munch on it on the floor with my friends.

I much prefer Cancun over El Farolito, but EF is open later.  Now that I'm too old and tired to stay out past 2 on most nights, I'm delighted to be able to come here more often.
author: S L.

description:
past midnight and hungry for mexican food? check.
taqueria cancun rated well and still open? check.
greasy mexican fare? check.

arrived here past midnight on a warm sf wednesday night (oxymoron, i know) with my brother. we decided to split a torta, and it did not disappoint. the bread was buttered and grilled to a nice warm state of balanced bliss between soft and crispy. the al pastor was greasy, spicy, and an unnaturally violent shade of red (just the way i like it). they sliced in a very generous portion of avocado, and the cheese was melting as i dug into my half of the torta. there were also a few tomato slices in it (meh). we choose to forgo the refried beans and sour cream, but this was heaven at midnight. it was only 5 bucks too; what a steal.

on the side, we had stale chips to accompany house-made red salsa and a tomatillo green salsa verde. the red salsa was your standard fare, but the tomatillo verde was more tart, and it had a fantastic kick. it takes getting used to though.

come for the food, not for the ambiance or chips. leave satisfied and stuffed.
author: Danny C.

description: Been to over 200 mexican joints in the bay area, and cancun is the best. Cilantro, a grilled tortilla, hot sauce on the table, enough sour cream and guac, not too much salt, a sick jukebox with golden standards, hipsters looking hungrily within....
author: daniel f.

description:
I wandered in here last night, craving a tasty burrito.  Line wasn't too long, but that's probably due to it being a Sunday evening.

My usual burrito wherever I go is a regular with black beans and carnitas.  I didn't have huge expectations due to the cheap prices (nor did I expect them to have black beans).

I was proven wrong on both fronts.  I got the burrito quickly, and walked home.  Even after walking 5 blocks, when I bit into the burrito it was fantastic!

It didn't get soggy even after the walk and held together quite nicely (especially since it was enormous).  The carnitas was perfect.  It wasn't undercooked or overcooked, nor was it slimy like some is.  The seasoning was excellent too.  It was nice and spicy and had a ton of cilantro.

As an added bonus it came with a bunch of tortilla chips.  The chips were good (although I've had better).

All said, I will definitely be frequenting Taqueria Cancun.
author: Michael L.

description: Burrito mojado con una águila (Imperial - cerveza Costarricense) para tomar.  Just as I sit down, the guitarist begins playing...  Best meal I've had with a plastic fork and knife in years!
author: Sejin H.

description:
This place is great.  How can you go wrong with alambres?  It has BACON in it!  BACON!

The chips and salsa they give you have a lot of flavor - particularly the guacamole.  I don't even really like guacamole, but the guacamole here has a really nice kick to it.

Not only that, but the portions of food are MASSIVE and it's extremely affordable.

There were a few bits of meat that were a bit fatty and chewy so that was a let down.  Also, there is a large lack of cheese with the meals.
author: Alex R.

description: An extremely solid burrito. They also included free chips and salsa in the bag which was a huge plus. Would definitely visit again. If you're looking for a good (and cheap!) burrito in the Mission, this is the place to go!
author: Miles F.

description:
I had heard of La Taqueria and Pancho Villa before I even lived in the city, but never Taqueria Cancun.  And yet, it's got just as many Yelp reviews, scores of "Best such and such 200X" plaques on the walls, and a bold claim to the "Best Veggie Burrito in the City".  Now let's get one thing straight: you could not possibly have the best veggie burrito in San Francisco without at least one special ingredient in it.  Ideally, you should have lots of special ingredients to choose from (at least as many as meat burrito eaters get).  So I was disappointed to see that Cancun's is pretty straightforward.  But it's still compulsively devourable, and a great deal to boot.

Throw in the canary-yellow + fire-hydrant-red color scheme, the heavy bench tables, and some sweet agua fresca flavors (like melon, perfect for an oppressively hot Mission day), and you've got a downright fun place to grab lunch.  And no crowds either (though who knows what happens when the bars around here start turning out the hungry hordes).
author: Wes M.

description: Best tacos ever. I cannot stop coming back to this popular late night restaurant. I have even been here sober and it is fantastic!!! This is the spot for authentic taqueria!! Great staff as well!
author: Martin T.

description: I've probably gone here more than any other SF taqueria. Their green salsa is the best around. Something to note, that a lot of other reviewers miss, is that the food quality is really dependent on the time of day. They seem to make food a lot better during normal dinner hours. Late at night, to the drunk crowds, the food quality goes down, and no one really cares. So for sampling any taqueria at its best, I'd try and avoid the late night hours.
author: Kevin F.

description: Last Friday I was so hungry and needed to eat (quickly) before meeting a friend at El Rio. Perfect! I remembered this taqueria as being pretty good, but hadn't been in a few years. Also, my prior experiences here were after late nights out drinking and dancing... Needless to say, it was earlier in the evening and I was sober. I ordered the veggie burrito w/o sour cream, and it was soooooo darned good! It comes HOT, first of all, and was texturally delightful! Creamy, chewy, flavorful! DELICIOUS! I've been to countless taquerias and I think this one may be my top choice! Also the little salsas that come on the side are yummy! I need to go back more often and I will!
author: Jessica S.

description: This place is really good. Very authentic. We saw a long line so that means it's good. I ordered a super taco and my bf got a super burrito. It came with a side of salsa and chips. The salsa is SUPER spicy. I can't resist salsa so I took it like a man. My taco was huge. Meat was over flowing out. If you are a girl, 1 super taco will do and it's like 3 bucks!
author: Karen L.

description:
The burritos are flaky ... like a pastry ...  *HEAD ASPLODE*

I think this is my favorite burrito place in town.  I tried both the steak and carnitas (pork) and it puts everywhere in the neighborhood to shame.  Taqueria Cancun was voted Best of The Bay in 2008 and its easy to see why -- everything's fresh and taste amazing.

Ordering and experience are the only faults -- it's unclear where to stand to order (go to the cashier in the end) and who will give you your food (it appears on the glass with a number that matches your receipt).  You'll also have to stomach some serious Mexican music party jams along with your food, but all in all it's quite the worthwhile fiesta.

My recommendation:  Try the Super Burrito Carnitas without rice and beans and fresh juices - Carrot or Orange.  Also, note the fresh oranges served to the Virgin Mary on the way in. Amen!
author: niero g.

description: Great burritos, fair prices, in and out service and also decent places to sit down if you want. This is one of the ONLY place left in the Mission where I'll still eat, mostly because its one of few places to stay true while being flooded with pinche gabachos.
author: Diesel S.

description:
Unquestionably the best burrito in sf. It's all about the super burrito with steak and everything on it. Perfectly grilled steak, ideal balance of rice, beans, cheese and fresh sliced avocado in a grilled oversized tortilla. Take every bite with their stellar green avocado tomatillo sauce and wash it down
 with a corona. Great little hole in the wall that I highly recommend. I take all my visitors here and they still talk about the burritos.
author: peter h.

description:
I can't compare Cancun to La Taqueria but I was between both and chose this one. It was so amazing I stopped back a second time before I returned to the east coast without even wanting to try LT. 
I got a carnitas burrito that was so rich in flavor! They give you chips and two types of salsa while you wait. Delicious. 
I also tried their horchata which I can't say was the best I've had but the burrito made up for it. 
I still fantasize about it today...
author: Cristiana C.

description:
Disclaimer: My review may be biased due to being slightly intoxicated during my meal here
This place is fun. I saw my first digital jukebox here (and to all the patrons and staff who got to hear the incomparable Selena [descanza en paz] song Amor Prohibido four times in a row directly after I left, you're welcome).  
The food was great. I had ceviche tostadas, great flavor and good value. My companions had all six varieties of tacos between them and gave raving reviews. Looking forward to coming back here in a similar state.
author: Lacy K.

description: Bomby as always! It's been years since I was here and I came here a few days ago super late and it was crackin! The food speaks for itself and you'll taste why there are long lines of drunk ass people here late at night.
author: Steph S.

description:
This place was packed when we got there, n I have no idea why. Possibly because, 99% of the customers were hungry drunk people. Every table was dirty n they had no bus boy to clean the table n remove the other customers trash. I ordered a beef Brain taco, n a carna asada  burrito, the brain taco really didn't have any Mexican flair to it, it was just a small piece of brain, with a tiny dab of salsa, it was average, nothing special. The burrito barely had any meat in it, it contained 95% rice ,4% beans, 1% meat. It tasted average. Also few minutes after I ate there, i got a massive stomachache (it felt like mike tyson kept punching me in the stomacth, that how bad it was), i will never eat here. Later during the night after my brother in-law dropped me off at my home, I found out that he also got a massive stomach ache when he got home. lets do a little math if 1+1=2, than if I got a terrible stomach ache + my brother in-law got a terrible stomach ache = the meat in our burritos was bad.
I do not reccomend eating here, 99.9% of these reviews are from people that ate there when they were drunk. Anything taste good when your drunk, probably even dog crap. What I'm trying to say is, these reviews are not authentic (since they are drunk people) and undependable (since they are drunk people).
author: Khaled A.

description:
I came here after grabbing a drink in the mission with some friends.  Cheap and solid food.

I had the wet burrito (the actual name escapes me).  It comes with chips and salsa.  The salsa was really spicy and tasty.  And the burrito was great.  

Great spot for good cheap Mexican food.
author: Sabine A.

description:
I only get to visit SF about once a year, and I always make a point to get at least one burrito.  On my most recent visit, we went to Cancun based on the great reviews.  I was flip-flopping between the carne asada and the al pastor super burrito, but the asada won out in the end.  The line was curved around the back of the small shop, but they process you efficiently, and hand over a basket of chips and salsa to eat while they make your order.  The place was pretty busy, and definitely loud, but that's part of the experience and not out of place.

When my super burrito arrived, I was impressed with both its size and weight, and the giant tortilla was wrapped cleanly and evenly.  Biting into it made my weekend, and it was full of cheesy, cilantro-y freshness.  I found that adding some of the pico de gallo and (spicy) salsa verde from my chips was a great idea, and added a little bit of extra flavor.  That was my only area for criticism, is that I would have liked some more seasoning or spice in there.  

Now, that may be because I've gotten used to the less-authentic offerings that are more accessible to me, and I will still say that I love Chipotle, which is like a flavor explosion, but in my experience this was more true to the real deal, and that's OK with me.  Like I said, adding salsa filled it out nicely for me.  I haven't had the chance for a good direct comparison, but from what I remember, it was similar to El Farolito, which I also enjoyed.

Bottom line here... for your minimal investment, you will get a huge burrito that is incredibly satisfying and filling, quick service, and a lively place to chow down.
author: OJ B.

description: This place is authentic! Got the seafood burrito and it was a monster!! Be prepared to be full for the whole day. The nachos were so crispy and yummy. Go on an empty stomach
author: Angela L.

description: Just awesome.  I've been there dozens of times and I hope to go dozens more.  If I had a family I'd take my kids there once a month, teach them to respect good food and deafening mariachi music.
author: Moshe Q.

description:
Super Burrito w/ Carne Asada (4 stars): I can't say this is the best burrito in SF... yet. But that's just because I haven't had any others. I will say it beats out Chipotle.

Festive Atmosphere, Good Salsa (nice and spicy). Overall... I'll be back.
author: Melissa H.

description:
The first time they mixed up my order was an honest mistake, ok not an issue.

But the second time shortly thereafter is super un-ok. When this happens you get a rushed lackluster replacement burrito and an otherwise apathetic response.

Check your order before you leave or better yet, go to Pancho Villa's instead.
author: Alan F.

description:
Oh man, talk about HITTING THE SPOT.
Food is fantastic, the burrito I got was huge and only like 7 dollars.  It was great tasting, perfect amound of spice.  I went in with no idea of what this place was like and I was completely satisfied.  The chips while you wait are authentic, hardly ever see that anywhere besides Mexico.
Drop in if you're in the area.  Cash only.
author: Theo T.

description:
People swear by this place but after visiting it's not likely that I'll be returning. I found that TC offers different tastes and flavors than the reigning burrito champ of my heart: El Farrolito. Nonsense, say you? A taqueria is a taqueria is a taqueria, right?! Well, if you must know, I consider myself a bit of a connoisseur of taqueria fare and have developed a highly refined palate for meat, beans and rice encased in edible gift wrapping. Along with every other visitor/resident of the Mission...

If I could resist the temptation of heading to my usual taqueria, I would definitely give this place another go.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
I have yet to find the 5 star burrito, but this is my favorite bare bones taqueria in the city. The major stand out from Cancun and the others are the black beans. They are simply the best black beans I have ever had. I have tried soaking my own, and I can't make them as good at Cancun's. Everything here is good. I usually get a carne asada burrito, but for years, back in 1998-1999, I was vegetarian and had a veggie burrito here about 2-3 times a week. I was also broke at the time. 

One other great thing is that the super burritos here come with whole avocado instead of guacamole. This makes a difference. When I get super burritos with sour cream, guacamole and salsa, they are kind of sloppy and to mixed up with all the liquid. At cancun the flavors are distinct and hold together. Love this place for well over a decade and still stand behind them as best in the Mission.
author: Jordan P.

description:
The goods:

Open relatively late, free chips, decently decorated/clean interior, a pretty good, big & fat burrito, and for you carnivores -they serve meaty breakfasts.

The mehs:

Decent burritos, though I don't quite think they hold up to a couple of the other taquerias in the Mission. Their green chili sauce never does it for me (El Farolito's is way better in my opinion), either.

* So mainly it's that I don't consider their food to be so great.

I'd still come here again, though, if the mood struck.
author: Kai S.

description: A friend introduced me to this location while I was visiting from out of town. I've never had tacos this good in my life. What more is there to say? A perfect destination for that late-night food craving (we visited around midnight). I only wish I lived in the area so I could visit again!
author: E F.

description:
Every time I've had a burrito here, it's been CONSISTENTLY made of win. I mean it. Where else can you buy a burrito that leaves you feeling great about yourself, even towards the end of it? Even when I'm full, I can't stop eating that baby-sized roll. It is, honestly, the burrito I would like to eat on my deathbed. 

As my san diego friend and I say, it is the BEST burrito to be found in sf. Hands down.
author: Baviera K.

description: Best late night taqueria in the area! The food is really delicious, and the prices are a steal! It's a great place to come with friends after a night out. I had to minus one star for the dive-y, loud atmosphere, though--unless you love being cramped in close quarters with a bunch of irritating bros, hipsters, and creeps. But hey, sometimes it's worth it for the food.
author: Katie M.

description: The BEST at so much. Keep trying other spots but coming back to reliable goodness here. The Market St. shop is even better, although scary at times. The Alambre Especial is the best thing you will eat at a taqueria anywhere, ever.
author: Terry G.

description:
Cancun is alternate Go-to Late-night Post-Par Taqueria.   Really good for late nights.  I've gone back in the day when sober and It's not bad, but not great.

The thing with Mexican food in the Mission is that it's all fairly decent but nothing is outstanding.  To switch it up, i usually alternate between Cancun and Faralitos.  

Sometimes the meats are under seasoned.  The ingredients besides the meats are consistently good, the salsa is good and the price is the hook for me.  It's a decent burrito for a great price.
author: Anthony L.

description:
This is THE spot for drunken mexican food. Right amidst the rest of the Mission these guys keep the doors open late for all the vagrants and intoxicated hipsters alike. Fair prices and consistently greasy, everything you need to cut the alcohol during a night filled with drinking, or the morning after one.

CASH ONLY!
author: Daniel K.

description: I almost always get the prawn super burrito.  It's big and tasty, and Taqueria Cancun is open late. There's almost always a line, even though they're pretty quick to make your order, which speaks to food qualify. Pro tip: call in your order, and go straight to the cashier and pay and get your delicious food.
author: Troy A.

description:
Folks, this is it!

Vegetarian burrito or tacos.

'Nuff said.
author: Bruce J.

description:
The burrito mojado is the best burrito I've ever had, and that, my friends, is a BOLD statement.

I actually feel bad even saying this.  It feels like picking a favorite child, because burritos are my children, and also, they make me feel like I'm pregnant after I eat them.  But umm, what? Oh yeah.  Taqueria Cancun makes a freaking awesome burrito.  But you have to get that enchilada sauce on top, get all funky mojado with it, or else you're not having the full experience, y'know?
author: Jessie H.

description: Tasty enough but the last time I was there I saw the cooks handling raw meat with their bare hands before they went back to rolling burritos (without washing up first). Gross and, frankly, disrespectful to their customers. I'll probably still come here occasionally but not more often than that since I value my health.
author: Aaron V.

description: Get the chorizo tacos! The best I've had in a while. Super nachos were good too and the chips are crunchy. The carne asada tacos were very good, juicy and seasoned well. Cheap, fast and delicious. Legit.
author: Tommy K.

description:
I didn't want to write a review for Cancun until I'd had a chance to eat here while relatively sober.  I did so this weekend and was fairly impressed.

One thing I like about Cancun is that it's efficient.  Sure, it's crowded, but for the number of people in line after bars close you get your order taken and prepared rather quickly.

I ordered a super burrito with chicken.  Some pluses are that they use avocado instead of guacamole, they grill the tortilla, and the cheese was melted.  The chicken itself was nothing special, but it still hit the spot.  Overall it was a very solid burrito.

Like El Farolito down the street, the chips here aren't very good, but the salsa is.
author: Joseph N.

description:
My go to place when in the area.  Always get tacos and a couple beers and they are mmm mm good every time.

My standard is one cabeza, one carnitas and one carne asada.  booyah! dang im getting hungry!
author: J. B.

description: The burrito is godly. The cheese, beans, and rice marry into a solid mass of delicious flavor and mouthfeel. Carnitas is cooked to perfection. Tortilla skins are grilled til firmly crisp.  The burritos pass the no drip test and hold on strong through the entire meal without any foil. I cannot think of a single negative thing to say.
author: Randy C.

description: I used to be a loyal El Farolito fan, but since I moved to 18th and Valencia, this is my go to spot. Their Super Quesadilla is amazing. Salsas are fresh, delicious avocado. And they are open late. Cash only thought :)
author: Laura G.

description:
word,

As the educated scholar Flavor Flav once stated, "Don't believe the hype." Taqueria Cancun has been on every weekly newspaper (SF Weekly, Bay Guardian, Chronicle) list of best taqueria in San Francisco. I believe in the spirit of telling the truth that if the list was, "Best taqueria to eat when completely drunk" I would whole heartily agree.

When you're drunk you get hungry. I believe it may be a scientifiic fact, better check Scientific Weekly on that. Anyway, when you are drunk you want food in your system. More specifically you want cheap greasy food to satisfy your rumbling drunken rage. Burrittos satisfty this hunger like malt liquor satisfies whinos. 

To be fair the food at Taqueria Cancun will fill your up when its the wee hours of the morning, and on the cheap. However, the best aspect of Taqueria Cancun is it hours and location, NOT it's quality. The chips are flat and the burritto meat has a tendency to be burned and soggy. 

All in all Taqueria Cancun is not on my list of places to get Mexican food, but is on my list of places to go when you are drunk in the Mission.

yups
author: david h.

description:
This was my first taqueria in the city when I moved here.  I am still going there 6yrs later, so that's got to be a good sign.  I am a huge fan of the veggie burrito....soooo good. Love it! It's open wicked late so it's convenient for all of us who like to go out in the mish at night.
success
author: andrea g.

description:
Cancun is a long time favorite.  Great ingredients as well as little touches such as the grilled tortilla and avocado scooped fresh instead of mystery guacamole make it the best burrito around.  The chorizo is especially good.

The salsa and chips are also great.  The green salsa is *hot* but delicious.  

It's a dive so don't expect white table cloth service but for the price, you can't complain.  Two thumbs up!
author: Charles M.

description:
I'd give 6 stars if I could just to pay respect to their quesadilla.  It's iconic.
staff is top notch. it gets packed in there at night and they turn out the food really quickly.  they are really nice too considering how obnoxious people can be. I'd give it an extra 1/2 star for the people watching you can do in there.  hipsters are funny.
author: Kurt T.

description: This place is probably 3.5 stars for food and 5 stars for price.  Vegetarian burrito tasted like heaven and cost like $5 buck!  Either that or I was starved that day.  Me and my colleague chowed down vegetarian burrito with a Corona.  Cheers to our new office space in the Mission.  I love their chips.  Not the best chips I've tasted but pretty unique.  They're so cheap with their salsa.  What's up with that?
author: MT D.

description: A+++. Hardworking people. Would return here sober.
author: Sushi S.

description:
My favorite burrito place in the Mission!  Fast service, big portions, and absolutely delicious.  Get a super burrito - comes with all the fixings inside!  You also get chips and one small container each of mashed avocado and salsa, unless you get nachos - in which case you don't really need the extra chips, but you still get the two sauces!

Atmosphere is pretty lively - always a lot of people coming in to order and eat in or get take out...  Music is rather loud, but adds character to the place.  Picnic table style seating.
author: Dori S.

description:
I'm a lover of pollo asado burritos and I've tried Can-Cun's four, maybe five times?  What can I say... with so many glowing reviews, I just had to be sure.  And I'm sure it aint the best.
The chicken marinade is good but not great.  Grill flavor is weak. And I always taste a slight chorizo flavor, what's up with that?  Maybe I'm tasting the annato seasoning in the marinade (or something), I dunno.  The super pollo burrito at Can-Cun has never impressed me.

However... hand me one of their carne asada super quesadillas and I'll hold it in all fours and chew until I'm picking shreds of foil from my teeth.  On the matter of quesadillas, I have no shame.
And hardly any objectivity :(
author: Ben S.

description: Ok burritos, great Tortas, not a fan of the chips.
author: Michael E.

description: Disclaimer up front: I came here during brunch hours, so my experience was likely different than what most people come here for.  I had a breakfast burrito and a carne asada taco.  The breakfast burrito was ok - it tasted good, but there was too much sour cream and not enough egg.  The taco was decent as well, though I don't have enough to make a call on its taste, as it was simply too small.
author: Josh Q.

description:
What am I going to say that the other 900 haven't?
When you are looking for a quick, cheap, and awesome end to the hunger in your tum tum....this is it.  Nice big menu full of great mexican options. THe burritos are to die for, the quesadillas are dripping with gooey cheesy goodness, and it's cheap as hell. The proportions are perfect, the way the ingredients are put together is just fantastic, and the taste is off the charts.
Taqueria Cancun=WINNER.
Stop in, stuff your face, enjoy. You're welcome.
author: Carson E.

description: I hate to admit it, but I've had the carne asada super burrito too many times to count.
author: Lauren C.

description: I'm a huge fan of the fact that one vegetarian burrito equals two meals. And that every bite is perfect and delicious. Oh God I hope they have burritos in heaven.
author: Amanda C.

description:
It lives up to the hype! Fantastic burritos! 

PS: if you're a real burrito aficionado, check out the taco truck scene on international boulevard in Oakland. Different... but arguably better.
author: Ben L.

description:
Good solid food. The salsas that come with the chips are SPICY = YUM. 

They're open late and great for groups after a few drinks at random bars in the Mission.
author: Jennifer T.

description: This is actually the best Mexican food that I have ever had. Get the carnitas super burrito. Crispy, cheesy, delicious. I may eventually try something else here, but for now this is the only thing I want to eat when im in the Mission.
author: Jason E.

description:
Okay, I take back what I said earlier about this place.  I stopped by last night after failing to meet up with a friend for Ethiopian.  I swear, the only reason why I even went in here is because my car was parked right out front.

I surveyed the menu with skepticism, not wanting to get the carne asada tacos.  I wanted something easy to eat in the car, so I decided on a super burrito with pollo asada and black beans.

$6.59 for one of the best burritos I've ever had in my freaking life.  I'm not sure if the previous burritos just weren't tasty with carne asada or what, but the chicken made it THAT MUCH BETTER.  And fresh chunks of avocado?  Much better than the previous "guacamole" they shoved into my tortilla months ago.

Amazing.  This place has earned my trust again.
author: Tori S.

description: Favorite tacqueria in the Mission. I know El Farralito down the street tends to get the lion's share of Yelp love but if you're looking for juicy and perfectly done burritos, this is the place to go. their chips -- albeit a bit salty -- are also some of the best you'll have. My favorites here are the shrimp burrito, and really, any wet burrito. Quick service, cheap prices, amazing food, a jukebox -- what more could you ask for from a tacqueria?
author: wendy q.

description:
Veg burrito!
Duh
...but always you want to take one more bite until it HURTS!!
author: Dizzy L.

description:
I haven't tried anything but the super burritos from this place, but I have to give it to them...THESE guys mean business. What seems to be a 1+ lb burrito is jam packed with the typical stuff you'd normally find, but here's the kicker. Instead of guacamole, they use real avocado to line the insides of this tasty morsel. Now don't get me wrong, I have nothing against guac, but you have to admit, this is a refreshing take on the typical late night burrito.

There's always a line at night simply because they're open till 2am on the weekends to service the alcohol-induced hunger within the SF partyers. The line might be long, but they're so efficient at putting out orders that it's worth the wait. The only thing that I can say is a negative is the limited seating, but I'm sure it's only because I came during the peak rush.
author: Alexander M.

description:
Dear Taqueria Cancun

Please open one of your fine establishments in the Richmond. I regularly see lines round the corner out here for Gordo and that's just not right. We have 2 Gordo's within a few blocks of each other too. I can guarantee you huge success and much loyalty. Somewhere on Geary and 20 something would be great. OK thanks.

DK
author: Dee K.

description:
After a late night of drinking without eating dinner, I needed emergency food.
I was looking for another taqueria, but since this was the closest one to where we were drinking, they one. 

With $6.00, I ordered a super chicken taco which comes with an ample amount of cheese, sour cream, avocado and two tortillas. I also ordered a fish cerviche on a tostada.  I was hungry and pleasantly surprised by the flavorful and freshness of the food.     

I now have a new place to go to in the Mission for emergency food after midnight.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
Mmmm! Nothing beats a delicious carne asada super burrito at 1:45 am after almost going through a vodka induced coma. My savior! I've been to many taquerias and pizza shacks after a night of fun and drinking. I must say that Taqueria Cancun is one of the best taquerias. The service is great and they get your food out quickly. To hold you over during the wait, they give you a bowl of chips to nibble on. 

Let's talk about the burrito. Taqueria Cancun evenly distributes the amount of meat, rice, guacamole, beans, etc. Don't you hate it when taquerias load up the burrito with beans and give you minimal amount of meat? I guess it's a cost saving measure. Well, you don't have to worry about that at Taqueria Cancun. 

I must warn you that the lines can be extremely long after the clubs close. Taqueria Cancun does a great job getting the line moving and taking your order. The seating is very limited so be prepared to eat standing. The venue isn't clean but at the same time it's not dirty. I give Taqueria Cancun the benefit of the doubt as when it gets that busy, who has time to clean. Plus, the cleanliness of an establishment is the last thing on the mind of drunken party goers. They just want food!
author: Manton R.

description:
Oh man. When I used to live near Cancun, I used to go here ALL THE TIME. Grilled chicken torta would do me for a whole day's meal. I used to go for lunch, dinner and post night out tortas and force all my friends to go there too. 

Now I live in Inner Sunset which apparently is a burrito Bermuda Triangle. Crap.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I want to give 3.5.  Seriously, when are half stars going to be a choice? But since they were so incredibly fast, I am rounding up.  

pros:
-Tasty food*
-Fast service
-comfortable picnic bench seats
-HUGE burritos...I am not a dainty girl and even I have my lunch for tomorrow leftover from today's burrito!

Cons:
-Their chips are out of a bag, a little stale tasting
-they dont have a Salsa bar and only give you little tiny plastic capfuls of salsa and you have to ask for more...I am a condiment girl and need lots of sauce
-they stuff the burrito with mostly beans and rice and just a little bit of grilled chicken...grrr...need more meat...grrr

* though the food is tasty and you get a lot of it, it is a tad bit bland...

I've been here and I'll be here again because despite the gripes, they always deliver solid mission food.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Ahhh Cancun...

As a patron for almost 20 years I can honestly say that even as the neighborhood changes around them, the food is the same. Awesome. Their burrito de al pastor sets the standard, there is none better. Whenever I am in the Mission I usually buy one to eat in and two or three to take back to Marin. A lifetime ago, I used to eat there every day.
author: Eric H.

description:
This is one of my sister's favorite burrito places.  She always raves about Taqueria Cancun, and she finally took me there on Wednesday.

We got there at 6 pm, and the place was jumping.  I wouldn't say that Taqueria Cancun was packed, but there were quite a few customers inside.  It was pretty difficult to maneuver around the long wooden tables and benches, the shiny ATM and the giant jukebox.  I also wanted to maneuver around some of the patrons of Taqueria Cancun, because I'd much rather bump into the 1,000 lb. ATM machine than into some of the characters I saw there.

I ordered the steak super burrito and the chicken super taco.  Let me tell you, It was a lot of food!  The burrito was juicy and FILLED with carne asada, rice, beans and all the other Mexican fixin's.  The tacos were really good, too.  I loved the generous slices of avocado that topped my taco.  What I didn't like was the seasoning on the chicken.  I am not sure what it was, but it looked like curry and cayenne pepper mix, and it tasted weird.  The tortilla chips they gave us were delicious!  They came with relatively bland pico de gallo and salsa verde, which was a lot hotter than I anticipated.  Proceed with caution.

1 super burrito + 3 super tacos + 2 diet cokes + free chips and salsa = $19.26.  It's an amazing value.  The same meal at La Taqueria would cost you 50% more, while being only marginally better.

I would definitely come back here the next time I am craving Mexican food, but . . .. I would only come here with a very good friend or a very close relative, mainly because there is no graceful way to eat a super taco.  I would also get a lot of napkins and wear an old sweatshirt.  "If it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face."  Indeed.
author: Yan G.

description: There's no wrong answer when it comes to grilled or steamed tortillas but Taqueria Cancun is the place to go if you're in Team Grilled.
author: Ames B.

description: Super Burrito Carne Asada. It will change your life. Seriously, these burritos are balls deep stick-my-d***-in-it worthy status.
author: Nick F.

description:
The interior isn't anything to write home about, and the atmosphere isn't amazing, but I really enjoyed the tacos and quesadilla they had.

Cheap and good, if you want a quick meal then this is definitely the place!
author: Martie K.

description:
I rarely carne asada because the texture never taste right and besides most taqueria spice it up with garlic powder and such. But this place carne asada wet burrito was amazing! Seriously, the meat was grilled to perfection! I enjoy the gaudy decoration and Mary is my homegirl!

I WISH THEY HAVE BETTER CHIPS AND A SALSA BAR
author: Billy T.

description:
This place actually reminds me of the mexican food I ate in cancun at the Fiesta Americana hotel. I do have to question the authenticity, but the taste is good.

I am currently on a mission to find the best enchilada's in the city. I came here yesterday with my bf and we shared chicken enchilada platter.

The veridct: 4 stars. 

We both really enjoyed this, it was flavorful and filling. I really loved the rice and the beans.It was simple but very good. I am hesitant to say the BEST ever, since I haven't tried out all the other places but it was definitely good and recommended.
author: Zu W.

description:
Take it from somebody who has spent the last 18 years in NEW Mexico (yes, the U.S. state), Taqueria Cancun is good, authentic, and would probably be somewhere you might find in Mexico City.

This was my first time eating here, actually, I got take out. It was pretty good. The staff was friendly, and definitely kept the atmosphere authentic. My burrito was $6 and change, and it was medium sized. Where I come from, a big burrito means about twice the size as this burrito, and it will take you two days to eat it; not the case with this one.

While waiting for my food, I enjoyed watching the cook prepare everybody's food. It was quite entertaining. 

When I got home, I was THRILLED to see that they gave me chips & pico de gallo. The guacamole they gave me was watered down and mediocre, though. The same goes for the Crema (Mexican sour cream), it was far too wet to be real Crema.

My burrito was good, but there wasn't enough meat to fill it, so I would hit 'empty' spots with just rice, beans, and other filling. I finished the whole thing, and I am a little tiny person.
