Their meat is freaky saucy spicey greasy goodness that has crack-like effects. I think they must put addictive chemicals in their meats. Chips on the other hand are no bueno but the burritos are so effing rad that I will get into it anyway. I love Taqueria Cancun in spite of their boring, generic supermarket chips.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Kept car running while my date ran in to fetch veggie burritos.  

Moments later he landed in the passenger seat clutching a giant bag of lunch,  grinning, "So.  In 2 hours when you're still feeling okay I'll tell you their Health Code card score!"
author: Megan G.

description:
A friend and I were walking down Valencia to meet up with another friend.  We were easily having the most kick ass walk in human history (for example the guy driving by hella slow on his bike blasting Let's Get It On while random people stopped in the streets and sang.  Hell yeah...).  So things were cool and life was cool and it was sooo late and we were sooooooooo hungry.  We detoured to Mission to find food.   

On the way there everything got darker and I was brought down at an alarming rate by this crazy dude kicking this can around with the intensity of, well, a crazy dude.  He stared at me and I thought I was going to have to bust out my dusty aikido moves....  then I saw it.... and it was as uplifting as the first time I saw a glitter rendition of Mother Mary holding a glow in the dark Jesus....

Inside there was a pretty long line that went fast, bright colors, somewhat not scary patrons, and a cute old Mariachi dude serenading us (if I were like 50 years older I would have been all over that).  The veggie burrito was good and I was happy, as always, with my Juarritos.  I was finally starting to feel better.   Thank you for helping me return to my happy place Taqueria CanCun.  :)

I've had some damn good Mexican food in my time and this wasn't exceptional, but it was good and open late.  Gotta love that.
author: Misty M.

description:
Confession: I don't actually like burritos that much. "What the fuck are you eating in the Mission for?" 

The taco is the burrito's sloppy messy sister. I love tacos. And Cancun has some amazingly delicious tacos. And they're $2.30 each. Get the carne asada. The only question is, do I want two tacos? Three tacos? FOUR tacos? The Count would have a field day. 

And by four tacos, I really mean six. After eating tacos 1-3 you've dropped enough meat on taco 4 to make more.  

I've been trying to cook more meals at home to save money. But every day these tauntingly cheap tacos sit there five minutes away. Slave over a hot stove for 30 minutes? Or delicious tacos in five minutes? 

"1, 2, 3...three tacos! ah ah ah ah ah!"
author: Victor L.

description:
This is definitely one of the best burritos I've ever had. The salsa and chips were pretty awesome as well. Highly recommend getting the super burrito with beef and everything on it.

Atmosphere isn't the best for dining in, so grab your stuff to go and enjoy.
author: Emmanuel P.

description:
NOTHING has changed at Cancun in the past 10 years. Same loud festive decor, same ranchero music blaring out of the jukebox, and most importantly, exactly the same 1 am chicken burrito with the basket of chips and hot salsa verde. 

More consistent in taste than McDonald's could ever be. Not that I eat McDonald's, but whatever.

4 stars.
author: Mr K.

description: What can I say about Taqueria Cancun that hasn't already been said?  If you can stomach the smell of feces wafting off the various incontinent crackheads you'll dodge on the way there,  Cancun is arguably one of the top 3 places in San Francisco to get your Mexican fix.  I've had both the carne asada quesadillas and the enchiladas and both were mouth-wateringly delicious.  The chips and salsa are both solid as is the Horchata.  It can get a little crowded inside, so you might want to have a friend snag a table if there's one free while you wait in line.  This is the place I always take my friends from out of town to give them the "SF Mexican food" experience, and everybody always leaves happy.  You know the old phrase "nobody ever got fired for buying IBM?"  Well, nobody (that I know of) has ever taken shit for taking their friends to Taqueria Cancun.  Except maybe if they were referring to the aforementioned crackheads.
author: Anna T.

description:
Muy Fantastiko!! 

You cant go wrong! This better-than-hole-in-the-wall is great late!  It's vibrant and clean, and near a bustling spot on Mission.  The food is good, their meats are great, and I'm not even a mexican food burrito enthusiast!  But the two people I went with were and the loved it too!  

The have a HUGE wet burrito Mojado?!  And the plain basic... The Al Pastor (marinated meat) is so divine!  I should've gotten as a meal plate instead of in a burrito!  

The chips are mediocre, but not bad at all.  And they only have two weirdo salsas... one is a watery green salsa with what seems like a hint of oregano.  Then they have a thicker salsa that has a multitude of flavors all seeming to stem from a cucumber paste.  I wish they had the traditional red... and they only have beer as a bev 21 of choice.  Hmm.  

But the place is bright, clean, quick, easy, etc, etc!  It's in my book now!!
author: GingerSnap G.

description:
I used to frequent Taqueria Cancun after many a long night out in the Mission, but had never eaten there sober. I was always happy with my super burrito or super quesadilla or whatever the heck would absorb the alcohol in my lightweighted belly. It had probably been almost a year since I last visited so I stopped in on a recent weekend day. Wanting something smaller than a burrito, I opted for a super taco w/ al pastor and it was surprisingly delicious. I enjoyed it so much, I was thisclose to ordering another.

But B had ordered a carnitas super burrito which turned out to be bland. Super bland. Not being one to waste edible food, I helped him finish it. After having the most delicious al pastor, this was torturous. I look forward to my next visit (drunk or sober) so I can order numerous more of those al pastor super duper tacos.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I found this place on a random walk through the Mission.  Definitely the best burrito in SF that I have had so far.  Sometimes the place is a little busy, but it is worth it.  Also the burritos are HUGE so usually I get them to go and cut them up into portions since they are enough to feed an army...

I am a "frequent flyer" here and i can't think of a 2-week period that I haven't made a trip to Taqueria Cancun....
author: Chris W.

description: I've been to many a Mission burrito joint, and this one may have the biggest vege burritos, but the chips here a gross and the horchata is pre-mixed with ice, so it's watered down. But, if you are tipsy, and on this side of Mission street, it will suffice.
author: Shira O.

description:
I remember a M*A*S*H episode where Hawkeye dreamed of ordering bbq from a special joint in the States.  He wanted it flown in so his lips would burn.  "Better than sex," he said.   

Well, that's what the guacamole (WTF?) here is like.  Maybe it's salsa verde... god knows.  But if you're like me, and those lips start burning, you just want more and more and eat faster and faster to extinguish the flames but somehow starting safety fires in the mouth does not contain the conflagration.  So it burns bigger and brighter and you're so coked up with endorphins that you lean over and smooch the homeless person sharing a bench with you.  Well, maybe you don't, but it WOULD cool down that mouth.

The US claims to have stopped producing chemical weapons, but if Hans Blix ever sends a team in, I suggest he starts with the bathroom here.  Just make sure the inspectors are wearing full NBC gear cuz otherwise they're gonna die.  I did not have NBC gear on, walked in, and nearly fainted.  Not with joy.  In my experience, the quality of the food in a Mexican restaurant is inversely proportional to the cleanliness of the bathroom.  How horrible of me to generalize.  Bottom line, hold it. If you're one those walnut-sized bladder types, just wear one of those ballgame bags or take a cue from that nutty astronaut and wear an adult diaper.  Tinkle as you order and shoot the short cook a strangely relaxed -- ah, that's better -- grin.

on to the next subject - prices.  If you're not already swooning from an ill-advised visit to the restroom, you will surely pee yourself with relief when you pull out your pesos to pay the bill of particulars.   I mean you rack up a few quesadillas, tacos and whatnot and you'll struggle to spend 10 smackers.

What's not to love?
author: James F.

description:
*hows the food? 2 stars. 
*hows the experiance? 4 stars.

*were we drunk? pretty much.
*was everybody else in the place drunk? oh hell yeah!
*was anything else open? if they were then it doesn't really matter since this is the place to be drunk and hungry at 3am in the mish.
*whats the wait time? long enough to loose a buzz...or, long enough to be simultaneously amused by the other drunkards that you will be pressed up against and annoyed by their lack of...oh, who cares? if you are there at 3am then you probably stink too!
*hows the service? new york style--rude, fast, efficient, they will get your order correct if you don't want onions or you want extra guac, they don't give a flying fuck if you want spicy or mild salsa. 'suck it up people and relive the heat tomorrow morning on the crapper!'
*would i go back? next time i am drunk at 3am, hungry and near by.
author: Bad Ass Chic K.

description:
I hate all of these foodies and out of towner's ragging on their burrito that they paid less than five bucks for. It's a dive people! There is either a drunk hobo or police tape around the corner of the place and you're worried about the ammount of meat and tenderness of the experience? Shrooog!

This place is an awesome dive. Period.

I stomp into this yellow painted paradise with a sigh of relief and hunger. Salsa, banda, or rigatone music blares from the speakers and the cooks joke and sing to the tunes in the most loving way. Awesome, I know.
Ordering is a snap and you don't have to be fluent in Spanish to do so.
You could totally drop a minimal amount of fliff  for a huge sauce covered burrito. And you don't have to be a Persian king to buy for your lame friend who always wonder's "Hey man, can you get this? I got you next time!"

He never get's me next time...

Anyway, the place is open till 2am every damn day so you could hit a bar, get tanked, and totally still have enough time (and scrilla) to get yourself an enchilada platter that will render you sober in no time. Every platter comes with a free side of chips and some pretty decent salsa for you dippers out there. *Watch out*, salsa can be spicy for some so handle with care!

It can also be amusing to watch how the cooks check out every half way hot chick who runway walks into the joint. Seriously, watch their eyes man. But this does not distract them from that burrito you've been waiting on, light-speed cookin!

They also have bottled beer too just in case you want to keep your current buzz going!

If you're in the Mission stop by and fill up. Promise you will not leave hungry.
author: Nick G.

description: Best vegetarian burrito in the city.  I don't know how they do it.
author: Laurence W.

description:
I came to the Mission District in hopes of finding some authentic and delicious Mexican food, and I found it in Taqueria Cancun.  I ordered the carne asada quesadilla, and it was carna asada for REAL.  Thank goodness they also served Jarritos.  It was decorated appropriately, the staff is friendly (and I was forced to use Spanish, which I always love), and the ambiance is pretty much perfect for the food.  Laid back, delicious, quick, and fun.  

Perfect.
author: Brooke L.

description:
One word.... Carnitas.

Every time I want Carnitas I think of this place, but I'm way too lazy to drive into the city for it :(  

Sometimes I wish I could teleport just for their carnitas.
author: Crystal R.

description:
I almost sobbed with joy as I bit into my big juicy veggie burrito with luscious slabs of avocado and a perfect meld of cheese, beans, rice, and salsa.  

Heaven just might be a glorious burrito, a Negra Modelo, and chatting about the meaning of a graduate student existence.  Mmmmm
author: Danielle Y.

description:
CONS:
- dirty, dirty, dirty
- arse-ugly interior
- annoying mariachi dudes busking in the store

PROS:
- open late
- holy god cheap as hell
- tons of food for your money
- way more authentic than most of the other "Mexican" places in the Mission

Taqueria Cancun is the perfect stop after a long night of drinking at various bars in the Mission. Sure, I've barfed up some of their burritos  in alleys on my way home but that was the result of binge drinking, not bad cooking.
author: James C.

description:
One time I was at Casanova Lounge with a group of friends, and I was reallllllll drunk.  Like, socially unacceptably drunk.  And as we departed the bar, my friends went right...but I, I took the road less traveled.  I said to myself:

Drunk me: YOU NKOW WHAT JOSH, NOW'S THE TIME...TAKE A STAND, YOU GO YOUR OANW WAY.

What was I rebelling against? I'm not sure I was full of $4 well whiskey-cokes and tired of being surrounded by box-cut-asymmetrical-hair cuts, plus I was reallllll drunk...so you know it seemed like a good idea at the time.

Forgive me, I digress.  The rest of the night was a blur, I mean...a brown-out, you know when you wake up in the morning after a long-night of boozing and you catch a scent, see a sight, or hear a noise, and suddenly like 2 or 3 hours of forgotten inebriated memories come rushing back to you?  

Well first, I picked up my jeans to look for my wallet, and instead found a business card for Taqueria Can-Cun where it should be.  Strange, I thought, I wonder where that place is.  Then I found some salsa/guac stains on the front of my jeans...hmmmm, the plot thickens.  And then, then ladies and gents, I burped.  I hate to apply a word like epiphany to a moment like this, but as that gaseous balloon of whiskey and 'rito left my stomach...I remembered gravity messing with me while standing in line to order, I remembered asking for a Super Carne Asada with black beans, I remembered eating it outside, leaned up against a Volkswagen, and I remembered absolutely-positively-friggin' loving it.

I went back sober....just as good.
author: Josh T.

description:
The food is great, my gf ate 4 tacos and I had a chicken burrito. I got parking basically in front and i like the seating. I'll go back for sure.

Plus it is super cheap, I think all that food and a couple of drinks were like $20.
author: Jeff W.

description:
One night, as I was tipsy and hungry around the Mission (but then again, who isn't?) I was craving a good vegetarian burrito. Since the neighborhood is dominated by Mexican restaurants, I didn't know where to begin.

So then I did some offline Yelping and asked a guy standing outside a bar. "Taqueria Cancun," he said. "They have the best vegetarian burritos in town."

Oh, and they do. Even they know so, with a banner proudly proclaiming this fact. After I ordered one, and biting into the huge slices of avocado wrapped inside the burrito, I definitely agreed.

I would say this is my favorite burrito place in San Francisco. They also have a location on 6th and Market, which I stop by when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Valerie L.

description:
O god.  cheesy, meaty, tasty goodnes AND open late?  I eat here more often than is probably good for my arteries.  Which really means "not enough".

One order of super nachos can feed at least two of me.  Sweet.
author: Pirate M.

description:
So this place is kind of amazing. Especially if you eat here often enough that you get sick of it, then you get real hungry one night at The Dark Room, and you really need to eat something.... "I'm going to Can Cun, anyone need anything?"

Then you get your big honkin' Carne Asada Super Burrito (No salsa, thanks) and you take it on back, and you eat it so fast that you worry you're gonna get sick, so you sit down for 5 minutes, and life is golden.

Or, alternately, you holler out to your buddies "Anyone wanna get a burrito?" and you get a gaggle of people to go and take over one of those ginormous picnic tables and you all pool together your chips and salsa (but you don't eat so much of the salsa because it's real spicy, and you definitely don't eat the green salsa because it *looks* like guacamole but I'm pretty sure there's no avocado in it. And you all drink your Negro Modelos and have a grand time, except for when that really well dressed homeless guy comes in with the paper cup with the edges turned down. After he leaves again, though, you're in.

Do get the fresh squeezed Orange Juice, especially if you're near the end of your drinking experience for the evening. It heals all wounds. Do try one of the exciting meat choices that doesn't sound appetizing. It will surprise you and you will have it again.

A couple of things, though. Don't use the bathroom, it'll make you think bad things. Don't look too closely at any surface, especially not the surfaces where the food's prepared. Trust me. It tastes excellent and it doesn't make you sick, don't explore any deeper.
author: Rhiannon C.

description:
Every time I hang out in the Mission, I wonder how so many of the Mission-dwelling, Kilowatt-frequenting hipster contingent manage to stay skinny enough to wear jeans that would make Jack Skellington think he needed a crash diet. Because ye gods, is there plentiful amounts of remarkable deliciousness - including Taqueria Cancun.

Every time I see them put together a tortas, I tell myself that NEXT time, I'm going to try one - and then I walk in again and hurl myself into the comfortable blanket of the Super Burrito, washed down with a Jarritos. Whether drunk or sober - or while dwelling in that mystical, 6 p.m. middle ground where the shamans and necromancers of San Francisco reside, not quite hammered but nowhere near able to properly handle motor vehicles or take serious medication - the options and sheer deliciousness at Taqueria Cancun will suit you just fine. 

The place is also littered with clips proclaiming their many victories for "Burrito of the Year" in various SF weekly publications. I'd have to say they deserved every single one of them; they are tasty. 

Personal faves include the Carnitas. Also, I once stopped in after a show at the Dark Room (when they still allowed BYOB) and grabbed a bite. While I was there a Mariachi band walked in, ordered and sat at a table and played while they ate. It was a nice moment.
author: Drew H.

description:
Taqueria Cancun has a solid burrito!  The mix of all that good stuff wrapped in a tortilla is so heavenly!  Menu offers a lot of choices (beef brains included if that's what you fancy) and prices are reasonable.  Service is quick too!

It's only a block away from my school so that can either be a good or bad thing.
author: Michelle W.

description: I went to their location in grilroy thinking that this place would be the same but it was not. The tacos are not full with meat and the restaurant is kind of dirty. The Gilroy location is 20X better than this location.
author: Matthew L.

description: The burritos are so bomb. The meat is seasoned so perfect and juicy. They are not greedy with any of the toppings. I always stop by for lunch if I'm close by. very delicious!
author: Carms R.

description: The veggie burrito can't be beat! fresh ingredients, including fresh avocado! cheap and hearty. you can eat half of it for lunch, wrap the other half back up in the foil and put it in your purse for later.
author: Ashlee M.

description: Their salsa has kick- add hot sauce on top for genuine tears. I almost always get a stomach ache after eating here. Is it because its so good? Or so greasy/salty? I don't know- but I keep coming back.
author: Sara S.

description:
Over the last few months, ever since my boy just moved into the Mission, several major topics came up: What are the best dinner spots, bars, street vendors, clubs, and finally, the one that matters the most.....(drum roll), what is the best taqueria.

My golly, it's gotta be El Farolito!...no wait, La Taq!.....o but then, wait Cancun!

All these options, but WHICH, which is the best of them all?  How man has searched the streets of the Mission in hopes of finding the one taqueria, the one that will fulfill all our needs, and the outcome has come to this.  I have journeyed through the taquerias, and I've come to this conclusion.  

There is no one spot that has everything covered and supercedes that of the other spot, it is at times a coincidence or a result of the other variables such as who makes your burrito, if that day, someone decided to not clean up and lay a pube in your salsa.....but in my past few months of experience, I can declare that Cancun has the best Lengua Super Burrito.  It's far more juicier than El Farolito, and they too use avocado slices like La Taq.  They also serve it much larger than the Super at El Farolito (I had to share mine in order to finish that massive beast)  Also, they have great spicy salsa which makes it a plus.  So there you have it, Best Lengua Super Burrito Award goes to Cancun!
author: Vincent K.

description:
Taqueria Cancun is by far one of the best, if not the best Mexican restaurant in the city. Everyone seems to love their burritos. The best thing this joint has to offer is its tacos, though! Hence it's name "Taqueria..." 

I am never disappointed here. EVER. It's finger lickin' good. Also, very cheap. No mainstream over-priced food here. Love it!

Only negs are the parking, if you drive and the fact that it's always packed no matter what time you go, but perhaps that's a good thing...
author: MJ T.

description: Divey food at its finest. I couldn't believe how cheap our meal was (12 dollars for two). Tacos were fantastic but I hear their burritos are even better. If you crave greasy, fast food (especially late) this is the place to be. I will surely return here when I come back to SF.
author: Cris L.

description:
I love this place! You don't have to be drunk to eat here! Their food is amazing! I got the Super Taco, both chicken and beef steak, it is deelicious! The salsa is spicy and the avocado salsa is a nice balance. The service is quick and the atmosphere is fun. The prices are better then reasonable, you get your dollars worth.
I would highly recommend this place to anybody!
author: Jenna P.

description: Because it's so popular, I wish I could say I hate this place and bucket myself in with some mysterious taqueria elite. But I can't. The Chorizo tacos are my favorite in the city. Nice little pre-packaged basket of chips and salsas with every order. Burrito is solid; perfect follow up to a night of heavy drinking or what have you.
author: Casey S.

description:
My husband loooooves Cancun. I never minded ending up here late night because there was nowhere else to go, but when he wanted to go at other times I always resisted.
RESIST NO MORE! I just went and had one of the best burritos I've EVER had! It was seriously delicious & they didn't even mess up my whitegirlness order. I brought a visiting vegan who had only had that crap they try to pass as Mexican food on the East Coast & she was impressed.
I think the key is going at less busy times, then they make your items with care! Oh yeah, the green salsa is great too!
author: Melisser E.

description:
I wouldn't call Cancun the best Mexican in the mission, but it is pretty damn good and open till 2:45 on Friday and Saturdays, which makes it a great place to go after bars (in particular the beauty bar which is right across the street) and get some late night food. 

I highly recommend splitting an order nachos with al pastor beef with a friend. Its a great deal and one of the most satisfying meals one can have when the (beer) munchies call.

My two biggest complaints about this place is 1) They don't have a salsa & condiment bar, not mention only 2 salsas and 2) They tortilla chips aren't as good as they could be. Nevertheless, open late.
author: Eric O.

description: Late night food doesn't get much better than this.  This place is fast, cheap, open late, and delicious.  Their super chicken quesadillas are the best.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Just dropping by to give Cancun 5 stars and some cheers!
Although I only occasionally find myself in the Mission (mostly likely for a show at Balazo), I have been to numerous Taquerias in the area. Of all of them, I find Cancun to be my favorite. I am a huge fan of the different selection of meats that one can choose from to add your burrito or taco. Their Lengua or beef tongue is as tender as brisket and works great in a burrito. 
Orders come with chips and salsa and portions are always huge.
author: Zach L.

description:
Taqueria Cancun, you tasty, cheap little bitch... how I endlessly lust after you and your veggie burritos. 

Ok, so I'm no southern-Californian-turned-Mission-hipster burrito-officianado, but the ones I do know told me about this place. And I have thanked them deeply. I have no need to spend years hunting down a better burrito, because I have found the love of my life.

Why should you trust me? You shouldn't. You should strut your shit over to the nearest TC (there are several!) and order a vegetarian burrito with extra salsa and a can of Tecate to wash it down. 

Then tell all your southern California friends that San Francisco took away the one thing they had going for them :)
author: Megan B.

description:
Open late, late, late and they are cheap, cheap, cheap.

The "cheap" to which I refer isn't a gross kind of "well, at least it wasn't expensive so I don't feel so bad about the angry juice coming out of my bottom" kind of cheap but rather a "I'm kind of stealing this" sort of cheap.  I've never had a bad burrito here and getting serenaded by the blaring juke only adds to the experience.

It's a shame I don't live in NoBern any longer b/c I used to eat here 3 days a week.  As a result, if you ever meet me, look at my right pinkie...it's entirely made of burrito.  Who knew their burritos could encourage and participate in cell division!?!?!
author: Steve B.

description:
The only Mexican joint in the Mission I like to toddle too in the wee hours of the morn.  I know I'll get to stuff myself with a hearty, delish meal that won't endanger my intestines.

My only quibble is the dicey location, which means that once I leave the car I get to interact with the leering crazies of the hood.
author: Femita J.

description:
Can't speak to the burritos, but the quesadillas were perfect at 2:30 am.

I gave my chips to a homeless guy so can't say how good or bad they were.

Seemed a little pricey at almost $6 for one quesadilla though.  Granted, I'm sure the dollop of sour cream was worth 90 cents.
author: laura g.

description:
After living in NY since May, I can't express how badly I needed a REAL burrito. I had the opportunity to come back to The Bay in December and this was one of my first stops. I ordered my usual - super carne asada burrito with black beans. Both salsas - green and regular - are complement the burrito magnificently. You can even switch between green and regular mid-burrito! How awesome is that?!

After a few bites, I actually whispered to myself, "Man this is f**king good!" Within minutes, all that was left were foil scraps, broken chips, and crumpled napkins. Oh, and an empty Mexican Coke bottle. If I could give a sixth star, it would be for selling bottled Mexican Coke instead of the subpar canned American version.
author: anton d.

description:
My first encounter with Cancun was after a night of--what else-- bar hopping. It might have been the delirious state of mind I was in, but the ultra-hot salsa verde caught me off guard.

In a good way.

I'm making Taqeria Cancun a regular stop on my trips to the Mission. It's all you would expect in a burrito joint.

One problem though, their beers are a little pricey :(
author: Kelly S.

description: Burrito is ok went in bought four burritos extra sour cream got home none ok simple mistake burrito was good enough to go back ordered two burritos extra sour cream got home none I'm done I eat a lot of burritos and always tell people when I find a good one but screwing me over sour cream with no parking only except cash so I have to make trip to the ATM to boot you lost what would have been a regular customer who spends at least twenty bucks every time it go there twice a week try don chuy up excelsior great service killer burrito for a liquor store that's my spot
author: Frank L.

description: I used to go here in the late 90s as a regular meal. A veggie burrito and a soda for under $5 that was probably my only thing I ate all day. It is a relief to see this place still open. They will take care of you. Ignore the one review that seems to point out a conspiracy to convert vegetarians with bicycles to meat eaters. I eat meat, but had always preferred the veggie burrito and this restaurant has never disappointed. Now I am looking forward to my next visit to San Francisco and Taqueria Cancun.
author: Matt N.

description: I'm trying to figure out why I'm not giving this place a 5 star rating, because I love it so much.  I think it's because although the burritos I eat here are great, the quality can fluctuate depending on the meat I choose.  I believe I've had good luck with the carnitas and chicken, not as good with the carne asada.
author: Mike A.

description:
So I just got home from having drinks. What do I want to eat? 

Nothing in my fridge. 

I want a burrito!!! Oooh a chicken quesadilla sounds divine, too.

I once ate here twice in one day. As a burrito fanatic, THAT is how tasty it is. 

End of story. 

Oh, cash only kinda puts holes in the boat.
author: Kiki C.

description:
I love this place and it's delicious!!

Plus, if you're into the bar scene, it's centrally located between a bunch of hip bars and open late.

Nom nom nom. Delicious.  If you're in the mission or castro district, I suggest that you stop by and try it.
author: Lindsay D.

description: TAQUERIA COCKROACH is more like it!  I have been going to this place for the past few months as it is down the street from my work, when last week I was disgusted!!!!!!!!  I was eating, looked down and low and behold there was a big ass dead cockroach in my food!  I spit out my food and so did my co-workers.  I took a picture of it on my iphone (now posted on yelp) and when I showed the guy with the pony tail behind the counter, he didn't even say a word!  Not even sorry!  So I felt obligated to tell people that THIS PLACE IS DIRTY! You will wind up with a mouth full of cockroach!
author: mark s.

description: I can't describe how much I miss Taqueria Cancun's.  I writhe, bathed in sweat, a continent away.  My senses betray me, sure of the faint sound of the south-of-the-border jukebox, deluded by the imagined scent of al pastor.  I am haunted by burritos.
author: Gabriel S.

description:
Taqueria Cancun is a great little Mission Taqueria, but recently I've been very disappointed in their burritos. I feel like they've lost that magical ratio of rice:beans:meat:etc that makes a burrito really spectacular. The latest burritos I've had there have just been way too much rice and really lacking on the rest which makes it extremely filling, but not that tasty.

Now I mainly stick to their tacos, which are still really delicious. To get to that 4th star they need to rework their burrito ratios to make every bite perfectly balanced.
author: Angelo S.

description:
I've never been an aficionada of Mexican food until I first went to Cancun. My boyfriend dragged me there and put a super quesadilla in front me: I was first skeptical considering that I don't like avocado nor onions, but to my own surprise, I ate everything in minutes!!
I also love the tortillas they give you with your orders.

Definitively my favorite Taqueria in the city.
author: The French ninjas P.

description:
Warning: the salsas are HOT! One of the green ones looks like it's going to be guacamole, but it isn't. My chicken super burrito was nothing special, but it was big. At 11:30 on a Thursday night, the line was pretty long. So long that it extended into the PineSol-smelling, bright yellow hallway just outside the restrooms, which, I heard, were not so fun. It almost took away my appetite, so avoid that part of this place if you can.

Enjoy the free chips, cheap prices, large bench tables and interesting late-night crowd.
author: Dave K.

description:
Your vegetarian taco (with ripe avocad! How!) brought me to tears. I dunno how I ever eat a taco in manhattan again. 

Mebbe I just won'.

Mebbe I just think about you an' cry, bebbe.
author: Daniel P.

description:
It seems anytime I'm in the Mission I naturally gravitate to this place. The clientele are as colorful as the decor, so it's always an amusing experience complemented by great food! 

I'm partial to their chicken burrito, but the tacos and nachos I've had are quite good too.
author: Liz K.

description:
I am a bit of a Mexican food snob. Growing up in Chicago, I have been spoiled by good tasting Mexican food. My usual encounters come after a long night of debauchery but I know what I like and I was excited to go to the Mission district and try out San Francisco's authentic Mexican cuisine. 

I ended up going with the Chicken Burrito which was very tasty. The burrito was filled with chicken, rice, beans and lettuce and was about 8 inches long and as thick as a fist. With my burrito came an order of chips, guacamole and salsa. The guacamole was a little runnier than I am used to but it had jalapeno seeds which gave it a kick. For $4.99 and tax, it is a great deal 

Taqueria Cancun is pretty much a fast food restaurant. You go in and order at the counter and then grab a seat at long tables which you may end up sharing with others while you wait for your order to eat. If you are looking for good Mexican meal in the Mission district ata price that is just right, Taqueria Cancun is a must.
author: Chris M.

description:
It's open late and serves excellent cheap tortas.  Lots of meat, slices of fresh avacado and nicely toasted bread.  

I wish their salsas weren't so horridly spicetastic.
author: Shyam P.

description: You won't be disappointed by the burritos here, but they didn't blow me away either.  Good option if you're stumbling out from the mission bars at 1am
author: Jori P.

description:
*THE* number one hangover-prevention place in the city.

Drink your water. Eat your burrito.

You'll thank me in the morning.
author: Dina G.

description: Salsa verde is excellent. We ordered a carnitas super burrito, it was tasty but el farolito is my favorite place in the mission.
author: Drew H.

description:
I'm with Megan that you should NEVER use the bathroom at Cancun.  Ordering was a challenge even when sober because the guy at the counter murmured in an amazingly undecipherable accent.  However he did seem patient, even though I kept saying "huh?" a few times.

Free chips with whatever you order is choice, with some great hot sauce to go with them (get the green stuff).  My burrito was a bit bland so I added a lot of spice to um, kick it up a notch.

Good for a late night quesadilla if you're so drunk you can't feel your face anymore and therefore don't give a crap what the food's like.  Bland for a sober meal that requires walking/traveling any sort of distance to get there.  Cheap is always good.

Again, STAY AWAY from the bathrooms.
author: Andrew B.

description:
No change in star review.

I got one carnitas super taco.  And MAN was it super.  It was piled high with stuff.  So much that I had to eat a few layers with my fork before I could pick it up.  Really good but I think I'll stick with the burritos next time :)
author: Angela S.

description: best part of this place is the price of their veggie burrito. you automatically get all the fixins (guac, crema, etc) and it's only $5.50 total. a lot of other places charge you the same price as getting meat without even givin you the extras.
author: Villager E.

description:
The best part about going out in the Mission is getting a chance for late night food at Taqueria Cancun!  

Special Tip #1: Order in Spanish for more food & more chips & salsa
Special Tip #2: Make sure someone saves your spot while in line if you go to the restroom.  Drunks in line are funny but HUNGRY and love to cut in line.
author: D G.

description:
I don't really get why their veggie burrito is any better than their carne asada burrito. Both are delicious, you just have delicious steak replaced with delicious vegetable.

The burrito isn't quite as good as La Taqueria's, but a WAY better value.

I wish they didn't leave the door open when it's wicked cold....
author: Mark A.

description:
I haven't eaten every vegetarian burrito on earth yet, but I can confidently say that it just doesn't get any better than this.  Tortilla grilled lightly, fantastic beans, deceptively simple seeming, really, but try to do it yourself.  I am starting to drool now; must go there.

and yes, there's a lot of panhandling, but there you go.  a small price to pay in my mind, whether you make a donation or not.

CANCUN!!!!!
author: Ben H.

description: Your awesome Taqueria spot in the Mission.  What can you say bad about a place that offers burritos for roughly $5 that includes chips and salsa.  This place will not be my default Taqueria in the Mission, until I can find a new spot.
author: Shad B.

description: FOOD POISONING!  We gave this place another shot last night. We split a carnitas quesadilla. By this morning we were both jockeying for time on the toilet. Ugh. NEVER AGAIN.
author: Tim W.

description: One of my two favorite Mexican places in the Mission so far. The best tortillas, nicely browned on the grill. Their chicken sometimes gets this amazing bacon-like crisp and flavor to it; when that happens, there's nothing better in the City. Burritos and tortas are excellent and they're generous with the avocado.
author: Marco L.

description: This is my go to Mexican spot in the Mission.  A lot of Mexican food seems to be only good when you are intoxicated, but this place is amazing all the time.  I always get the Super Quesadilla with carne asada.  So good.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Damn i get to be the jerk that gives this place a so so review. I really wanted to jump on the band wagon and give it 4 or 5 stars but I cannot and almost gave it 2 stars. First and foremost i love Mexican food especially Burritos, I can honestly say it is my favoritest  food in the whole wide world( yea i said favoritest). I have been to a million different places similar to Taq Cancun whether it was in  SF, L.A., San Diego or Mexico and enjoyed it . The carne asada burrito i ordered was one of the worst i have ever eaten. It was very bland, lacked any kind of flavor and was nothing but filler. I watched the guy make my burrito and though it was a bean and rice burrito for someone else. Don't believe me, it had 2-3 scoops of rice, 2 scoops of beans and 1 full scoop of carne. I also asked and paid for guacamole and got a 2 slices of avocado instead thanks. I seriously only ate half of my burrito and threw the other half away and left very disappointed. 

Now on to the good, i think there salsa verde was very good and went well with the chips they serve (but it could not save my burrito). It had that little kick i enjoy in good salsa. The chips you get when you eat here were decent nothing special but enjoyed with the tasty salsa. Taqueria Cancun offers many different types of beverages for you to enjoy including beer. I went with the Sidral Mundet Apple Soda cause i love it. 

If i ever come back again i will order a bean and rice burrito and hope they fill it with carne asada and guacamole ...maybe I'll just go with the tacos my friend said were delicious or just walk a block to the next place and hope for the best.
author: Raul R.

description:
YES!

never disappoints! 

LOVE the tortas and alambres best!

also, try the carrot juice for realll!
author: Niki B.

description:
The super veggie burrito is pretty good, but I'm taking off points for a few reasons:
a) although the cooked tortilla is awesome, they cook it on the meat grill.
b) they don't let you choose your own salsa or beans, and their salsa is too spicy for my feeble tongue.
c) One time they threw some weird carrots and mushrooms into my burrito. 
d) They only give you one thing of chips per order. So even if you order two burritos for two people, you still only get one thing of chips.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Sober I'd give their burritos 3 stars.

Drunk, I give it 5 stars.

But come on, nobody eats their sober, right? Or is it just me?
author: Zach C.

description: The last time I reviewed this place, I didn't know much about it other than that it had a reputation and that I had fond half-memories of eating here after emerging from the bars. A year and a half or so later, I've eaten all over the city and still think that this is the best taqueria I've tried. Get the pastor burrito and a ceviche tostada!
author: L. G.

description: Visited from NJ. We spent all night searching for the mission or a cab to get us there ! When we finalllyyy got a cab she recommended this place based on the green salsa. Man was she right! I was in heaven  I love Mexican but authentic can be hard to find in NJ and this place was everything I wanted and more. We made sure to come back one more time before our trip was over after trying a few tacos at other places along the way to compare & this was hands down the winner. Yum!
author: Colleen B.

description:
The Super Vegetarian burrito at Cancun is fantastic.  The tortilla is fresh and warm, the cheese melty and not too salty, the salsa delicious & spicy, the avocado chunks and fresh cilantro plentiful, and... most importantly... the bean/rice ratio is just right.

Cancun is the perfect place to stop before a movie or show for a cheap, delicious burrito that will keep you full for hours.  Just be sure to stay in the noisy, colorful dining room and don't venture back to the nasty bathroom.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Super Burrito Mojato

Everytime I get drunk and want something cheap, filling and awesome, I think of the Cancun Super Burrito Mojato. It doesnt get better than this. Beware of long lines though, also, its cash only
author: Venkat K.

description: Had the enchiladas with black beans and rice. Ok but not spectacular. The place is in the Mission, so I think the bar should be a little higher.
author: Buck N.

description:
Taqueria Cancun is one of the best places in San Francisco to get a vegetarian burrito. BUT their super nachos are to die for! I haven't had any of their meat selections but I've heard the carne asada is good too. I recommend ordering black beans instead of pinto and light sour cream.

The atmosphere is a bit obnoxious, but hey, it's the mission. They have a great jukebox.  The last time I was there a young man from Mexico that spoke very little English played Juanes "La Camisa Negra" over and over again. It was muy fantastico!

Anyway, I eat burritos like four times a week so I know what I'm talking about.

Just stay away from their bathrooms...

Edit:
Dude, I totally forgot to mention their burrito mojado! Holy Shit! Best wet burrito in the world! HANDS DOWN.
author: Janice K.

description:
- Cheapy Food.
- The best salsa verde in town.
- This one dude that always comes up and asks for some cash.   Affectionally named The Captain by my friend as he gave him change.
- Best tacos I've had in town.
- Mariachi Band???
author: Eyal C.

description: I'm never eating here again. I used to love this place, but last time I was there, a girl harassed one of my friends to buy her a Coke, tried to pick a fight with my girlfriend,  and punched me in the face. Management refused to do anything about it until she picked a fight with another table and split a dude's lip. This all happened right in front of the counter. The manager just shrugged when I asked him if he was going to do anything about it. Unacceptable.
author: Allan H.

description: This was my 1st time having 100% authentic Mexican Food! I loved it! I  had the Chicken "Burrito Mojado! I'll put it to ya like this.....I ate this thing around 2pm and was full til around midnight! I loved this place! That burrito was the size of my shoe! lol! I wear a 12! lol size! And I also drank some of Cinnamon Milk stuff...Pretty tasty but thick!
author: Michael O.

description: I was going to be all hatey on this place because it's popular, well-lit, and filled with white people.  Nevertheless, the quality of the meats and ingredients is great, the line moves quickly, and the prices are reasonable.  They don't get 5 stars because they didn't completely fill my burrito with cilantro.  It's all it takes.  Just stuff it full of that beautiful green stuff and you'll make anything taste like heaven.
author: Bill H.

description: Best! Not that i've tried a lot of other burrito places, but there was not much reason to. The prices are awesome, the food is really great and it's colorful inside, almost too colorful in the most perfect way. There's not a lot of seating but it's easy to get to-go food.
author: Genna M.

description:
Easy four star burrito.

Five bucks for a carne asada super burrito, no guac but they use slices of fresh avocado.

Not a fan of their tortilla chips or salsa, I wished they had some fresh blended red hot sauce for the burrito instead.
author: kate r.

description:
This has to be my favorite taqueria in the city- so check it out
it's cheap
the food is pretty close to southern cal mexican food
open late 
it's a bit dirty...but for some reason i can always pick up a hint of bleach smell
the music is super loud so when you are hung over, it's perfect- you don't have to talk
author: Valarie A.

description:
Had a bit of a late nite craving for tacos after a night of dancing at the Ambassador to DJ Am. Caught a cab and asked for a recommendation on a good taqueria...without hestitation he said Cancun. I said "Sweet, I haven't been to that one." Done deal. 

Being a taco aficionado I was like ohh, I gotta try my litmus test tacos: lengua and al pastor. The lengua was tasty, but it was big chunks that had been stewed, rather than steamed and finely diced up with cilantro and onions as condiments. The al pastor was good, but not authentic tasting as it is when sliced off the traditional vertical spit. It tasted more like pork meat coated in al pastor sauce. I paired it with a Tecate and I was a happy camper. 

But then I was done and still hungry so I order one more pollo asado taco which was really good. The salsas were spicy and very tasty. 

So overall, good, but not great! I would definitely go back and try other tacos and other entrees.
author: isaias J.

description:
I don't normally find myself disagreeing with such illustrious reviewers as gnat c., but, I must.  Cancun is a nighttime oasis of flavor.  Maybe it's the spanish.  Everything tastes better if you can order in spanish.

I wouldn't be so bold as to tell you this place is, well, clean, but I mean comeon, it's a burrito joint!  You don't want to see how the sausage is made.  You're best to sit back, wait for your burrito, and stare at the other patrons.  You'll fit right in.

Oh, and a final word of wisdom.  The line goes BACK from the cash register, not forward.  Make sure you do that.  Otherwise.  Well.  You know.
author: Nelson A.

description:
After a night at the climbing gym my friends and I needed some grub.  The normal taco truck outside of MIssions Cliffs had driven away so we ventured up towards Mission St.  We attempted to go to Cha Cha Cha, but that place was too packed.  

The bright yellow sign of Taqueria Cancun caught my eye.  After checking the previous Yelp reviews on my friends iPhone this looked like a great second choice.  I was impressed by the amount of people eating here.  One of the other things I noticed is that they didn't do a good job at busing the tables.  The Yelp reviews had me all hyped up so I ignored this and  thought, "the food has got to be good".

I got in the long line and placed my order in Spanish.  Trust me, I don't sound like a gringo but the guy taking my order almost seemed annoyed that I was speaking Spanish to him.  The next thing I noticed was that the chips that come with your meal were from a bag...sorta stale tasting too.  And instead of a salsa bar they gave you two tiny containers of salsa.

I had three super tacos--the carnitas one had a couple pieces of grissle in it, the al pastor one was so greasy I almost crapped my pants eating it, and the carne asada one had no flavor.  What's so super about one and a half slices of avocado and a mound of sour cream?  And for $3 each?!  Come on!

Bottom line, from the three tacos I ate and the looks of the burritos and quesadillas my friends ordered, this place is not all as good as others have made it out to be.  I won't be coming back here unless I'm really buzzed.

I'm sticking to El Farolito and the El Tonayense taco trucks.
author: Christopher W.

description: Free tasty chips and salsa. The usual variety of meatybits (tongue, brains, etc.) but also $2.50 vegetarian tacos piled with goodies. Large tasty burritos. Open late so that an emergency burrito craving can be satisfied. Nothing not to like about this place.
author: Kimberley D.

description:
Lets get a few things straight. Its the mission, don't use the bathroom or eat off the floor, or even off the dinning tables for that matter. Don't eat here if you have IBS or a compromised immune system. Use your best judgment as my mother always says.

Go to El Farolito for the carne asada, the veggie burrito is what you should be eating here. There are certain essential burrito elements this place seems to get right each and every visit. 

1) The tortilla MUST touch the grill first. 
2) Half a perfectly ripe avocado replaces meat 
(not steamed veggies like other mission unmentionables...blah!)
3) An unhealthy amount of cheese brought down by angels from the Mexican portion of heaven
4) Structural integrity. This one has it, stand your burrito up on end while you put out the fire in your mouth.
5) Don't forget the awesomeness of the place. Bright yellow walls, best of the bay awards strung out like wallpaper, and the occasional mariachi band trickling in.

Now go and enjoy friends! And don't forget to burn your local taco bell!
author: Amanda G.

description:
I'm going to start eating at this place all the time. The best thing I noticed when we walked in was the fact it never closes before 1am (amazing). On top of that, the food was delicious. Very good authentic mexican which is damn cheap. And they have beer! 

I need to try it for a late night munchie run at some point.
author: David D.

description:
A friend from LA swore to my BF and I that this place is the closest thing to a Mexican join in SoCal.

We don't agree.

Atmosphere is cute, bright, and clean and colorful.  Lots of options.  Neither of us liked what we had, his burrito had too much stuff in it with too many flavors competing, and too much salsa.  My chorizo burrito barely had any chorizo and had beans and rice and too many things going on for me to even notice what little chorizo I got.  

I would come back, but I would be super specific when I order to leave everything that I don't want in the burrito out, as it comes with way too much stuff!!

Cheap though, and packed.  So the BF and I may stand alone on our opinion on this place.
author: Denise B.

description:
Why do I always get to this place late at night and order the super freaking carne asada nachos??!?!

Because they're effin good and tasty and after having a few sippity sip sips of your choice of drink for the night you might be a little hungry.  Based on the rest of the reviews here, it's a common theme.

This place is open late, they're super crowded with the late night revelers, and they serve really good food!!!
author: Jenn A.

description:
I DON'T want cheese on my burrito, damnit. How HARD is that?

I EVEN LEARNED HOW TO SAY IT IN SPANISH! FOR YOU!

I don't like queso. I don't want queso.

And how can a place claim to have the BEST Vegetarian Burrito when it's seriously just beans, salsa, and rice? Where are the VEGGIES? Nonexistant here, that's where.

I mean, I'm sure it's great for those of you indulging in animal flesh or animal excretions of sorts, but it's NOT good for me. Plain and simple.

I don't understand the hype. It's a mediocre taqueria...like so many others in the neighborhood.

It has this intense following, the line is always loooooooooong, the water cups are laughable...I don't get it. 

It's a typical Mission burrito for those of you on the meatsies. It's passable for me. Very passable. So passable, in fact, that I live a block away and I've been there three times since I moved into the city.

The graffiti in the bathroom is neat, though.


---


EDIT: I still don't get it.
author: Danyell K.

description:
Sorry Y'all.  This place is great if you're a Gringo who loves paper mache decor and squeezing in tight lines.  
If you're any kind of Mexican food foodee you know better.  The carne asada is dry and 50 percent chewy fat.  The last time I went they messed up my order...twice!  Dude, it's a burrito.  50 other cooks on Mission street can do it, why can't they do it here?
Don't believe me?  Check it.  Order your food and watch the guy toss (yes, literally toss) your order together.  Sloppy like they're pissed.  When you order your food, ask for a cup of water and enjoy your plastic shot glass of H2O.
Sorry guys, I'm done with this place.  A shrimp burrito from El Toro a block away whoops on anything this place can TOSS together.

P.S.  be sure to bring cash or pay the $2 ATM fee.
author: Pablo R.

description: Yet another pre-airport trip to Taqueria Cancun - this one was the best yet.  The green salsa is SO awesome, but the standard pico is good, too.  I got the vegetarian burrito, and it was really good - I got pinto beans this time, which were perfectly cooked and well seasoned.  All of the other ingredients were fresh and well proportioned.  It helped make the awful airline delay a little less hungry!
author: Betty R.

description:
You'll thank me for this:  Super Nachos Al Pastor.  They give you enough to feed 3 people.  I'm not kidding.  

 I get cravings for this stuff regularly.  Hits the spot every time.
author: My N.

description: Probably my favorite taqueria anywhere, and most of that is for the food itself - every burrito should get avocado and fresh cilantro to start with.  Beyond the menu Cancun is a classic example of your basic taqueria, where you order and pick at the counter, from the usual choices plus a few items not always seen elsewhere.  It'd be a good place to take someone from out of town who's never been to a taqueria.  Can be crowded, can be noisy, can be hard to park, but whatever.
author: Carter S.

description:
Affordable, quantity over quality. Nice cashier. Long lines but they move quick. Ample seating and a colorful vibe.

I got the Burrito Mojado (with carnitas) it was huge and spicy but not so flavorful, and let's just say it goes in one way and spills out the other, kind of like soft serve.
author: Merri K.

description: Really good burrito place, exactly what you would expect from a cash only hole in the wall. They close before 2...gates were up by 1:45am on a Friday
author: Ojus P.

description:
I moved to the Bay from San Diego. I've gotten accustomed to the winter all the time feeling (kinda), but I have to say the yearning for great Mexican food is still with me.  I heard great things about this place. In fact, people are always really excited when they talked about. Example, "It's sooooooooo good!!" So I bowed to peer pressure, plunked down 6 bucks, and now I'm disappointed. 

All I have to say is my burrito had lettuce and/or sour cream in it.  Two ultimate no-nos.
author: Nefarious J.

description:
My third favorite burrito in the mission (well, actually of anywhere I've been).  

1.) La Taqueria
2.) El Farrolito's
2.) Cancun

Great when the bars close.  Salsa has some real kick to it.
author: Evan A.

description:
Before I lived in San Francisco, I was ok with Taco Bell and Burritoville (in New York) but after moving to San Francisco and having a super burrito, I was eating CRAP before. I LOVE TAQUERIA CANCUN!!!!!

I never thought a burrito could make me feel this way. Now when I see people walking down the street eating a Taco Bell burrito, I want to smack them. The cream, the beans, the avocado instead of guacamole! The combination is so delicious! I'm getting so hungry just thinking of it. 

When I first moved here, I'd have one every day, until I got a job and then it was just on Mondays when I was off from work, but then they changed my schedule so now it is every Friday when I'm hanging out at El Rio. Yum! 

Oh and the enchiladas are really good too!
author: Bella T.

description:
To preface this, my fried told me this was the best burrito she has ever had- so Taqueria Cancun had a lot to live up to and it did!  The whole place looks like a hole in the wall.  These places are the best because the best food comes from places like this.  The inside was filled with bright banners and it just made me laugh when I walked in.

I copied my friend's suggestion on her super burrito with chicken and horchata.  The burrito was ginormous, and I mean ginormous.  But it was quite tasty.  Filled with fresh avo, this burrito definitely made my books.  The one thing I was disappointed with were the chips.  They just were not my style of liking.  Oh well, I can't wait to go back for another super burrito!
author: Cara D.

description:
this place is the real deal. no frills, no bs, no "soy-rizo" crap like Papalote sells... 
the pollo asado, the carnitas, the carne asada....seriously, whatever they have is good. The super tacos and burritos are awesome....but the regular ones are great too... grab a jarritos and a couple super tacos and enjoy. BING BANG BONG.
author: Saul G.

description:
After all these years of hanging in the Mission, I have never once had a burrito around there. Insane, I know (I'm a pizza kinda girl). I think I put this spot on a pedestal, too many high expectations. I had a regular burrito and it was HUGE! I think it took me three or four bites to make a dent in it! The chips and salsa were good. I am going to get a torta next time.

But I love the indoor picnic tables and the colorful decorations. And it's open till 3am!!!
author: Maureen M.

description: Get the super burrito, as much as the mando wet burrito looks tempting, its not as good. This place rules by the way.
author: Ben K.

description:
Love it.  Here's why:
(1)  It's Tasty.  The ingredients are fresh, and they are very generous with the Avocados.
(2)  It's Fast.  Granted it was not super crowded when we went (on a Thursday night), but it only took them 5 minutes before the food was delivered.
(3)  Great Value.  I got the Carne Asada Taco (WOULD DEFINITELY GET IT AGAIN), and it came with chips & salsa & spicy Guac.  let me tell you about the Spicy Guac.  It's Spicy.  It might not hit you right away, but believe me, my friend, your lips will be swollen by the time you dip the third chip.  Little container really packs a real punch.
(4) Honorable Mention.  The burrito.  California Style.  Easy on the rice, but big on the flavor.  i labeled it honorable mention because i actually didn't eat this, but my husband did.  And he liked it.
author: Laura C.

description: A good substitute when I don't feel like making my way down to El Farolito. The burritos are just as big and just as tasty, and the hot sauce really kicked my ass the first time I tried it. For a double dose of fire, I recommend getting the wet burrito. That's hot.
author: Rebecca P.

description: No one can make a better burrito! Authentic, fresh and inexpensive.
author: Christopher D.

description:
Seriously...this says it all: http://flickr.com/photos/benbrown/381496695

Not to mention they scored a 66 on their most recent inspection: http://www.sfdph.org/eh/Violations/Loc_CurrentViol.asp?LocationID=2749

No thanks!
author: Don O.

description:
I've been here so many times, I can't even count.  You really do get the most bang outtta your buck here.  Cheapest vegetarian burritos in the city, I think.  And yes, vegetarian burritos grew on me.  Healthier, and I don't feel nearly as pregnant as I always feel after eating Mexican.

  And the staff is so sweet!  One time I had just come back from work and looking very tired because I had just spent the last five hours transcribing tapes and the guy asked me if there was anything wrong.  He wouldn't believe me when I said I was just tired from transcribing the god damn stack of tapes at the office.  (I guess scooping beans is worse?)  But obviously, he didn't seem jaded.
author: Natasha L.

description:
There are 4 good burrito spots in SF in my opinion (in this order): Taqueria Cancun, El Farolito, El Castillito (by Safeway-Castro), and El Pelon.

Cancun is superior for tastiness with the price and the Salsa.  
A Super Pollo Asado Burrito can't be beat.  Never disappointed.
author: Jake B.

description:
When I first moved to the Mission, I took notice of the shops where the mannequins displayed were very hippy. As I passed by these shops on the way to Taqueria Cancun, little did I realize I'd soon get a little hippy myself if I didn't stop eating their nachos all the damned time.
Taqueria Cancun looks like a fiesta threw up all over the tables and the walls. (I mean this in terms of decor, not cleanliness!). Mariachi bands make guest appearances as my friends and I pillage through the deliciousness that is Taqueria Cancun.
author: Jessica R.

description: Burritos elevated to the status of art.    This place should be named one of the seven wonders of the eating world.
author: Denise S.

description: the carne asada was kind of disappointing. Should have gotten the burrito.
author: David C.

description:
I'm faced with a dilemma in writing this review.

Allow me to explain.  I know everyone says that these are the best burritos in existence.  If I agreed with that statement, would it really add any extra weight to its veracity from the point of view of you, the reader?  Or would it merely cause my opinion to blend in with all the rest?

Here's another way to look at it: I'm going to tell you that Taqueria Cancun makes the best Burritos you will ever have (there, I said it), and you're going to think "wow, if everyone loves this place so much, it really must be something special.  Why don't I go try it, right now?"

I guess it could go either way, but really, if you don't go get a burrito from taqueria cancun then you are missing out on one of those things that everybody should do at least once before they die...

p.s. To all those reviewers who had tacos or some other nonsense here and wound up being disappointed: what are you thinking!?  This is not the place to get tacos, this is the place to get burritos!  Didn't you get the damn memo?  Get with the program!
author: Matthew M.

description: I wish I could make this place my home. I used to live down the block and I essentially subsisted wholly on veggie burritos from Cancun. Having left the neighborhood, I'm always looking for excuses to go grab a feed bag from Cancun and stuff my face. I'm not going to weigh in on which Mission taqueria is the best, but I will say that Cancun will always be near the top of my list. Their salsas are different than what you'll find in other spots, but I back them hard. They're both pretty spicy, though the batches vary day to day. Tacos and nachos are good and the horchata is tasty. The veggie burrito, however, is what always draws me back. $5.46 for an awesome burrito. It doesn't get much righter than that.
author: Peter S.

description:
Really good burritos, you get free chips, as is standard in this city.  When you order it spicy, it's actually spicy which is a HUGE plus.

Staff is quick, efficient and they never mess up your order.

I love going here when i'm drunk, it ALWAYS satisfies my cravings.

Only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because it's cash only, but they do have an ATM right there in the store.
author: Alexandra A.

description:
i have to say the best Carne Asada Super Burrito in town. For $5 bucks you can't go wrong. I live near CCSF and at one time I drove down 4 times a week to Cancun to get my fix!! 
Great food, chill environment (in taqueria terms), and livin up to all the hype. Now if only Anthony's Cookies would team up with them and have some kinda joint venture....
author: Eric A.

description:
A great place to go at 2am after being out in the Mission.  

Super burrito al pastor -- pretty darn tasty, and better than some of the other fare I've had (though, obviously, my experience is not exhaustive).  Tasty salsas and chips to munch on while waiting for your order, "festive" atmosphere, convenient location for late-night... sounds good to me.
author: Tim B.

description:
I love the pollo asada they do.  My favorite dish here is the Burrito Majado(Super Pollo Asada Burrito Mojado).   It's basically a bigass burrito covered in enchilada sauce.   

The staff here has it dialed.  They are friendly, respectful and your food comes out quick.  They hook you up with a nice helping of chips and 2 kinds of salsa.

Fun fact:  Most vegetarians seem to prefer this Mexican restaurant over others.
author: Dante S.

description:
Yay! Apparently I'm the 759th person to review this place.

Everything is above average; tacos, burritos, chips, salsa (green avocado salsa is great!)  On my latest trip, I got the Burrito Majado- which was the size of my head and covered with enchilada sauce.  I felt the hair on my chest growing just eating it.  The price to be a man (or manly) 5.99.

The decor is a little too whitie-tex-mex.  -you know, cheesy.  -Strings of shiny banners, terra cotta inside, etc.

It's not a destination, but it is a good place to go for solid and consistent mex.
author: Jake H.

description: Definitely the most bang for your buck in terms of burrito size, but I still favor Papalote and El Burrito Express in terms of tastiness.  I prefer having guacamole in the burrito (instead of avocado chunks) and the rice was kind of mushy....purely adding carbs without adding much flavor, but the cheese was nicely melted into the burrito, the carne asada was great, and the burrito never spilled or tore apart.  Great option for tight budgets--a super burrito can make 2 meals at $5.99 that's a bargain!
author: Lauren M.

description:
THIS PLACE IS SOOOOO GOOD!

I had just finished a class at Dance Mission and my friends and I knew we had to eat all the calories we burned off ..so we headed to Taqueria Cancun.  My favorite thing about this place is their tortillas!  I heard they make the tortillas themselves.  It's the perfect touch to their already perfect burrito.  Everything here is top quality but  I can never decide whether I want a quesadilla or a burrito so I bring a friend who will split both with me!

Here's why it's great: 
1. I ordered my Super Quesadilla (The BEST) and before I even got to my seat, they called my number.  
2. My friend got her burrito and exclaimed "LOOK HOW MUCH MEAT IS IN HERE!" (Because there really IS that much meat!)
3. Their horchata has lots and lots of cinnamon yummm

I've never had a problem with the seating here and more importantly...with the prices.  For $6.50...you have dinner AND (according to my friend) "breakfast" for the next day! Scooore!
author: Helen V.

description:
The best vegetarian burrito around. That alone gets it 5 stars. They do something unique with their guacamole salsa. Interesting.

Relax and enjoy the jukebox. Again, best veggie burrito in town?!? Yes,
author: Peter B.

description: I went to this place because one of the local newspapers had a year end poll and this place got voted best burrito. I wholeheartedly agree. I've only ever had their vegetarian burrito  but it's the best thing ever. I always drag my buds there when we're nearby cuz it rules. Sadly I don't live anywheres close to here and the burritos in my hood suck. This place is inexpensive, the burritos are big and i swear they give you a whole avocado in each one. I couldn't recommend this place more. Well, I wish it were closer to me but then they'd have to jack up the prices and it would be full of frat boys and their pole dancing girlfriends.
author: Eric M.

description: We have a split rating here. Wife thought it too spicy and I thought it was pretty good but short of some of the praising I read here. We both had the carnitas super burritos. A 3 plus I guess. Bring cash - no credit cards.
author: Mike M.

description:
EDIT: what fucking happened Cancun? 
On a thursday night... about a week ago (11/9/06) we stopped in to get A chicken super burrito and a chicken quesadilla. We got fucking nuckle meet and gristle. THANKS ANYWAY. I won't be returning anytime soon.

10/0/06:
Favorite place for mexican food. We drive all the way from Western Addition to get the super burritos!

1. GIANT burritos
2. delicious quesadillas
3. The salsa, Green or Red are super spicy. Bring on the heartburn.
4. they serve chips and salsa with every order-- best deal on a meal in town!
author: maranda w.

description: So far this place has the best super burrito in the city. It still pales in comparison to anything from socal, but it's just not fair to compare.
author: Alfredo A.

description:
Good, cheap, basic burritos. Pretty much the same fare you get anywhere else in the mission, but maybe a little cheaper. The regular burrito comes in at $3.80, and the super burrito is a buck more (and includes guac and sour cream). Probably 2 meals if you don't have a huge appetite.

The chips are pretty tasty, and the salsa is quite hot (especially the green stuff - I'm not a spice weenie, and i found it to be intense).

Overall, thumbs up.
author: Dana L.

description: Great food! Had super tacos (chorizo and chicken). Will go back here EVERYTIME I can when I'm in the area. Place is authentic and plane great! Good place to grab some food after a night of drinks.
author: Raj P.

description:
Awesome prices -- Awesome food -- Awesome music? umm...

Okay: Awesome prices and Awesome food. 


Open late! Makes me happy.
author: Mike S.

description: Late night cravings, heck yes!  I'm not a fan of quesadillas, but they doctor it up good here. They do have lines, so be patient.  Otherwise, good stuff!
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
My favorite taqueria in SF hands down! This review is based on the burritos and the burrito mojado! YUM!! I prefer their green sauce over the regular pico de gallo crap. The green salsa makes this place! Get them to put it inside the burrito instead of the pico de gallo crap, and put it on top of the mojado too! That was my favorite.. and cheap! Split it or it can last 2 days and probably stayed in you even longer.. TMI  
Carne asada and carnitas were great, too!
Small place -- the one on market-- try the one in mission for more room.. but good luck parking :)
author: H B.

description: If you're looking for a cheap meal, this place satisfies.  My husband loves their chicken enchiladas.  I love their veggie burritoes.  Yes, the bright yellow decor is appalling.  But for some reason, this place really does have the best burritoes in the Mission!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Three words...OH MY GOD!!!

Best freakin' burrito of my life!  Really, I'm not exaggerating!  Okay, maybe a little, because I was drunk, but seriously, wow!

I guess I should have guessed that it was going to be good, because my vegan eating roommate, whom I have never seen touch anything like a burrito, turned the car around so fast and insisted that we get burritos from this place, no exceptions.  

Yay, for Absolutely most Amazing burrito!  

Go get ya one!
author: Sara P.

description:
It was my girlfriends first time experiencing a San Francisco burrito and I practically forced her to eat at Cancun, as I remember it tasting like nothing else in the world.  The last time I came to Cancun was around 3 years ago, but this place used to be my favorite burrito place EVER.  I'm pretty sure it's either gone straight down the hill or my tastes have drastically changed?? I had it the other day and there wasn't anything special about it.  Gone was the uniquely limey flavor.  Gone was any heat whatsoever.  It wasn't even as big as I remembered?  The only thing that tasted the same was the green avocado salsa stuff (and it's still great, in case you were wondering).

Maybe I hit it on a bad day, who knows...  But either way, next time I'm in San Francisco I'll probably try another burrito place first.
author: Bryan R.

description:
Let me preface with the fact that there is only one thing I get from Taqueria Cancun, that the place is no sanitary wonderland, and that I truly love Mexican food.

Okay, now that we have that out of the way, the super burrito with chicken has got to be one of the most pleasing burritos I have ever experienced. Their traditional style with a little twist on the way they spice their meat is incredible. The green avocado salsa is also a necessity, particularly if you like things spicy! This burrito is huuuuge, usually shared with my lady, and satisfying down to my very soul. My brother typically gets the same burrito with beef, and also raves about the flavor...it's all in the spices. 

Their chips are something to pass on definitely. They seem as though they come out of a bag you would buy at a grocery store for cheap. They are thick, corny, salty...just not good eats. However, anything that is grilled up in their yummy spices and juices are definitely delicious. 

Four stars for their cheap, giant, and delectable super burrito.

***Disclaimer: Order the GRILLED CHICKEN (not the pollo)!!!
author: Shannon F.

description: I would have to say this is a late night establishment when in the Mission.  The crowd is always eclectic and the food seems fresh (at 2AM).
author: Aasim K.

description:
This is the best taqueria in all of the mission.  Granted, I've only had the vegetarian burritos, but that is b/c they are so yummy I wouldn't dream of changing it up!  They are super generous with the avocado and have a mind-numbingly spicy salsa.  

It isn't the cleanest or safest looking joint, but god damn, does it taste good.  On a sunny day, I like to grab a burrito from here, take it to Dolores Park, and just chillax.
author: Sid D.

description: Let me first state that I did not eat the food. I went in one night after a good time at Bruno's and I was waiting in the line to get my taco, when I saw a roach on the back wall of the kitchen. Now I thought to myself, well if it's just one roach, I can still eat here. And this his best friend walked out. And then his sister, and the whole family were wandering around that wall while people placed their orders. I counted five roaches and that was it. Food is not to be eaten from here.
author: Betty C.

description: Stiff competition for good Mexican food in the Mission.  I had an awesome taco salad here; the fried flour tortilla it was in was ridiculously delicious.  The place is cleaner and nicer inside then most its cheap eats competition.
author: Daniel H.

description:
I never quite understood why the burritos in so cal are so much better than no cal.  Why can't they use the same ingredients up here that they use down there?

In a city that does not have much quality mexican food, this place is actually pretty good.  While most bay area burritos are very bland with no flavor, Taqueria Cancun is quite tasty.

They have a jukebox.  I highly recommend Mana!!

Me gusto Taqueria Cancun.
author: Tim X.

description:
Surprise surprise... Jayce is yelping a taqueria.

My "late night eatery" theory applies to Taqueria Cancun as well. For those of you who aren't avid readers of my rants, the concept is simple...
that anything that is open late surpasses its own underlying mediocrity by purely due to the fact that they are their to scratch that itch when a late night craving strikes.

Like a heroin dealer... on those nights when you just can't get to sleep.
Same concept: case in point, who would ever go to Mel's Diner for midday BY CHOICE?!
Right... no one.

So Taqueria Cancun wasn't bad but wasn't all that good either.
It was different in texture and composition. Neither bad nor good. Just unique in an obscure way.
I, personally, was pleased. Or satisfied rather, being late night after a show. The tomatillo salsa was super smoky and hella good.
But with the choices that day time brings, I can't imagine visiting Taqueria Cancun prior to 9PM.
Zooooorrrry hombre.
Also, they don't accept plastic... WEAK.
author: JAYCE B.

description:
...so my BF and i actually came across this place after dining at Mission Street Food (hey!  it wasn't me that was still hungry)!  

vegetarian burrito = good
free chips and salsa = good
salsa that's actually spicy = great

love coming across unexpected places!
author: Nancy T.

description: This place needs another review like I need another burrito but on the off-chance that you weren't convinced yet, let me assure you that this place makes good, cheap, pretension-less food. The Al Pastor is especially tasty and did I mention cheap?
author: Will R.

description:
There are three kinds of food that people review with extreme polarized passion: sushi, falafel, and Mexican.  I weep over Taqueria Cancun.  I weep even more when I'm out of town and I get that hankering for carne asada, because I know that no other taqueria will ever be quite as good as Cancun.  None other has quite that pasty yellow paint on the walls, the ridiculously spicy "guacamole", the water cooler you rehydrate from as you wait in line after 2AM.

And indeed, you read half the reviews, and it's those three things that some most despise.  How can this be?  This place is incredible.  People, do me this favor: if I'm ever on my death bed and I lose my voice, it's a carne asada super burrito that I want for my last meal.  Mmm...
author: Daniel D.

description: Mexican food in the mission is always good but This place got the best quesadilla by Far tho! And their horchata is the BEST!!
author: Lana B.

description: I pretty much came here because yelp.com told me to and I wanted to check out this place that apparently got the best burrito award.  It was busy with lots of long tables that you generally share with other people.  The place was a little dirty but I didn't mind much.  They serve beer and give you free chips and salsa and Guac.....and it was the BEST guac I have ever tasted.  It was spicy :)  I ordered one vegetarian burrito for $2.50 or something like that and it was really big!  I really couldn't eat it like a taco because there was so much stuff in it.  Definitely come here is you're looking for cheap ass, tasty mex food.
author: Erica H.

description: There is not consistency with Taqueria Cancun, one day it's the best, and the other day not so much. Recently I've found that the burritos and salsa are much hotter than they used to be, way too hot for my taste.
