The food here is great, the chips suck, but the salsa almost makes up for the chips sucking. If the chips were better, I wouldn't go anywhere else, except sunflower, or farolito.... well I would go here more often.
I am a carnivore but the veggie burrito is the best one in the city
author: Burne D.

description:
Okay...so this has been long in coming.  Taqueria used to be the best place for burritos in the city.  Unfortunately, they slid down hill and are now quite a bit below average.  

Main compliant: Very little chicken in the 'chicken burrito' - it is half of the name, it should be the main ingredient.  Don't make me suffer through a pound of rice and beans to find the three pieces of chicken.

Full Disclosure: Haven't been back in six+ months.  Maybe they've gotten better again?
author: Brian H.

description: Used to come here a lot - the salsas are nice and spicy, but unfortunately, that's necessary because the burritos are pretty bland. The Carne Asada is especially dry. Sure, the price and hours are good, but get one of these burritos to go and then try it 5 minutes later. I honestly think that people are seduced by the colorful interior and the 65,000 drinks they've had before coming in. Good in a pinch, but doesn't really compare to the better taquerias around.
author: Owen R.

description: Good food great prices lots of awards on the wall defiantly would go back to this place and recommend it to everyone. As with a lot of these places bring your appetite, and be prepared to be semi cramped. Also watch your knees, shins and ankles on the tables, there is no lack of places to bump each one of them multiple times.
author: Christopher F.

description: Had lunch on Tuesday afternoon. I spent the next night and half the day on Thanksgiving in the restroom. Just found out the person I had lunch with did the same. We should have known when we saw the cook come out of the restroom with wet hands......
author: Howard C.

description: Best Burrito I have ever had! I am almost a regular here:) and I always get the Super Carne Asada Burrito.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
I love mexican food and burritos in particular and am always on a search to find the best. My roommates has suggested this place to me numerous times and I finally went. 

The veggie burrito.... the best I have ever had. AND they don't charge extra for avocado, but already throw it in there anyway. YUM A FAT burrito w/ avo and chips all for $5.

Know anyone who can beat that price and the deliciousness? I didn't think so. Also, the service was friendly, quick and they give 3 different salsas for your chips. :) 
My belly was full, my dogs enjoyed what I couldn't finish and we all were happy.
author: Katy W.

description: the burritos were huge and delicious and so was the freshly made orange/carrot juice. i love the atmosphere too- not gimmicky or obnoxious.
author: Sara S.

description:
on sunday i was lying in a sweaty mess of sudden the SF heatwave. i might have been at a park, lounging in style if it wasn't for the very painful vacation UTI i was suffering from. 

my sweet date, in an effort to cheer me up, trekked to the mission in hopes that a chicken super burrito would allow me some temporary respite from the agonizing "down there" pain. 

i will say it right here and now, every single delicious bite of my burrito took me one step closer to god and one step away from the lower catacombs of hell where i was currently residing. 

taqueria cancun is hands down the best burrito i have ever eaten in my life.  it also goes well with antibiotics. true story.
author: Alysia A.

description: The best Fish Tacos and Vegetarian Burritos in San Francisco.  This is a very powerful statement.  I've lived the Mission for a few years and I can tell you they don't get any better than this place.
author: Lee R.

description: the food was hardly eatable. very greasy, not to fresh and very blend. the salsas very boring. there is many other better taquerias in mission district
author: jackybrown23

description: My number 1 spot for Mexican food in the Bay area.  Why?  Time and time again, for dinner or post-bar food, this is where I go.  Why?  Not only do they have amazing prices, their food is also the best and they are cheap.  I always get the wet burrito mojado with carne asada.  This thing is stacked with filling and smothered in cheese and enchilada sauce.  It is quite spicy so if you can't handle the fire then I'd suggest that you ask them to have the salsa on the side.  Their chicken quesadillas are also very very tasty and loaded with cheese.  Whenever I am feeling like a veggie burrito they also offer those and they are better than anywhere else because they actually put avocados in them rather than guacamole.  CANCUN TAQUERIA IS THE BEST!!!
author: Jeffrey B.

description:
You can have one of the best vege burrito experiences you've ever had at Cancun or a bite into your burrito can make you gag with the thought of uncleanliness. I've had both experiences here.  

At least they stop serving the chips in the unwashed baskets wrapped in old used foil. 

Despite my complaining, I've eaten about 2 thousand of these burritos and that is not an exaggeration. You'll keep chasing the horizon for that one good one.
author: H K.

description:
Overrated..   granted I don't eat veggie burritos.  I've heard that that's their bread and butter.

 Being born and raised in SD, I consider myself an expert in Burritos..  and  I just find Cancun's burritos dry.  The quality seems ok.. but, I just don't dig the burrito.  I went there today, and they put so much rice in the burrito,, i almost choked on the dryness.   Ok, I admit I dont take sour cream in my burrito.. maybe that would change the dryness,,   

They don't offer Guacamole, usually my favorite part of the burrito and their  salsa is a bit too spicy for my liking

OK..  here's another gripe, and most SF taquerias suffer from this .

BAD Tortilla CHIPS!  what is up with those horrible chips?  Again.. i am a bit of a snob having come from a place where Mexican food is 24 hour and delicious...  don't get me wrong, I LOVE SF..  but SD  burritos kick ass more..

But, there is really good Mexican food in SF too.. Taqueria Cancun is  mediocre..    I prefer El Castillito on Church.. and there are others, I just don't remember the names.. there's one on 16th and Valencia that serves really good chips too..warm and everything..  ok, i'm tired.. and tired of ranting...zzzzz
author: Georgio S.

description:
Great carnitas and carne asada!
More meat than you can shake a vegan at!
It doesn't get any better. I like my taquerias simple, fast, and cheap and this place meets all criteria.
Cute eye candy comes to eat as its the place to be apparently.
Me, hung over, lookin not so cute, and silly me not in flip flops like most clientele.
A must place to visit daytime, or while bar hopping in the Mission.
author: Jonas S.

description:
One of the best burritos that I've had in the city. The beans were just firm enough and not too big. they included avocado instead of guacamole, and the carne asada was perfect; none of that dried out crap that you run in to from time to time. plus the super burrito had just the right amount of spice and all for $6.

While I plan on making a more concerted effort to explore the rest of the mission's taquerias, Cancun has definitely set the standard.
author: Russell B.

description:
Nice one. The place to go when the wallet is hurting and you still can't be bothered to cook....

I chowed down a regular burrito - really not all that special, staple of all taquarias. I saw a patron grubbing down on some sweet looking super nachos. Topped up with all the goodies and it looked awesome - thats what I'm gong to get next.

Of course this place gets its four stars because of the price...
author: Krishnan S.

description:
Hmmm...plenty of negative reviews.  Let me just say that in my experience, Cancun is food of the gods.  It's exactly what I want every tim I go.  Salsa is spicy and delicious.  Burritos are always a tad crispy on the outside with cheese that is actually melted (yes!).  Cancun is so, so, so good.  And the avocados rather than guacamole is a problem for many but works damn well for me.  YUM.

Oh, and I've had many many out-of-towner friends ask me to send them a Cancun burrito.  Yes, via the mail.   I've never done it, but can you blame them for wanting a delicious burrito delivered to their sad burritoless-save-for-Taco-Bell towns?
author: Eliza L.

description:
BEWARE OF ROACHES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

So my friend and I had just taken in a great performance at Dance Mission down the street and were walking along Mission trying to decide where to eat.  When we noticed that this place seemed to be pretty full, we dipped in and ordered veggie burritos.  After about the 5th bite into what I thought was a decent burrito, I noticed movement on the table out the corner of my left eye.  Now spying movement out the corner of one's eye is never a good thing in any type of eatery (or in a darkened movie theater either).  When I screwed up the nerve to take a look, I was horrified to see that this roach was not only fairly large, but it was charging toward my oblivious friend sitting across from me.  From what I understand, seeing roaches during daylight hours in a room full of people is a sign of MAJOR infestation.  Unfortunately, Taqueria Cancun is probably not the only business in the Mission (or elsewhere) to have this problem, but like most diners, I would rather not know about it.  For those of you who do want to know, consider yourself warned.
author: Andrea Z.

description: When i think about the pros and cons of moving back to California, taquerias are a serious item to be weighed and considered in the "pro" column. Cancun is my favorite taqueria in San Francisco. Sure the music is cranked such that it is hard to have a conversation, but who has time to converse when you are consuming the enormous, delicious and affordable tacos and burritos that this place has to offer.
author: Mo A.

description: Quite a spicy sauce on their Burrito Mojado, but good and tasty. Good prices and service.
author: Janet P.

description: Good place to go after a nghit in the mission.  The burrito is nothing special, love their tacos maybe the best I ever had.  I don't know if its just me, but, what the f* with  their spicy hot salsa, I will bet anyone $100 you can't take a shot of that green s* without crapping your self.
author: igy c.

description:
im vegetarian so try the vegetarian burrito.
gynormous
delishh!

4 stars-it's been a while since i went here.
somehow i forgot, but i know i did go. :)
author: Marc K.

description: I can't say much about the actual restaurant. The wife brought home a burrito for me after hanging out with her friend. I had a super burrito with carne asada. This was a big tasty burrito. Rice, beans, and plenty of flavor. I normally like to have samples of the restaurants salsas on my burrito but sadly those were not in my bag. All in All a tasty burrito, you can definitely call it super.  If I am in the mission I might give it another whirl...
author: Miguel V.

description: For years, the vegetarian burrito here was almost flawless.  Unfortunately for the last 2-3 years, they're now hit or miss, mostly on the miss side.  Not much cheese, and the beans, rice, and guacamole now just seem mushy and not as fresh.  I hope they can recover what used to make them so consistently great.  It used to be a real treat to eat here, but now it usually results in disappointment.
author: Zeke A.

description:
is it tobacco that people refer to as the "silent killer?" 

in all honestly i think the title belongs to the greasy tortas here. 

delicious, yes.  killing you one bite at a time? definitely.
author: Andrew P.

description: One of the best burritos of my life.  Check that, BEST burrito of my life.  Doesn't look like much but they are well organized behind the counter.  So good I was visiting for 5 days and ate here TWICE.  I wish we had something this amazing in Bmore.  Now I've got cravings.  damnit.
author: Kristin R.

description:
I'm so sad to have to write this but the glory days seem to be over...
I've been a DIE-HARD FAN of this place for longer than I care to share, I have bought more veggie burritos than I can count and always turned others on to going as well - in the City, Cancun is the only taqueria I go to - BUT - the last two times have been majorly disappointing.  
I used to love these burritos for their juiciness, meaning almost dripping with goodness, sour cream, guac, refried beans, yum!  Then suddenly it was DRY, two thirds was rice, I had to eat my way all the way to the bottom to find a little dollop of aforementioned ingredients. With every bite, I thought, "this can't be true, I'm sure the next bite is where bliss starts" - but NO!  I was very sad.  Then I thought, maybe it was just a bad day, or someone new was just learning how to make burritos, or whatever - so I decided to try again today and brought a friend... but it was the SAME story!  Dry burrito stuffed with rice, seems like one side of it was JUST rice, then a bit of the veggie ingredients mixed in at the bottom.  NOOOO!  Now it just seems like something's really changed, and I can't come back to Cancun!  At least not this location - I may try one of the others one more time but if this is some franchise-wide shift, I'm going to have to call our long lasting relationship quits!!!  :(
author: Alexandra K.

description: Their "wet" burritos are immense and tasty. Basically, take a burrito and treat it like an enchilada. Eat an entire one on your own if you dare.
author: Patrick Z.

description:
kick ass cheap eats.  when you want a good solid burrito or post-bar grub this is the place to go.

my favorite is the veggie burrito or the nachos.
author: Kyra W.

description: I always go here for their Al Pastor Tacos... One of the best Tacos!
author: Teddy H.

description: I don't get what all the fuss is about, the burrito was OK but nothing that blew my mind. My favorite burrito place in SOMA is the Los Compadres Taco Truck which seems to be hanging around Howard and 2nd these days. Also, Mission and 6th is shady, which is another reason that's kept me from going back very often.
author: Abhinav S.

description:
I am addicted to that place.
I have been eating there about once a week almost every week for the last 5 years and can't stop it anymore!!
Their burritos are very tasty with a great blend of flavors and always in a great wrap.
The different kinds of meat they have are delicious.
Don't get cooled down by the look of the place, that's part of what makes it such a great place: nothing pretentious, you are there to eat something that taste good!!
author: Jean T.

description: I don't know what I was thinking in the previous review.  Cancun rules and I am ashamed to have doubted them.  How could it be that I ever given Cancun four stars, much less hinted that they actually deserved three?  I look back, and I don't recognize the man who said those terrible, stupid things.  Cancun, baby, I'm sorry.  I just get so crazy sometimes! You gotta understand.  I love you, girl.
author: Sean K.

description: About as good as it gets for Tacos in the Mission!  So cheap, and so tasty!
author: David A.

description: It's true. Best darn burritos on earth. Fresh thick slices of avocado stuffed silly into a gargantuan burrito with fragrant supple rice. It's so oozing with flavor that I just might need to move there to get more.
author: Susan D.

description:
Ah Taqueria Cancuns...A diamand in the ruff is what i would venture to call this place. An thats not stretching it either. The Mission late night is Gnarlssssssss. Bistro and I happened upon the place once back in September but being that I was in a drunken stupor I didnt remember much about the spot other than the grub was FUCKIN AMAZING. Let me repeat FUCKIN AMAZING. i cant tell you how much i was craving for a burritto after that first encounter...well i got my chance this last friday.

The Bist and I found ourselves on the Haight around closing time and decided to catch a grub at this place, being that i was pretty sober compared to the last time we where there, i knew i would have a better opinion of this place.

We strolled up after having searched high and low for a parking spot, which almost takes an act of God to do in the City. The spots has one of the loudest decors on earth, your assualted with like a million colors the second you walk in. That and the sound of Mexican beats coming from the juke and the smells of the grill cooking up some marvelles grub.

I went ahead and upgraded my burritto this time to a wet burritto (no racist jokes here people, Im brown and proud beatch!) The carne asada is grilled to perfection and wrap in a store bought flour tortilla with all the trimmings and then the burritto is thrown on the grill once more, for what? dont know dont care. It is then topped off with off with enchilada sauce, melted cheese, pico, crema, and guac. Scarfed that bad boy down in seconds and washed it down with a modelo. damn!!!! The chips and sauce...if you forget to ask for some your playin yourself. top 10 material saucewise.

Oh almost forgot to bring up the natives. You get an assortment of characters at this location, there are three, well at night anyways. The thugs, hustlers (me), pimps (me), hippsters (JRNO) and trannys (JRNO) and so on. Shit we got to see some cat hang cuffed, layin on the sidewalk, surronded by cops, in a pool of his own blood! Hows that for realness!!!
author: Danny E.

description: In a neighborhood that has the best burritos that I've ever had in the US, Taqueria Cancun stands out: but be wary because once you've had the food there, nothing else will do! I wake up in the middle of the night craving their food.
author: Sandeep C.

description: I used to be an atheist. Now my god is Taqueria Cancun's super burrito with chorizo.
author: adrian b.

description: This place was crowded when we got there. Unfortunately, that was not a predictor of how good the food is. We had the super burrito with carne asada and a taco salad. Both were blah. I should just stick with Mexican food in San Jose.
author: AM N.

description: This place is F'n awesome.... I'm a native Mexican / San Franciscan and for me, burritos are a comfort food.  This place rocks for the basic burrito and it doesn't rape the wallet.
author: James R.

description:
Chips and tortillas arent made in house, but the hombres behind the counter know their meat and will make you a delectable meal for cheap.  

On a main drag in one of the world's great cities, we were treated to a sublime carne asada torta wrapped in foil, a ginormous burrito mojado I'm told was awesome, chips, salsas, a bottled water and Mexican coke - for fifteen bucks.  

It's simple.  You order and pick up your meal at the counter, in one of those awful plastic baskets, and there's a panhandler or two, but the food is genuinely delicious and  a superior San Francisco value.
author: Matt S.

description: Super burritto was pretty super. I think it's pretty much the same as all the other burritos around the neighborhood though, same ingredients, carna asada was just as good. The chips were not good and the salsa was bland. Ok, the chips weren't bad and neither were the salsa - but they were completely typical and the chips not fresh which is a bummer. Overall, would I come back, sure I'm sure the rest of their options would hit the spot for yummy cheap mexican food. Do i think the burritto is the very best in the city..?? Not really, but I guess it could be tied with all the rest of the ones that taste exactly like it.
author: Audrey V.

description: $6.50 for a very large and bland burrito.  I still have over half of it in my fridge.  You get hungry and look in the fridge and cabinets to decide what to eat.  The burrito was over looked many times.  It has an appointment with the trash.
author: Po L.

description: My favorite taqueria in the Mission and possibly the only place that grills, instead of steams, the tortilla. The best vegetarian burrito in The City and I'm not even a vegetarian. My girlfriend claims that the tacos are better than the overpriced versions served up at La Taqueria. This place is why I miss SF.
author: Troy B.

description: used to be one of my favorite places for mexican in SanFrancisco. Everything tasted good. i am sure it is not nearly as sanitary a place as i would like, i usually try not to think about that when i go out to eat or else i wouldn't eat anything! They are open real late and this place is cheap for real tasty food. From other people's reviews seems like they are still operating the same as when i was living there.
author: Sophie M.

description: I don't get the hype.  Based on pure taste, I've had better burritos elsewhere.  Now, if we're talking about the amount of burrito one gets per dollar spent, I guess it deserves five stars, because you get a pretty big ass burrito for fairly cheap.  However, nobody needs that much food in one sitting.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food (which is a minor problem as someone living in the Mission), so I am most definitely not the best judge of it, but I took a trip to Taqueria Cancun after seeing the excited Yelp reviews.

I got a carne asada burrito, which was good, but didn't seem amazing to me. It didn't stand out from the (limited experience) previous burritos I've had. It was *a lot* of food, though, and very cheap considering that. For pure stomach filling value, it's probably hard to beat this place.
author: Chris L.

description: This is one of the few taquerias actually open really late on week nights after I get done with my social outings.  $6 for a delicious carne asada burrito and chips.  I'd rather hit El Farolito but this is right by my apartment and still makes for a delicious late night meal.
author: Patrick T.

description: If you are a vegeterian you will love the veggy burrito, all the food is good, I also like the nachos and tortas, these guys are fast  they get your order right away.
author: David G.

description:
Yes, I have eaten here before when I was sober. Yes, I enjoyed my lengua burrito thoroughly. It's a good mission taqueria. Prices are good and the servings are generous.

Ok, since I know you're wondering.. I have eaten here after drinks as well. It's just as awesome. So, the bottom line, this place is good whether you're drunk or sober.
author: phil w.

description: One of my favorite burrito spots in the mission. Great for a late night meal.
author: Allison L.

description: They make on the city's best burrito.  The tortilla is grilled perfectly.  You can not go wrong here!
author: Brent F.

description: Huge well-made burritos for only $5. Not the best burritos I've had (I lived in San Diego for six years... can't beat those) but definitely among the best in San Francisco. Did I mention they're huge?
author: Pierre B.

description: Delicious burritos for reasonable prices.  I often go with the shrimp burrito for $8.75, which is uberfilling and tasty.  It's perfect for satisfying my post-climbing burrito craving.
author: William C.

description: best ever.  carnitas super quesadilla.  i give the people that gave taqueria cancun three stars three stars.
author: Rock Rock Robot Rio G.

description: For "one of the top burrito places in the Mission", this place is just so so. Compared to other Burrito places in the US?  This place would get 3 stars, but it IS in the Mission where the burrito was born.   Food is decent, but for the cheap decor, heart of the Mission location, and average food, you'd expect better prices.  I personally find its cousin well down the street a step up.
author: John W.

description: Man, this place has the best Mexican food in all of Mexican foodom.  The strength and beauty of the 'Quesadilla Suiza' simply cannot be described.  There are no words--well maybe a few.  It is like eating a nimbus cloud, the one that Peter Pan and Tinkerbell stood on when they looked down at Captain Hook in his pirate ship, next to the mermaid lagoon.  Where was I?  Oh, Mexican food.  Yeah it's pretty good.  WARNING:  Ladies, keep the lipstick and camel toes to a minimum here.  There is always somebody drunk or sketchy in this place, which amuses the staff.
author: Eggs M.

description: This is one of my favorite taquerias in SF.  They have the best burritos and I love their green avocado salsa.  Spicy, but sooooooo addicting.  The only thing that's kind of a downer for me is the creeper mexican guys...ladies, you know how that goes.  If you look remotely female in any way,  all eyes are on you.  Even when I've been in there looking my worst,  there's still the creepiness status of all the guys elbowing each other and staring.  Regardless of this however,  it will definitely NOT keep me from coming back.  I always get the chorizo super burrito, no sourcream, no guac.  Always good, always satisfying.  Prefer the food at this one to the one up in Bernal Heights, although the one in BH definitely has less of a stalkerish vibe.
author: Marley E.

description: A grimy-looking, cramped little hole-in-the-wall that is actually fairly clean (Health Dept score of 94) and very well-organized and which serves up GREAT food. No bathroom.
author: Ramon E.

description: This place a great place to go when trying to show friends from Europe "authentic Mexican food" (which was my situation). The atmosphere, people, and food are almost like the real thing and you get a lot of food for really cheap.
author: Jamie W.

description:
Pros:
Awesome, big burritos with great tasty chicken and spicy salsa. When I'm at home, and I have a craving for burritos, it's either TC or El Farrlito. The mexican sodas here are the cheapest, and there is actually room to sit down. Let's not forget that they are open super late for any of your late night snackers. The salsa they serve here is awesome.

Cons:
The chips are not quite as good as Poncho Villa, but they are free. They are very stingy on the salsa.
author: Chris D.

description: Veggie or meat, it don't matter. Their veggie burrito is just as good, if not better than their more fleshy options. It's chock full of good bits, with an excellent mush to not mush ratio. Best part: Burritos here are huge and cheap. Plus, free chips. Not the best burrito in San Francisco, but highly serviceable.
author: Brittney G.

description:
$9 bought me 2 super al pastor tacos & a corona.

mas fino
author: Kevo M.

description: All the meat is on one side of the burrito...I usually eat the ricey end first, and finally discover that the meat has been concentrated into the last three inches of the burrito.  And by the time I find it, I'm full.
author: Randy F.

description: For a taqueria, as good as it gets. Street-style Mexican food is simple and Cancun does the little things right, which makes all the difference. Grilled tortillas, two kinds of homemade and extra spicy salsa, tender carnitas and "alternative" meats such as sesos, cabesa, fast, accurate service, Mexican kitsch galore. No bullshit. Have cash (it's the Mission after all), know what you want when you step up to the register, and enjoy!
author: nathan l.

description: 5.99 gets you the best burrito in the city! The burrito mojado with red and green sauce filled with meat, cheese, beans, rice, guacamole, etc. I have had many other burritos in the city and none compare to this one and it is the cheapest! They have amazing nachos, veggie burritos, breakfast and tortas too! =)
author: Deseray T.

description: Best super burrito in town?  Nope.  Best super burrito for the price in town?  Sure.  I've got a few other places closer to me in the mission worth the couple extra bucks.  I did think the ingredients were fresh and the meat less greasy than some places.
author: Laura S.

description: Of the three Cancuns in the city, the Bernal location is the best. This one usually sucks though...
author: Neil K.

description: SUPER RICO! I take everyone who comes to visit to this place. $5 burritos, filling and delicious! The free chips are top notch, not like the paper-thin ones that come in other Mexican spots. They are thick, tasty and salty. Service is fast and friendly and they even have cerveza. Go here. Now.
author: Greg G.

description: I've been here twice and won't go back. The burritos were so-so at best, and the staff was hurried and totally rude. Make sure you know exactly what you want (or don't want) on your burrito, because when you order, it's set in blood. I tried to make a change a few seconds after my order was taken and I was rather brusquely told it "was too late," even though I didn't get my order for another 10 minutes. Give me a break.
author: Aaron L.

description:
years ago i was drawn in to taqueria cancun by the sign on the window that says "best veggie burrito".

i ate one, super of course, and walked the mile or so home.  next thing i knew, i woke up face down in the middle of my bed with my clothes, shoes, and all the lights on.  that burrito KNOCKED.ME.OUT.    

what i am trying to illustrate here, is that (1) passing out and waking up fully clothed in your own bed is far superior to waking up naked in someone else's bed and (2) the burrito induced experience can be totally worth it.

unlike some other taquerias in the mission, cancun makes great tacos, burritos, and nachos.  and their green chopped jalapenos and spicy salsa are terrific fresh compliments.  also, the horchatas are creamy and cinnamon-ey and wonderful.

eat carefully but eat often!
author: Linda L.

description: Personally, this is my favorite taqueria in SF.  I think the atmosphere is fun, the meat (carne asada and carnitas) is amazingly seasoned and the prices are reasonable.  Loved the enchiladas as well.  And it's open late night, which is huge.  It's true, there aren't fresh chips so maybe it's best for a burrito on the run.
author: Kristin P.

description: I was irritable, lost and hungry....BUT THEN I ran into this joint and had the best burrito I have had since living in San Francisco.  I got the chicken super and it was GLORIOUS!  It turned my anger right into happiness!  This place is for real if you are starving and looking for a quality burrito.
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: This is my favorite taqueria in the Mission. The carnitas and the al pastor here are dynamite! It's definitely not as clean as Pancho Villa, but the food just dominates everything else in the area! Superb!
author: Ben E.

description: YUM.  I took my far east bay students here for burritos after we spent the afternoon at 826 Valencia, and their suburban conception of "mexican food" was shattered.  One student said, "Ms. M, after this burrito, I don't think I can go back to the Chipotle."  Yes, young one.  Yes.
author: Natalie M.

description:
this place is pretty good. good for when its past midnight and you're coming out of medjool, or any other bar/club down in the mission for that matter, and craving some tacos. 

gets pretty crowded but pretty worth it when you've got that buzz on and you like mexican food.
author: Georgia W.

description: Saw an ad in the Chronicle where they claimed to have the best vegetarian burritos...I'm not vegetarian but it was nothing special.
author: LIVE to E.

description: Our last culinary adventure before leaving the city.  We needed some good food in a hurry so we could make the trek to Oakland to fly home.  We found Cancun walking down the street and gave it a try.  II had a carne asada burrito--I forgot to order no rice so I had to pick it apart with a fork.  The GF had a veggie burrito and surprisingly she ate the whole think because it was huge.  We had a couple of beers and were on our way.  It was good, fast and cheap.  Exactly what we were looking for.
author: David H.

description: The super prawn burrito has claimed the throne to my favorite burrito.  At first I was like "Prawn burrito? Nah that sounds gnar-gnar." But then I tried it and it was a FLAVOR-EXPLOSION.  The only down side, Cash Only?  In this modern age of debit card ubiquity, I would rather just pay for my burrito with my card, since this place can get surprisingly pricey for a taqueria.
author: Randall B.

description: Best burritos North of Los Angeles County.  They taste good sober and even better when you're drunk.  The super burritos are huge and will super sober you up quick.  The inside of this place is usually a zoo and good luck picking out your burrito when it's ready.  The large bench tables are right out of a park and make for an interesting communal dining experience.  And if you're eating by yourself theres always plenty of entertainment.  Good default if you've been partying in the Mission and need some late night grub.  Way better  than Pancho Villa and a couple bucks cheaper too....
author: Summit S.

description: After my first vege burrito here last month I thought I had found the end- all , be all of burritos.  I thought about that tightly wrapped, perfectly balanced and spiced wrap of goodness for weeks.  I almost went back to the few taqueria reviews and deducted a star, because Can Cun could be the only five star burrito for me.  I went back this week and was not nearly as stunned by the still excellent burrito.  Tacos Jailisco can keep that last star.
author: Robi P.

description: I'm a bit surprised with all the five-star reviews of this place.  Although a bit more clean and festively decorated than some of its stark and dirty Mission-area neighbors, the food seems just typical and you will likely be pestered by a greater than average number of street denizens.  Good prices though.
author: Rick H.

description: Holy guacamole!  They make it hot here, spicy and delicious.  It's standard mexican stuff on the menu, the veggie burrito is what I get and it doesn't disappoint.  The atmosphere & decor is bright, colorful & very festive.  Yay!
author: Emily T.

description: I love how heavy 2 burritos in a takeout bag from here is.  Love the carne asada here but not a huge fan of their beans.  Also not a huge fan of their chips and the oh too spicy guacamole sauce.  But otherwise this is probably my favorite taqueria so far.
author: Jen C.

description: You San Franciscans have no idea how good you have it.  Burritos like the Taqueria Cancun super al pastor do not exist in other places of the world, especially places called Los Angeles.  Sure you might find a decent taco or green corn tamale down here, but when it comes to the gloriously delicious and filling food log for around four bucks... my God you are lucky ducks.  So, don't quibble, enjoy.  It's simple and cheap food at its best.  What more do you want?  You know, if I had to eat one thing for the rest of my life, this holy, marinated pork & avocado stuffed tortilla cylinder might very well be it.
author: George N.

description: Ate here with my uncle. Just got a few steak tacos, but they were pretty good. Cheap too. They give you a lot of meat, which is awesome, considering some places I know are pretty skimpy when it comes to the meat.
author: Janine F.

description: Pretty solid, not the SF best. Need to improve the guacamole and chips.
author: Tristan C.

description:
mmmmm....mexican food deliciousness....

I ate here 2 nights ago and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since.  

I took away a star because I wasn't crazy about the chips and salsa and also for the distraction of the constant stream of homeless wandering inside and being bug-a-boos.
author: L. Renee D.

description: I'm not buying the hype of this burrito place. I just don't think they're all that great, even though they are cheap. Just a little too much onion in them or something... And eating there puts me a little on edge, what with the restaurant doubling as a crack house and all.
author: Michael E.

description: My friend spoke very highly of this place. I had very high expectations -- especially because Boston is not known for Mexican. The pollo asado super quesadilla was good, but not as amazing as I thought it would be. But, really good for sure.
author: Anu Y.

description: I ran on in here the other night, not expecting much since I was kinda rushed and needed to chow down before drunk festivities would follow later. All I ordered was a carne asada torta (my standard taqueria fare, I'm a whore for the floury soft rolls that make tortas better for me than a burrito), and damn was I left satisfied. And the workers are speedy, like super quick style get in and get out. The location was convenient for walking, but the space is kinda small...which makes this a great place for take out. No less, I was pleasantly surprised, and I'll definitely head back here if I'm in the 'hood.
author: Danielle D.

description:
super delicious, super cheap, and super huge burritos.

i don't know about anything else here, because i don't get it. cancun is for burritos, and nothing else.

it's loud in here, so beware. the jukebox is on so high that it's impossible to have a conversation unless you're yelling, in which case food is flying out of your mouth. not to mention it's garish and bright and kitschy, you know, in the way i'd like my own kitchen to be. (yes, i'd totally be down with a giant shrine to mary in my kitchen.)

matter of fact, i kind of picture my wedding party (as in, instead of a wedding, i'm going to have a party... when that time comes. ahem.) like this. you know, bright, loud, crazy drunk people everywhere, and i always fancied i'd have taco trucks catering this party. burritos from cancun would do just as nicely. 

minus one star for the grody state of affairs in the bathroom, which is seems like i HAVE TO USE REAL BAD every time i come here.
author: Irene S.

description: love this place--cheap and delish. the veggie tacos are to die for, and the chicken quesadillas are great, but I don't think the other meat dishes are quite as good...
author: Allie W.

description: Why this place constantly wins all the awards for "Best Burrito," or, especially "Best Veggie Burrito" I will never know.  Their veggie burrito is pretty openly and blatantly done on the same grill as the meat, and even tastes of meat flavor.  Thankfully, now that I've discovered La Corneta, Papa Lote and El Metate, I haven't been in over a year.
author: Ben V.

description: These burritos are above all the rest, hands-down. I agree with Gabriel S., they are the gold standard burritos, the first place we go when we hit SF and the place we dream about when we're not there. Dee-lish!
author: Cam T.

description:
yummy!

this is my favorite veggie burrito in the city. they melt the cheese onto the tortilla then fill with tasty toppings including AN ENTIRE AVOCADO. so filling, so flavorful and their green salsa packs a kick if you want is so spicy.

i really wish that they would turn down the volume of their juke box though. i can tolerate mariachi, just not at that decibel.
author: Allegra F.

description: Melissa C. and I ordered the carne asada burrito to go so we could eat it while watching a flick in The Dark Room across the street.  The burrito was mighty tasty.  Odd thing, we don't recall being asked how spicy we wanted the burrito...so upon first bite, we were surprised with by the little kick.  I'd definitely be back there for more food if I happen to be nearby.
author: Michelle N.

description: Best burritos in town.  Great prices.  Good atmosphere.  Great place to take kids because you can be noisy.  I get my kids a rice and bean burrito.
author: Jessica L.

description: One of the best wet burritos out there. It's huge, cheap, and delicious. Their guacamole is spicy, which you don't see too often so it's definitely something different. I see a lot of people like this place, I wouldn't say it's the best burrito in the world but it's pretty good. Like I say for most burrito shops, "If you are in the area and want Mexican, try this place." Because honestly most taquerias are the same.
author: Diego C.

description: This is a solid place, on par with the other taquerias in the Mission vying for the locals and Mission District tourists. Next time you're there, ask these desk clerk for "dos leches en mi panchila"
author: Aris V.

description: I could find and eat a way better burrito in antioch then i did in SF!!! Maybe its good for people who don't eat food on a regular basis but for myself it was not cutting it. It was just ok. but when i see best bay 2009 and four stars on yelp i expect better then ok. I also got mine with mole sauce and the sauce was really spicy which is fine but not when its just spicy and no flavor. mole sauce is supose to be pack with flavor i doubt they could use that sauce on there enchaladas.  I have no desire to ever return again.
author: alycia s.

description: Dirty and somewhat scary. A crackhead wandered in here while we were eating and seemed like he was about to try to rob the place. The burrito itself was good - but patchy. It started out all meat and ended with the last quarter being only beans and rice. All the ingredients were concentrated in various separate portions of the burrito. I'd have to say that el Farolito easily beats this place.
author: Sven S.

description: This place is ok.  Their burritos can be a but runny at times.   I think their carne asada is one of the better ones overall from the various taquerias.
author: Demanding T.

description: After a not-so-great Mexican food experience in Philly last night, I woke up with a really bad craving for my tried and true favorite: the vegetarian burrito from Taqueria Cancun.  I heard there is some service in Philly that will mail a legit Philly cheesesteak on a delicious and squishy Amoroso role to anywhere in the USA.  Anyone in San Francisco want to open a similar business for Cancun's burritos? I'm sure I could round up many paying customers on the east coast for your good service....
author: Krissy A.

description: Best cheap burrito in the Mission. Seriously. They use great fresh ingredients, including real avocado rather than guacomole. My firm favourites include their chicken quesadila (wonderfully saucy), and their soft tacos. Get extra green salsa...you'll want it.
author: Sarah F.

description: These are some of the best burritos in the land. Super cheap, obviously, and every dish is huge with the option of getting something even huger. The tacos are great: very flavorful, well sized, and fresh ingredients. Burritos seem to be the best here though, but do not underestimate their special plates which are the burritos on a plate, without the tortilla. Every order gets you a basket of chips that is hard to finish and a thing of salsa which makes everything you get better, if that is even possible. Beers are really cheap, as are sodas, and everything else you might want to drink. It is cash only, which may be a downer for some of us, but luckily not much cash is required. Every order comes out super quick, and even the fastest eater will savor and take a while to finish their delicious meal. Well worth a journey in this foodie city, and especially great if you come across it late at night after a fun night in the Mission.
author: Dan H.

description:
I don't know whether it was late or I was just plain hungry, I really enjoyed the food here. Reasonable, super fast and super yum burrito. I had the vegetarian burrito, and it tasted really fresh, with a good helping of sour cream (which i like :)). The place was busy at midnight. The chips and salsa were great. The salsa was Spicy!  The green salsa had a good amount of chillies and garlic. 

Would surely visit again if in the area.
author: Tarak P.

description: This review is just based on the chicken taco at Taqueria Cancun.  A little over a week ago, I did a taco crawl with a few friends, where we tried 5 different taco places in the Mission.  I felt the chicken taco at Taqueria Cancun was the best.  It was the most flavorful and unique tasting of the tacos I had that night.
author: Josh K.

description: I love this place. Prices are decent and the burritos are clutch. And when I mean clutch, I mean these are like crack in Mexican food form.
author: linda t.

description: I had a chicken burrito which was a decent price and huge. Unfortunately I didn't feel the burrito totally matched some of the others in the mission. A bit greasier but still good.
author: Mark H.

description: Taqueria Cancun is an amazing place, with great mexican food at a very affordable price. I love "real roots" places, and this one has this vibe.
author: Eduardo D.

description:
Veggie burritos here kick ass hands down. 

Breakfast burritos aren't bad either

Nachos are atrocious. I can make better ones in my own microwave. The chips are soggy and the whole thing is tasteless.
author: A K.

description:
i got a taco here. and it really wasn't all that great. sure, it was good. but great? no. my friends did not enjoy their burritos either.

but on a plus side, my friend picked up a 40 year old fatty. two thumbs up for that one, bro.
author: Victor B.

description: Believe the hype. It's better than Farolito (and you don't get food poisoning, which is always nice). Yes, they have the best veggie burrito ever. And this is from someone who loves meat. The secret? Heaps of fresh cilantro and chunks of avocado... mmm....
author: Roman H.

description: On election day I got a burrito from Taqueria Cancun... and I voted Obama. ... I think we're meant to be.  My burrito was pure bliss!  The salsa was spicy and didn't leave me feeling like I had gained 5 pounds... well maybe it did... but the dancing I did in the streets later that night helped work it off!!
author: Alice H.

description: Teeming with foot traffic, teeming with cheezy goodness, teeming with cockroaches- everything about this place is flowing with life force. Get a veggie burrito. Wash it down with a jumbo horchata rice milk drink, Sweet Lord! $3.80 of eyes-rollin-round-the-back-o-your head goodness. I really don't care about the health rating or the cuca-racha pix from other yelpies. Extra protein, right? The energy is just good people, doing what they do best: servin up real stick-to-your-ribs Mexican fare. So good, I went back a second time this week. The mariachi music adds to the cheesy goodness. You'll likey.
author: Rebecca A.

description: Ok, I know what yer sayin'! This guy likes to hand out 5 stars like a girl scout does cookies! Not true.  T.C. is by far the best taqueria...nah, scratch that...best Mexican in town.  I'm not down with those mango salsa, sundried tomato, no lard cookin joints either.  I'm Mexican enough to have grown up eating goat for Thanksgiving and roasting pigs in our back yard in a pit in the ground for xmas.  But I digress...this taqueria is the real deal and the salsa verde and pollo asado are unparalleled.  Try the Alambras plate. Damn, I'm going tonight!
author: J P.

description:
seriously you can not go wrong here.

i don't eat meat but  the ones that i know say the asada and the carnitas are good as is the chorizo.

as for the veggie buritos they win the reader's awards cause the deserve it. not too full not too sloppy(just the right amount of disaster) perfectly balanced flavor throughout. super is great although i feel like i need a nap afterwards.  

quesadillas are good too also you get chips and two salsas and it spicy in the best way possible just don't rub your eyes
author: Chris G.

description: Only hassle: having a homeless women try to bum money off of you while waiting for your burrito after a very long day.
author: Joanna R.

description: Best burritos/tacos in the city.  Whenever I have friends in town, I'm sure to take them here!  The price is right, the place is cheesy (in a good way) with wandering guitar players, and food awesome.  My favorite is the pork carnitas tacos with a little lime squeezed on top!
author: C J.

description: I am a vegetarian and this taqueria does, indeed, prepare the best vegetarian burrito that I have tasted in San Francisco.  The tortilla is fried or broiled rather than steamed, (you can tell by the little crispy brown spots),  the cheese filling is grated,  and the guacamole is chunky.  Other taquerias pale in comparison, (but I will keep looking).  Only failing is that they lack a hot sauce bar and serve the sauce in little cups
author: Paul Q.

description: For a long time, I've felt that Taqueria Cancun is one of the great treasures of San Francisco. I remember when I moved here in '92 and my new friends would gush about La Parilla Suiza, this location's name at the time. Coming from Virginia, and less experienced then, I'd never had anything like a mission burrito before. And with gorgeous chunks of avocado and tons of cilantro I was getting more than the brilliant combination, I was tasting these exotic ingredients for the first time and loving them. I was amazed and hooked and I called my parents back home to tell them about it. I went last night after a show at El Rio and their burritos are still the best I've had anywhere. And the rest of their menu and their other locations are great, too.
author: Tim N.

description: This is my favorite taqueria in SF.  The inside is just tacky and gross enough for it to be charming, and the staff are all quite pleasant. I thought the Veggie Burrito was good, but bland.  I am, though, a huge fan of the chicken burrito....it was amazing.  Love the pico de gallo, and green salsa/faux guac condiments. Overall, everything tasted fresh and was absolutely awesome.
author: Emily M.

description: I wanted to like it and have a good alternative to El Farlito but I'm awful disappointed.  I ordered a steak super burrito and I'm constantly spitting out chunks of chewy meat or cartilage.  A good burrito needs good meat and this place just doesn't have it.
author: Nelson W.

description: I don't how they do it, late night or during the day this place is on point!
author: Nick M.

description: Speedy service and massive portions make this a nice burrito stop in the Mission!  I wish I lived closer!!
author: Jason V.

description:
This place is pretty good.  I really enjoy the tacos here.  A bit expensive (esp. compared to real tacos in Mexico) @ $2.25/each but they are actually tasty and fill you up pretty good.  Other than the tacos all the other food here is pretty cheap.  I would recommend getting the regular tacos instead of the super.  The super have sour cream and avocado which is good but makes them kinda messy and you don't really need those extras since the regular was good enough.  I also like the super burrito mojado.  Its basically a burrito with melted chesse and salsa on top!  The carne asada here is my fav meat.  Not the best you'll have but good.  They actually have pretty good Mexican breakfast here.  Eggs and ham is my favorite with the Chorizo and eggs a close second for the AM.  Another good thing to try here is the torta with ham or carne asada.  It its great when your not starving since the burritos here are big.  The another dish I like here is the quesadilla suiza ("Suisse Quesadilla" but that just menas the quesadilla has meat in it) .  It has the same stuff as a  burrito but with no beans and they cook it with a bunch of chesse.  Watch out for the green salsa!  It is very good but spicy and will catch you off guard if you pour it all over your food!


They have coke in a bottle from Mexico which taste way better than the American can Coke since its made with real sugar.  They also have aguas frescas.  My favorite is horchata.  I actually like the carrot juice they make there, makes you feel a bit healthy after taking down a huge burrito.  The place has meixcan beer from Sol, Corona, Tecate and others.  It is a great place to go after a night at the bars and it is kinda its own scene since its really crowed on late nights in the weekend since its open after 2AM and they'll pretty stay open until the crowds die down.  

The guys (and it is really only guys) that work there are all pretty cool and hard working.  Most are from Mexico and are into soccer.  So if you wanna get a reaction wear a Club America or Chivas soccer jersey and you'll get a "cool shirt" or a "ah man, you like them?". But its all in good fun.  They have a great selection of Mexican music from corriods, banda, mariachi, and even some Spanish rock.  I love this place!
author: Ivan M.

description: Best burritos I've ever had.  Big chunks of avocado.  Fresh squeezed orange juice.  Cheap.
author: Russel S.

description: THIS  PLACE IS FANTASTIC!!! Far better than any other Mexican restaurant that I've been to in SF.   I hope they never shut it down, it's just too good to be true.  I'm salivating just thinking about it.  Take their burrito supreme - now these aren't just filled with rice, beans, guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and meat; they are filled with heaven - that's what it is - heaven - is what I like to call it.  Their hot sauce is great too.  One tip -  I'd avoid going there in the middle of the night if you can - unless you want some visual entertainment  - hats off to Taqueria Cancun!!
author: Puneeta S.

description: I want a taco!  And damn, Cancun does tacos good.  They made me a veggie taco with black beans, rice, fresh avocado slides, shredded cheese and just the right amout of sour cream.  For less than $3.  At 1:30 in the morning.  Only downside is that they are of course packed that late at night, and the service is kinda slow, so if you wanna taco bad, you have to settle for chips for at least 15 mins.  But the taco is worth the wait.  And the $8 cab ride to get to it :)
author: Neha S.

description: Burrito here are just ok.  Needs more meat.  The soft tacos, however, are pretty good here.  Moral of this review is if want tacos come here.  If you want a burrito go to El Farlito or La Taqueria.
author: Fatty A.

description: When you're not in the mood for a burrito, try the Super Quesadilla with Carne Asada. It won't let you down.
author: Tim B.

description: One of my favorite destinations in the Mission for burritos and other stuff. I remember when the burritos here were much larger, but they have shrank. They are still tasty, nonetheless. Can't go wrong with their tacos....simple tortillas with hot savory meat....onions and hot sauce. Their ceviche is pretty darn good too. The shrimp cocktails are huge but they are sometimes a lil overcooked and the soup gets a little too sweet, best to share with somebody.
author: Dustin L.

description: Decent Al Pastor. Really good Carnitas tacos. Just not sure about the picnic table seating or the odd line setup in the back...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I love that this place is open close to 3AM on the weekends! When you're out at a show or clubbing you can pick something up to eat. I happen to get my veggie burrito (no dairy products added) on my way to BART and am guilty of eating it on BART. The chips taste a bit store bought but the  fresh avocado makes up for it!
author: kendy p.

description:
Best Nachos we've tried in the Mission/S.F.  

Burrito was better than La Cumbre's simply because they cooked the tortilla prior to wrapping up all the goodness inside.

Great value and great atmosphere!
author: Willy C.

description: Best damn hangover food.  Love the authentic, spicy salsa and jalepenos in everything.
author: Brandon C.

description: I had a carne asada burrito here...It was only $4.99 for a huge burrito...However, the burrito wasn't very flavorful...I guess it would have probably tasted better if I just dunked it in hot sauce...I think I would come back and try something else on the menu...Food is quick and very reasonable prices...The chips were great...And also the dip it comes with...are loaded with Jalapenos!
author: Vicky C.

description: ok I dont get what the hype is all about here...I have recently moved to bernal and have found myself three times in the last month grabbing late night burro's here...just not great ..well just ok at best! yet they have all those guardian awards on the wall...did they give dan leone kickback burritos or does the stoned drunk nighttime crowd take the time to fill out ballots? I need to get a good burrito! and this is not it!
author: Ricote F.

description: The first time I was ever in San Francisco, I walked around Mission street like an idiot, trying to find a taqueria.  Finally, I asked someone, "What is the best taqueria in the Mission."  I was sent to Taqueria Cancun.  Cancun does a number of items very well, but what they are the best at is their burritos.  Tasty, huge, and sitting like a brick in your stomach, they are not to be missed.
author: Joanna S.

description: Best burrito in San Francisco!  Not only does this place have the best burrito but it has many other bests, the tacos, quesadillas, etc.  The mexican sausage is super tasty!  The decor is quite festive and lively, all around a great stop for a cheap and delicious meal!
author: Steven K.

description: If you want a huge line for a good burrito with some good salsa, then try this place out. I used to love this place then I tried Pancho Villa and never turned back. Cancun has good chicken burritos, I find their carne not too good because it usually contains alot of gristle. Also thier salsa is good but not the best. If I lived near 19th I would visit this place often, but i dont anymore so Pancho Villa is my spot.
author: J B.

description: super Chicken quesadilla is hands down the best thing to have ever been eaten by anyone ever! can't say enough about how good it is.  The salsa is hella spicy though...hella!
author: Julian M.

description: I love you. I wish I could be closer to you. I found plus size tortillas and tried to imitate you at home, it was okay.
author: Samantha G.

description: Of all the Cancun locations, I prefer this one because you can actually find parking in under 30 minutes. They never give you guacamole ("We don't have any, have this green overly-spiced mixture instead"), but they do serve banging burritos, best in The City IMHO. Right near Jasmine Tea House as well, so you can kill two culinary birds with one stone.
author: Ramon T.

description: Um Im mexican so maybe Im biased but I ordered the veggie burrito only to find a grip of rice, some advo and bean sprinkled about; salsa was salty and so was the rice;  I wanted to like this place based on reviews but not too good for a real burrito try el castillo...I would like to say their agua fresca was delicious!
author: Ribec F.

description: This is a great place to grub before clubbing, except that no one wants to talk to taco breath chick.  Oh well, food over men any day!  I love the carne asada and apple soda.  This is a whole in the wall so it's a bit dirty.  Do not use the bathroom h here.  It is really, really gross and if you saw it ,you may never eat here again.
author: Jeanne C.

description: I've been going here for years. This is the spot for vegetarians to get burritos that aren't eight times smaller than their friends' meat burritos (this always happens to me at other taquerias). They are open late and provide the perfect late night munchies.
author: Amanda L.

description: This is used to be my SPOT in the 'hood until recently, sad, since they're only three blocks away.  Here's why they lost a star-- downgraded quality of the meat in the quesadilla suiza.  Why are there tendon-y and chewy PIECES (bits) of carne asada in there (and the burritos) rather than SLABS of carne asada like their use to be?  They're cheapin' out-- and since I remember the good ole days... These days it's hit and miss, but mostly miss.  Chips are very low quality as well.  Things are always changin in the big, bad city...
author: E L.

description: How can you not love a place that's open in the wee hours in the a.m. Their HORCHATA is the best, you have to get a large cup of it. We had the shrimp cocktail, which was a bit watery and nachos. It's 2 a.m. and you've been drinking all night, anything is good at this point. ;-)
author: Gladys C.

description: Thier veggie burrito comes with real avocado and it makes all the difference. PLUS, it's only like $4. Thier torillas are a perfect texture and they give you as much lime as you want. I can't even say how many times I have gotten my fill at this wonderful little mexican pearl among a sea of lesser competitors.
author: Geryon R.

description: Classic Burrito Joint, pretty damn cheap. ($4 burrito) The burritos are huge with grilled outer shells rather than steamed for that hot, comfort foody feeling.
author: Liss C.

description: We came here amidst a night of heavy drinking and it was wonderful. There was a great vegetarian burrito that like four of us had and all had great things to say about it. Convenient location, quick food brought to our table, and some beer to keep the buzz going. Totally awesome.
author: Bryan M.

description: This restaurant is filthy. I found a roach in my chips. This place has been cited a bunch of times by the local offices.
author: Steven Y.

description: Just brilliant. Cheap, unassuming and tasty, you can't go wrong here. It's delightfully messy, serves Negro Modelo beer and makes its own salsa and guacamole. And when you're drunk - it all tastes ten times better.
author: Niko V.

description:
my mouth is watering just thinking about a veg burrito from cancun. 

i know i don't know what i'm missing by not eating their meat dishes, but hey, sorry.

i just love the unpretentiousness of this place. they have won countless awards for being burrito mecca, and yet nothing has changes or gone to anyone's head. they have simple, delicious food, community tables, friendly people, and an authentic atmosphere, and beers. 

what more do you want?
author: fiona b.

description: Oh, thank you to the powers that be for introducing me to this place!  I moved from the Mission a few months ago but NOTHING will stop me from coming here on the regular.  The tacos, oh those tacos, are the best I've had!  For $3 a pop, it is a steal!  The meat is seasoned well and the avocado is always fresh.  You also get chips and salsa complimentary.  They're open late which is perfect for us party-goers.  And the men that work there are super sweet.  Only accepts cash but conveniently has an ATM machine inside.  Lots of tables for dining a jukebox to set the fiesta mood! Loves it!
author: Jenn C.

description: This place is delicious! The Super Burrito and Super Quesadilla are excellent! Cheap prices and big portions! Go check it out
author: Jonathan J.

description: the veggie burrito is delicious! and they have fresh carrot & orange juice.
author: Cricket X.

description: I love this place, I only give it four stars because of location and the homeless people actually pan handling in the restaurant. I still go again and again, one of my favorite places to eat in the whole Bay Area. Try the Carnitas Super Taco!!
author: Benjamin K.

description: Burritto was good but the chips are way too salty.
author: Sean D.

description: good if yer in the neighborhood, but not worth the overpraise of 5 stars.  there's just other places that are better. like La Corneta
author: Richie W.

description: Okay so I've eaten here a couple times pretty buzzed up after the club and I swore it was the best Taqueria in the City. Everyone pretty much knows that any food you give a drunk person they will eat and claim it's the best food they have ever eaten. So I was determined to see if I was just wasted or if Taqueria Cancun was the real deal. First time sober I got a Carne Asada Burrito and I was sold.. Second time I got a Chicken Quesadilla and I was blown away. I've eaten at over 30 different Taquerias and this by far was top 3. The next time I went I got a shrimp quesadilla and was amazed. Probably the best quesadilla I've ever eaten and I now only order that when I go. Soo good!! I grew up eating Mexican food since it's a big part of my culture. I am 100 percent behind the 5 stars I gave Taqueria Cancun and would say It's the best taqueria in the Mission right ahead of El Farolito.
author: Richard R.

description:
as a socal-ite, when first moving here I was really set on finding a great taqueria. it was one of the reasons i moved to the mission in the first place. lame, i know. sue me.

so in my search of the great taqueria, i stumbled upon Taqueria CanCun at about 2am. and was really pleased at what a selection they had. i hated the jukebox (those digital ones are so f****g lame).

i'm a huge fan of the burrito mojado (I feel a bit racist for calling it the wetback burrito). the prices are pretty reasonable and the food is seriously filling. 

for that grimey, hole-in-the-wall, crackheads up for three days feel of  a taqueria, try the sixth @ market location. that's my favorite of the three.

oh, and this is pretty much the BEST place to end up after a night of drinking.
author: Trav M.

description: Taqueria Cancun delivers great authentic burritos for very reasonable prices. I usually go with the Carne Asada burrito. One thing I appreciate is that, unlike a lot of other places, Cancun grill the tortilla which adds a  unique flavor. Definitely in the upper echelon of the Mission Burrito scene. Cash only.
author: John B.

description: These burritos are so good you'll almost forget that a rat just ran over your foot while you were eating it.  Just kidding.  They're dirty, but they're not THAT dirty.
author: Renee D.

description: Damn good burritos. Some of the best I've ever had. Love the whole slices of avocado vs guacamole.
author: John M.

description:
****UPDATE*****
i checked the green card on this taqueria a few days ago
its a 92!!!!! man that other taqueria cancun is really doing a disservice to this better cleaner one.  

Sorry, i posted this review to the wrong taqueria cancun.

but see how easy it is to get confused?  they have the same name and are on the same street.

well to save you from making any fatal (ecoli or salmonella) mistakes when choosing your late night burrito destination.  Let me warn you by linking to the original

if you goto cancun, make sure you are on the one between 18th and 19th. 

and not this one
http://www.yelp.com/biz/taqueria-cancun-san-francisco#hrid:i1igTCPtML-OgEBcNg4d2Q
author: Irvin S.

description: best late night nachos ever. best enchiladas I've had on an empty stomach. oh my gosh. te amo!
author: Amanda S.

description: In the midst of a 3-taqueria taco spree, this one was sufficient, but didn't stand out.  Tried the al pastor, which had a good helping of meat, but was a bit chewy and tough.  Also came with a helping of chips and salsa, which were surprisingly spicy.  Perhaps  the burrito is the thing to get here...
author: Jeremy C.

description: Oh man.. went here today. It's definitely better than La Taqueria... They put a good amount of avocado in the burrito, and I like how the sour cream goes into the rice and makes it moister.. Delicious. I had the grilled chicken super burrito, and it was soo tasty.. man.. I love how the tortilla is kind of crispy too, so your burrito doesn't get soggy towards the end. MMM their avocado salsa/guacamole thing they serve with the chips is delicious too!
author: O K.

description: Oh my god, I am going to copy everyone else!! Best burrito I ever had, but of course I was three sheets to the wind from the Knockout bar and anything would be delicious at that point. But hey, in the moment I was singing the happy burrito song, loving each bite. TC makes a great vegetarian burrito but it half worries me that I can't see them making it. Maybe it tastes so good because the tortilla is warmed on the grill, only inches from chicken and beef frying. At 2 in the moring when my belly is full of beer, vegetarian ethics mean nothing to me. I kiss you dodgy burrito. I love your badness. It's like walking on the  wild side for me.
author: Go Cat Go G.

description:
Went on a taco crawl one evening and ordered only 1 Al Pastor Taco and 1 Carne Asada taco at each of these locations

Taqueria Cancun
Taqueria San Jose
El Farolito
Taqueria Altena

Hands down Taqueria Cancun had the best Al Pastor and Carne Asada taco.  They were both tender and tasty and the sauce was delicious.  

El Farolito - meats were dry and salty.  Overrated and worse of the 4
Taqueria San Jose - didn't like the Al Pastor sauce, Carne was #2
Taqueria Altena - Al Pastor #2, Carne was good 

Wanted to go try La Taqueria but it closed right when we arrived at 9pm on a Friday evening.  

Definitely Taqueria Cancun is a keeper.  Will try it against La Taqueria, Pancho Villa, El Tayonese, and some others next time.
author: David C.

description: These people are incredibly rude.  The guy in the front got upset because I asked for extra crackers with my shrimp cocktail.  I was paying $12 for my meal and all I wanted was extra crackers.  I'll neeeeeeevveeeerrrrr go there again.
author: Maribel E.

description: This place has consistent good Mexican foods but I hate having to stand shoulder to shoulder with some smelly hipster bike messenger while I wait to order. Almost without fail some asshole holds a place in line for one of their friends which is an extreme annoyance. As for the food though, I always get the burrito and am never disappointed. Guess you gotta suffer to get the good stuff.
author: Tommy P.

description: I lived in the Bay Area from 2000 to 2002. Cancun is one of my favorite dining experiences of all time. They grill the tortillas so that they are warm and flaky. The carne asada and al pastor are marinaded to perfection. They use avocado instead of guacamole. And most important for a good burrito, they roll it so it doesn't fall apart. They must put just the right amount of food in the burrito. So many places can't roll a decent burrito. The Bay Area has great fresh food in general. Also like El Farolito, and the burrito place near the corner of Shattuck and Ashby in Berkeley (though things may have changed since 02). Berkeley Bowl does a great job too.
author: Webb H.

description: I thought this place was okay. The burrito was a little bean-heavy. BUT, I was stuffed and buzzed for 8 bucks. I love the jukebox, but didn't love getting whistled at in my Jane Fonda Workout costume by all the creepy old dudes. 2 pieces of advice, totally unrelated to the food - don't eat at Cancun in costume and stay away from the bathroom!
author: Esme W.

description:
holy crap, the burrito mojado is the perfect thing to order when you have no money. i swear this thing can last for three meals and only costs $5.50. pure. genius.

oh, and they have miller chill. don't hate. that junk's tasty.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: It's been 4 years since my last trip to San Francisco and I was not disappointed. It's just as good as I remember it and I can't wait to return. As others have said, the veggie burrito is a must...order it straight up, just as it's listed on the menu.
author: Nick C.

description: The better of the Cancun's around the city.  I ate the super burrito for lunch..passed out at work...and couldn't even make complete sentences when I was out of my food coma.  I don't think I'm going to eat dinner....
author: Mark D.

description: This is one of my favorite places for a down home in the hood afordable authentic Mexican meal.  Taqueria Cancun is smack dab in the middle of de corazon of the Mission.  The portions here GENEROUS, yes it's in the barrio, but that's the whole charm. Love the table up front with the Lady Guadalupe shrine, love the no frills, la familia approch to business.
author: B H.

description: Still, hands down, my favorite burrito al pastor! It's gross and filthy, and last time I was there with my friend some drunk Mexican kept glaring at her sacrilegious tattoo and getting himself all worked up in a Catholic fervor. Also, some guys were trying to get all romantic and shit with us. It is not really the type of taqueria that makes me feel sexy. But I always leave satisfied.
author: Colleen B.

description:
you know the mexican food week in grade school? you had nacho day, burrito day, chimichanga day, etc.

yeah, thats what this place is. right down to the yellow cheapo round chips they give you with your meal.

i dont care how cheap the food is, this place is like getting a wedge from Jerod...
author: Darrell L.

description: Anybody who thinks this isnt a great burrito deserves unhappiness.
author: Jeffrey R.

description: Oh man. It's so good, why would I go anywhere else for a burrito? The salsa is a beautiful thing, and will keep your palate warm while you wait for your meal.
author: Megan P.

description: Totally overrated. It's only advantage is that it's open when the bars close. I think the food is pretty nasty but I had a good experience there once - I quietly pointed out a roach crawling across the big menu sign behind the register, and they gave me my order for free since I didn't make a big deal out of it.
author: Josh K.

description: I love a taco but Cancun also makes Ceviche tostadas!!!  Also be sure to order the grilled ceballitos (basically grilled sweet spring onions) - I promise it is really, really good especially with a little mexican beer to wash it all down.  Enjoy.
author: Annabel G.

description: My plan is to hit as many different Mission taquerias as I can for the rest of the year, and Taqueria Cancun has to be my favorite so far in terms of taste.  In terms of ambiance, well, I would prefer something more low key.
author: Tim G.

description:
the good thing about this place is that it's open late, and i can stumble in to fulfill my drunken burrito craving.  the bad thing about this place is that it's open late, so lots of other drunkards come stumbling in from all corners of the mission to fulfill THEIR drunken burrito cravings.  furthermore, i found the much-vaunted vegetarian burrito severely lacking.  they skimped on the guacamole and i ended up mainly with beans and rice.  

as for ambiance, check out the colorfully eye-popping (it's so colorful it will make you want to pop your eyes out)  crepe paper decorating the ceiling.  always a fiesta at taqueria cancun...!
author: Katherine K.

description: I've eaten here twice. Unfortunately, both times I was extremely drunk. So naturally it gets 5 stars! Hurray drunken burritos!
author: Shereen R.

description: Three things set this Taqueria apart from the rest: (1) hands down the tastiest carne asada of any of the taquerias in the mission, (2) sublime green salsa (worth the trip in of itself), and (3) the toasted tortilla.  There is no comparison anywhere else.
author: Cary W.

description:
After wandering around the mission in search of that ever elusive perfect bite before our concert, my buddy and I decided to step into Taqueria Cancun.  Walking in the restaurant looked much less shady than surrounding restaurants with a clean and bright interior.  We walked up to the counter and ordered. My friend got the torta while I went with a trio of tacos, a lengua, a cabeza and my old standby al pastor along with a beer to wash it down.  The food was prepared quickly and we began to scarf it all down.  

The first thing that I noticed was the there was a substantial amount of meat in each taco with just a sprinkling or onions, cilantro and salsa on your typical small taco sized corn tortilla.  The cabeza and lengua tacos were a little bland but tender.  It could have used some salt in the cooking or maybe a little more lime or salsa.  The pastor however was one of the better pastors that I've had in recent memory. The meat was properly cooked, had tons of flavor and offered a little kick of heat with just the right amount of grease to lube the taco on it's way down.  However, at $2.50 a taco, it's about twice as expensive as a good taco truck taco but I suppose they offer about twice as much meat so it probably evens out.  My friend's torta was really good juicy on the inside and toasty on the outside.  A lot of tortas that I've had don't really heat the bun for you.  I'd also like to try some of their burritos and other dishes as well to see how they compare but all in all a solid effort, espeically with the quality of their pastor.
author: Gary L.

description: The hot sauce packs a mean punch, but the experience is very well worth the tears. Once you try this place, all other Mexican food seems bland.
author: Melanie K.

description: This is one of my favorite taquerias.  The food is excellent.  I'm all about the spicy and their salsa brings a tear to my eye.  I don't even mind being oggled by the guys who work there.
author: angela k.

description: Home of the drunk burrito. Come here any night after midnight and their will be a line (to the back of the store... odd line layout) of drunks looking dive into some greasy Mexican food. Its also conveniently located across from Beauty Bar so theres a guaranteed slew of hipsters and Marina tools that come by afterwards. If you can get over them, then this place is definitely a great place for a late night burrito. Just watch out for the drunk guys who stumble in with the vomit he puked onto his jacket. Vile.
author: Rocky K.

description: Whoa! I usually eat at Gordo Burrito on 9th Ave and thought that was the best----- and you know what... I love Gordo so I will not speak badly of it, but this is very close competition! The burrito was extremely flavorful and delicious and had a real authentic flavor. I will definitely be back.
author: ben T.

description: Great burritos stuffed with whole avocadoes, sour cream, salsa! Avoid the bathroom unless you are about to shit your pants because you ate too many burritos.
author: Sal B.

description:
Oh, the dark side of Yelp... if you wouldn't trust your boozy brother in law's recommendations for a restaurant, why would 200 of his ilk give the review any more credibility?
It's pretty  obvious that the people who rate this place highly are looking for a late night drunken binge.  For those who are more sober, or who can still taste when they're addled, Cancun is easily among the worst. In the three or four times I've been dragged there by some group in the last 10 years or so, it's quality remains in the grease-pit.
You can get a burrito for $2-3 cheaper than the quality taco joints, and boy, do you get what you pay for. The quality of their ingredients is markedly inferior - you can really taste the cheapness, like american cheese and feed-grade meat.
Really, walk another block or two to El Toro, Pancho Villa, La Taqueria, or even La Corneta.  Your stomach, if not your tastebuds, will thank you. Then again, if you're into the cheapest drunk-fare, maybe this is your place, but do the rest of us a favor and tag it as such in your review!
author: Colin S.

description: I had vegetable soup for "dinner" at 5:00pm so I was starving when I got to the Mission. I knew I needed something filling and didn't get my fix until we arrived at Taqueria Cancun at 2:00am. We had previously gotten drinks at El Rio down the street. The decor had a bunch of Aztec art on the walls and a giant picture of Frida Kahlo. I decided to split a super quesadilla with J, not really thinking it would be anything special. It arrived cut in half and actually looked more like a burrito. It was really big too! It had fresh avocados in it, sour cream, fresh salsa, SUPER tasty carne asada, and a toasty crust. It tasted like a warm burrito wrapped inside a hot pocket. I'm bummed that they only have Taqueria Cancuns in SF. Maybe they'll have one in the bay area one day. For now, I'll have to trek to the mission to get my future fixes.
author: Nancy B.

description:
IT'S TOTALLY LOUD IN HERE!
