But the burritos are effing ridiculous.  I took my friend from Indiana here the other night for his first taste of real Mexican food.  He was a little late in arriving, so I sat down and watched the clientele.  There was your requisite bum hustling each customer for change and the drunk loser teenagers.  My friend showed up and we got on line.  The line looks totally intimidating and long, but it moves quite fast.  I ran into my co-worker's brother-in-law while waiting to order, which was a pleasant surprise.  So I order a super chicken burrito with everything.  Can I just say that I can never finish the whole burrito and I rarely find myself so into a burrito that I would actually want to finish it.  But this, this super chicken burrito all grilled after assemblage, made me want to finish every last little morsel. The chicken wasn't dry, there wasn't a high rice factor and the beans--holy shit.
Needless to say, both Indiana and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and took a solid hour to walk the ten or so blocks back to the apartment he shares with my best friend--we were that full.
This is a good place to go if you just want your basic burrito--no whole wheat tortillas or other crazy shit you can get at Pancho Villa or (gasp!) Chipotle.
And I think it is a good sign if the place isn't sparkling clean and there may be sketchtastic folks hanging around.  But that's just me.
author: Sarah H.

description: The best burrito in the city.  Fresh avocado, grilled tortilla and you know it's fresh because they are so busy all the time! Open late and the people are nice.
author: Dan S.

description:
This was one of my first introductions to Mexican food in the city after moving to the area from San Diego. Of course, I turned my smug nose up at such a concept as tin foil on a burrito and generally disregarded the food as nothing more than "passable". 

However, in subsequent visits (most of which I have hazy memories of due to certain methods of intoxication and general late-night, post-bars tiresomeness) I have found almost everything I've ordered to be amazing. I usually stick with things like quesadilla's, and it certainly delivered here.
author: John E.

description: So sad, I keep coming back here in hopes of the world's best "veggie" burrito and each time I am disappointed.  Super salty, undercooked onions and only two bits of avocado when I have visions of big hunks of green deliciousness within.  Definitely over-hyped, I think folks must have their wooly ski hats over their eyes (and mouths). I'm giving up and going back to Papalote, it's worth the few extra bucks plus better salsa.
author: michele K.

description:
There've been times I've walked 14 blocks for the toastiness and the fresh avocado of a Cancun veggie burrito. They fill you up, so don't plan on eating another dinner later (unless you're trying to bulk up?).

I would never order any of the meat products, they look pretty sickening. But the grimy atmosphere is an effective yuppie-repellant.
author: Zeefus J.

description: I honestly have no idea what I did to piss these people off, but my usual Super Burrito was full of hot sauce and hair. You guys can go to hell. :-(
author: Chancey M.

description: I left my tummy in San Francisco. I left it with you, Taqueria CanCun. How is it that you make such a delicious veggie burrito that just simply defies description? Why is every other burrito I have ever eaten completely lacking when compared to you? Is it the chunks of avocado? Is it the grilling of the tortilla? I don't know, but I pine for you Every. Day.
author: Jill D.

description: This place gets rave reviews, but I did not have a good experience and haven't wanted to try and see if that was a fluke. I recommend El Farolito or La Taqueria over Taqueria Cancun.... all have comparable fare (El Farolito gives larger portions than La Taqueria), but Cancun tastes worse for you. You need an iron stomach and need to eat crap regularly for Cancun to go down easily. Let's just say... if you are like me and tend to eat healthfully, you have less of a chance encountering Montezuma at El Farolito and La Taq.
author: Amanda C.

description: i moved away from the bay area, but every time i visit, the first thing i do is get an al pastor burrito mojado.
author: Jason C.

description: I never thought I'd find a taqueria that would be as good (or better than) El Farolito, but boy, was I wrong. Taqueria Cancun does the trick.
author: Michelle G.

description: This is the one of the only decent Mexican restaurants in SF.  Cancun is great for late nights after drinking and it somehow turns into a 5 star place when you are drunk (as you can see from reading the other reviews).  It's weird how there are great Mexican restaurants all around the bay, but none in the City.  Here in SF they have somehow figured out that they can charge more for a small plate of Mexican food by calling it a tapa, which are nothing like real Spanish tapas, and not satisfying when you are craving Mexican.  So if you can't get out of the City for some great Mexican then head over to Cancun.
author: Ryan S.

description: The cleanest looking and most decorated of the taquerias I have visited in the neighborhood.  Food was generous on the avocado, but nothing special outside of a typical large and tasty burrito.  The chips were very heavy and kinda stale.
author: kat s.

description: My favorite place for burritos in all of mission. They have a burrito they call "the big one" which a huge burrito covered in salsa and sour cream. It's soo much burrito and still soo tasty. And best thing about this place? While they're open til 3 and perfect for late night after the bars, the burritos are still awesome for during the day when you're looking for lunch!
author: Justin M.

description: The first two times I visited, the staff was engaged in some form of illegal activity.  The burritos may be all the better for it...  At Cancun you risk the occasional bite of meat that should never have made it into something served as food, but you get that at most places where a meal is under $5.
author: Joe R.

description: Greasy walls, greasy floor, greasy food,  and yet it has fans.. Even after a big night on the sauce at a late hour I couldn't stomach this joint.
author: Stellah D.

description: It seems like the quality went down recently.  Stick with the burrito's and the Torta's.  The carne asada that I had here lately was pretty tough.  Not as tender as most places and very fatty.  The breakfast burrito here is great also.
author: Mitch A.

description: This place always saves me. It saves me from my drunken hunger that long after college I'm convincing myself cures hangovers. It saves me from bad dining excursions in the Mission where a too new, too trendy restaurant may pop up and entertain me with terrible dining. It saves me when I am broke ass hell and need some cheap eats to satisfy my never ending SF desire to eat out. It saves me when no one can decide what they want to eat or everyone is being a little too picky to find a consensus. It's been good to me so I will continue to let it be my savior.
author: Alicia J.

description: Nice festive murals and streamers make eating the yummy tacos here pleasant, especially the tacos al pastor (marinated pork). Cheap too, at $1.80 each. Don't miss the carne asada as well. Parking here isn't easy, but with patience it can be done.
author: Hao L.

description: It was open, it was right across the street, and it filled our late night munchies....everyone there was there for the same reason.  I enjoyed this place, the nachos were good and ultra spicy.  Although I didn't try the burritos, word is they really hit the spot.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Mmmm...tacos.  Solid sobering up food after working up a drunken sweat at Baobab.  And while the salsa isn't that good, the chips are good enough I could eat them alone.
author: Katie S.

description:
i've been here numerous times, always very drunk and late at night.  it's always like, "hey i'm hungry, where we gonna go eat?"  ten minutes elapse with no replies and then, "cancun?"  "yea!  let's go now dammit!"  and so we make the journey and order buttloads of nachos and burritos.  they have a water fountain at the end of the line which is great when you're dehydrated and trying to prevent a hangover.

there's always food on the table from the last patrons.  it takes awhile to get cleaned up, but my friend doesn't mind.  he'll .. start eating it.  i almost threw up once when i saw him do that (there was a used napkin on top of an untouched taco).  so if you're into that kind of thing and/or short on money, there's always good food to be found here.  sanitation unknown.

edit 9/24/6 - after numerous outings in the mission, i've decided to bump my review to 5 stars simply because they're open late and there aren't many other options.  and it's only a few blocks away.  and it's damn good.  and has easily accessible water.  and because there's so many random people i run into there at 2am.
author: Em W.

description: I purposely got shit-faced so I can get the munchies here. For those from H-town, this is equivalent to a late run to Chachos or Taco Cabana. Munchies for the shit-faced and unruly. Hoo hoo hoo hoo hoo!
author: Cathy H.

description: wonderful vegetarian nachos. large amounts of avocado on them, and you get chips and salsa with every meal
author: michael d.

description: Vegetarian burrito was pretty good. I really liked their rice and the chunks of avocado in the burrito. My burrito was also really really BIG, which of course is always awesome, even if you cannot finish it. They have liters of Cola from Mexico, mmmm real sugar not high fructose corn shit. It's hard to pick just one taqueria in the mission but this one is pretty good.
author: Cori W.

description: Get the Super Burrito and fresh orange juice. If it's quiet, stick something on the jukebox in the corner.
author: Bob G.

description: Easily the best burritos I've ever had, and I've eaten a lot of burritos in my day.
author: Nick B.

description:
i hate this time of year, because it is the time of the year when i forget that la taqueria closes for the holidays.  i swear, this has happened to me so many times, it's honestly unbelievable.  i am literally dying for a la taqueria taco or burrito, and i go down there, and as i am walking up, i notice the gates are CLOSED, and I realize why!!! nooooooo!!!  so depressing.  

anyway, this just happened to me AGAIN the other day.  and cancun is where i ended up instead.  i've tried cancun so many times in the hopes that it would be better than it is.... but every time i come to the same conclusion: what is so great about it???  i still can't figure it out.  I've tried numerous menu items and still am unimpressed.  it's OKAY but with la taqueria literally down the street, it just doesn't compare.  this time i had chicken tacos.  not a huge fan-- they were okay but a bit bland.  my complaint about the burritos is that they have rice which i just don't think is necessary personally--just makes me extremely full.   one thing they got going for them is that they are cheap, but there's a reason why!
author: Yvette H.

description: Really good food, but they have the Best Torta I've found in SF so far. Wash that down with some fresca - hits the spot every time. Then you need a spot on the couch :).
author: Mike C.

description: I recently moved to San Fran and so far Cancun is the best burrito I've had.  Their burritos are large, fresh, and full of good stuff.  The place also has a good vibe which adds to the burrito experience.
author: Garrett D.

description: Don't expect to find a clean place to eat in this area of the Mission, just expect to find a good place to eat in this area of the Mission. The basket of chips with the very spicy salsa and guacamole was delicious. The burritos were, of course, HUGE. I didn't care if I was getting full, I ate that entire veggie burrito because my stomach was in need of it and the alcohol had to go somewhere. And whenever a Taqueria I go to has a "They love us on Yelp", of course you know a good majority of the stragglers from the bars in the Mission can't help but gravitate here.
author: Jamie L.

description:
good burrito!  seriously good burritos!  what sucks about this place is that it has become "hip" in the last 15 years and it gets packed out with white people.  also, the occasional gangster beat down inside the restaurant is another super negative.  i do like watching the so called hipsters try to ignore some guy getting bloodied up right next to them.  hey hipsters, next time you see a gang fight, why don't you try getting the fuck out the way.

cancun gets four stars for the food and i subtracted one star because the management hasn't done anything about the gang violence in 15 years.

**oh, if you are a real veg head, then don't eat here.  the veggie burritos are made on the same grill as the meat.  there's always a nice meat flavor in every burrito.  my girlfriend is a veg head and eating here actually makes her sick.
author: T D.

description: this place looks, sounds, smells, feels and tastes like taquerias i went to in mexico city.
author: Lena B.

description: REALLY good at 1 in the AM other than that.... might be a little spicy for whiteys
author: Jared F.

description:
my favorite taqueria... carne asada is great!!
only one possible drawback, this place can be a little bit too spicy, i love spice but some of the guac makes me turn read and sweat - great late night place.
author: Scott K.

description: My burrito didn't taste good! Maybe my expectations were set way too high but this was probably the worst burrito I've ever had in the Mission! Was I just being wonky that day?!
author: Susan L.

description: My favorite burritos anywhere. I'm not saying they are the best because, jesus christ, last time I made that claim it ended in a fight (between other people... I opened a can of worms with that one, I guess.) But personally, they are my fave. It's the tortilla I think. Instead of being excessively doughy, it's crispy and flaky and buttery-tasting.
author: Emily H.

description: As a big fan of late-night taquerias (La Vic in SJ being the best hands down), I was excited to finally try one in the Mission. It didn't blow me away. I am big fan of the veggie quesadilla in general because you get all of the fillings of a burrito, with the bonus of extra cheese and a slightly crispy tortilla. But the one here was giant and had too much cheese (not quite melted). It tasted fine, and the salsa was nice and spicy, but it cost me, with a mineral water, $7.11. That seems like way too much, especially since i just a had lunch at Super Taqueria in Morgan Hill for 3.15. Plus, I woke up this morning with a bad stomach ache--something that never happens after eating at La Victoria. Oh, and bathroom very sketch: not only didn't they have towels, they didn't even have a dispenser for towels.
author: Lauren H.

description: Overrated.  I've never understood what the hype is about this place.  The meat is pretty bland (and overcooked), the salsa isn't good, and the lines are long.  Don't get me wrong,  the burritos are okay... but why Taqueria Cancun consistently makes it on to "Best of" lists is completely beyond me.
author: Andrew E.

description: Top 3 taquerias in the Bay Area. Don't let the zagat rated sign fluster your judgment. There burritos are killer and i dunno what they do to their warp, but its really crunchy. Yummy.
author: Jose S.

description: I had no idea you could make food this good for under $4!  I ordered two chicken tacos which  were perfectly spiced.  The tacos are much smaller than the burritos (even if you order two), but just the right amount of food if you aren't starving hungry.  The atmosphere was loud and bright ~ I particularly noticed the painted murals on the walls.  About halfway through the meal, an aspiring American Idol singer/guitar player started strumming some Mexican tunes, so, depending on your perspective, that was either an entertaining aspect of the taqueria experience or a slightly annoying added amount of cacophony.  Between the musician and the colorful cast of characters dining, Taqueria Cancun was an entertaining and flavorful experience!
author: Matt P.

description: The reason why I like this place is because it's open late and it's dirt cheap. It's also very loud inside because the cooks are blasting Tex Mex crap on the uber lo end Tojaz boombox.  Despite that, loudness actually helps mask the ultra-intense drunk conversations going on in the establishment after 1AM.  Yeah, this is a great place to come to after tying one on.
author: Larry A.

description:
good food.

even better, open late @ night.  when you don't want pizza...

not the best mexican, but makes do.
author: Sheri N.

description: ahhhh...the drrrrty drrrt 2am burrito orgy- plus chips minus sex- that pretty much sums up an average morning drunken burritto rush. With the burritos stuffed full and lines of people saying the most hilarious drunken rants- all equalling up to $5.76 thats fully worth the cost of admision. Well, its either that or a nice extra scoop of hangover the next day....and who wants that? ;)
author: Tim V.

description: Came here on Cinco de Mayo. And then ran into this guy I used to make out with. While he was with his girlfriend. I think she could kind of tell. Oops. But that certainly didn't affect how tasty my nachos were. Mmmmmm, nothing can distract me from melty, ooey, gooey goodness. Good nachos in a very healthy portion. I love the huge chunks of avocado that come with it. Overall a good nacho experience combined with a mediocre running into a sort of ex experience. Four stars.
author: Cathy T.

description: My "standard of perfection" for al pastor.  Hands down. Nothing compares, but I will keep searching.
author: Bob W.

description: Carne asada super quesadilla. Amazing. Spicy!
author: Steve C.

description: I would make love to their veggie burrito with extra cilantro and black beans.  Maybe I'd hold the hot sauce though.  Pretty much everything here is pretty damn good, although sometimes their carne asada has some tendons in it and their chile relleno is the kind from a can.  If you want either of those go to El Farolito 5 blocks down, but if you want a veggie burrito that's worthy of sticking your privates into, look no further.  Goddamn, my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: steven m.

description: Best burritos ever. Super burrito with pollo asado can not be beat.
author: Sachin A.

description: Best Mexican to go in the city!  Their green salsa is especially tasty... I generally fancy the Veggie Burrito with black beans and extra green salsa...
author: J.M. B.

description: Umm, I hate their taqueria downtown. This location is a whole different beast. First off, the place is decorated like a kiddie party - colorful ceiling paper danglers and vivid colors everywherez. Late hours, thanks so much because when you're drinking nearby, you need quality grub, right? It's so strange how a simple vegetarian burrito can taste so different everywhere you grab it. Flavorful beans + rice with hunks of avo, no crema,  and the salsas were perfection.
author: Brittany L.

description: Classic San Francisco Taqueria in the mission. Big fat yummy burritos with great fresh juice to quench your thirst. I usually head there late night to satisfy my hunger before bed.
author: John J.

description: Ok, I've been here twice since my first scathing review and have not experienced the same cilantro malfuction, so I'm bumping it up a few stars.  Did I mention that cilantro is evil?
author: Landy G.

description: Excellent burritos at a good price- the size of the place precludes the long lines you find at Pancho Villa's, and I actually think they handle burritos a little better here. Usually always room to have a sit down, for yourself & a friend or two... but their burritos are actually a little spicier if you let them cool down on a walk home! The fresh  juice drinks are good too. It might be said almost one taqueria is as good as another in the Mission, but this one is the one I hit most often.
author: Mark L.

description: Good eats at cheap prices.  For a five star taqueria go to La Corneta -- the food is just as good, if not better, and the place is way cleaner.
author: Helen C.

description: If you're in the mood for good "hole in the wall" Mexican food and need a place that's open late, this is it!  Good portions, reasonable prices...  The carne asada is pretty good and when they add avacado to a meal, it's scooped fresh from the avacado.
author: Brian L.

description: I once thought that I knew what a burrito tasted like until I went to this place and realized I was a burrito virgin. This place even though dirt cheap sets the standard in my mind of what great Mexican food tastes like in San Francisco. Get the Burrito Mojado, the Super Burrito or the Super Quesadilla. Of the meats that you can choose from, I'm most impressed with the grilled chicken.
author: insipidphishie P.

description:
i'm moving to a nearby block in a coupla weeks, and did a google search to see what i'll be eating.  cancun was part of the results returned.

let me drop the R-bomb here.  i've been to this place 3 times.  2 times, there were roaches either on the wall next to our table, or on the floor near the bathroom in the back.  yummy!
author: Michael M.

description: Second best burrito in the City in my humble opinion (next to Farolito).  A bit spicier than the average burrito.  It is grilled a bit, so the cheese in the burrito is melted.  Mmmm.  Carne Asada.
author: Zac A.

description: The carnitas are excellent, the rice is flavorful, the cheese is melted just right and the tortillas are toasted to the perfect consistency.  The regular burrito at Cancun is one of the best I've ever had.  It's so good that it doesn't need any guacamole or sour cream...
author: Jay M.

description: I know the city health department doesn't agree, but I love this place. I come at least once a week for my Al Pastor Burrito. It is already crowded, so I don't think my review will be a tipping point, but I sometimes shy away from raving about this place as I don't want to spoil what has become a lively tradition for me. As long as their methods don't change, I will come back for years.... their burrito haunts me. And the green salsa, it makes my day. Add a negro modelo and I am set for the evening.... I think I have been here about 40 times in 6 years.
author: Sean Q.

description: Best Tortas ever and I am not even that much of a fan of Mexican food. I like their burritos but they are too spicy so I switched over to the tortas. The word mild doesn't seem to exist in the vocabulary of the staff here. come here when you are ravenous after a night of dancing and you shall know what it is to be in heaven.
author: Jade L.

description: Their tacos al pastor really hit the spot.  Add an ice cold beer and you're golden.
author: Pelle Y.

description: I have primarily eaten Mexican food in Mexico, which always never echos the "Mexican" of california. The chicken super taco and Cancun, always reminds me of those stands along the road in Puerto Vallarta and Cabo. The burritos are also fantastic, though I dont really reconmmend the plates ie enchalladas I recommend Panacho Villa for that!!
author: Liz C.

description: Still the best burrito I've had, bar none. While I'm completely open to new ones, this one is still the best. Even the vegetarian version is outstanding, though I prefer the chorizo the most.
author: Lucky L.

description: Festive little place to get your burrito fix. The veggie burrito hits the spot. yum, guac and sour cream! Such a convenient location in between thrift shop hopping or after a coffee run. I like their consistency and the flavor of the salsas.
author: Faye P.

description: In my quest for my favorite burrito, I recently had a Taqueria Cancun carne asada super burrito. We also had a delish melon aqua fresca (so sweet and just like dessert).  Overall, assessment- good meat, outside was grilled, good green salsa. In my quest, I'm starting to think I haven't yet met a burrito I didn't like. I'm a burrito-ho I guess.
author: Nima K.

description: I can't leave the mission without a super carnitas and al pastor taco from this place. I think the fact that they use whole slices of avocado instead of guacamole really does it for me. I can't even imagine factoring decor and atmosphere when judging this place. I mean its a hole in the wall.  If you are looking to use the bathroom in a place like this you have problems. That being said it would be nice if the pan handlers stayed outside the joint instead of trying to sit next to you. I'd be much more willing to give them a taco if that were the case.
author: Alexis G.

description: I think this place is over-hyped. I had the burrito and nachos and I was disappointing that they didn't have a whole lot of meat on them. The burrito and nachos didn't have a lot of grease dripping, which was a good thing. I think flavor wise, it's mediocre. The green avocado salsa was a plus. I wish the place was a little cleaner.
author: Andrenaline R.

description: Who needs cleanliness, ambiance, and service points when you can have a tasty, hits the spot, Mexican meal after a night of bacchanalian revelry?
author: Jean A.

description:
background:
we went on a taqueria pub crawl for a friend's going away party.  apparently there are no taquerias or pubs in nyc.  ;)  during the night, we hit up (1) el farolito, (2) mission bar, (3) taqueria cancun, and lastly (4) zeitgeist, where (5) the tamale lady showed up.

review:
nothing special about this place.  i tried their beef tacos which were eh and their quesadilla which was also eh.  there are definitely way better places to get mexican food than here.
author: jing c.

description:
one of the true staples of a san francisco diet.  i usually crave it around 1-2am...so, have never really been there sober. 

gotta order the cebollitas side order with the burrito...grilled green onions with lime...mmm-good.
author: Roy N.

description: I like their veggie burritos and meat tacos (they come simply with onions and cilantro). Overall, I've never eaten badly here and it's always spicy enough for me. The quesadilla suiza is also pretty good, just a tad greasy. I sure miss it, will go back....and especially good after a night out in the Mission!
author: Gina R.

description: I wouldn't say this is the best taqueria in the mission for overall quality, but they do have an awesome vegetarian burrito and an amazong burrito mojado.  The tortillas are great and they are warmed and slightly fried before each burrito is made.  Great atmosphere, but you might want to stay away from the chicken.  Adios!
author: Russell S.

description: Delicious, lively taqueria in the mission. Not overly greasy and I'm still tasting that super carnitas taco.
author: chris o.

description: As a mission resident, this is my go to place for mexican food. Everything is super fresh tasting and very reasonably priced. The taco's are fantastic!
author: Paul R.

description:
Taqueria Cancun is a top-tier taqueria in San Francisco, offering delicious Mexican food at the expected affordable price. I am a vegetarian, so have only had the veggie burrito, but this place is just about worthy of the "Best Veggie Burrito" award they promote as their claim to fame. 

There are a couple things that Taqueria Cancun does which sets them apart from the crappier taquerias: (1) They use fresh avocado instead of watered down, imposter guacamole. (2) Their burritos are actually served warm/hot, which is one of the greatest distinctions between the best taquerias and all of the other mediocre bullshit. When you go to Cancun, Farolito, or anywhere else respectable, you won't be getting a burrito that is only room temperature, if not cold. No, the best taquerias actually spend the time to make sure the proper temperature is attained for optimal enjoyment. (3) They offer their burritos "mojado," meaning drowned in enchilada sauce. This is an indulgence only for special occasions. 

I am not going to comment on the ambiance, as that is entirely irrelevant. At any taqueria, the burrito/food should be good enough to pull you away from your surroundings. So nonsense like cleanliness or "Van Halen on the jukebox" are not legitimate concerns. A low score from the Department of Health should be interpreted as more of a challenge to the quality of the burrito than anything else.
author: Bert M.

description: Good cheap fast Mexican food -- Plus you can watch through the front windows the gangs deal there drugs and fight out front. Just remember to duck and cover if bullets start flying.
author: Johnny B.

description: yeah! Burrito mojado! Great place for a super tasty burrito. If you can find  bigger amount of tasty food for the price, let me know.
author: Javi V.

description: This place is crazy yummy!!! I hit this spot up last saturday night before a night of drinking at the Beauty Bar. Caroline and I were pretty much famished and too avoid a very ugly and prolonged hangover we decided to eat a small snack before going and pounding the drinks at the bar across the street. So we ordered 2 super tacos Al Pastor and boy were they pretty damn yummy! No lie they have some really good Mexican food. I think slowly I am changing my perspective on Mission Mexican food. Like I have said in the past; we have amazing food in Oakland so I am extremely picky about my Mexican food in and around various parts of Oakland. Aside from getting hollered at by the cashier and cooks and the 3 drunken lil Mexican guys it was a really good experience. The spot was clean and they served me fast. Because when it comes to having a starving Yolanda and a slow cook...well the results can be disastrous.
author: Yolanda O.

description: they do make tasty burritos, but they used to be lot better many years ago...quality went down over years. One thing you will notice: they don't have the cleanest place, occassionally you will spot certain "insect" crawling around (I wonder if this is their secret ingredient). Other than that, they do make tasty tortas and agua frescas.
author: ji k.

description: I have to agree that the food here isn't anything to write home to mamma about, they do give you a freakin huge amount of food for less then it costs to keep a sweatshop worker employed for a day.  And lets face it, at 2am they put up with an amazing number of gringos trying to satisfy their munchies or drunen lust for greasy food.  Stay away from the beef brain tacos.
author: Anony M.

description: It's the spot.  why go anywhere else?  we really don't, esp since it's the closest one to us.  under normal circumstances, we split a veggie--$4.12 for dinner, can't beat that.
author: Suman G.

description: Probably the best tacos in the city and since they are a lot of taqueria that says a lot. They are very spicy but not too spicy that you can't eat them. Everythink else on the menu is just as good but it's always nice to have a Negro Modelo with your meal. The price is right, you can have many tacos and still have money to go to the many bars in the area.
author: Alec D.

description: Not bad. But people tend to be very opinionated and passionate about their burrito joints. I still prefer La Taqueria but would mind the Super Burrito once in a while.
author: Stephen Y.

description: Taqueria Cancun isn't the cleanest place in the city according to the health department, but who cares? If you have ever been hungry at 2 am after all the bars close, chances are you wont be looking for fine dining. In the Mission, you want a killer burrito. Lucky for you this place is open late and they're fast. I highly recommend the super burrito with chicken and refried beans.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
uh-mazing!!! delicious! food was ready quickly & it was good & spicy

chips were a lil cold but still crisp & yummy

carne asada tacos very authentic

-1 star for the side of avocado which was $1!! i think a lil pricy :0/
author: c e.

description: Authentic tacos, fresh spicy-ass salsa, tender beans and rice and fresh carrot juice...delicious
author: Jones D.

description: Terrific fresh food. Reasonable prices. I couldn't live without them.
author: k g.

description: Many friends love this place. Every time I go, the flour tortilla is a little burned, the chicken is a bit dry, and/or there's grit in the beans. No esta bueno. The one near the Civic Center is much better than this one. And, as Yvette K rightly says, El Gran Taco Loco is much better (vegetarian or not). Of course, El Farolito and La Taqueria are much better than either place...
author: Scott M.

description: Best vegetarian burrito for the price in the city, and great carne asada burritos too.  It's usually fairly dirty though even for a Mission taqueria, and the people wandering in to panhandle are tiresome.
author: Adam Z.

description: At Christmas time they give out calendars.  Also the guys at the counter are sweethearts & super friendly.    The nachos are awesome super veggie are the best.   I love the Taqueria Cancun franchise, just knowing they are around and I can have 2 delicious tacos con todo grilled to perfection whenever I want makes me happy.
author: Ona E.

description:
this used to be my burrito spot in the mission.  perhaps it's changed hands, or who knows, but it's certainly changed in quality.  don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad, but it just doesn't "wow" me anymore.  it brings a tear to my eye to know that something has changed, since this was the joint i told everyone about, so i hope i'm not marring my reputation as a burrito/torta afficionado . . . 

i think the next time i'll be headed further down the road to el farolito . . .
author: Jason J.

description: Most consistently good burrito I've had in SF. I think the main reasons this is so are: a) no meats in a hotel pan in their own funk- the meat is cooked to order and put directly onto your burrito from the grill and b) fresh avocado from the 'vocado to your mouf. Hook it up! Minus 1 star for the chips- I wish they had the unhealthy kind that you can see through.
author: Rainer P.

description: I created an account and am I'm writing this review at 4:25am just to say that I got food poisoning from a chicken burrito I ate for dinner tonight (6/7/11).  That being said, the food is good and I will probably return.  Probably.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Awesome burritos? check.
Great chips & salsa with every order? check.
Low prices? check.
"Authentic" mexican? check.
Open late-night? double check.

This little hole in the wall has the best burritos you are likely to find in the city. They are the best I have ever had anywhere. My favorite thing to order is the Carnitas Super Burrito and either a Mexican beer or a soft drink - the coke in a bottle is the kind you can get in Mexico (with real cane sugar, not corn syrup!) and the Mexican lime or mandarin sodas are tangy and great to wash down the meal with...

For a couple of reasons I give this 4 stars and not higher. First, they don't take credit cards (although they do have an ATM next to the jukebox). And second, I have been in several times and on more than one occasion the staff has not seemed to mind when a panhandler (or random crazy person) has wandered in to harass the customers.  I know it's the Mission, but the diners should feel comfortable and safe or they won't come back.  

Other than that, this place rocks.
author: U U.

description:
This is a wonderful taqueria in the mission district. 

Vegetarian friendly.
I had a massive burrito mojado (a burrito covered in sauce) for about $5.
The carnitas was delicious.
The horchata is also delicious.

I highly recommend Taqueria Cancun.
author: Kobey S.

description: i wouldn't come here for anything other than the vegetarian burrito. i'm not sure exactly how its so good, but it is. i try not to think about where the ingredients came from, definitely the cheap of the cheap. but hey, its fun to indulge in cheap delicious awesomeness and be full for the whole day, at least every once in a while. good salsas too, but you might need to ask for more. dont be shy, they will give.
author: Stefan M.

description: Somewhere in the mixed reviews of food poisoning, homeless people, drunk patrons, 70s Telemundo interior, so on and so forth. . .  this place makes a great burrito.  Maybe there will be a body passed out in the doorway, just don't let that interfere with a Penafiel and some chips.
author: Christopher G.

description: Carrot and orange juice drink will take the edge off the hot sauce. Dude at the next table was smoking crack once. You've been warned.
author: Johnnie M.

description: This place is pretty good, and incredibly cheap.  Get the 'wetback burrito'.  It's a burrito done up like an enchelada.  Just don't go to the one at 6th and Market.  The Mexican board of health would be appalled.
author: matthew w.

description: Mmmmm... the pollo asado burrito is amazing.  Unlike other places, they grill the chicken until it's caramelized... so yummy.  They also do a good job of grilling the burrito (vs. steaming) which adds even more yumminess.  Don't forget to try their carrot and orange juice drink -- which they make right in front of you.  Delicious and super healthy.
author: abdullah s.

description: When I thnk of Mexican food, it's usually lard, lard, lard with some salsa. But not with Cancun! The staff really knew the food they had, and what options and plates would not be lardful. It was nice! I kept thinking about a place in Berkeley, but I'n not sure if only the name is the same. I like the painted walls in the bathroom. It's always nice to see someone exercise creativity. Thanks~
author: Laura B.

description: Best, most authentic tacos I have ever eaten aside from a taco stand in Mexico. You can tell they try not to gringo this place down. Warning: Tacos and salsa are slightly spicy. This place is cheap too!
author: Jenny C.

description: This place is a must to try out if you are in the Mission for Lunch and especially late night after the clubs and bars close on Mission.  The Regular Burrito is not bad but if you are very hungry go with THE MOJADO which is huge.  It has Green sauce and Sourcream and such on the outside of this Gigantic and messy Burrito.  I would say La Cumbre has better Carne Asada than Cancun but they are a strong second in the mission and you cannot beat the atmosphere.  Also for all those people who love Spicy good Salsa this place is definetely the best.  The Green Sauce is very spicy and delicous.  If you want something small go with a taco and enjoy some great chips and salsa and loads of water on the house.  Way to go Cancun on a great Burrito or Taco experience everytime.
author: Harry E.

description: Prices seem to have gone up, but I can spare $5.50 for tortilla-wrapped, avocado-ridden happiness.  I hate to say it, but I think that their meat quality has declined slightly in recent visits.
author: Dan H.

description:
I don't know what's going on with this place. Where to start?
First of all there are always drug dealers,prostitutes,thieves and beggars hanging out in front/inside the door. I know its a not so nice part of the mission...I know its hard to keep them from hanging round but I have a shop half a block a way and we manage. 
Secondly... I've ordered here quite a few times (desperate lunch time hung overness) and every time and I mean EVERY-TIME my order is wrong. I ask for Jalapenos and you don't put them on I ask for them on the side after noticing and you stand there and look at me like Im an alien. WTF. Jalapenos? I know you understand you took my order the guy is putting jalapenos and everyone else's taco. What you think because Im a white girl I don't enjoy the spice love juices of jalapenos? 
The chips are always stale. Yes stale. how hard is it to get fresh tortilla chips? your a taqueria for christ sakes.
The sour cream should be called white water sauce because you cant possibly water it down anymore.
Orders are always thrown together badly.....example Nachos.
The veggie burrito is tasteless and well so is pretty much everything else I've ever eaten there.
The music is always too loud.....insert shouting here+++++++
and just to top all of this off if you weren't already sick of this place.....they gave three people food poisoning last month.
So I've marked this off my list of stumbling eats and now stumble right past and down to Taqueria el Buen Sabo on Valencia where the food is excellent they understand the words spicy and jalapeno and I don't have to worry about food borne illnesses!
author: Charlie B.

description: Want the best veggie burrito you've ever had in your entire life for only $3? Go here, damn it!
author: Y H.

description:
Cute small place, a litte on the dinky side but cute

After ordering I sat down to assess the food:

Nachos- not so great
Guacamole dip with jalapeno peppers- absolutely awesome 
Burrito mojado- my eyes nearly popped when this was brought out.  It was bigger than me and a visual feast for the eyes, lathered on the sides with red salsa and green guacamole with a white stripe of sour cream in the middle.  I honest to god was impressed when I saw it and then I ate it.  Disappointing it was with no distinct flavors, tasteless chicken (I had to ask my friend if we had ordered chicken even), big hunks of tasteless rice and beans.  Oh how I wished that the burrito's inside matched it's outside but it never happened, proving once again that beauty is only skin deep.  I thought fondly to my experiences at Chipotle where you can taste each flavor.

On the brighter side, the freshly squeezed carrot juice was good..... but I won't be returning for the burrito anytime soon!
author: Michele Y.

description: New York has its pizza, we have burritos. I'm not a huge fan of burritos and usually order tacos. One taco is really like 2. The vegetables and cilantro are cut fresh right there. It has the feeling of late night greasy spoon but doesn't leave you feeling sick. The food for the price in the city! Day or night!
author: Melissa A.

description:
cebollitas. spanish for 'green onions,' and for a $1.85, you can grilled goodness of these things with salt and pepper. it sounds so simple and i seriously tried to recreate this last night, but no dice. savory snack, indeed.

my mom and i always hit up cancun for their cocktel de camarones (shrimp cocktail) - the restaurant by my mom's work in san jose has this same dish for $9.50 and at cancun it's twice as big and only $6.50. these guys don't mess around when it comes to freshness. savory, giant shrimp, crack-like cocktail mix, and all the crackers you want - dear lord i want one right now. the burritos are also giant, and they're about the same level of price range as farolito.

the bernal heights one is slower but seemingly not as tasty, and the SOMA one will do in the pinch when you're coming out of the warfield after a show.
author: Jenz y.

description: the el pastor was SO good.  I'm not well-versed in mexican food since i'm an east coaster (taco bell is the standard there and then there's high end Rosa's kitchen or something like that - but is that real mexian food when it's $30?!) .  Been here and the place down the block at Mission/24th where the guy cooks in the window.
author: Emm C.

description: Great burrito.  Certainly not the best but worth going to if your too lazy to walk a few more blocks to the farlito.  They don't bring your food to you at the table and it seems I always get bothered by bums here.  It is cheap and open late so thats always a plus.
author: Ryan R.

description: This is the destination when drunk and on your way home from the mission bars. And yet, even when intoxicated, the food is still disgusting.
author: B. C.

description: Best burritos in the city! Nothing like fresh fork-mashed avocado versus the standard mystery green goop most places have. My standby: super burrito with lengua and refried beans, onions and cilantro, no rice, and no sour cream. Mmmm ... perfection!
author: Sharman G.

description: One of the owners of this place is a patient of the doctor I work for. Well, yesterday, I had a bad expirience at La Taza Cafe ( who doesn't cook salmon all the way!?!?!?! I mean it was RAW in the middle. It isn't steak people...it's fish!) and the owner of Cancun happened to have an appointment right when I got back from my horrible "lunch" at La Taza. I told him what happened and that I should have gone to his taqueria since I still haven't tried it (i know i know... but i only get to go to that area of the city every once in a while). About 20 mins later after he left my office, he came back and surprised me with a burrito, chips, salsa and orchata!!!!! Besides the fact that this is one of the nicest guys you could ever meet...it was one of the BEST burritos I've ever had! I will definitely be going there every chance I get. This is my new favorite!!!! Mmmmm....
author: Ashley R.

description: A friend of mine took me to Cancun Taqueria 18 years ago. I think if I could manage to put aside all the money I saved by going there over the years, I could open my own taqueria.. But then again why bother ? Cancun is there!... I am still surprised to see that burritos come with guacamole and sour cream without extra charge when they're so cheap already. They have black beans, tortilla is crispy and the festive mood is very rarely bothersome. When I'm so hungry that I can't even look for a place to eat, or when it's so late, this is the place I crawl to before the low blood sugar renders me unconscious. Anticipation high keeps me intact while I wait for my turn and I feel like it's my Bday when they call mi numero. Never felt self conscious for burying my face in a burrito there.  When I feel sick, I ask it to be extra spicy and have a Modelo with it and I'm cured. I honestly don't feel I need Obama's health-care but that burrito available when I need it. Luuuvvv Cancun.
author: Greg S.

description: This place is the bee's knees. I was visiting my parents for a few nights and this place was my lunch stop everyday. I get there chicken burrito it is AMAZING. I got some horchata to drink. I cant remember how much it costs but I know it was well-priced otherwise I wouldn't have gone there everyday.
author: Matt V.

description: Best burrito place in SF period.  Awesome tortilla quality, comparable to San Diego style, bitchin avocado salsa.  Personally prefer this location to the one on Market St.  Go here now.
author: Mark W.

description: Love this place! After a night of drinking or even when sober this place never fails to have awesome food. I love the tortas and tacos. I recommend getting a carne asada torta and a Mexican Coke, it will change your life and the way you see any other soda beverage forever. They also have good spanish music which is always fun to listen to, especially when Vicente Fernandez is playing and drunk people are singing along.
author: Marianna E.

description: The best and only taqueria to visit!  The best vegetarian burittos!  The biggest aspect is fresh ingredients and they grill their tortillas!
author: Sir Paul L.

description:
not like this place needs any more hype (how many times have they won the Guardian's Best of the Bay?) but their veggie burrito is the bomb -- the most delicious gut bomb on the planet. Plus they gave me a nickname they shout out everytime I come in. How cute is that? 

Damn I think I've got to go over there right now! it's that good.

p.s.: you gotsta go to the one at Mission/19th, the other two aren't as good. be brave, I think they just installed one of those police surviellance cameras outside on the corner; maybe that will cut down on the shootings.
author: Dan K.

description: So me and the man have had arguments about the best Taqueria in the Mission. His vote is Cancun and mine is Taqueria La Altena. I do have to give him credit mainly due to the fact that he might be more Mexican than me even though he's a blue eyed New Englander! Cancun has good tacos and a decent salsa collection. I get Tacos de Asada everywhere I go and am always looking for the best. The decor is charming and it is a dependable spot to go after you have had a crazy night in the Mish. I definitely don't have anything bad to say about it but its just not my first choice.
author: Sugey G.

description: Best vegetarian burrito.  Toasted tortilla is good touch.  Try the intriguing green sauce.
author: oliver w.

description: Definitely some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. I had a bean burrito and nachos.  So much avocado! So delicious! I have to go back again!
author: claudia g.

description: Very yummy veggie burrito, atmosphere is a little sketchy.  Whatever you do, do not venture into the bathrooms (though if you happen to be female and Spanish-speaking, I have found the staff willing to lend out their bathroom).  Probably the best of late night Mission taqueria joints.
author: Celeste A.

description:
best burritos in the city.  great price.   i love the guys at the counter.  

my favorite taqueria
author: Marcia V.

description: Awesome place to go when you've skipped dinner, had 17 cocktails at the Beauty Bar and need to eat before you pass out.  It has eyeball burrito on the menu if you're feeling brave. All sorts of crazily entertaining shenanigans happen here after dark on the weekends.....largely by people who have consumed 17 cocktails at the Beauty Bar.
author: Kelly P.

description:
I didn't know the Bay Area had this level of tasty burritos until I started going to the city more often for work stuff a few years ago.  I've stuck to just a few basic things each time, the burrito with grilled steak, the super burrito with grilled steak, the veggie, the super veggie, and the tacos.  Right off the bat, I would probably say its a toss-up between this place and El Metate when I'm trying to get a burrito in the mission.  It usually ends up being this place because of its proximity to the 16th St. BART station.  These guys have really, really good burritos with a good combo of things going into them and have a flavor that I have not been able to reproduce at home no matter how hard I've tried.   The best of their stuff is their grilled steak (unless you catch a whiff of bad luck and get some dry stuff that's been on the grill for hours). 

The salsa they've got going is the bomb and goes perfect on top of your burrito.  I always try to get extra salsa and end up finishing it all (both the red and the hotter green).

This spot as well as the one further down mission near Cesar Chavez serve up the same stuff.  In terms of ambiance, I wouldn't say there's much going on.  They're basically hole-in-the-wall places which can get crowded at times.  I don't mind the Mexican music from the jukebox but would prefer them to lower the volume sometimes so you can hear the dude behind the counter call your number when its ready, but ultimately, this is a place I'd swear by.  It doesn't take much of an excuse for me to go out of my way to have lunch or dinner at this spot.
author: Anx R.

description:
I don't disagree that Can Cun has incredible burritos, big and dripping in sour cream and all sorts of goodness.  And thought they're stingy with the salsa, both red and green are fantastic and super-spicy. 

The three stars -- as opposed to four -- is related to salsa: both the spiciness and the stinginess.  Can Cun refuses to serve tap water.  Therefore, anyone whose mouth catches on fire is required to buy a beverage.  The $1 for bottled water may be neither here nor there, but given that I don't drink anything but water and that I've never been denied tap water anywhere, I found this particularly annoying and petty.  

It's easily corrected, though, so I encourage Can Cun to reconsider.
author: Josh S.

description: My personal favorite Taqueria in the city. Conveniently located, great food, open late, and cheap. Also, it's nice and close to Dolores Park, a former favorite drinking spot of mine, and I have some great memories of walking the two blocks from the park for some late night drunken quesadillas.
author: Sean R.

description: Good fast Mexican.  House salsa is a bit spicy for my gringo ass but delicious.  Always a steady flow of customers in both locations, nice service.
author: M M.

description:
I've been going to this place since 2000 (yeah kids, I'm "old") when my dotcom was practically across the street. It was my favorite taqueria then and it still is now. Great, cheap, quick food. A super burrito would always fill me up, and that spicy green salsa, awesome. Atmosphere is exactly what a cheap food place should be like - simple, relatively clean, and lively. Great at 12pm and 2am.

Oh, they have three locations in the city, the one on 19th & Mission is the best, don't bother with the others. In fact the 6th & Market one just sucks, dunno why but its not even close to the same - avoid that one.
author: Trishan A.

description: A great place to go if you dont like yuppies and the atmosphere they create.  Good food at a good price.   Dont bother with any of the other taco shops on Mission.
author: John P.

description:
Visited this place late night, after nightclubbing in the area. The expectations were high since late night tacos are good for hangover next morning.
Well, as expected this place was crowed at 1:30 AM, people barely was able to walk along the main aisle, so it was a good indication of having good food.
I asked for "al pastor" and "carne asada" tacos; it took a while to get them as many people was in front on the line. To find an empty table was difficult, so we decided to sit down on a dirty table with leftovers from the past 3 or 4 groups sitting there.
Chips are straight from the Tostitos bag (less quality, thought) and salsa was decent. Al pastor tacos were too spicy and meat seemed overcooked, actually it tasted like pork curry or something, definitely didn't like it. Same for carne asada, overcooked.
It seems like they prepare the food very quickly because the big crowd, but it is not an excuse to do things wrong, I'd prefer to wait 10 more minutes for a good taco.
author: Fernando R.

description: Great food, open late, always lively and very celiac friendly! One of my weekly staples.
author: Dave M.

description: If you are looking for a tasty yet very filling burrito to sink your teeth into, Cancun is the place. The salsa is nice and spicy too!
author: A D.

description: I had the chicken burrito here, it was delicious. Their margaritas are really good as well. The atmosphere at this place is excellent. Overall, a great place to eat.
author: Tom A.

description: Love, love, love the vegetarian burrito and I eat meat.  I compare all other burrito experiences to Cancun and it always comes out on top.  Consistenly good, and still cheap even after getting really popular.
author: Janene S.

description: Wow, the food is sooo good and the prices are soooo low! We had a lengua taco, 3 burritos, a beer and a glass of horchata and it was under $20! My 21 year old couldn't believe the quality for the price! We love a good taqueria and we're glad there's more than one Cancun to stop at when we get the craving for "Mexican."
author: Avonelle T.

description:
I was yelled at by the cops for walking (eh, staggering) through yellow police tape to get into this place.  Its that good.

PS: I think someone was shot just before I arrived.
PPS: Still loved my burrito.
author: Greg S.

description: I thought it was an incredibly mediocre taqueria, especially considering the quality of the some other places in its direct vicinity. It was overpriced, and the food wasn't bursting with flavor as a taqueria food ought to. I will also venture to say, it was too spicy. I normally enjoy food that has good heat to it, but not when it completely masks any other flavors that might be there, and it tastes not of flavorful spice, but of heat, as if someone poured a bottle of Tabasco over my entire plate. I just don't see the attraction of this restaurant.
author: Joel W.

description:
So, Taqueria Cancun is the perfect place to take out-of-town visitors when you want to give them the "Mission burrito" experience.  It is especially the place if your friend prefers Tex-Mex food to pozole and menudo.  Or if he/she likes colorful decor that feels slightly kitschy.

The carnitas burrito I had was definitely tasty, it just felt a bit contrived to me.  The salsa didn't quite have that "made with love" feeling or flavor, and the burrito was on the saltier, greasier side, compared to other burritos I've had.  Hence, the Tex-Mex comparison above.  Real Mexican food (in my experience) is not the least bit greasy, despite the overwhelming amount of good stuff (sour cream, cheese, fried pork, etc.)  Nor is it commercial-tasting.  For me, Taqueria Cancun fell on the commercial-tasting side of the spectrum.  It could just be that I prefer a more simple burrito?

I am not knocking Cancun at all, I think whether you like this place or not depends on what you're looking for.  I would rather frequent El Metate (equally colorful decor!), El Norteno Truck and El Tonayense Truck.  Maybe I just like food from trucks?
author: Sarah C.

description: In all honesty, I would not have survived my early 20's without Cancun.  I might have starved.  My life was saved on many occasions by their tacos and burritos when I was just too moody and introspective to prepare food for myself.  As the years have gone by I have never lost my appreciation for the consistency, price or quality of the food.  Unlike some of these reviewers I actually lived in the mission so I never had a moment of revelation regarding where I was.  Seriously, people who wanna talk about a mouse, the street clientele, or what it looks like when they're sober should probably stay in the Marina/Hayes Valley/Arizona or wherever they cabbed/drove their Jetta in from.  If you know the city and are from the Bay you know Cancun is what it is.  Great.
author: rei j.

description: I keep going back, and I am never really happy. I must have eaten at this place at least 7-8 times and I have never had a burrito (meat or veg) better than the Farolito ones. Last night I tried the vegetarian burrito and the bathroom. Bathroom: definite mistake. Veggie burrito: bland and with an oddly floury tortilla. I'd skip Cancun. Farolito's only a few blocks away.
author: Liboo K.

description: Updated: Who am I kidding? I love this place, not the best food, but I love this place.
author: Jake W.

description: Best taqueria in san francisco, bar none. Seriously, and I've been to the ones that talk about their high ratings and all that and they are so overrated. Go to Cancun if you want some fun, some cool colors, some seriously yummy mexican food.
author: Darrin A.

description: Amazing, tasty and highly recommended for the late-nite burrito jones.
author: Scott F.

description:
Very disapointing. This past week I been trying different burrito places.

I tried the place on taraval (very good overall) gordo's which I didnt like at all.  and now this place.. Taqueria cancun.... 


I got the carne asada super burrito. Looked good, seemed like i t had all the makings of a burrito ( i drove about 10 miles maybe a little less) to get this. 

But because of the "HIPSTERS" AND FAKE HIPPIES swear this place is to die for. I went here. I admit the burrito didnt taste like any other burrito you can tell it was different. But the spices on the meat and everything else just didnt taste good. It wasn't that it was bland or anything it just didnt taste good.


Very disapointing. Im going to go to el farolito and see if there better because ALL THE "HIPSTER" RAVE about that place to. If el farolito is bad i will NEVER, EVER trust these damn fake ass hippies, moving to san francisco swearing they "KNOW GOOD FOOD" most of those fools get damn veggie burrito's to. 

This place was very very very disapointing. I was expecting the holly grail. I didnt EVEN GET A GOOD BURRITO. What a waste.
author: will d.

description: Love love love their tortas!! Both carne and pollo asada are fantastic! Love their jukebox and so do my Mexican friends (I let them do the song choosing). One complaint...their salsa is HELLA SPICY...but i eat it anyways..hehe.
author: Karen W.

description: This place is the bomb. No wonder why when you walk in there is a whole wall devoted to "Best of the Bay" awards. I admit I ate here literally every day for over a month once, but seriously the salsa verde has chunks of avocado in it and the tortillas are warmed up on a grill before turned into burrittos. The veggie burrittos are the thing to get, but the enchiladas are on point as well. This is not the best location of Taqueria Cancun in the city. The best one is on Valencia and Mission, that's a fact.
author: Peter B.

description: Get the super taco's, best it the city! Anytime I'm the area I go out of my way to eat here.
author: George R.

description: yeah, i dont get it. been here late night; was not impressed. crowded so i waited n expected better. or mebbe carnitas just isnt their best meat? mebbe it was an off night? or a bad batch cuz im just not feelin this place like the rest of the city.
author: Jaymes H.

description: Absolutely amazing.  It's a profound burrito experience.  The folks there are nice, the salsa is spicy, and the juke box es muy fantastico.
author: SL K.

description: Favorite veggie burrito spot in the city. The ingredients taste fresh and the tortillas are just right, they keep things nice n spicy and despite homeless dudes asking for change in the doorway I enjoy the environment. Always try to hit it up if I'm in the mish.
author: Ben L.

description: The best vegetarian burrito in the city, the bay, the universe.   And the cheapest?!!!  My life rulez when I'm here. They serve a mighty fine horchata as well.
author: Ryan B.

description:
After CRAVING a margarita and looking on yelp for a restaurant in the Mission that serves good ones, I was HEAVILY disappointed to arrive at Cancun Taquerita and find that they do NOT have Margaritas.  (Thanks a lot Tom, A. for the misinformation). 
Food is decent, the enchilada sauce was pretty good but , Papalote, La Taqueria and Gordos (although not in the mission) are much better.
author: shani h.

description: Bombadummmm Vege burrito, great hot hot hot salsa. You will be draggin your tongue on the ground for the rest of the day. This place is rockin. Ingredients are fresh and delicioso. OPen late and take your chances, you may get shot up on your way out. L
author: Tamrin H.

description: been burrito-ing here for YEARS - always good, and they haven't raised prices over the years as much as others in the hood.  breakfast items are great.
author: Kitty S.

description: i wish i could give it zero stars, our company was going to place a large order but we had a budget. we first called, they don't have a updated menu online and they don't have a fax machine. i called back asking for prices, after the 3rd item , the person answering the phone literally asked "why are you asking me so many questions, i'm busy right now" i said our company was trying to place a large order but we needed to know how much it was, he said if you're going to place an order tell me now. i told him never mind we're not ordering from them and hung up! we ordered from cinco de mayo taqueria instead and received a faxed menu within 3 minutes. i guess they don't need a large order business since they're so busy!
author: Doris K.

description: My friend brought me here when we were really drunk, but from what I remember, the burritos were delicious. Full salsa bar, which makes everything tastier. They actually have salsa that is spicy, I remember this because my mouth was burning, my nose was runny, couldn't open my eyes, and I felt like my lips were swollen. And yes, I would do it again. :)
author: Howie T.

description: Anyone can make a Veggie Burrito, and that is why a Taqueria is not a Taqueria in my book unless they have good quality meat which Cancun does not have.  The Carne is either chewy with a bunch of fat that never got trimmed properly or dry and overcooked The Lenguq, yes the tongue still has the skin on it?  Are you kidding me, tongue with the skin on it that was not even scrapped properly.  This place really is not very good, but all the Mission Hipsters from New England who know absolutely nothing about Mexican food will tell you it is the best.  Know your source of info, never take a recommendation for a Taqueria  from a vegetarian.  Kudos to the colorful decoration, good service, but really its the meat dammit that counts for me and this place just does not cut it.
author: Administrative C.

description: mmmm...best burritos i've had north of san diego!  their guacamole is fantastic (big chunks of avocado)...
author: Roshni R.

description: i'm not exaggerating when i tell u that i start to salivate (and maybe even drool a bit) when i merely think of the veggie burrito - trust me you do not want to watch me devour one...hands down, the best ever.
author: Christine R.

description: burrito mojado at this place is worth an extra trip to the bathroom the morning after.
author: Hoon R.

description:
"this place has crappy salsa and mediocre everything else.  i refuse to go here, even when im drunk/"

I HEREBY RENOUNCE THE ABOVE STATEMENT.  Im not really sure what it is about this place, but Ive gotten into it.  After years of being a Cancun naysayer I'm on board.  The salsa still sucks, and the burrittos are not mixed properly, but I'm a convert and a devottee to the super vege burrito w no jalepenos.  Im giving it three starts b/c if you want a cheap bland vege burrito thats pretty good this place is the spot.  Cant vouch for the meat or anything else (that shit looks pretty intense!).
author: Andy R.

description: after an awesome drunken night with yelp at medjool, we stumbled in here to grab some food.  all i gotta say is that the restroom almost scared me sober.  minus 1 star for you.  i think the taco was good.  i'm not sure.  how did i get home again?
author: Carol C.

description: My first day back in Cali after one year in France:  I am breathless and swaying with jetlag, but dammit, nothing can keep me from my 3 dollar al pastor super taco from taqueria cancun.  It is five am in France and I am seeing triple when I walk into that glorious temple of tacos.  Sweet ranchero music blasts from the juke box and colorful waterfall murals swirl in front of my eyes.  I take a seat at one of the wooden tables and start crunching through my basket of light, crispy chips, my mouth burning deliciously from the accompanying avocado salsa verde.  Finally my number is called and  I retrieve my super taco with shaking hands.  I bite into it's blessed goodness:  The thin, hot tortilla, the juicy, perfectly seasoned meat, all topped with the creamiest avocado and sour cream combo that this California girl has ever tasted.  "Magnifique", my notoriously picky French husband proclaims.  He finally understands what it means to be from California.  Thank you Taqueria Cancun for welcoming me home in style.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Cancun is a legit Taqueria. I really like the  super veggie. It's usually always packed. And on weekends during peak bar time its especially busy.
author: Ronnie M.

description: very good al pastor and carne asada. that burrito mojado is just too much, though. good, simple beer selection. not much to complain about here.
author: Jon F.

description: I am new to the area and stopped in here for lunch. The super burrito with prawns was fantastic, fresh, full of shrimp. The salsa and hot guacamole that came with the fresh chips was delicious.  The restaurant is filled with local Hispanic workers and dot commers getting lunch.  Colorful and clean. Highly recommended.
author: Ima A.

description:
it has been said enough times before: the vegetarian burrito here is the best, (and the best deal) in the city.

for me the place was a little bit of an acquired taste, but after a few visits, i was hooked.

the prawn burrito is great as well.
author: Dustin E.

description: this is a really ghetto mexican resto, you come here for food and not for the ambience.  i don't know how this place remains when clearly their motto is anything but cleanliness is next to godliness.  i'm pleasantly surprise for as long as i've eaten here, I haven't had digestion episodes.  great for late night snacking after your unsuccessful flirting at medjool and when all you have is $5.
author: Cathryn C.

description: there is this special gift that comes wrapped in a GRILLED tortilla, with whole hunks of avocado ( also in the incredibly spicy verde salsa, arguably one of the greatest sauces created daily in this century) burning hot pinto beans and spanish rice ( the carne asada and sour cream is breathtaking as well, even though i dont eat them anymore, rats....) and goes under the guise that you dont even have to pay five dollars in order to recieve? all you non believers are truly devoid of actual taste.
author: Christopher J.

description: best veggie burrito in town! just don't expect it to be as good to you coming out as it was going in.
author: Renee L.

description: just ate here and this is by far the worst taqueria in the city! the burritoes are greasy and super oily. they should but grease on the menu just in case you want a side of it.  the bathrooms are another story!!  yuck...im having a tummy ache just by writing this review
author: Christian S.

description: where gringos go to burn their lips on krazy-spicey salsa. i like to drink a lot before i go so i can pretend it doesn't hurt.
author: Eli F.

description: A friend introduced me to this place a few years ago, and I've been coming here ever since.  While I haven't explored the menu much, the Vegetarian Burrito (ordered w/o Sour Cream) [$4.50 + tx] and salsa are a work of art.  I'm not sure what they do to make it so good, other than use fresh, well cooked ingredients.  The three kinds of house salsa are fantastic.  Very authentic.  Be sure to ask for more if you run out dipping the free chips as drizzling salsa onto the burrito adds immeasurably to the culinary delight.  Sometimes one veggie burrito isn't enough and I have to go back for a second.  (They are that good.)
author: J. R. F.

description: this is the best taqueria in the city ,good food , good prices,not to long lines.
author: Maxx M.

description: this is my second favorite taqueria next to pancho villas.  the quesadillas here are humongous, and perfectly crisped on the outside.  the salsa here is crazy spicy sometimes. i can handle my food really hot, but sometimes i can barely even eat the salsa here.  also, this place is open late.  it's the perfect place to hit up at 2am when you just staggered out of a nearby bar and you desperately need some quesadilla goodness.  plus, you meet the randomest people there at that time of the night.. it's like the party after the party.
author: vlad k.

description: Tasty, but pretty dirty (even for a Mission taqueria)
author: Tom S.

description: Wow!!  Maybe I was a bit drunk, but the food here rocked! One thing that stood out the most was how fatty the carnitas was.  If you don't like that, you'd better avoid it.  Nothing better than a mouth full of rice, beans, pico de gallo, and some fatty ass carnitas when you're drunk, actually no.  It gets better.  If you're lucky, you'll get to see some grubby dude with his girlfriend who just sits in there and waits for people to leave food behind.  Then he'll calmly walk over, look over his shoulders and start stuffing his face with left-overs while his girlfriend watches enthusiastically.  Not only  is the food good.  This place provides the entertainment too.  What more can you ask for?
author: Nick H.

description: so so so not good. not even good after a day of sitting in dolores park drinking wine, followed by beers at the 500 club and unabashed dancing at el delirium...at 2 in the morning you would think i wouldn't be so picky. my burrito was completely ruined by their salsa which is beyond spicy...and though i thought i ordered chicken who knows if that was what was really in my burrito. i once loved this place many many years ago, but it is no longer what it was.
author: Zoe s.

description: levis stay-press black polyester pants  thin cut midnight blue wool blazer  black leather vintage mid top chelsea boot  fitted market street dress shirt and thin vintage tie  Beauty Bar's opening day party homeless hippies  dot commers  2 vege burritos and mandarin jarritos  after party at the burger king loft  paranoid android blaring from a double parked civic hatchback  popscene teen cuties  gentrification  graphic design  blonde redhead  outkast  pulp  harmony korine  winona ryder  bill viola
author: jason h.

description: i've never had a bad meal here. everything from the tacos to burritos are very good. the service isnt bad and their late night hours make it especially convienant. nothing beats this place after a night on the town. the place can be a bit hectic at 2:00AM on a Friday or Saturday night so be ready to be a loud crowded zoo filled with drunk people.
author: Andrew D.

description: I was excited to try this place as I just moved in around the corner and I need a steady take-out place. I ordered a super quesadilla with chicken and couldn't eat it. The meat was made up of small super crispy chunks that weren't even definitively chicken. Imagine those chunks swimming in a sea of mushy grease in a soggy tortilla. Gross.
author: Ilya S.

description: pretty good.  very reasonable portions, especially considering the prices.  they do not skimp on the meat, but the chicken was also a bit on the bland side.  the grilled tortilla is definitely a perk and sets them apart from many places.  chips included are better than many other places too and the salsas included (particularly the green one) are quite a pair.  i will definitely return, but for my money el farolito is king of the mission.
author: Ryan H.

description: During a series of Mission binge drinking, I originally thought was the lexicon of burritos in the bay area.  When I entered the location on Mission street and passed under the bright yellow glow from the sign as bright as a lighthouse casting light onto a dark street, I first saw the legion of awards hung all over the walls.  Awards, plaques -- these are good things signifying what you want to hear when you eat at a place that is as filthy inside as Cancun.  A line of drunks files along towards the back of the place and you step up to order your burrito, be brave and order tongue.  A word of caution to those that actually care about eating with clean hands, the bathroom almost certainly will not have hand soap and good luck finding paper towel.  If you are me, and after sobering up, quickly begin to ask yourself how the heck the people preparing your food wash themselves.  If you are asking this and if you mind cockroaches on the floor, keep walking up Mission and pass Cancun by.  There is a point in all our lives when the clock has reached the nether regions of the darkness of morning and drunken food is just that, a no nonsense meal served quickly and cheaply, and sadly at this juncture of my Mission drinking life, that is far as Cancun has reached in my eyes.
author: Taylor P.

description: i really dont care about this place in the day time...im basing this review on the weeee hours of a sat/sun morning....from midnite to about 2am...this place is like a gourmet restaurant....theres a line/long wait...the food is good/fresh/hot off the grill.....pricing is not an issue...its mexican food at its finest...the tostadaas...the tacos....nachos....mmmmm good....yeah im probably plastered/loaded when im here....but hey isnt everybody at this hot spot in the mission
author: elmer d.

description: a massive 3 dollar super taco for breakfast. what a deal. so much carnitas, nearly impossible to pick up. sour cream, avocado, cheese, cilantro. free chips and 2 kinds of salsa, too. a beautiful, colorful room. one of the taquerias in the mission that i'll remember to frequent.
author: Tim O.

description: Been here a couple times for burritos, and it was just aight.  But then my buddy craig turned me on to the tortas.  Dizzamn.  By far the best torta i've ever had, and I've had my share (I spent six years in san diego.)  Get the carnitas torta.  You will love it.
author: john k.

description: Best Mexican food to hit my mouth. My friend took me to this place when I was visiting San Francisco and he was on point with his high praises. I got the carne asada burrito and pleasantly surprised side of free chips and salsa. The green chile sauce was awesome, but beware, it does pack a spicy kick. The food came out just in time as we finished our last chips. Very casual eating environment with long tables to fit a larger group of 6. I will definitely visit San Francisco again, just to eat here again!
author: Robert M.

description: whoo, this is some spicy mexican food.  you will need a glass of horchata with what they serve up, but hurts. so. good.
author: Jill k.

description: i don't like their burritos... cus they chop up fresh jalapenos and throw them inside for the occasional spice attack... i think they do it to make up for their otherwise rather bland flavors...
author: charlotte s.

description: Cheap, big portions, very good. I love the super nacho's
author: Jonas h.

description: i had 3 tacos: carne asada, al pastor and carnitas.  the carnitas were the best, but still not good enough to make this place a destination.  al pastor had a weird bbq-ish sauce and carne asada was dry and average.  plus, they added a salsa on top of all 3 tacos which i did not particularly like.  the spicy green salsa that comes with the chips was fantastic (and VERY spicy); if i end up there again i will ask for no salsa on top and add the green one instead.  the fresh oj and carrot juice was nice, and although a bit too much cinnamon i liked the horchata.  i like la taqueria better.
author: B R.

description: Unbelievably good shrimp burrito, cheaply priced, and actually FILLED with shrimp! (You know how some places are stingy with shrimp... Cancun delivers!) Plus, the staff is friendly in a real, not fake-polite way.
author: Geae D.

description: mmmm delicious! best tacos in SF. super taco al pastor!!!!!
author: jack r.

description: Great, authentic food.  Quite busy all day long but worth the wait!
author: Samantha G.

description: I am relatively new to the mission burrito, but this is one of my favorites.  Parking is a bit tough in this area, and the line can be long, but it's well worth it.  Prices are very cheap, as is the norm in the mission.
author: Richard C.

description: went here cause it was voted best taqueria in sf and i felt it a crime that i had never set foot in such a place. very good tacos al pastor, spicy salsa, but they didnt humor my attempts to speak spanish, instead making me feel like an idiot. i'll keep my allegiance with la cumbre.
author: Lisa M.

description: I must confess that I'm rarely here sober.  Its usually the absolute must go destination whenever food cravings come to those that have had a few too many.  Its always an adventure to get here.  Once it was the bart, a few times shoved into a taxi, others times the bus or by the graciousness of our DD.
