Sometimes we stumble in from bars in the area but however we get here we are always elated as we walk inside.  The big wood tables, the bright yellow walls, the crazy prints and pictures and lone blacklight.  The mix of homeless people, hipsters, and inebriates makes for entrancing people watching.   It's exactly where you want to be.  You fight your way to a table and go order delicious food.  Then you're set.  You night is made.  Everything is perfect.
author: B B.

description: hands down, my favorite taqueria to get a vegeterian burrito in all of SF. i wouldn't go for the atmosphere, but do try the burrito and the melon juice. simply superb!
author: Kerri B.

description: if i were to rate this place based on the wet carne asada burrito alone, i'd give it 5 stars...HELLA GOOD!  i live in l.a., and find myself craving my fave burrito from this place.  even though parking bites, this one's better (cleaner) than the one on market street.  oh yeah, try the melon drink if you're feeling fruity as opposed to the horchata, which is also good.  everything tastes authentic.  some of you may judge me or not find me believable, being filipina and all.   what do i know about what authentic mexican food tastes like, right?  i must remind you that i'm IN los angeles and it's my hometown.  nuff said.  (if you don't know what i'm talking about, you must come and visit our lovely city soon.)
author: Khris L.

description: Once upon a time when I was a party girl and boozing it up all the time, Taqueria Cancun always seemed like such a great idea at 2:30 a.m.  Now that I've matured and sobered up (slightly) I decided to make my first non-alcohol induced visit and I have to say, the beer goggles really made this place. The meat in my carnitas super burrito was very bland and for that much fat and guilt wrapped in a enriched white flour tortilla, it should taste damn good. Had it been amazing, I would've easily put the whole thing away, but the fact that I could only get through half of it is not a good sign.
author: Cher E.

description: Bitchin ass green salsa. I always go for the supertaco with a regular taco.
author: Firstname L.

description: orgasmically good!  the burrito i ordered was lightly crispy on the outside and there was a lot of avocados on the inside.  they even provided chips and salsa with my order.  dirt cheap and damn good.  i'll be coming here next time when i come to the mission.
author: Amy Z.

description: This is a good startchy burrito...lots of rice and beans. Perfect for after drinking or after taking a long walk around the Mission.  I prefer the salsa verde to the red salsa. Always cheap and fast.
author: Jessie H.

description: I think I should have gotten a burrito, because the taco was disappointing.  But you know what, I got more than my two bucks worth in the jalapenos in my pico de gallo.  That stuff was SPICYYYY.  And really good with chips at 2am.
author: gen w.

description:
best burritos in sf. i love it here because they put rice in their burritos. 

and soo cheap. i go here every time.
author: Miss O.

description:
legendary.

when i think of san francisco and how i miss living there, i think of my family, my friends, and taqueria cancun (in that order, shame on you!). there's nothing like an experience at this place -- so conveniently located near bars and in the mission district, such a kick-ass section of the city. does the place look a little not clean? yes. but i figure that grit just adds to the amazing flavor in my burrito. you'll be ok. get over it. the food here is so much more superior to ANYTHING you can order at that Pancho Villa place (you will pay entirely too much for a bland dish there). there are other taquerias in the mission that are pretty good... but Cancun tops them all in my book. i probably would have subsisted on nothing but Taqueria Cancun when i lived in the city, except i thought about all that grease going to my pores and decided instead to go there in intervals. whenever i visit, i must get my burrito fix. you'll see what i mean, if you haven't already.

buen provecho
author: karen p.

description: ay dios mio!  seriously, i will eat here everyday until i head back to the east coast!  the tostada con ceviche is frikkin cheap and out of this world!
author: Oliver C.

description: This is probably the best burrito I have had, and definitely the best value for a burrito I have had.  The Burrito Mojado was really good.
author: Saikat C.

description: there is no better way to end an evening in the Mission then trekking up to Can Cun...if you get a taco make it a super veg. style. super good and not too heavy, be wary of drunk friends who get ambitious, they'll be in for a surprise!
author: o. c.

description: there are so many good taqueria's that this one does not compare.  i got the tacos but i would walk the 5 blocks up mission to la taqueria.
author: michelle k.

description: hell yea late hours for those after hour urges. good tacos at the right price one of my favorite places in the city
author: T L.

description: sweet memories of grilled chicken super burrito with all the goods tight wrapped in foil. new york mexican food is pain. go when you're drunk and in need of some extra power or a late snack before you head home. don't be turned off by the staleness of the chips; grab your burrito or soft tacos when they call your number and eat with out fear.
author: Justine S.

description: we were super excited about coming here, since one of our friends loves it so much when she's visiting from chicago she makes a special trip over here to get a burrito for the plane ride home. maybe the bar had been set to high, 'cause really it was just kinda like Chipotle, except bigger, spicier, and free chips if you're 'dining in'. oh, and it was cheaper too.
author: Toisha T.

description: Really tasty, really reasonable. Fresh, bountiful ingredients. I ordered a super taco ($3) and was surprised to see the guy throw a full half avocado into my taco. It was seriously overstuffed which meant messiness, but lots of the good stuff (insides). I haven't found a place in the area, or anywhere for that matter, that does this better.
author: Iris M.

description: The burritos taste really good one day and not so great other days.  The chips and salsa are just plain bad.  Tasteless chips and your choice of hot or really hot salsa, neither one is even tasty.  The last few times I've gone there I've had to rush, practically run home.  Many better choices for a burrito in the Mission.
author: Tom Z.

description: I've never understood this place. Every year or 2 for the last 10 years or so someone drags me back here and I go along because I love burritos - not just Mission burritos but ALL burritos - so much that I can't believe that I don't like them here, and the same thing happens every time. Mediocrity. I give it 2 stars because mediocrity is really easy to acheive in a simple burrito so it's really unforgivable for these guys who've been doing it this long not to be able to serve me a something a little better. And the funny thing is the people I go with tend to say that there's isn't very good that day either, but I think they're trying to make me feel better for being one of the only people in San Francisco who doesn't like Cancun. I just don't get it. I'm sorry if I've offended anyone here. It must be me.
author: jeremy m.

description: I didn't know! but then my friend turned me on to their beautiful veggie burritos... like 1/2 an avocado inside! and it's grilled or something? it's fantastic. can't attest to the rest, but... the veggie, with that fabulous green salsa? Mmmm hmmm...
author: Miriam M.

description: Great veggie burritos, but it seems like this is their signature.  My husband was underwhelmed by the meat burritos... love the paper decorations though!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Cancun burritos could be a bit more consistently good, but when they're good... they're great.  Lots of avocado makes them the late night standard.
author: Ken M.

description: i was highly unimpressed with the al pastor. and the burrito was kind of blah. i want all of the fixings mixed togetehr--i don't want a bite of just avocado or just beans. i also found myself really wanting some salt on it. the nachos were okay though.
author: Stephanie R.

description: I love the burritos at Cancun and have never had a bad experience there, drunk or sober.  However, what keeps me from giving this place more than three stars is the cleanliness of the place.  Were not talking just a one star reduction in cleanliness, but two and that's being gracious.  I can't speak to the bathrooms, since I know better than to use the bathroom in a place like Cancun.  Also, the occasional junkie strolling in hassling people for money is a bit of a turn off and gets tired when dining in the Mission.  The steak super burrito always hits the spot.  The grilled tortilla & steak, the black beans, the avocado, the salsa all come together to make this burrito memorable and enjoyable, no matter if I'm cold stone sober or drop dead drunk.  Also, the tomatillo salsa verde is off the chain as the kids say these days.  Needless to say, when I go to Cancun, I do feel like I'm rolling the dice, since it looks like the health department hasn't stepped in there in a number of years.  If you're not down with the Mission-sit-down-dinner-experience, I would suggest a 'to-go' shot.  The prices on the menu will keep you from wondering what lurks in the back kitchen.
author: DamnGringo X.

description: best super burrito and steak quessadilla in town. bar none. real slices of avocado, they lay the tortilla on the grill (not steamed), and you know there's got to be lard on there. cold in winter; not the best place to hang.
author: adrian c.

description: The first time I had cancun it was after an epic mountain bike ride. I've never been so happy. Their burritos esp. carnitas are delicious. Lot's of guac and sour cream to balance out the drier beans, rice and meat. It's not the most flavorful burrito I've had - but it's got all the right components to almost be there
author: Michael S.

description: The best burrito mojado I've ever had. Actually, this review should be entitled "review of burrito mojado al pastor at Taqueria Cancun" because that's the only thing I get. I've tried to order other things, but when I get to the counter, the only words I can squeeze out are "burrito mojado." The thought of passing it up is just too much. And it's a much better value than the super burrito.
author: Will M.

description: Just ordered 2 chicken super tacos tonight and they were awesome!  Especially if you're into avocados and sour cream.
author: Tommy T.

description: i live for the vegetarian burrito at cancun and its companion green avocado/tomatillo salsa.  cancun knows how burritos should be made:  tortillas grilled, not steamed; pinto beans packed with flavor; fragrant rice goodness; and the perfect mix of onions, cilantro, sour cream and cheese.  the low price includes a basket of chips and unlimited salsa.  and the salsa, oh the salsa -- its level spiciness corresponds directly with the spiciness level of the peppers at that point in the season.  if you can't eat spicy, i recommend you try this salsa when peppers are just coming into season and the salsa is at its mildest.  you'll immediately become hooked.  over time, you'll learn that you HAVE to tolerate the spiciness for just another bite... and then you'll be an old spice pro.  not the aftershave, the food flavor level.  by far the best taqueria in the mission.
author: jme m.

description: Hands down, this place has the best vegetarian burrito in the city. The breakfast is good too, chorizo with eggs, tortillas, beans, yum! Total mission atmosphere.
author: John M.

description: five solid stars.  there is nothing comparable to this place.  i love the shrine, colorful banners, crazy jukebox.  but let's not forget why we're there.  burritos!  the super al pastor is to die for.  spicy, tender meat with guacamole, cilantro, beans, rice, cheese, salsa...and whatever else yumminess they throw in.  i should never eat a whole burrito, but i can't help myself.  i love this place.
author: kelly d.

description: My go to late night burrito joint.  I always get the carne asada burrito, so I really can't say much about anything else.
author: Gregorio S.

description: Cute little Mission dive with authentic Mexican food served counter style.  Veggie burrito just alright, but the cheese enchiladas served with a side of rice and beans and a great sauce totally hit the spot.
author: P L.

description: This is my favorite place to get a vegetarian burrito in the city. The fresh avocado chunks, hot sauce, and sour cream are wonderful. To top it off they grill the tortillas and melt the cheese to perfection! It is like no other burrito in the city (in my opinion).
author: Tiger M.

description:
Good food! I ordered a quesadilla with chicken... it was very good! the skin was crunchy and the cheese was melted just right as its stringy level. My sister ordered a burrito with grilled beef. It came with chips and some very very spicy salsa and dip. Both which are only $5 each. 
Our meal was very enjoyable until I found a strand of hair embedded in my quesadilla, so we quickly brought it back to the cashier. They examined it in disbelief. They were speaking in Spanish amongst themselves. Couple of minutes later, the cashier came over to my table and asked if I wanted the same thing or if I wanted my money back. I didn't care about the money; I only wanted the HALF of my quesadilla back. I told him, but he insisted on giving me a WHOLE quesadilla back. He packed it up to-go for me along with some chips and salsa. When I got it, I tried a piece. Not only was it with beef instead of grilled chicken, but the skin was not made nicely crispy like it was before; it was rather very soggy and seemed as if it wasn't grilled. Before I left, all of the workers behind the counter turned to my table and mumbled more Spanish amongst themselves... hmmm.. I wonder what they said?
Overall, good food but OK costumer service.
author: Dianne I.

description: the best friggin el pastor i had in ages... yum... yum...
author: Cleo R.

description: i used to go here all the time.  i went there last week and remembered it being a lot better.  i thought the al pastor was way over spiced, i thinik the meat is meant to be spiced but i thought it was overkill i had the super quesadilla, my GF had the taco.  they were both al pastor both overspiced but i thought the taco was beeter than mine.
author: Anthony Y.

description: have you ever had a burrito that kicks you in the face because it's so spicy and then makes you pass out after you chose to eat the whole thing with extra avacado scooped on top?  have the burrito mojado, with avocado paired with a delicate orange soda.
author: michael k.

description: i am a burrito lover, and with the many choices available in the mission, cancun is still my favorite.  i always get grilled chicken with all the works and it always hits the spot.  they usually melt the cheese just right while grilling the tortilla just enough to have a slightly crispy outer jacket with all the good stuffings melded on the inside.  my mom prefers la cumbre and my dad prefers pancho villa, but hey, to each his own.
author: M K.

description: this place is good. normal prices for burritos normal taqueria everything. burritos were solid. not much to say about it except a friend almost fought some russian guy for no reason. open late.
author: Wats C.
